original: Ṛgveda
analyzed: ṛgveda
translated: Ṛg Veda

original: mā cid anyad vi śaṃsata sakhāyo mā riṣaṇyata /
analyzed: mā cit anyat vi śaṃsata sakhāyaḥ mā riṣaṇyata
translated: Do not praise anything else, O friends, do not be dispirited.

original: indram it stotā vṛṣaṇaṃ sacā sute muhur ukthā ca śaṃsata //🔽avakrakṣiṇaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ yathājuraṃ gāṃ na carṣaṇīsaham /
analyzed: indram id stotā vṛṣaṇam sacā sute muhur ukthā ca śaṃsata  avakrakṣiṇam vṛṣabham yathā ājuram gām na carṣaṇīsaham
translated: Praise Indra, the powerful one, at the pressing, and repeatedly chant the hymns.🔽The unretreating bull, as swift as a horse, the cow who conquers the people,

original: vidveṣaṇaṃ saṃvananobhayaṅkaram maṃhiṣṭham ubhayāvinam //
analyzed: vidveṣaṇam saṃvanana ubhayaṅkaram maṃhiṣṭham ubhayāvinam
translated: The one who causes hatred, who brings people together, who strikes both sides, the most generous, who goes to both sides.

original: yac cid dhi tvā janā ime nānā havanta ūtaye /
analyzed: yat cit hi tvā janāḥ ime nānā havante ūtaye
translated: Even if these people here call upon you in various ways for help,

original: asmākam brahmedam indra bhūtu te 'hā viśvā ca vardhanam //
analyzed: asmākam brahma idam indra bhūtu te hāḥ viśvā ca vardhanam
translated: May this prayer of ours, O Indra, be for your increase and for the growth of all.

original: vi tartūryante maghavan vipaścito 'ryo vipo janānām /🔽upa kramasva pururūpam ā bhara vājaṃ nediṣṭham ūtaye //
analyzed: vi tartūryante maghavan vipaścitaḥ ryaḥ vipaḥ janānām  upa kramasva puru rūpam ā bhara vājam nediṣṭham ūtaye
translated: The wise ones are competing with each other, O magnanimous one, the noble thoughts of the people.🔽Come and bring the most desirable strength for help.

original: mahe cana tvām adrivaḥ parā śulkāya deyām /
analyzed: mahe cana tvām adrivas parā śulkāya deyām
translated: Even for a great price, O wielder of the thunderbolt, I would not give you away.

original: na sahasrāya nāyutāya vajrivo na śatāya śatāmagha //
analyzed: na sahasrāya na ayutāya vajrivas na śatāya śatāmagha
translated: Not for a thousand, not for ten thousand, O wielder of the thunderbolt, not for a hundred, O you who have a hundred powers.

original: vasyāṃ indrāsi me pitur uta bhrātur abhuñjataḥ /
analyzed: vasyāṃ indra asi me pituḥ uta bhrātuḥ a bhuñjataḥ
translated: You are dearer to me, O Indra, than my father or my brother who gives me food.

original: mātā ca me chadayathaḥ samā vaso vasutvanāya rādhase //
analyzed: mātā ca me chadayathaḥ samā vaso vasutvanāya rādhase
translated: And my mother covers me, O good one, for the sake of wealth and prosperity.

original: kveyatha kved asi purutrā cid dhi te manaḥ /
analyzed: kva iyatha kva id asi purutrā cit hi te manaḥ
translated: Where are you going? Where are you? For your mind is in many places.

original: alarṣi yudhma khajakṛt purandara pra gāyatrā agāsiṣuḥ //🔽prāsmai gāyatram arcata vāvātur yaḥ purandaraḥ /
analyzed: alarṣi yudhma khaja kṛt purandara pra gāyatrā agāsiṣuḥ  pra asmai gāyatram arcata vāvātuḥ yaḥ purandaraḥ
translated: Thou risest, O warrior, O destroyer of forts, O Purandara, the Gayatri verses have sung forth.🔽Sing to him the Gayatri hymn, let him blow who is Purandara,

original: yābhiḥ kāṇvasyopa barhir āsadaṃ yāsad vajrī bhinat puraḥ //
analyzed: yābhiḥ kāṇvasya upa barhiḥ āsadam yā asat vajrī bhinat puraḥ
translated: By which (verses) he went to the sacrificial grass of Kanva, by which the wielder of the thunderbolt broke down the forts.

original: ye te santi daśagvinaḥ śatino ye sahasriṇaḥ /🔽aśvāso ye te vṛṣaṇo raghudruvas tebhir nas tūyam ā gahi //
analyzed: ye te santi daśagvinaḥ śatinaḥ ye sahasriṇaḥ  aśvāsaḥ ye te vṛṣaṇaḥ raghudruvaḥ tebhiḥ naḥ tūyam ā gahi
translated: Those hundreds and thousands that are thine, O thou who hast ten powers,🔽Those strong, swift-moving horses of thine, come to us quickly with them.

original: ā tv adya sabardughāṃ huve gāyatravepasam /
analyzed: ā tu adya sabardughām huve gāyatra vepasam
translated: To thee today I call the milch-cow, easy to milk, who moves in the Gayatri (verse),

original: indraṃ dhenuṃ sudughām anyām iṣam urudhārām araṅkṛtam //
analyzed: indram dhenum sudughām anyām iṣam uru dhārām araṅkṛtam
translated: Indra, the cow who yields much milk, another food, with a wide stream, made ready.

original: yat tudat sūra etaśaṃ vaṅkū vātasya parṇinā /
analyzed: yat tudat sūraḥ etaśam vaṅkū vātasya parṇinā
translated: When the sun struck Etaṣa, the crooked one, with the wind's wing,

original: vahat kutsam ārjuneyaṃ śatakratuḥ tsarad gandharvam astṛtam //
analyzed: vahat kutsam ārjuneyam śatakratuḥ tsarat gandharvam astṛtam
translated: Śatakratu carried Kutsa Ārjuneya, he pierced the unready Gandharva.

original: ya ṛte cid abhiśriṣaḥ purā jatrubhya ātṛdaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ṛte cit abhiśriṣaḥ purā jatrubhyaḥ ātṛdaḥ
translated: He who, even from afar, from before the collar-bones, the piercer,

original: saṃdhātā saṃdhim maghavā purūvasur iṣkartā vihrutam punaḥ //🔽mā bhūma niṣṭyā ivendra tvad araṇā iva /
analyzed: saṃdhātā saṃdhim maghavā purūvasuḥ iṣkartā vihrutam punar  mā bhūma niṣṭyāḥ iva indra tvat araṇāḥ iva
translated: The bountiful one, the binder of the bond, shall make whole what was torn asunder.🔽Let us not, O Indra, be like those who dwell in the desert, like those who are without a home,

original: vanāni na prajahitāny adrivo duroṣāso amanmahi //
analyzed: vanāni na prajahitāni adrivas duroṣāsaḥ amanmahi
translated: Like forests that are not to be abandoned, O thou of the stone (weapon), we have thought of thee as hard to appease.

original: amanmahīd anāśavo 'nugrāsaś ca vṛtrahan /
analyzed: amanmahi id anāśavaḥ nugrāsaḥ ca vṛtrahan
translated: The swift ones have not thought of him, nor the all-devouring, O Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: sakṛt su te mahatā śūra rādhasā anu stomam mudīmahi //
analyzed: sakṛt su te mahatā śūra rādhasā anu stomam mudīmahi
translated: Once only, O mighty one, will we rejoice in thy bounty, O hero, in the hymn of praise.

original: yadi stomam mama śravad asmākam indram indavaḥ /
analyzed: yadi stomam mama śravat asmākam indram indavaḥ
translated: If he will listen to my hymn, the drops of Soma to Indra,

original: tiraḥ pavitraṃ sasṛvāṃsa āśavo mandantu tugryāvṛdhaḥ //🔽ā tv adya sadhastutiṃ vāvātuḥ sakhyur ā gahi /
analyzed: tiras pavitram sasṛvāṃsaḥ āśavaḥ mandantu tugryāvṛdhaḥ  ā tu adya sadhastutim vāvātuḥ sakhyuḥ ā gahi
translated: Swift, flowing through the filter, let them gladden him, the strengtheners of Tugrya.🔽Come to the assembly of praise, to the friend who calls thee.

original: upastutir maghonām pra tvāvatv adhā te vaśmi suṣṭutim //🔽sotā hi somam adribhir em enam apsu dhāvata /
analyzed: upastutiḥ maghonām pra tvā avatu adhā te vaśmi suṣṭutim  sotā hi somam adribhiḥ ā īm enam apsu dhāvata
translated: The praise of the bountiful ones shall be thine. I long for thy good praise.🔽For the pressers have pressed Soma with the stones. Run hither with the waters.

original: gavyā vastreva vāsayanta in naro nir dhukṣan vakṣaṇābhyaḥ //
analyzed: gavyā vastrā iva vāsayantaḥ id naraḥ niḥ dhukṣan vakṣaṇābhyaḥ
translated: As with a garment of wool, they clothe him, the men, milking him from the flanks.

original: adha jmo adha vā divo bṛhato rocanād adhi /
analyzed: adha jmaḥ adha vā divaḥ bṛhataḥ rocanāt adhi
translated: Now from the earth, or from the lofty sky, or from the region of the clouds,

original: ayā vardhasva tanvā girā mamā jātā sukrato pṛṇa //
analyzed: ayā vardhasva tanvā girā mamā jātā su krato pṛṇa
translated: O thou who art born, O thou of great wisdom, grow thou great in thy body through my song. Fill thee full.

original: indrāya su madintamaṃ somaṃ sotā vareṇyam /
analyzed: indrāya su madintamam somam sotā vareṇyam
translated: For Indra, the best of pressers, the most gladdening Soma, the most excellent.

original: śakra eṇam pīpayad viśvayā dhiyā hinvānaṃ na vājayum //
analyzed: śakraḥ eṇam pīpayat viśvayā dhiyā hinvānam na vājayum
translated: Shakra hath caused him to swell with all his thought, urging him on like a racer.

original: mā tvā somasya galdayā sadā yācann ahaṃ girā /
analyzed: mā tvā somasya galdayā sadā yācan aham girā
translated: Never may I, with the voice of prayer, beg thee, O Soma, with the throat of Soma.

original: bhūrṇim mṛgaṃ na savaneṣu cukrudhaṃ ka īśānaṃ na yāciṣat //
analyzed: bhūrṇim mṛgam na savaneṣu cukrudham kaḥ īśānam na yāciṣat
translated: Who would not entreat the fierce one at the feasts, the wild beast that is angry?

original: madeneṣitam madam ugram ugreṇa śavasā /🔽viśveṣāṃ tarutāram madacyutam made hi ṣmā dadāti naḥ //🔽śevāre vāryā puru devo martāya dāśuṣe /
analyzed: madena iṣitam madam ugram ugreṇa śavasā  viśveṣām tarutāram mada cyutam made hi sma dadāti naḥ  śevāre vāryā puru devaḥ martāya dāśuṣe
translated: Urged on by the rapture, the fierce one with fierce strength,🔽The all-conquering one who delights in the rapture, in the rapture he gives us strength.🔽In the good time, the god bestows good things on the mortal worshipper.

original: sa sunvate ca stuvate ca rāsate viśvagūrto ariṣṭutaḥ //
analyzed: sa sunvate ca stuvate ca rāsate viśva gūrtaḥ ariṣṭutaḥ
translated: He gives to the presser and the praiser, the all-lauded one who is not to be praised.

original: endra yāhi matsva citreṇa deva rādhasā /
analyzed: ā indra yāhi matsva citreṇa deva rādhasā
translated: O Indra, come and rejoice with the wondrous gift, O god.

original: saro na prāsy udaraṃ sapītibhir ā somebhir uru sphiram //
analyzed: saraḥ na prāsi udaram sapītibhiḥ ā somebhiḥ uru sphiram
translated: Like a lake, with the gladdening (waters), with the Soma juices, fill thy capacious belly.

original: ā tvā sahasram ā śataṃ yuktā rathe hiraṇyaye /
analyzed: ā tvā sahasram ā śatam yuktāḥ rathe hiraṇyaye
translated: A thousand, a hundred, yoked to thy golden chariot,

original: brahmayujo haraya indra keśino vahantu somapītaye //
analyzed: brahma yujaḥ harayaḥ indra keśinaḥ vahantu soma pītaye
translated: O Indra, let the tawny (horses) yoked by prayer draw thee to the Soma drink.

original: ā tvā rathe hiraṇyaye harī mayūraśepyā /🔽śitipṛṣṭhā vahatām madhvo andhaso vivakṣaṇasya pītaye //🔽pibā tv asya girvaṇaḥ sutasya pūrvapā iva /
analyzed: ā tvā rathe hiraṇyaye harī mayūra śepyā  śiti pṛṣṭhāḥ vahatām madhvaḥ andhasaḥ vivakṣaṇasya pītaye  pibā tu asya girvaṇaḥ sutasya pūrva pāḥ iva
translated: Let thy two tawny (horses), with the tail of the peacock,🔽With spotted backs, carry thee to the drinking of the sweet juice, of the well-pressed (Soma).🔽Drink of this, O thou who lovest the song, as the first drinker of the juice that is pressed,

original: pariṣkṛtasya rasina iyam āsutiś cārur madāya patyate //
analyzed: pariṣkṛtasya rasinaḥ iyam āsutiḥ cāruḥ madāya patyate
translated: Of the purified, the sweet, this libation is poured forth, the beautiful, for delight.

original: ya eko asti daṃsanā mahāṃ ugro abhi vrataiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ asti daṃsanā mahān ugraḥ abhi vrataiḥ
translated: He who alone exists, the great, the terrible, with his mighty vows,

original: gamat sa śiprī na sa yoṣad ā gamad dhavaṃ na pari varjati //
analyzed: gamat sa śiprī na sa yoṣat ā gamat havam na pari varjati
translated: May he, the lovely one, go to us, may he, the youthful one, come to us. He does not avoid the call.

original: tvam puraṃ cariṣṇvaṃ vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasya sam piṇak /
analyzed: tvam puram cariṣṇvam vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasya sam piṇak
translated: You crushed the moving fortress of Sushna with your weapons.

original: tvam bhā anu caro adha dvitā yad indra havyo bhuvaḥ //🔽mama tvā sūra udite mama madhyandine divaḥ /
analyzed: tvam bhās anu caraḥ adha dvitā yat indra havyaḥ bhuvaḥ  mama tvā sūre udite mama madhyandine divaḥ
translated: You followed the light, O Indra, twice, when you became worthy of oblations.

original: mama prapitve apiśarvare vasav ā stomāso avṛtsata //
analyzed: mama prapitve apiśarvare vaso ā stomāsaḥ avṛtsata
translated: I call you, O Vasu, at sunrise, at midday, in the evening twilight, in the night. The praises have turned to me.

original: stuhi stuhīd ete ghā te maṃhiṣṭhāso maghonām /
analyzed: stuhi stuhi id ete gha te maṃhiṣṭhāsaḥ maghonām
translated: Praise! Praise these two, they are the most generous of the generous.

original: ninditāśvaḥ prapathī paramajyā maghasya medhyātithe //
analyzed: nindita aśvaḥ prapathī paramajyāḥ maghasya medhyātithe
translated: The one with the blamed horse, the one with the best bow, the one worthy of Magha's sacrifice.

original: ā yad aśvān vananvataḥ śraddhayāhaṃ rathe ruham /🔽uta vāmasya vasunaś ciketati yo asti yādvaḥ paśuḥ //
analyzed: ā yat aśvān vananvataḥ śraddhayā aham rathe ruham  uta vāmasya vasunaḥ ciketati yaḥ asti yādvaḥ paśuḥ
translated: When I, with faith, mounted the chariot, following the horses to be yoked,🔽I thought of the wealth of the good, of the animal that is to be had.

original: ya ṛjrā mahyam māmahe saha tvacā hiraṇyayā /
analyzed: yaḥ ṛjrā mahyam māmahe saha tvacā hiraṇyayā
translated: The two who are swift for me, who honor me with skin of gold,

original: eṣa viśvāny abhy astu saubhagāsaṅgasya svanadrathaḥ //🔽adha plāyogir ati dāsad anyān āsaṅgo agne daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ /
analyzed: eṣa viśvāni abhī astu saubhaga āsaṅgasya svanat rathaḥ  adha plāyogiḥ ati dāsat anyān āsaṅgaḥ agne daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ
translated: May this Sanga, with his rattling chariot, be superior to all good fortune.🔽Now let the one with the yoke-strap surpass the others, O Agni, with ten thousand,

original: adhokṣaṇo daśa mahyaṃ ruśanto naḷā iva saraso nir atiṣṭhan //
analyzed: adhokṣaṇaḥ daśa mahyam ruśantaḥ naḷāḥ iva sarasaḥ niḥ atiṣṭhan
translated: The ten bright ones for me, like snakes, have stood up from the water.

original: anv asya sthūraṃ dadṛśe purastād anastha ūrur avarambamāṇaḥ /
analyzed: anu asya sthūram dadṛśe purastāt anasthaḥ ūruḥ avarambamāṇaḥ
translated: His great bulk is seen in front, his thigh is unsupported, leaning.

original: śaśvatī nāry abhicakṣyāha subhadram arya bhojanam bibharṣi //
analyzed: śaśvatī nārī abhicakṣya āha su bhadram arya bhojanam bibharṣi
translated: The eternal woman looks on, saying, You bear excellent food for the noble one.

original: idaṃ vaso sutam andhaḥ pibā supūrṇam udaram /
analyzed: idam vaso sutam andhaḥ piba su pūrṇam udaram
translated: O Vasu, drink this pressed Soma, drink from the full stomach.

original: anābhayin rarimā te //
analyzed: anābhayin rarimā te
translated: O one without a navel, we have prepared it for you.

original: nṛbhir dhūtaḥ suto aśnair avyo vāraiḥ paripūtaḥ /
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ dhūtaḥ sutaḥ aśnaiḥ avyaḥ vāraiḥ paripūtaḥ
translated: Pressed by men, pressed by stones, purified by woolen filters,

original: aśvo na nikto nadīṣu //
analyzed: aśvaḥ na niktaḥ nadīṣu
translated: Like a horse bathed in the rivers.

original: taṃ te yavaṃ yathā gobhiḥ svādum akarma śrīṇantaḥ /
analyzed: tam te yavam yathā gobhiḥ svādum akarma śrīṇantaḥ
translated: We mix this barley for you, as sweet as with cows, when we press it.

original: indra tvāsmin sadhamāde //
analyzed: indra tvā asmin sadhamāde
translated: O Indra, in this assembly.

original: indra it somapā eka indraḥ sutapā viśvāyuḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ id soma pāḥ ekaḥ indraḥ suta pāḥ viśvāyuḥ
translated: Indra alone is the drinker of Soma, Indra the good presser, the life of all,

original: antar devān martyāṃś ca //
analyzed: antar devān martyān ca
translated: Among the gods and mortals.

original: na yaṃ śukro na durāśīr na tṛprā uruvyacasam /
analyzed: na yam śukraḥ na durāśīḥ na tṛpraḥ uru vyacasam
translated: The bright one, the evil-minded one, the three-pointed one do not reach

original: apaspṛṇvate suhārdam //🔽gobhir yad īm anye asman mṛgaṃ na vrā mṛgayante /
analyzed: apaspṛṇvate suhārdam  gobhiḥ yat īm anye asmat mṛgam na vrāḥ mṛgayante
translated: The wide-ruling, the good friend.🔽When others seek him with cows, like a deer, they seek the deer.

original: abhitsaranti dhenubhiḥ //
analyzed: abhitsaranti dhenubhiḥ
translated: They surround him with milch cows.

original: traya indrasya somāḥ sutāsaḥ santu devasya /
analyzed: trayaḥ indrasya somāḥ sutāsaḥ santu devasya
translated: May the three Soma juices of Indra, the god,

original: sve kṣaye sutapāvnaḥ //
analyzed: sve kṣaye suta pāvnaḥ
translated: Be in his own abode, O you who are well-heated.

original: trayaḥ kośāsa ścotanti tisraś camvaḥ supūrṇāḥ /
analyzed: trayaḥ kośāsaḥ ścotanti tisraḥ camvaḥ su pūrṇāḥ
translated: Three jars drip, and three bowls are well-filled,

original: samāne adhi bhārman //
analyzed: samāne adhi bhārman
translated: On the same broad surface.

original: śucir asi puruniṣṭhāḥ kṣīrair madhyata āśīrtaḥ /
analyzed: śuciḥ asi puru niṣṭhāḥ kṣīraiḥ madhyatas āśīrtaḥ
translated: You are pure, O most bountiful one, with milk in the middle, anointed with curds.

original: dadhnā mandiṣṭhaḥ śūrasya //
analyzed: dadhnā mandiṣṭhaḥ śūrasya
translated: Most delightful to the hero.

original: ime ta indra somās tīvrā asme sutāsaḥ /
analyzed: ime te indra somāḥ tīvrāḥ asme sutāsaḥ
translated: These are your Soma juices, O Indra, strong, pressed for us.

original: śukrā āśiraṃ yācante //
analyzed: śukrāḥ āśiram yācante
translated: The bright ones ask for the sweet drink.

original: tāṃ āśiram puroḷāśam indremaṃ somaṃ śrīṇīhi /
analyzed: tām āśiram puroḷāśam indra imam somam śrīṇīhi
translated: Bring that sweet drink, that cake, and this Soma to Indra.

original: revantaṃ hi tvā śṛṇomi //
analyzed: revantam hi tvā śṛṇomi
translated: For I hear that you are very generous.

original: hṛtsu pītāso yudhyante durmadāso na surāyām /
analyzed: hṛtsu pītāsaḥ yudhyante durmadāsaḥ na surāyām
translated: The drunkards fight in their hearts, like intoxicated ones over Surā.

original: ūdhar na nagnā jarante //
analyzed: ūdhar na nagnāḥ jarante
translated: They do not age naked on the udder.

original: revāṃ id revata stotā syāt tvāvato maghonaḥ /🔽pred u harivaḥ śrutasya //
analyzed: revān id revataḥ stotā syāt tvāvataḥ maghonaḥ  pra id u harivas śrutasya
translated: The worshipper should be very generous to you, O generous one, O Maghavan.🔽For I hear of you, O possessor of tawny (horses).

original: ukthaṃ cana śasyamānam agor arir ā ciketa /
analyzed: uktham cana śasyamānam agoḥ ariḥ ā ciketa
translated: The enemy of the poor knows even the praise being sung,

original: na gāyatraṃ gīyamānam //
analyzed: na gāyatram gīyamānam
translated: But not the Gāyatrī chant being sung.

original: mā na indra pīyatnave mā śardhate parā dāḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ indra pīyatnave mā śardhate parā dāḥ
translated: Do not give us to the greedy one, O Indra, do not to the violent one.

original: śikṣā śacīvaḥ śacībhiḥ //
analyzed: śikṣa śacīvas śacībhiḥ
translated: Teach us, O mighty one, with your might.

original: vayam u tvā tadidarthā indra tvāyantaḥ sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: vayam u tvā tadidarthāḥ indra tvāyantaḥ sakhāyaḥ
translated: We, your friends, O Indra, have come to you for this purpose.

original: kaṇvā ukthebhir jarante //
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ ukthebhiḥ jarante
translated: The Kaṇvas serve you with praises.

original: na ghem anyad ā papana vajrinn apaso naviṣṭau /
analyzed: na gha īm anyat ā papana vajrin apasaḥ naviṣṭau
translated: O wielder of the thunderbolt, I do not desire anything else in the new sacrifice.

original: taved u stomaṃ ciketa //
analyzed: tava id u stomam ciketa
translated: I know this praise is for you alone.

original: icchanti devāḥ sunvantaṃ na svapnāya spṛhayanti /
analyzed: icchanti devāḥ sunvantam na svapnāya spṛhayanti
translated: The gods desire the one who presses (Soma), they do not long for sleep.

original: yanti pramādam atandrāḥ //
analyzed: yanti pramādam atandrāḥ
translated: They go to heedlessness, being ever vigilant.

original: o ṣu pra yāhi vājebhir mā hṛṇīthā abhy asmān /
analyzed: ā u su pra yāhi vājebhiḥ mā hṛṇīthāḥ abhi asmān
translated: Come to us, O Agni, with the Vâjas; do not be angry with us.

original: mahāṃ iva yuvajāniḥ //
analyzed: mahān iva yuva jāniḥ
translated: Like a great young woman.

original: mo ṣv adya durhaṇāvān sāyaṃ karad āre asmat /
analyzed: mā u su adya durhaṇāvān sāyam karat āre asmat
translated: Do not, today, O thou of evil thoughts, make an evening for us from the front.

original: aśrīra iva jāmātā //
analyzed: aśrīraḥ iva jāmātā
translated: Like a son-in-law without beauty.

original: vidmā hy asya vīrasya bhūridāvarīṃ sumatim /
analyzed: vidma hi asya vīrasya bhūri dāvarīm sumatim
translated: For we know the abundant favour of this hero,

original: triṣu jātasya manāṃsi //
analyzed: triṣu jātasya manāṃsi
translated: The thoughts of him who is born in three places.

original: ā tū ṣiñca kaṇvamantaṃ na ghā vidma śavasānāt /
analyzed: ā tu siñca kaṇvamantam na ghā vidma śavasānāt
translated: Pour out for him, O Kanva, for he knows not from the strong one,

original: yaśastaraṃ śatamūteḥ //
analyzed: yaśastaram śatamūteḥ
translated: More glorious than a hundred.

original: jyeṣṭhena sotar indrāya somaṃ vīrāya śakrāya /
analyzed: jyeṣṭhena sotar indrāya somam vīrāya śakrāya
translated: Press out the Soma for Indra, O presser, for the hero, for Sakra,

original: bharā piban naryāya //🔽yo vediṣṭho avyathiṣv aśvāvantaṃ jaritṛbhyaḥ /
analyzed: bharā piban naryāya  yaḥ vediṣṭhaḥ avyathiṣu aśvāvantam jaritṛbhyaḥ
translated: Bearing it, for the manly one to drink.🔽Who, best to be worshipped, in battles, for the singers,

original: vājaṃ stotṛbhyo gomantam //🔽panyampanyam it sotāra ā dhāvata madyāya /
analyzed: vājam stotṛbhyaḥ gomantam  panyampanyam id sotāraḥ ā dhāvata madyāya
translated: Bring the prize, with horses, with cattle, for the praisers.🔽Pour out again and again, O pressers, for the strong drink,

original: somaṃ vīrāya śūrāya //
analyzed: somam vīrāya śūrāya
translated: The Soma for the hero, for the brave one.

original: pātā vṛtrahā sutam ā ghā gaman nāre asmat /
analyzed: pātā vṛtrahā sutam ā ghā gamat nā āre asmat
translated: The Vr̥itra-slayer drinks the pressed (juice); he comes to us, O Nâri.

original: ni yamate śatamūtiḥ //🔽eha harī brahmayujā śagmā vakṣataḥ sakhāyam /
analyzed: ni yamate śatamūtiḥ  ā iha harī brahma yujā śagmā vakṣataḥ sakhāyam
translated: He, the protector of a hundred, is restrained.🔽Come hither, O ye two bay horses yoked by prayer, bring the friend, O ye strong ones,

original: gīrbhiḥ śrutaṃ girvaṇasam //
analyzed: gīrbhiḥ śrutam girvaṇasam
translated: The famous one, the lover of song, with songs.

original: svādavaḥ somā ā yāhi śrītāḥ somā ā yāhi /
analyzed: svādavaḥ somāḥ ā yāhi śrītāḥ somāḥ ā yāhi
translated: Sweet are the Somas; come; pressed are the Somas; come.

original: śiprinn ṛṣīvaḥ śacīvo nāyam acchā sadhamādam //
analyzed: śiprin ṛṣīvas śacīvas na ayam acchā sadhamādam
translated: O you with the beautiful face, O you with the strength of the Rishis, come to this feast.

original: stutaś ca yās tvā vardhanti mahe rādhase nṛmṇāya /
analyzed: stutaḥ ca yāḥ tvā vardhanti mahe rādhase nṛmṇāya
translated: And those who praise you for great bounty and manly power,

original: indra kāriṇaṃ vṛdhantaḥ //
analyzed: indra kāriṇam vṛdhantaḥ
translated: O Indra, they who are doing deeds, they who are prospering.

original: giraś ca yās te girvāha ukthā ca tubhyaṃ tāni /
analyzed: giraḥ ca yāḥ te gir vāhaḥ ukthā ca tubhyam tāni
translated: And those hymns of yours, O you who love the hymns, and those eulogies for you,

original: satrā dadhire śavāṃsi //
analyzed: satrā dadhire śavāṃsi
translated: They have always set aside their own strength.

original: eved eṣa tuvikūrmir vājāṃ eko vajrahastaḥ /
analyzed: eva id eṣa tuvikūrmiḥ vājām ekaḥ vajra hastaḥ
translated: This very one, of great power, alone, with the thunderbolt in his hand,

original: sanād amṛkto dayate //
analyzed: sanāt amṛktaḥ dayate
translated: Unimpeded from of old, bestows.

original: hantā vṛtraṃ dakṣiṇenendraḥ purū puruhūtaḥ /
analyzed: hantā vṛtram dakṣiṇena indraḥ purū puruhūtaḥ
translated: Slaying Vrtra with his right hand, Indra, invoked by many,

original: mahān mahībhiḥ śacībhiḥ //
analyzed: mahān mahībhiḥ śacībhiḥ
translated: The great one with his mighty powers.

original: yasmin viśvāś carṣaṇaya uta cyautnā jrayāṃsi ca /
analyzed: yasmin viśvāḥ carṣaṇayaḥ uta cyautnā jrayāṃsi ca
translated: In whom all the people, and the battles, and the vigorous deeds,

original: anu ghen mandī maghonaḥ //
analyzed: anu gha id mandī maghonaḥ
translated: Are ever joined, O bountiful one.

original: eṣa etāni cakārendro viśvā yo 'ti śṛṇve /
analyzed: eṣaḥ etāni cakāra indraḥ viśvā yaḥ ti śṛṇve
translated: This very Indra has done all this, he who hears all,

original: vājadāvā maghonām //
analyzed: vāja dāvā maghonām
translated: The giver of strength to the bountiful ones.

original: prabhartā rathaṃ gavyantam apākāc cid yam avati /
analyzed: prabhartā ratham gavyantam apākāt cit yam avati
translated: The bearer of the chariot seeking cattle, he who protects even from misfortune,

original: ino vasu sa hi voḷhā //
analyzed: inaḥ vasu sa hi voḷhā
translated: He is the bestower of wealth, for he is mighty.

original: sanitā vipro arvadbhir hantā vṛtraṃ nṛbhiḥ śūraḥ /
analyzed: sanitā vipraḥ arvadbhiḥ hantā vṛtram nṛbhiḥ śūraḥ
translated: The sage who wins with the swift horses, the hero who slays Vrtra with men,

original: satyo 'vitā vidhantam //
analyzed: satyaḥ vitā vidhantam
translated: The true protector of the one who is afflicted.

original: yajadhvainam priyamedhā indraṃ satrācā manasā /
analyzed: yajadhva enam priyamedhāḥ indram satrācā manasā
translated: Worship him, O you of pleasing thoughts, Indra, with a mind ever devoted,

original: yo bhūt somaiḥ satyamadvā //
analyzed: yaḥ bhūt somaiḥ satyamadvā
translated: Who has become true by the Soma libations.

original: gāthaśravasaṃ satpatiṃ śravaskāmam purutmānam /🔽kaṇvāso gāta vājinam //
analyzed: gātha śravasam sat patim śravaskāmam purutmānam  kaṇvāsaḥ gāta vājinam
translated: The Kanvas sing to the strong steed, the lord of the herd, the hearer of the herd, the one who desires fame, the one who is much desired.

original: ya ṛte cid gās padebhyo dāt sakhā nṛbhyaḥ śacīvān /
analyzed: yaḥ ṛte cit gāḥ padebhyaḥ dāt sakhā nṛbhyaḥ śacīvān
translated: The one who, even without (the cows) being led to the stalls, gives the cows to the men, the powerful friend,

original: ye asmin kāmam aśriyan //
analyzed: ye asmin kāmam aśriyan
translated: Those who have placed their desire in him.

original: itthā dhīvantam adrivaḥ kāṇvam medhyātithim /
analyzed: itthā dhīvantam adrivas kāṇvam medhyātithim
translated: Thus, O wielder of the thunderbolt, the Kanva Medhyātithi,

original: meṣo bhūto 'bhi yann ayaḥ //
analyzed: meṣaḥ bhūtaḥ bhi yan ayaḥ
translated: The ram, having become iron, has approached.

original: śikṣā vibhindo asmai catvāry ayutā dadat /
analyzed: śikṣa vibhindo asmai catvāri ayutā dadat
translated: The teacher Vibhindu gave him four myriads,

original: aṣṭā paraḥ sahasrā //
analyzed: aṣṭā paras sahasrā
translated: And eight thousand more.

original: uta su tye payovṛdhā mākī raṇasya naptyā /
analyzed: uta su tye payaḥ vṛdhā mākī raṇasya naptyā
translated: And those two, the increasers of milk, the grandson of Māki Raṇa,

original: janitvanāya māmahe //
analyzed: janitvanāya māmahe
translated: We invoke for the sake of begetting.

original: pibā sutasya rasino matsvā na indra gomataḥ /
analyzed: pibā sutasya rasinaḥ matsva naḥ indra gomataḥ
translated: Drink the juice of the pressed (Soma), rejoice in our wealth, O Indra,

original: āpir no bodhi sadhamādyo vṛdhe 'smāṃ avantu te dhiyaḥ //
analyzed: āpiḥ naḥ bodhi sadhamādyaḥ vṛdhe smām avantu te dhiyaḥ
translated: Be our protector, best at the feast, may your thoughts protect us.

original: bhūyāma te sumatau vājino vayam mā na star abhimātaye /
analyzed: bhūyāma te sumatau vājinaḥ vayam mā naḥ star abhimātaye
translated: May we be in your good favor, O strong one, do not oppress us with your anger.

original: asmāñ citrābhir avatād abhiṣṭibhir ā naḥ sumneṣu yāmaya //
analyzed: asmām citrābhiḥ avatāt abhiṣṭibhiḥ ā naḥ sumneṣu yāmaya
translated: Protect us with your wondrous aids, lead us to happiness.

original: imā u tvā purūvaso giro vardhantu yā mama /
analyzed: imāḥ u tvā purūvaso giraḥ vardhantu yāḥ mama
translated: These songs of mine, O you of abundant wealth, may they strengthen you,

original: pāvakavarṇāḥ śucayo vipaścito 'bhi stomair anūṣata //
analyzed: pāvaka varṇāḥ śucayaḥ vipaścitaḥ bhiḥ stomaiḥ anūṣata
translated: The pure ones, the wise ones, of the color of fire, have sung with praises.

original: ayaṃ sahasram ṛṣibhiḥ sahaskṛtaḥ samudra iva paprathe /
analyzed: ayam sahasram ṛṣibhiḥ sahaskṛtaḥ samudraḥ iva paprathe
translated: This one, made by the thousand with the Rishis, hath spread forth like the ocean.

original: satyaḥ so asya mahimā gṛṇe śavo yajñeṣu viprarājye //
analyzed: satyaḥ saḥ asya mahimā gṛṇe śavaḥ yajñeṣu viprarājye
translated: The true greatness of him is sung in the assemblies of the priests at sacrifices, his power.

original: indram id devatātaya indram prayaty adhvare /
analyzed: indram id devatātaye indram prayati adhvare
translated: To Indra, the deity, to Indra, when the sacrifice proceeds,

original: indraṃ samīke vanino havāmaha indraṃ dhanasya sātaye //🔽indro mahnā rodasī paprathac chava indraḥ sūryam arocayat /
analyzed: indram samīke vaninaḥ havāmahe indram dhanasya sātaye  indraḥ mahnā rodasī paprathat śavaḥ indraḥ sūryam arocayat
translated: To Indra, in the battle, the singers call, to Indra to gain wealth.🔽Indra hath spread out the two world-halves with his greatness, Indra hath caused the sun to shine.

original: indre ha viśvā bhuvanāni yemira indre suvānāsa indavaḥ //
analyzed: indre ha viśvā bhuvanāni yemire indre suvānāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: In Indra all the worlds are to be ordered, in Indra the pressed Soma-drops are purified.

original: abhi tvā pūrvapītaya indra stomebhir āyavaḥ /
analyzed: abhi tvā pūrva pītaye indra stomebhiḥ āyavaḥ
translated: The living ones, O Indra, the first to drink, with praises, have come to thee.

original: samīcīnāsa ṛbhavaḥ sam asvaran rudrā gṛṇanta pūrvyam //
analyzed: samīcīnāsaḥ ṛbhavaḥ sam asvaran rudrāḥ gṛṇanta pūrvyam
translated: The Rishis, the sons of Rishis, have sung forth the ancient one.

original: asyed indro vāvṛdhe vṛṣṇyaṃ śavo made sutasya viṣṇavi /
analyzed: asya id indraḥ vāvṛdhe vṛṣṇyam śavaḥ made sutasya viṣṇavi
translated: By this, O Indra, thy manly strength hath grown great in the rapture of the juice shed forth in Vishṇu's place.

original: adyā tam asya mahimānam āyavo 'nu ṣṭuvanti pūrvathā //
analyzed: adyā tam asya mahimānam āyavaḥ nu stuvanti pūrvathā
translated: The living ones today extol that greatness of thine as in the days of old.

original: tat tvā yāmi suvīryaṃ tad brahma pūrvacittaye /
analyzed: tat tvā yāmi su vīryam tat brahma pūrvacittaye
translated: To that thy hero might, to that holy power for earliest thought,

original: yenā yatibhyo bhṛgave dhane hite yena praskaṇvam āvitha //
analyzed: yena yatibhyaḥ bhṛgave dhane hite yena praskaṇvam āvitha
translated: Wherewith thou holpest Yati and Bhrigu when the prize was staked, wherewith thou holpest Prṣnigarbha and Praskanva,

original: yenā samudram asṛjo mahīr apas tad indra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ /
analyzed: yena samudram asṛjaḥ mahīḥ apaḥ tat indra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ
translated: Wherewith thou madest the ocean, the great waters, that, O Indra, is thy manly strength, O Vrṣan.

original: sadyaḥ so asya mahimā na saṃnaśe yaṃ kṣoṇīr anucakrade //
analyzed: sadyas saḥ asya mahimā na saṃnaśe yam kṣoṇīḥ anucakrade
translated: His greatness shall not be diminished at once, whom the two worlds have made to be worshipped.

original: śagdhī na indra yat tvā rayiṃ yāmi suvīryam /
analyzed: śagdhi naḥ indra yat tvā rayim yāmi su vīryam
translated: Help us, O Indra, when we seek wealth and good heroism from thee.

original: śagdhi vājāya prathamaṃ siṣāsate śagdhi stomāya pūrvya //🔽śagdhī no asya yad dha pauram āvitha dhiya indra siṣāsataḥ /
analyzed: śagdhi vājāya prathamam siṣāsate śagdhi stomāya pūrvya  śagdhi naḥ asya yat ha pauram āvitha dhiyaḥ indra siṣāsataḥ
translated: Help for the first victory, for the one who strives, help for the praise, O ancient one.🔽Help us in this, O Indra, when thou hast helped the wealth of the one who strives with his thoughts.

original: śagdhi yathā ruśamaṃ śyāvakaṃ kṛpam indra prāvaḥ svarṇaram //
analyzed: śagdhi yathā ruśamam śyāvakam kṛpam indra prāvaḥ svarṇaram
translated: Help so that thou mayst win the ruddy, the dark, the tawny one, O Indra, the golden one.

original: kan navyo atasīnāṃ turo gṛṇīta martyaḥ /
analyzed: kad navyaḥ atasīnām turaḥ gṛṇīta martyaḥ
translated: Which mortal shall praise the new strong one of the Atasi people?

original: nahī nv asya mahimānam indriyaṃ svar gṛṇanta ānaśuḥ //
analyzed: nahi nu asya mahimānam indriyam svar gṛṇantaḥ ānaśuḥ
translated: For they have not attained the greatness and power of Indra, who sing his heavenly praise.

original: kad u stuvanta ṛtayanta devata ṛṣiḥ ko vipra ohate /
analyzed: kad u stuvantaḥ ṛtayanta devataḥ ṛṣiḥ kaḥ vipraḥ ohate
translated: When will the truthful gods be praised? Which Ṛṣi, which wise one understands?

original: kadā havam maghavann indra sunvataḥ kad u stuvata ā gamaḥ //
analyzed: kadā havam maghavan indra sunvataḥ kad u stuvate ā gamaḥ
translated: When, O magnanimous Indra, will you come to the pressing of the one who offers libations, when will you come to the one who praises?

original: ud u tye madhumattamā gira stomāsa īrate /
analyzed: ud u tye madhumattamāḥ giraḥ stomāsaḥ īrate
translated: These songs, these praises, most rich in sweetness, rise up.

original: satrājito dhanasā akṣitotayo vājayanto rathā iva //
analyzed: satrājitaḥ dhana sāḥ akṣita ūtayaḥ vājayantaḥ rathāḥ iva
translated: The ever-victorious, the ever-new, the inexhaustible, the swift ones, like chariots, striving for booty.

original: kaṇvā iva bhṛgavaḥ sūryā iva viśvam id dhītam ānaśuḥ /
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ iva bhṛgavaḥ sūryāḥ iva viśvam id dhītam ānaśuḥ
translated: The Kaṇvas, like the Bhṛgus, the Sūryas, have attained all that is to be gained by praise.

original: indraṃ stomebhir mahayanta āyavaḥ priyamedhāso asvaran //
analyzed: indram stomebhiḥ mahayantaḥ āyavaḥ priyamedhāsaḥ asvaran
translated: The living ones, the Priyamedhas, have sung, extolling Indra with their hymns.

original: yukṣvā hi vṛtrahantama harī indra parāvataḥ /
analyzed: yukṣvā hi vṛtra hantama harī indra parāvataḥ
translated: Yoke, O Vṛtra-slayer, O Indra, thy two Bay Steeds from afar,

original: arvācīno maghavan somapītaya ugra ṛṣvebhir ā gahi //
analyzed: arvācīnaḥ maghavan soma pītaye ugraḥ ṛṣvebhiḥ ā gahi
translated: Come hither, O bountiful one, with the mighty ones, to drink the Soma.

original: ime hi te kāravo vāvaśur dhiyā viprāso medhasātaye /
analyzed: ime hi te kāravaḥ vāvaśuḥ dhiyā viprāsaḥ medha sātaye
translated: For these thy bards have sung with thought, the sages for the sake of the sacrifice.

original: sa tvaṃ no maghavann indra girvaṇo veno na śṛṇudhī havam //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ maghavan indra girvaṇaḥ venaḥ na śṛṇudhi havam
translated: Therefore, O Indra, bountiful, lover of song, hear thou the call of the singer.

original: nir indra bṛhatībhyo vṛtraṃ dhanubhyo asphuraḥ /
analyzed: niḥ indra bṛhatībhyaḥ vṛtram dhanubhyaḥ asphuraḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast burst Vṛtra from the great bow-like (clouds),

original: nir arbudasya mṛgayasya māyino niḥ parvatasya gā ājaḥ //
analyzed: niḥ arbudasya mṛgayasya māyinaḥ niḥ parvatasya gāḥ ājaḥ
translated: Thou hast brought hither the cows of the mountain, of the wild beast, of the magician, of the Arbudi.

original: nir agnayo rurucur nir u sūryo niḥ soma indriyo rasaḥ /
analyzed: niḥ agnayaḥ rurucuḥ niḥ u sūryaḥ niḥ somaḥ indriyaḥ rasaḥ
translated: The fires have shone forth, the sun, the Soma, the invigorating juice,

original: nir antarikṣād adhamo mahām ahiṃ kṛṣe tad indra pauṃsyam //
analyzed: niḥ antarikṣāt adhamaḥ mahām ahim kṛṣe tat indra pauṃsyam
translated: From the atmosphere thou hast dragged down the great serpent: this is thy manliness, O Indra.

original: yam me dur indro marutaḥ pākasthāmā kaurayāṇaḥ /
analyzed: yam me duḥ indraḥ marutaḥ pākasthāmā kaurayāṇaḥ
translated: Whom, O Indra, the Maruts, the wicked-minded Pākastambha, the son of Kaura,

original: viśveṣāṃ tmanā śobhiṣṭham upeva divi dhāvamānam //
analyzed: viśveṣām tmanā śobhiṣṭham upa iva divi dhāvamānam
translated: The most glorious of all by his own might, as it were running in the sky.

original: rohitam me pākasthāmā sudhuraṃ kakṣyaprām /
analyzed: rohitam me pākasthāmā su dhuram kakṣya prām
translated: To me Pākastambha has given a red bull, strong, with a girth like a rope,

original: adād rāyo vibodhanam //
analyzed: adāt rāyaḥ vibodhanam
translated: The awakener of wealth.

original: yasmā anye daśa prati dhuraṃ vahanti vahnayaḥ /
analyzed: yasmai anye daśa prati dhuram vahanti vahnayaḥ
translated: Whom ten other yoked bulls draw, one after another,

original: astaṃ vayo na tugryam //
analyzed: astam vayaḥ na tugryam
translated: To Tugra's son, as a bird (draws) to the sky.

original: ātmā pitus tanūr vāsa ojodā abhyañjanam /
analyzed: ātmā pituḥ tanūḥ vāsaḥ ojaḥ dāḥ abhyañjanam
translated: The body of the father is the self, the garment is the skin, the anointing is the strength.

original: turīyam id rohitasya pākasthāmānam bhojaṃ dātāram abravam //
analyzed: turīyam id rohitasya pākasthāmānam bhojam dātāram abravam
translated: I have spoken of the fourth, the cooked food of Rohita, the giver, the enjoyer of the Paka-sthaman.

original: yad indra prāg apāg udaṅ nyag vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: yat indra prāk apāk udak nyak vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ
translated: When, O Indra, you are invoked by men either to the east, west, north, or downward,

original: simā purū nṛṣūto asy ānave 'si praśardha turvaśe //
analyzed: sima purū nṛṣūtaḥ asi ānave si praśardha turvaśe
translated: You are the bountiful one among many men, you are the one who subdues the Anus and Turvasas.

original: yad vā rume ruśame śyāvake kṛpa indra mādayase sacā /
analyzed: yat vā rume ruśame śyāvake kṛpe indra mādayase sacā
translated: When, O Indra, you rejoice with the Rumas, the Rusamas, and the Syavakas,

analyzed: ā iha vām pruṣitapsavaḥ vayaḥ vahantu parṇinaḥ

original: acchā svadhvaraṃ janam //
analyzed: acchā su adhvaram janam

original: rathaṃ vām anugāyasaṃ ya iṣā vartate saha /
analyzed: ratham vām anugāyasam yaḥ iṣā vartate saha
translated: The chariot that follows you, which moves with food,

original: na cakram abhi bādhate //
analyzed: na cakram abhi bādhate
translated: Does not impede the wheel.

original: hiraṇyayena rathena dravatpāṇibhir aśvaiḥ /
analyzed: hiraṇyayena rathena dravat pāṇibhiḥ aśvaiḥ
translated: With your golden chariot, with your swift-handed horses,

original: dhījavanā nāsatyā //
analyzed: dhī javanā nāsatyā
translated: O Nāsatyas, with your mind-swift (chariot).

original: yuvam mṛgaṃ jāgṛvāṃsaṃ svadatho vā vṛṣaṇvasū /
analyzed: yuvam mṛgam jāgṛvāṃsam svadathaḥ vā vṛṣaṇvasū
translated: You two delight in the watchful deer, or in the bull, O you who possess great wealth.

original: tā naḥ pṛṅktam iṣā rayim //
analyzed: tā naḥ pṛṅktam iṣā rayim
translated: Bestow on us food and wealth.

original: tā me aśvinā sanīnāṃ vidyātaṃ navānām /
analyzed: tā me aśvinā sanīnām vidyātam navānām
translated: O Aśvins, may you know my new and old desires.

analyzed: yathā cit caidyaḥ kaśuḥ śatam uṣṭrānām dadat sahasrā daśa gonām
translated: As the son of Cedi, giving a hundred oxen and ten thousand cows.

original: yo me hiraṇyasaṃdṛśo daśa rājño amaṃhata /
analyzed: yaḥ me hiraṇya saṃdṛśaḥ daśa rājñaḥ amaṃhata

analyzed: adhaspadāḥ id caidyasya kṛṣṭayaḥ carmamnāḥ abhitas janāḥ
translated: The people on all sides are under the feet of Cedi, and the peasants are like leather.

original: mākir enā pathā gād yeneme yanti cedayaḥ /
analyzed: mākir enā pathā gāt yena ime yanti cedayaḥ
translated: Let him not go by that path by which the Chedis go.

analyzed: anyaḥ na id sūriḥ ohate bhūri dāvattaraḥ janaḥ
translated: Let another lord be chosen, a people more bountiful.

analyzed: mahān indraḥ yaḥ ojasā parjanyaḥ vṛṣṭimān iva
translated: Great is Indra, who by his might is like Parjanya full of rain,

analyzed: stomaiḥ vatsasya vāvṛdhe  prajām ṛtasya piprataḥ pra yat bharanta vahnayaḥ
translated: He has grown by the praises of Vatsa.🔽When the priests of holy order spread forth offspring,

original: viprā ṛtasya vāhasā //
analyzed: viprāḥ ṛtasya vāhasā
translated: The seers by the impulse of holy order.

original: kaṇvā indraṃ yad akrata stomair yajñasya sādhanam /
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ indram yat akrata stomaiḥ yajñasya sādhanam
translated: When the Kaṇvas made Indra with praises to accomplish the sacrifice,

original: jāmi bruvata āyudham //
analyzed: jāmi bruvate āyudham
translated: Addressing him as a kinsman, a weapon.

original: sam asya manyave viśo viśvā namanta kṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: sam asya manyave viśaḥ viśvāḥ namanta kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: All the people and all the clans bow down to his wrath,

original: samudrāyeva sindhavaḥ //
analyzed: samudrāya iva sindhavaḥ
translated: Like rivers to the ocean.

original: ojas tad asya titviṣa ubhe yat samavartayat /
analyzed: ojaḥ tat asya titviṣe ubhe yat samavartayat
translated: That is his strength and his splendor, that he has brought together both,

analyzed: indraḥ carma iva rodasī  vi cit vṛtrasya dodhataḥ vajreṇa śata parvaṇā
translated: Indra the two worlds as with a shield.🔽Even through the rushing of Vṛtra he cleft asunder with his hundred-knotted thunderbolt,

original: śiro bibheda vṛṣṇinā //
analyzed: śiraḥ bibheda vṛṣṇinā
translated: His head with his mighty (weapon).

original: imā abhi pra ṇonumo vipām agreṣu dhītayaḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ abhi pra nonumaḥ vipām agreṣu dhītayaḥ
translated: We utter these songs of praise to the most excellent of the Vipa.

original: agneḥ śocir na didyutaḥ //
analyzed: agneḥ śociḥ na didyutaḥ
translated: Like the flame of Agni, like a flash of lightning.

original: guhā satīr upa tmanā pra yac chocanta dhītayaḥ /
analyzed: guhā satīḥ upa tmanā pra yat śocanta dhītayaḥ
translated: When the songs, existing in secret, shine forth by themselves,

original: kaṇvā ṛtasya dhārayā //
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ ṛtasya dhārayā
translated: The Kaṇvas, with the stream of holy order.

original: pra tam indra naśīmahi rayiṃ gomantam aśvinam /
analyzed: pra tam indra naśīmahi rayim gomantam aśvinam
translated: That wealth, O Indra, may we obtain, rich in cattle and horses,

original: pra brahma pūrvacittaye //
analyzed: pra brahma pūrvacittaye
translated: The prayer for the sake of our former thoughts.

original: aham id dhi pituṣ pari medhām ṛtasya jagrabha /
analyzed: aham id hi pituḥ pari medhām ṛtasya jagrabha
translated: For I have grasped from my father the wisdom of holy order.

original: ahaṃ sūrya ivājani //
analyzed: aham sūrye iva ajani
translated: I have been born like the sun.

original: aham pratnena manmanā giraḥ śumbhāmi kaṇvavat /
analyzed: aham pratnena manmanā giraḥ śumbhāmi kaṇva vat
translated: With the ancient hymn I adorn the songs like Kaṇva,

original: yenendraḥ śuṣmam id dadhe //
analyzed: yena indraḥ śuṣmam id dadhe
translated: Whereby Indra has taken strength.

original: ye tvām indra na tuṣṭuvur ṛṣayo ye ca tuṣṭuvuḥ /
analyzed: ye tvām indra na tuṣṭuvuḥ ṛṣayaḥ ye ca tuṣṭuvuḥ
translated: O Indra, those Ṛṣis who have not praised you, and those who have,

original: mamed vardhasva suṣṭutaḥ //
analyzed: mama id vardhasva suṣṭutaḥ
translated: May I prosper, well praised by you.

original: yad asya manyur adhvanīd vi vṛtram parvaśo rujan /
analyzed: yat asya manyuḥ adhvanīt vi vṛtram parvaśas rujan
translated: When his wrathful spirit, breaking Vṛtra limb from limb,

original: apaḥ samudram airayat //
analyzed: apaḥ samudram airayat
translated: Sent the waters to the ocean.

original: ni śuṣṇa indra dharṇasiṃ vajraṃ jaghantha dasyavi /
analyzed: ni śuṣṇe indra dharṇasim vajram jaghantha dasyavi
translated: O Indra, you struck down the Dāsa's firm thunderbolt,

original: vṛṣā hy ugra śṛṇviṣe //
analyzed: vṛṣā hi ugra śṛṇviṣe
translated: For you, O mighty one, are eager to hear.

original: na dyāva indram ojasā nāntarikṣāṇi vajriṇam /
analyzed: na dyāvaḥ indram ojasā na antarikṣāṇi vajriṇam
translated: Neither the heavens nor the firmaments of the wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: na vivyacanta bhūmayaḥ //
analyzed: na vivyacanta bhūmayaḥ
translated: Nor the earths could contain him.

original: yas ta indra mahīr apa stabhūyamāna āśayat /
analyzed: yaḥ te indra mahīḥ apaḥ stabhūyamānaḥ āśayat
translated: He who, O Indra, has set in order your great abodes,

original: ni tam padyāsu śiśnathaḥ //
analyzed: ni tam padyāsu śiśnathaḥ
translated: Crush him down in the paths of the swift one.

original: ya ime rodasī mahī samīcī samajagrabhīt /
analyzed: yaḥ ime rodasī mahī samīcī samajagrabhīt
translated: He who has grasped these two great worlds together,

original: tamobhir indra taṃ guhaḥ //
analyzed: tamobhiḥ indra tam guhaḥ
translated: O Indra, is hidden by darkness.

original: ya indra yatayas tvā bhṛgavo ye ca tuṣṭuvuḥ /
analyzed: ye indra yatayaḥ tvā bhṛgavaḥ ye ca tuṣṭuvuḥ
translated: O Indra, those who have striven for you, the Bhṛgus and those who have praised you,

original: mamed ugra śrudhī havam //
analyzed: mama id ugra śrudhi havam
translated: Listen to my strong call.

original: imās ta indra pṛśnayo ghṛtaṃ duhata āśiram /
analyzed: imāḥ te indra pṛśnayaḥ ghṛtam duhate āśiram
translated: These speckled cows of yours, O Indra, are milking ghee and clarified butter,

original: enām ṛtasya pipyuṣīḥ //
analyzed: enām ṛtasya pipyuṣīḥ
translated: These, swollen with the sap of truth.

original: yā indra prasvas tvāsā garbham acakriran /
analyzed: yāḥ indra prasvaḥ tvāsā garbham acakriran
translated: Those who, O Indra, have been most eager to win a son,

original: pari dharmeva sūryam //
analyzed: pari dharmā iva sūryam

analyzed: tvām id śavasaḥ pate kaṇvāḥ ukthena vāvṛdhuḥ  tvām sutāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: You, O lord of strength, the Kaṇvas have magnified with a hymn,🔽You, the pressed juices, O Indra.

original: taved indra praṇītiṣūta praśastir adrivaḥ /
analyzed: tava id indra praṇītiṣu uta praśastiḥ adrivas
translated: Your praise, O Indra, O wielder of the thunderbolt, is foremost in your guidance,

original: yajño vitantasāyyaḥ //
analyzed: yajñaḥ vitantasāyyaḥ

original: ā na indra mahīm iṣam puraṃ na darṣi gomatīm /
analyzed: ā naḥ indra mahīm iṣam puram na darṣi gomatīm
translated: To us, O Indra, show the great food, the fortress rich in cattle,

original: uta prajāṃ suvīryam //
analyzed: uta prajām su vīryam

original: uta tyad āśvaśvyaṃ yad indra nāhuṣīṣv ā /
analyzed: uta tyad āśu aśvyam yat indra nāhuṣīṣu ā
translated: And that which is most excellent among horses, which, O Indra, is among the Nāhusīs,

original: agre vikṣu pradīdayat //
analyzed: agre vikṣu pradīdayat

original: abhi vrajaṃ na tatniṣe sūra upākacakṣasam /
analyzed: abhi vrajam na tatniṣe sūraḥ upāka cakṣasam
translated: You have kindled the dwelling, O sun, with eyes looking around,

original: yad indra mṛḷayāsi naḥ //
analyzed: yat indra mṛḍayāsi naḥ
translated: Since, O Indra, you are gracious to us.

original: yad aṅga taviṣīyasa indra prarājasi kṣitīḥ /
analyzed: yat aṅga taviṣīyase indra prarājasi kṣitīḥ
translated: Since, O mighty Indra, you rule over the lands,

original: mahāṃ apāra ojasā //
analyzed: mahān apāraḥ ojasā
translated: Great, boundless with your strength.

original: taṃ tvā haviṣmatīr viśa upa bruvata ūtaye /
analyzed: tam tvā haviṣmatīḥ viśaḥ upa bruvate ūtaye
translated: The people who bring oblations call upon thee for aid.

original: urujrayasam indubhiḥ //
analyzed: uru jrayasam indubhiḥ

original: upahvare girīṇāṃ saṃgathe ca nadīnām /
analyzed: upahvare girīṇām saṃgathe ca nadīnām

original: dhiyā vipro ajāyata //
analyzed: dhiyā vipraḥ ajāyata

original: ataḥ samudram udvataś cikitvāṃ ava paśyati /
analyzed: atas samudram udvataḥ cikitvān ava paśyati
translated: From there he looks upon the ocean, the wise one, from the height,

original: yato vipāna ejati //
analyzed: yatas vipānaḥ ejati
translated: From which the drinking-place moves.

original: ād it pratnasya retaso jyotiṣ paśyanti vāsaram /
analyzed: āt id pratnasya retasaḥ jyotiḥ paśyanti vāsaram
translated: They behold the light of the ancient seed, the day,

original: paro yad idhyate divā //
analyzed: paras yat idhyate divā
translated: When it is kindled above, in the sky.

original: kaṇvāsa indra te matiṃ viśve vardhanti pauṃsyam /
analyzed: kaṇvāsaḥ indra te matim viśve vardhanti pauṃsyam
translated: The Kaṇvas, O Indra, all increase thy thought, thy manly power,

original: uto śaviṣṭha vṛṣṇyam //
analyzed: uta u śaviṣṭha vṛṣṇyam
translated: And also, O mightiest one, thy strength.

original: imām ma indra suṣṭutiṃ juṣasva pra su mām ava /
analyzed: imām me indra suṣṭutim juṣasva pra su mām ava
translated: Accept this praise of mine, O Indra, and help me well,

analyzed: uta pra vardhaya matim  uta brahmaṇyāḥ vayam tubhyam pravṛddha vajrivas
translated: And also increase my thought.🔽And we, O much-increased one, O wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: viprā atakṣma jīvase //
analyzed: viprāḥ atakṣma jīvase
translated: The sages have fashioned this prayer for thee, that thou mayest live.

original: abhi kaṇvā anūṣatāpo na pravatā yatīḥ /
analyzed: abhi kaṇvāḥ anūṣata apaḥ na pravatā yatīḥ
translated: The Kaṇvas have sung forth, like waters flowing in channels,

original: indraṃ vananvatī matiḥ //
analyzed: indram vananvatī matiḥ
translated: To Indra, the thought that seeks him.

original: indram ukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ samudram iva sindhavaḥ /
analyzed: indram ukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ samudram iva sindhavaḥ
translated: The hymns have magnified Indra, like the rivers (magnifying) the ocean,

original: anuttamanyum ajaram //
analyzed: anutta manyum ajaram

original: ā no yāhi parāvato haribhyāṃ haryatābhyām /
analyzed: ā naḥ yāhi parāvataḥ haribhyām haryatābhyām
translated: Come to us from the further shore with thy two beautiful tawny (horses),

original: imam indra sutam piba //
analyzed: imam indra sutam piba
translated: Drink this, O Indra, which has been pressed for thee.

original: tvām id vṛtrahantama janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: tvām id vṛtra hantama janāsaḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: You, O best of Vritra-slayers, the people with strewn sacrificial grass,

original: havante vājasātaye //
analyzed: havante vājasātaye
translated: Call upon you for the sake of gaining strength.

original: anu tvā rodasī ubhe cakraṃ na varty etaśam /
analyzed: anu tvā rodasī ubhe cakram na varti etaśam
translated: The two world-halves follow you, like a wheel that is never turned back,

original: anu suvānāsa indavaḥ //
analyzed: anu suvānāsaḥ indavaḥ

original: mandasvā su svarṇara utendra śaryaṇāvati /
analyzed: mandasva su svarṇare uta indra śaryaṇāvati
translated: Be gladdened, O you of golden hue, and also, O Indra, in the house of Saryaṇa,

original: matsvā vivasvato matī //
analyzed: matsva vivasvataḥ matī
translated: Be gladdened by the thought of Vivasvat.

original: vāvṛdhāna upa dyavi vṛṣā vajry aroravīt /
analyzed: vāvṛdhānaḥ upa dyavi vṛṣā vajrī aroravīt

original: vṛtrahā somapātamaḥ //
analyzed: vṛtra hā soma pātamaḥ

original: ṛṣir hi pūrvajā asy eka īśāna ojasā /
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ hi pūrva jāḥ asi ekaḥ īśānaḥ ojasā

original: indra coṣkūyase vasu //
analyzed: indra coṣkūyase vasu
translated: O Indra, you are to be praised for wealth.

original: asmākaṃ tvā sutāṃ upa vītapṛṣṭhā abhi prayaḥ /
analyzed: asmākam tvā sutām upa vīta pṛṣṭhāḥ abhi prayaḥ
translated: We will bring you to our Soma, O you with a back covered in gold, to the sacrificial food,

original: śataṃ vahantu harayaḥ //
analyzed: śatam vahantu harayaḥ
translated: Let a hundred tawny (horses) carry you!

original: imāṃ su pūrvyāṃ dhiyam madhor ghṛtasya pipyuṣīm /
analyzed: imām su pūrvyām dhiyam madhoḥ ghṛtasya pipyuṣīm
translated: This ancient thought, which is filled with honey and ghee,

original: kaṇvā ukthena vāvṛdhuḥ //🔽indram id vimahīnām medhe vṛṇīta martyaḥ /
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ ukthena vāvṛdhuḥ  indram id vimahīnām medhe vṛṇīta martyaḥ
translated: The Kaṇvas have increased with a hymn.🔽A mortal should choose Indra, the wise one, among the bountiful ones,

original: indraṃ saniṣyur ūtaye //
analyzed: indram saniṣyuḥ ūtaye
translated: Indra, the one who wishes to gain, for help.

original: arvāñcaṃ tvā puruṣṭuta priyamedhastutā harī /
analyzed: arvāñcam tvā puruṣṭuta priyamedha stutā harī
translated: O you who are praised by many, the two horses praised by Priyamedhas

original: somapeyāya vakṣataḥ //
analyzed: soma peyāya vakṣataḥ

original: śatam ahaṃ tirindire sahasram parśāv ā dade /
analyzed: śatam aham tirindire sahasram parśau ā dade
translated: A hundred (cows) I have obtained in Tindira, a thousand in Parṣā,

original: rādhāṃsi yādvānām //
analyzed: rādhāṃsi yādvānām
translated: The gifts of the Yadus.

original: trīṇi śatāny arvatāṃ sahasrā daśa gonām /
analyzed: trīṇi śatāni arvatām sahasrā daśa gonām
translated: Three hundred horses and ten thousand cows

original: daduṣ pajrāya sāmne //
analyzed: daduḥ pajrāya sāmne
translated: Did they give to Pajra for the Saman.

original: ud ānaṭ kakuho divam uṣṭrāñ caturyujo dadat /
analyzed: ud ānaṭ kakuhaḥ divam uṣṭrām catur yujaḥ dadat
translated: Kakhu lifted up the sky, and gave four-oxen teams,

original: śravasā yādvaṃ janam //
analyzed: śravasā yādvam janam
translated: Through glory to the people of Yadu.

original: pra yad vas triṣṭubham iṣam maruto vipro akṣarat /
analyzed: pra yat vaḥ triṣṭubham iṣam marutaḥ vipraḥ akṣarat
translated: When the sage has sent forth the Tristubh verse to you, O Maruts, for food,

original: vi parvateṣu rājatha //
analyzed: vi parvateṣu rājatha
translated: You shine among the mountains.

original: yad aṅga taviṣīyavo yāmaṃ śubhrā acidhvam /
analyzed: yat aṅga taviṣīyavaḥ yāmam śubhrāḥ acidhvam
translated: When, O mighty ones, you, the bright ones, have set your mind on the journey,

original: ni parvatā ahāsata //
analyzed: ni parvatāḥ ahāsata
translated: The mountains have trembled.

original: ud īrayanta vāyubhir vāśrāsaḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ /
analyzed: ud īrayanta vāyubhiḥ vāśrāsaḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ
translated: They send forth the clouds with the winds, the sons of Pr̥iṣni,

original: dhukṣanta pipyuṣīm iṣam //
analyzed: dhukṣanta pipyuṣīm iṣam
translated: They make the swelling food to flow.

original: vapanti maruto miham pra vepayanti parvatān /
analyzed: vapanti marutaḥ miham pra vepayanti parvatān
translated: The Maruts scatter the mist, they make the mountains tremble,

original: yad yāmaṃ yānti vāyubhiḥ //
analyzed: yat yāmam yānti vāyubhiḥ
translated: When they go on their journey with the winds.

original: ni yad yāmāya vo girir ni sindhavo vidharmaṇe /
analyzed: ni yat yāmāya vaḥ giriḥ ni sindhavaḥ vidharmaṇe
translated: When the mountain and the rivers for your coming, O you of fixed law,

original: mahe śuṣmāya yemire //🔽yuṣmāṃ u naktam ūtaye yuṣmān divā havāmahe /
analyzed: mahe śuṣmāya yemire  yuṣmān u naktam ūtaye yuṣmān divā havāmahe
translated: Bowed down to your great strength.🔽We call on you at night for help, on you by day we invoke,

original: yuṣmān prayaty adhvare //
analyzed: yuṣmān prayati adhvare
translated: On you when we set out at the sacrifice.

original: ud u tye aruṇapsavaś citrā yāmebhir īrate /
analyzed: ud u tye aruṇapsavaḥ citrāḥ yāmebhiḥ īrate
translated: Those ruddy ones rise up with their variegated journeys,

original: vāśrā adhi ṣṇunā divaḥ //
analyzed: vāśrāḥ adhi snunā divaḥ
translated: The clouds on the back of the firm sky.

original: sṛjanti raśmim ojasā panthāṃ sūryāya yātave /
analyzed: sṛjanti raśmim ojasā panthām sūryāya yātave
translated: They send forth the ray with might, the path for Surya to travel.

original: te bhānubhir vi tasthire //
analyzed: te bhānubhiḥ vi tasthire
translated: They have spread out with their beams.

original: imām me maruto giram imaṃ stomam ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: imām me marutaḥ giram imam stomam ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ
translated: Accept this hymn of mine, O Maruts, this praise, O ye who are R̥ibhu's sons.

original: imam me vanatā havam //
analyzed: imam me vanata havam
translated: Accept this call of mine.

original: trīṇi sarāṃsi pṛśnayo duduhre vajriṇe madhu /
analyzed: trīṇi sarāṃsi pṛśnayaḥ duduhre vajriṇe madhu
translated: The dappled cows have yielded three lakes of mead for him who wields the thunderbolt,

original: utsaṃ kavandham udriṇam //
analyzed: utsam kabandham udriṇam
translated: The spring, the reservoir, the well.

original: maruto yad dha vo divaḥ sumnāyanto havāmahe /
analyzed: marutaḥ yat ha vaḥ divaḥ sumnāyantaḥ havāmahe
translated: O Maruts, when we call on you from heaven, seeking your favour,

original: ā tū na upa gantana //
analyzed: ā tū naḥ upa gantana
translated: Come ye unto us.

original: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā sudānavo rudrā ṛbhukṣaṇo dame /
analyzed: yūyam hi stha sudānavaḥ rudrāḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ dame
translated: For ye are they, O ye of bounteous gifts, O Rudras, R̥ibhukshanas, in the house,

original: uta pracetaso made //
analyzed: uta pracetasaḥ made
translated: And wise in the wild joy of Soma.

original: ā no rayim madacyutam purukṣuṃ viśvadhāyasam /
analyzed: ā naḥ rayim mada cyutam purukṣum viśva dhāyasam
translated: Bring hither unto us that wealth which floweth with the juice, which feedeth many, and supporteth all.

original: iyartā maruto divaḥ //
analyzed: iyarta marutaḥ divaḥ
translated: The Maruts move from heaven.

original: adhīva yad girīṇāṃ yāmaṃ śubhrā acidhvam /
analyzed: adhi iva yat girīṇām yāmam śubhrāḥ acidhvam
translated: When ye, O bright ones, have directed your way to the mountains,

original: suvānair mandadhva indubhiḥ //
analyzed: suvānaiḥ mandadhve indubhiḥ
translated: Ye are gladdened with the flowing drops of Soma.

original: etāvataś cid eṣāṃ sumnam bhikṣeta martyaḥ /
analyzed: etāvataḥ cit eṣām sumnam bhikṣeta martyaḥ
translated: Even from so great a distance a mortal may beg of them for bliss,

original: adābhyasya manmabhiḥ //
analyzed: adābhyasya manmabhiḥ
translated: Of him who is unassailable, with hymns of praise.

original: ye drapsā iva rodasī dhamanty anu vṛṣṭibhiḥ /
analyzed: ye drapsāḥ iva rodasī dhamanti anu vṛṣṭibhiḥ
translated: They who, like drops, with showers of rain, blow through the two world-halves,

original: utsaṃ duhanto akṣitam //
analyzed: utsam duhantaḥ akṣitam
translated: Milling the inexhaustible spring.

original: ud u svānebhir īrata ud rathair ud u vāyubhiḥ /
analyzed: ud u svānebhiḥ īrate ud rathaiḥ ud u vāyubhiḥ
translated: Rise up with your songs of praise, rise up with your chariots, rise up with your winds,

original: ut stomaiḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ //
analyzed: ud stomaiḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ
translated: Rise up with your lauds, O ye of speckled mothers.

original: yenāva turvaśaṃ yaduṃ yena kaṇvaṃ dhanaspṛtam /
analyzed: yena ava turvaśam yadum yena kaṇvam dhana spṛtam
translated: By whom ye brought Turvaga and Yadu, by whom ye brought Kanva who winneth wealth,

original: rāye su tasya dhīmahi //
analyzed: rāye su tasya dhīmahi
translated: For that we pray to you for riches.

original: imā u vaḥ sudānavo ghṛtaṃ na pipyuṣīr iṣaḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ u vaḥ sudānavaḥ ghṛtam na pipyuṣīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: These, O ye bountiful ones, are your streams of ghee, your strengthening food.

original: vardhān kāṇvasya manmabhiḥ //
analyzed: vardhān kāṇvasya manmabhiḥ
translated: Increase (them) with the hymns of Kaṇva.

original: kva nūnaṃ sudānavo madathā vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: kva nūnam sudānavaḥ madatha vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: Where now, O bountiful ones, do you rejoice, ye who have strewn the sacred grass?

original: brahmā ko vaḥ saparyati //
analyzed: brahmā kaḥ vaḥ saparyati
translated: What Brahman worships you?

original: nahi ṣma yad dha vaḥ purā stomebhir vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: nahi sma yat ha vaḥ purā stomebhiḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: For we have not, as formerly, with our hymns, O ye who have strewn the sacred grass,

original: śardhāṃ ṛtasya jinvatha //
analyzed: śardhām ṛtasya jinvatha
translated: Stirred the host of holy order.

original: sam u tye mahatīr apaḥ saṃ kṣoṇī sam u sūryam /
analyzed: sam u tye mahatīḥ apaḥ sam kṣoṇī sam u sūryam
translated: They have united the great waters, the earth, and the sun,

original: saṃ vajram parvaśo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: sam vajram parvaśas
translated: And the thunderbolt in the joints (of Vṛtra).

original: vi vṛtram parvaśo yayur vi parvatāṃ arājinaḥ /
analyzed: vi vṛtram parvaśas yayuḥ vi parvatān a rājinaḥ
translated: They have rent Vṛtra in pieces, the joints, the unbending mountains,

original: cakrāṇā vṛṣṇi pauṃsyam //
analyzed: cakrāṇāḥ vṛṣṇi pauṃsyam
translated: Performing the manly deed.

original: anu tritasya yudhyataḥ śuṣmam āvann uta kratum /
analyzed: anu tritasya yudhyataḥ śuṣmam āvan uta kratum
translated: They have helped Trita in his fight, and his strength and his mind,

original: anv indraṃ vṛtratūrye //
analyzed: anu indram vṛtratūrye
translated: And Indra in the battle with Vṛtra.

original: vidyuddhastā abhidyavaḥ śiprāḥ śīrṣan hiraṇyayīḥ /
analyzed: vidyut hastāḥ abhidyavaḥ śiprāḥ śīrṣan hiraṇyayīḥ
translated: The thunder-wielding ones, the impetuous ones, with their heads the golden crests,

original: śubhrā vy añjata śriye //
analyzed: śubhrāḥ vi añjata śriye
translated: The bright ones have anointed themselves for beauty.

original: uśanā yat parāvata ukṣṇo randhram ayātana /
analyzed: uśanā yat parāvataḥ ukṣṇaḥ randhram ayātana
translated: When Uśanâ, from afar, has brought the bull to the opening,

original: dyaur na cakradad bhiyā //🔽ā no makhasya dāvane 'śvair hiraṇyapāṇibhiḥ /
analyzed: dyauḥ na cakradat bhiyā  ā naḥ makhasya dāvane śvaiḥ hiraṇya pāṇibhiḥ
translated: The sky has resounded with fear.🔽Come to us, O gods, to give us the feast, with your horses whose hands are golden,

original: devāsa upa gantana //
analyzed: devāsaḥ upa gantana
translated: To the feast.

original: yad eṣām pṛṣatī rathe praṣṭir vahati rohitaḥ /
analyzed: yat eṣām pṛṣatī rathe praṣṭiḥ vahati rohitaḥ
translated: When the spotted one, the red one, draws the chariot on which the spotted one is yoked,

original: yānti śubhrā riṇann apaḥ //
analyzed: yānti śubhrāḥ riṇan apaḥ
translated: They go, white, through the waters, through the sieve.

original: suṣome śaryaṇāvaty ārjīke pastyāvati /
analyzed: su some śaryaṇāvati ārjīke pastyāvati
translated: In Susoma, in Saryanavat, in Arjika, in the home of the Pastyas,

original: yayur nicakrayā naraḥ //
analyzed: yayuḥ nicakrayā naraḥ
translated: The men have gone with the wheel-less (chariot).

original: kadā gacchātha maruta itthā vipraṃ havamānam /
analyzed: kadā gacchātha marutaḥ itthā vipram havamānam
translated: When will you come, O Maruts, to the sage who calls you here,

original: mārḍīkebhir nādhamānam //
analyzed: mārḍīkebhiḥ nādhamānam
translated: To the one who serves you with the Marut-like (gifts)?

original: kad dha nūnaṃ kadhapriyo yad indram ajahātana /
analyzed: kad ha nūnam kadhapriyaḥ yat indram ajahātana
translated: When now, O you who love the Kaṇva (priests), will you leave Indra,

original: ko vaḥ sakhitva ohate //🔽saho ṣu ṇo vajrahastaiḥ kaṇvāso agnim marudbhiḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ vaḥ sakhi tve ohate  saha u su naḥ vajra hastaiḥ kaṇvāsaḥ agnim marudbhiḥ
translated: Who will be your friend?🔽With those whose hands wield the thunderbolt, the Kaṇvas will serve Agni with the Maruts,

original: stuṣe hiraṇyavāśībhiḥ //
analyzed: stuṣe hiraṇya vāśībhiḥ
translated: With those who have gold for their share.

original: o ṣu vṛṣṇaḥ prayajyūn ā navyase suvitāya /
analyzed: ā u su vṛṣṇaḥ prayajyūn ā navyase suvitāya
translated: O you who are to be invoked, come to the most recent, to the most excellent prosperity

original: vavṛtyāṃ citravājān //🔽girayaś cin ni jihate parśānāso manyamānāḥ /🔽parvatāś cin ni yemire //
analyzed: vavṛtyām citra vājān  girayaḥ cit ni jihate parśānāsaḥ manyamānāḥ  parvatāḥ cit ni yemire
translated: Of the Maruts, whose booty is variegated.🔽Even the mountains, when they are crushed, are shattered, when they are broken, when they are destroyed,🔽Even the mountains are bent down.

original: ākṣṇayāvāno vahanty antarikṣeṇa patataḥ /
analyzed: ā akṣṇayāvānaḥ vahanti antarikṣeṇa patataḥ
translated: The sky-going (Maruts) are borne on crooked paths.

original: dhātāra stuvate vayaḥ //
analyzed: dhātāraḥ stuvate vayaḥ
translated: The supporters (of the world) bestow life on the one who praises.

original: agnir hi jāni pūrvyaś chando na sūro arciṣā /
analyzed: agniḥ hi jāni pūrvyaḥ chandaḥ na sūraḥ arciṣā
translated: For Agni, the ancient one, is known by the hymn, by the light of the sun.

original: te bhānubhir vi tasthire //
analyzed: te bhānubhiḥ vi tasthire
translated: They have spread out with their rays.

original: ā no viśvābhir ūtibhir aśvinā gacchataṃ yuvam /
analyzed: ā naḥ viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gacchatam yuvam
translated: O you two who are to be invoked, come to us with all your aids, O you two Aśvins,

original: dasrā hiraṇyavartanī pibataṃ somyam madhu //
analyzed: dasrā hiraṇya vartanī pibatam somyam madhu
translated: You two wondrous ones, whose path is gold, drink the Soma-mixture.

original: ā nūnaṃ yātam aśvinā rathena sūryatvacā /
analyzed: ā nūnam yātam aśvinā rathena sūrya tvacā
translated: Come now, O ye Aṣvins, with your car, with a sun-bright covering,

original: bhujī hiraṇyapeśasā kavī gambhīracetasā //🔽ā yātaṃ nahuṣas pary āntarikṣāt suvṛktibhiḥ /
analyzed: bhujī hiraṇya peśasā kavī gambhīra cetasā  ā yātam nahuṣaḥ pari āntarikṣāt suvṛktibhiḥ
translated: Ye who enjoy the gold-hued back, ye sages, with profoundest thought.🔽Come hither, O ye Aṣvins, to the call of Nahus, from the region of the air.

original: pibātho aśvinā madhu kaṇvānāṃ savane sutam //
analyzed: pibāthaḥ aśvinā madhu kaṇvānām savane sutam
translated: Drink ye the meath, O Aṣvins, pressed at the banquet of the Kaṇvas.

original: ā no yātaṃ divas pary āntarikṣād adhapriyā /
analyzed: ā naḥ yātam divaḥ pari ā antarikṣāt adhapriyā
translated: Come hither to us from the sky, from the region of the air, O ye who love the house.

original: putraḥ kaṇvasya vām iha suṣāva somyam madhu //
analyzed: putraḥ kaṇvasya vām iha suṣāva somyam madhu
translated: The son of Kaṇva here hath pressed the meath that is mingled with the Soma.

original: ā no yātam upaśruty aśvinā somapītaye /
analyzed: ā naḥ yātam upaśrutī aśvinā soma pītaye
translated: Come hither, O ye Aṣvins, and give ear to us to drink the Soma.

original: svāhā stomasya vardhanā pra kavī dhītibhir narā //
analyzed: svāhā stomasya vardhanā pra kavī dhītibhiḥ narā
translated: Ye sages, with your thoughts, O ye men, are the increasers of the hymn.

original: yac cid dhi vām pura ṛṣayo juhūre 'vase narā /
analyzed: yat cit hi vām puras ṛṣayaḥ juhūre vase narā
translated: Whatever aid, O ye Nâsatyas, the ancient R̥ishis offered you,

original: ā yātam aśvinā gatam upemāṃ suṣṭutim mama //
analyzed: ā yātam aśvinā gatam upa imām suṣṭutim mama
translated: Come hither, O ye Aṣvins, come to this my eulogy.

original: divaś cid rocanād adhy ā no gantaṃ svarvidā /
analyzed: divaḥ cit rocanāt adhi ā naḥ gantam svar vidā
translated: From the bright realm of heaven come hither to us, ye who find light.

original: dhībhir vatsapracetasā stomebhir havanaśrutā //
analyzed: dhībhiḥ vatsa pracetasā stomebhiḥ havana śrutā
translated: With thoughts that know the youngling, with your lauds, O ye who hear the call.

original: kim anye pary āsate 'smat stomebhir aśvinā /
analyzed: kim anye pari āsate smat stomebhiḥ aśvinā
translated: What other men than we have sat around you, O ye Aṣvins, with their hymns of praise?

original: putraḥ kaṇvasya vām ṛṣir gīrbhir vatso avīvṛdhat //
analyzed: putraḥ kaṇvasya vām ṛṣiḥ gīrbhiḥ vatsaḥ avīvṛdhat
translated: The son of Kaṇva, the R̥ishi, the youngling, hath strengthened you with songs.

original: ā vāṃ vipra ihāvase 'hvat stomebhir aśvinā /
analyzed: ā vām vipraḥ iha avase hvat stomebhiḥ aśvinā
translated: The sage hath called you hither, O ye Aṣvins, to his worship with his hymns of praise.

original: ariprā vṛtrahantamā tā no bhūtam mayobhuvā //
analyzed: ariprā vṛtra hantamā tā naḥ bhūtam mayobhuvā
translated: Most victorious over foes, most slaying of foes, be that for our welfare.

original: ā yad vāṃ yoṣaṇā ratham atiṣṭhad vājinīvasū /
analyzed: ā yat vām yoṣaṇā ratham atiṣṭhat vājinīvasū
translated: When the two maidens mounted your chariot, O you who possess wealth in horses,

original: viśvāny aśvinā yuvam pra dhītāny agacchatam //
analyzed: viśvāni aśvinā yuvam pra dhītāni agacchatam
translated: O Aśvins, you went to all the thoughts.

original: ataḥ sahasranirṇijā rathenā yātam aśvinā /
analyzed: atas sahasra nirṇijā rathena ā yātam aśvinā
translated: From there, O Aśvins, come with your chariot that has a thousand reins,

original: vatso vām madhumad vaco 'śaṃsīt kāvyaḥ kaviḥ //
analyzed: vatsaḥ vām madhumat vacaḥ śaṃsīt kāvyaḥ kaviḥ
translated: The calf Vatsa, rich in honey, has praised your speech, the poet, the wise one.

original: purumandrā purūvasū manotarā rayīṇām /
analyzed: puru mandrā purūvasū manotarā rayīṇām
translated: You who are greatly to be praised, O you who possess abundant wealth, the best inspirers of wealth,

original: stomam me aśvināv imam abhi vahnī anūṣātām //🔽ā no viśvāny aśvinā dhattaṃ rādhāṃsy ahrayā /
analyzed: stomam me aśvinau imam abhi vahnī anūṣātām  ā naḥ viśvāni aśvinā dhattam rādhāṃsi ahrayā
translated: O Aśvins, may you two carry this praise of mine.🔽O Aśvins, bestow upon us all kinds of gifts, O you who are to be invoked.

original: kṛtaṃ na ṛtviyāvato mā no rīradhataṃ nide //
analyzed: kṛtam naḥ ṛtviyāvataḥ mā naḥ rīradhatam nide
translated: Do not delay for us, O you who are to be invoked at the proper time, do not delay for us.

original: yan nāsatyā parāvati yad vā stho adhy ambare /
analyzed: yat nāsatyā parāvati yat vā sthaḥ adhi ambare
translated: Whatever, O Nāsatyas, is far away, or whatever you are in the sky,

original: ataḥ sahasranirṇijā rathenā yātam aśvinā //
analyzed: atas sahasra nirṇijā rathena ā yātam aśvinā
translated: From there, O Aśvins, come with your chariot that has a thousand reins.

original: yo vāṃ nāsatyāv ṛṣir gīrbhir vatso avīvṛdhat /
analyzed: yaḥ vām nāsatyau ṛṣiḥ gīrbhiḥ vatsaḥ avīvṛdhat
translated: The calf, the Ṛṣi, who has praised you, O Nāsatyas, with hymns, has increased you.

original: tasmai sahasranirṇijam iṣaṃ dhattaṃ ghṛtaścutam //🔽prāsmā ūrjaṃ ghṛtaścutam aśvinā yacchataṃ yuvam /
analyzed: tasmai sahasra nirṇijam iṣam dhattam ghṛtaścutam  pra asmai ūrjam ghṛtaścutam aśvinā yacchatam yuvam
translated: To him, bestow food that has a thousand reins, that drips with ghee.🔽O Aśvins, bestow upon him strength that drips with ghee,

original: yo vāṃ sumnāya tuṣṭavad vasūyād dānunas patī //
analyzed: yaḥ vām sumnāya tuṣṭavat vasūyāt dānunaḥ patī
translated: Who has praised you for bliss, for wealth, O lords of bounty.

original: ā no gantaṃ riśādasemaṃ stomam purubhujā /
analyzed: ā naḥ gantam riśādasā imam stomam puru bhujā
translated: Come to us, O ye who slay the foe, to this hymn, O ye who have much wealth.

original: kṛtaṃ naḥ suśriyo naremā dātam abhiṣṭaye //
analyzed: kṛtam naḥ su śriyaḥ narā imā dātam abhiṣṭaye
translated: Grant us, O ye who are good to us, O ye who are men, for our protection.

original: ā vāṃ viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ priyamedhā ahūṣata /
analyzed: ā vām viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ priyamedhāḥ ahūṣata
translated: With all your aids have the singers of sweet hymns invoked you.

original: rājantāv adhvarāṇām aśvinā yāmahūtiṣu //
analyzed: rājantau adhvarāṇām aśvinā yāma hūtiṣu
translated: Rulers of sacrifices, O ye Aṣvins, when the call is uttered.

original: ā no gantam mayobhuvāśvinā śambhuvā yuvam /
analyzed: ā naḥ gantam mayobhuvā aśvinā śambhuvā yuvam
translated: Come to us, O ye Aṣvins, bringing bliss, bringing happiness.

original: yo vāṃ vipanyū dhītibhir gīrbhir vatso avīvṛdhat //
analyzed: yaḥ vām vipanyū dhītibhiḥ gīrbhiḥ vatsaḥ avīvṛdhat
translated: The young calf who has strengthened you with his thoughts and his songs, O you who have many resting-places.

original: yābhiḥ kaṇvam medhātithiṃ yābhir vaśaṃ daśavrajam /
analyzed: yābhiḥ kaṇvam medhātithim yābhiḥ vaśam daśavrajam
translated: With which (songs) ye helped Kaṇva and Medhātithi, with which (songs) Vaṣa and Daśavraja,

original: yābhir gośaryam āvataṃ tābhir no 'vataṃ narā //
analyzed: yābhiḥ gośaryam āvatam tābhiḥ naḥ vatam narā
translated: With which (songs) ye helped Gośarman, with those (songs) help us, O heroes.

original: yābhir narā trasadasyum āvataṃ kṛtvye dhane /
analyzed: yābhiḥ narā trasadasyum āvatam kṛtvye dhane
translated: With which (songs) ye helped the men Trasadasyu in a difficult matter,

original: tābhiḥ ṣv asmāṃ aśvinā prāvataṃ vājasātaye //
analyzed: tābhiḥ su asmān aśvinā prāvatam vājasātaye
translated: With those (songs) help us, O ye Aṣvins, to win strength.

original: pra vāṃ stomāḥ suvṛktayo giro vardhantv aśvinā /
analyzed: pra vām stomāḥ suvṛktayaḥ giraḥ vardhantu aśvinā
translated: May your praises, your well-sung hymns, your songs, O ye Aṣvins, prosper.

original: purutrā vṛtrahantamā tā no bhūtam puruspṛhā //
analyzed: purutrā vṛtra hantamā tā naḥ bhūtam puruspṛhā
translated: In many places, O ye best slayers of Vrtra, be that for us, O ye who are much desired.

original: trīṇi padāny aśvinor āviḥ sānti guhā paraḥ /
analyzed: trīṇi padāni aśvinoḥ āvis sānti guhā paras
translated: Three steps of the Aṣvins are manifest, in the cave, beyond.

original: kavī ṛtasya patmabhir arvāg jīvebhyas pari //
analyzed: kavī ṛtasya patmabhiḥ arvāk jīvebhyaḥ pari
translated: The sages, by the paths of truth, have turned (them) back to the living.

original: ā nūnam aśvinā yuvaṃ vatsasya gantam avase /
analyzed: ā nūnam aśvinā yuvam vatsasya gantam avase
translated: Now, O ye Aṣvins, come to the help of Vatsa.

original: prāsmai yacchatam avṛkam pṛthu cchardir yuyutaṃ yā arātayaḥ //
analyzed: pra asmai yacchatam avṛkam pṛthu chardiḥ yuyutam yāḥ arātayaḥ
translated: Grant him a wide and safe path, and drive away the evil spirits.

original: yad antarikṣe yad divi yat pañca mānuṣāṃ anu /
analyzed: yat antarikṣe yat divi yat pañca mānuṣām anu
translated: What strength there is in the atmosphere, in the sky, and among the five peoples,

original: nṛmṇaṃ tad dhattam aśvinā //
analyzed: nṛmṇam tat dhattam aśvinā
translated: Bestow that strength upon us, O Aśvins.

original: ye vāṃ daṃsāṃsy aśvinā viprāsaḥ parimāmṛśuḥ /
analyzed: ye vām daṃsāṃsi aśvinā viprāsaḥ parimāmṛśuḥ
translated: The sages who have praised your deeds, O Aśvins,

original: evet kāṇvasya bodhatam //
analyzed: eva id kāṇvasya bodhatam
translated: Be aware of this, O Kaṇva's sons.

original: ayaṃ vāṃ gharmo aśvinā stomena pari ṣicyate /
analyzed: ayam vām gharmaḥ aśvinā stomena pari sicyate
translated: This Gharma, O Aśvins, is sprinkled around with the praise,

original: ayaṃ somo madhumān vājinīvasū yena vṛtraṃ ciketathaḥ //
analyzed: ayam somaḥ madhumān vājinīvasū yena vṛtram ciketathaḥ
translated: This sweet Soma, O you rich in treasures, by which you have thought of Vrtra.

original: yad apsu yad vanaspatau yad oṣadhīṣu purudaṃsasā kṛtam /
analyzed: yat apsu yat vanaspatau yat oṣadhīṣu puru daṃsasā kṛtam
translated: What has been done by you, O you of many forms, in the waters, in the trees, and in the plants,

original: tena māviṣṭam aśvinā //
analyzed: tena mā aviṣṭam aśvinā
translated: By that, O Aśvins, enter into me.

original: yan nāsatyā bhuraṇyatho yad vā deva bhiṣajyathaḥ /
analyzed: yat nāsatyā bhuraṇyathaḥ yat vā deva bhiṣajyathaḥ
translated: When, O Nāsatyas, you hasten to help, or when, O gods, you heal,

original: ayaṃ vāṃ vatso matibhir na vindhate haviṣmantaṃ hi gacchathaḥ //
analyzed: ayam vām vatsaḥ matibhiḥ na vindhate haviṣmantam hi gacchathaḥ
translated: This calf of yours is not tied by thoughts, for you go to the one who offers oblations.

original: ā nūnam aśvinor ṛṣi stomaṃ ciketa vāmayā /
analyzed: ā nūnam aśvinoḥ ṛṣiḥ stomam ciketa vāmayā
translated: The sage now thinks of the praise of the Aśvins for the sake of wealth,

original: ā somam madhumattamaṃ gharmaṃ siñcād atharvaṇi //
analyzed: ā somam madhumattamam gharmam siñcāt atharvaṇi
translated: Let him pour the sweetest Soma into the hot water.

original: ā nūnaṃ raghuvartaniṃ rathaṃ tiṣṭhātho aśvinā /
analyzed: ā nūnam raghu vartanim ratham tiṣṭhāthaḥ aśvinā
translated: Now, O Aśvins, mount your chariot that moves swiftly,

original: ā vāṃ stomā ime mama nabho na cucyavīrata //
analyzed: ā vām stomāḥ ime mama nabhaḥ na cucyavīrata
translated: These praises of mine have not deceived you, like the sky.

original: yad adya vāṃ nāsatyokthair ācucyuvīmahi /
analyzed: yat adya vām nāsatya ukthaiḥ ācucyuvīmahi
translated: If today, O Nāsatyas, we have gladdened you with hymns,

original: yad vā vāṇībhir aśvinevet kāṇvasya bodhatam //
analyzed: yat vā vāṇībhiḥ aśvinā iva id kāṇvasya bodhatam
translated: Or with songs, O Aśvins, be aware of this, O Kaṇva's son.

original: yad vāṃ kakṣīvāṃ uta yad vyaśva ṛṣir yad vāṃ dīrghatamā juhāva /
analyzed: yat vām kakṣīvān uta yat vyaśvaḥ ṛṣiḥ yat vām dīrghatamāḥ juhāva
translated: What Kakṣīvān and Vyāṣva, the seer, and Dīrghatamas have offered to you,

original: pṛthī yad vāṃ vainyaḥ sādaneṣv eved ato aśvinā cetayethām //
analyzed: pṛthī yat vām vainyaḥ sādaneṣu eva id atas aśvinā cetayethām
translated: And what Vainya has offered to you in the assemblies, from there, O Aśvins, you should be aware of this.

original: yātaṃ chardiṣpā uta naḥ paraspā bhūtaṃ jagatpā uta nas tanūpā /
analyzed: yātam chardiṣpau uta naḥ paraspā bhūtam jagat pau uta naḥ tanū pā
translated: Be our protectors from the rear and from the front, be our protectors from the world and from our bodies.

original: vartis tokāya tanayāya yātam //🔽yad indreṇa sarathaṃ yātho aśvinā yad vā vāyunā bhavathaḥ samokasā /
analyzed: vartiḥ tokāya tanayāya yātam  yat indreṇa sa ratham yāthaḥ aśvinā yat vā vāyunā bhavathaḥ samokasā
translated: Go for the support of our offspring and children.🔽When you go with Indra in his chariot, O Aśvins, or when you are with Vāyu in the same abode,

original: yad ādityebhir ṛbhubhiḥ sajoṣasā yad vā viṣṇor vikramaṇeṣu tiṣṭhathaḥ //
analyzed: yat ādityebhiḥ ṛbhubhiḥ sajoṣasā yat vā viṣṇoḥ vikramaṇeṣu tiṣṭhathaḥ
translated: When you are of one mind with the Ādityas and the Rbhus, or when you stand in Viṣṇu's strides,

original: yad adyāśvināv ahaṃ huveya vājasātaye /
analyzed: yat adya aśvinau aham huveya vājasātaye
translated: If today, O Aśvins, I were to invoke you for the sake of gaining strength,

original: yat pṛtsu turvaṇe sahas tac chreṣṭham aśvinor avaḥ //
analyzed: yat pṛtsu turvaṇe sahaḥ tat śreṣṭham aśvinoḥ avaḥ
translated: Or in battles with Turvaṇa and Vṛṣa, that is the best help of the Aśvins.

original: ā nūnaṃ yātam aśvinemā havyāni vāṃ hitā /
analyzed: ā nūnam yātam aśvinā imā havyāni vām hitā
translated: Now come, O Aśvins, these offerings are prepared for you.

original: ime somāso adhi turvaśe yadāv ime kaṇveṣu vām atha //
analyzed: ime somāsaḥ adhi turvaśe yadau ime kaṇveṣu vām atha
translated: These Soma juices are for Turvaśa and Yadu, these for you among the Kaṇvas.

original: yan nāsatyā parāke arvāke asti bheṣajam /
analyzed: yat nāsatyā parāke arvāke asti bheṣajam
translated: Whatever medicine, O Nāsatyas, you have far away or near,

original: tena nūnaṃ vimadāya pracetasā chardir vatsāya yacchatam //
analyzed: tena nūnam vimadāya pracetasā chardiḥ vatsāya yacchatam
translated: Therefore, O you who are not intoxicated, O you who are wise, give us a dwelling place like a home for a calf.

original: abhutsy u pra devyā sākaṃ vācāham aśvinoḥ /
