analyzed: abhutsi u pra devyā sākam vācā aham aśvinoḥ
translated: I have awakened with the divine speech together with the two Ashvins.

original: vy āvar devy ā matiṃ vi rātim martyebhyaḥ //
analyzed: vi āvaḥ devi ā matim vi rātim martyebhyaḥ
translated: The divine one has turned away the thought and the gift from mortals.

original: pra bodhayoṣo aśvinā pra devi sūnṛte mahi /
analyzed: pra bodhaya uṣaḥ aśvinā pra devi sūnṛte mahi
translated: O Ushas, awaken the Ashvins, O goddess, the great joy.

original: pra yajñahotar ānuṣak pra madāya śravo bṛhat //
analyzed: pra yajña hotar ānuṣak pra madāya śravaḥ bṛhat
translated: The regular sacrificial priest, for the sake of joy, the great fame.

original: yad uṣo yāsi bhānunā saṃ sūryeṇa rocase /
analyzed: yat uṣaḥ yāsi bhānunā sam sūryeṇa rocase
translated: When you, O Ushas, go with the light, you shine with the sun.

original: ā hāyam aśvino ratho vartir yāti nṛpāyyam //
analyzed: ā ha ayam aśvinoḥ rathaḥ vartiḥ yāti nṛ pāyyam
translated: Here comes the chariot of the Ashvins, going to the abode of men.

original: yad āpītāso aṃśavo gāvo na duhra ūdhabhiḥ /
analyzed: yat āpītāsaḥ aṃśavaḥ gāvaḥ na duhre ūdhabhiḥ
translated: When the pressed juices, like cows with udders, are milked,

original: yad vā vāṇīr anūṣata pra devayanto aśvinā //
analyzed: yat vā vāṇīḥ anūṣata pra devayantaḥ aśvinā
translated: or when the hymns are sung, the pious invoke the Ashvins.🔽For glory, for strength, for the protection of men,

original: pra dyumnāya pra śavase pra nṛṣāhyāya śarmaṇe /🔽pra dakṣāya pracetasā //
analyzed: pra dyumnāya pra śavase pra nṛṣāhyāya śarmaṇe  pra dakṣāya pracetasā
translated: for the wise one, for skill.

original: yan nūnaṃ dhībhir aśvinā pitur yonā niṣīdathaḥ /
analyzed: yat nūnam dhībhiḥ aśvinā pituḥ yonā niṣīdathaḥ
translated: When now, O Ashvins, you sit in the birthplace of the father with your thoughts,

original: yad vā sumnebhir ukthyā //
analyzed: yat vā sumnebhiḥ ukthyā
translated: or with your favors, O you worthy of praise.

original: yat stho dīrghaprasadmani yad vādo rocane divaḥ /
analyzed: yat sthaḥ dīrghaprasadmani yat vā adaḥ rocane divaḥ
translated: When you are in the far-shining one, or in the light of the sky,

original: yad vā samudre adhy ākṛte gṛhe 'ta ā yātam aśvinā //
analyzed: yat vā samudre adhi ākṛte gṛhe te ā yātam aśvinā
translated: or in the house built in the ocean, from there, O Ashvins, come hither.

original: yad vā yajñam manave sammimikṣathur evet kāṇvasya bodhatam /
analyzed: yat vā yajñam manave sammimikṣathuḥ eva id kāṇvasya bodhatam
translated: Or what time ye prepared the sacrifice for Manu, even then, O Kaṇva's sons, be ye awake.

original: bṛhaspatiṃ viśvān devāṃ ahaṃ huva indrāviṣṇū aśvināv āśuheṣasā //
analyzed: bṛhaspatim viśvān devān aham huve indrāviṣṇū aśvinau āśu heṣasā
translated: I invoke Br̥ihaspati, all the Gods, Indra and Vishnu, the two Aṣvins swift to hear.

original: tyā nv aśvinā huve sudaṃsasā gṛbhe kṛtā /🔽yayor asti pra ṇaḥ sakhyaṃ deveṣv adhy āpyam //
analyzed: tyā nu aśvinā huve su daṃsasā gṛbhe kṛtā  yayoḥ asti pra naḥ sakhyam deveṣu adhi āpyam
translated: I call on you, O Aṣvins, with fair praise, to take your place,🔽Whose friendship is to be desired above all other Gods.

original: yayor adhi pra yajñā asūre santi sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: yayoḥ adhi pra yajñāḥ asūre santi sūrayaḥ
translated: Above whose friendship the pious have their home, and the godless their abode.

original: tā yajñasyādhvarasya pracetasā svadhābhir yā pibataḥ somyam madhu //
analyzed: tā yajñasya adhvarasya pracetasā svadhābhiḥ yā pibataḥ somyam madhu
translated: With their own powers they drink the sweet drink of Soma, the wise ones of the sacrifice and the rite.

original: yad adyāśvināv apāg yat prāk stho vājinīvasū /
analyzed: yat adya aśvinau apāk yat prāk sthaḥ vājinīvasū
translated: What ye have done to-day, O Aṣvins, what ye have done aforetime, O ye rich in wealth,

original: yad druhyavy anavi turvaśe yadau huve vām atha mā gatam //
analyzed: yat druhyavi anavi turvaśe yadau huve vām atha mā gatam
translated: What ye have done for Druhyu, for Anu, for Turvaga, for Yadu, then come to me.

original: yad antarikṣe patathaḥ purubhujā yad veme rodasī anu /
analyzed: yat antarikṣe patathaḥ puru bhujā yat vā ime rodasī anu
translated: What time ye fly through the wide air, what time ye move along these two world-halves,

original: yad vā svadhābhir adhitiṣṭhatho ratham ata ā yātam aśvinā //
analyzed: yat vā svadhābhiḥ adhitiṣṭhathaḥ ratham atas ā yātam aśvinā
translated: Or what time ye ascend the chariot with your own powers, then come hither, O ye Aṣvins.

original: tvam agne vratapā asi deva ā martyeṣv ā /
analyzed: tvam agne vrata pāḥ asi devaḥ ā martyeṣu ā
translated: Thou, O Agni, art the guardian of vows, a God among mortals.

original: tvaṃ yajñeṣv īḍyaḥ //
analyzed: tvam yajñeṣu īḍyaḥ
translated: Thou art to be worshipped in sacrifices.

original: tvam asi praśasyo vidatheṣu sahantya /
analyzed: tvam asi praśasyaḥ vidatheṣu sahantya
translated: Thou art to be praised in assemblies, O mighty one,

original: agne rathīr adhvarāṇām //
analyzed: agne rathīḥ adhvarāṇām
translated: O Agni, the charioteer of sacrifices.

original: sa tvam asmad apa dviṣo yuyodhi jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: sa tvam asmat apa dviṣaḥ yuyodhi jātavedaḥ
translated: So, O all-knower, do thou keep far away from us the enemies,

original: adevīr agne arātīḥ //🔽anti cit santam aha yajñam martasya ripoḥ /
analyzed: adevīḥ agne arātīḥ  anti cit santam aha yajñam martasya ripoḥ
translated: And the godless hostilities, O Agni.🔽Even when near, thou dost not approach the sacrifice of the mortal foe,

original: nopa veṣi jātavedaḥ //
analyzed: na upa veṣi jātavedaḥ
translated: O all-knower.

original: martā amartyasya te bhūri nāma manāmahe /
analyzed: martāḥ amartyasya te bhūri nāma manāmahe
translated: We mortals meditate on the abundant name of thee, the immortal,

original: viprāso jātavedasaḥ //
analyzed: viprāsaḥ jātavedasaḥ
translated: The sages, O all-knower.

original: vipraṃ viprāso 'vase devam martāsa ūtaye /
analyzed: vipram viprāsaḥ vase devam martāsaḥ ūtaye
translated: The sages call the sage, the god, for help, the mortals for aid,

original: agniṃ gīrbhir havāmahe //
analyzed: agnim gīrbhiḥ havāmahe
translated: Agni, with songs, we invoke.

original: ā te vatso mano yamat paramāc cit sadhasthāt /
analyzed: ā te vatsaḥ manaḥ yamat paramāt cit sadhasthāt
translated: O calf, may my mind come to thee even from the highest place,

original: agne tvāṅkāmayā girā //
analyzed: agne tvāṅkāmayā girā
translated: O Agni, with a longing song.

original: purutrā hi sadṛṅṅ asi viśo viśvā anu prabhuḥ /
analyzed: purutrā hi sadṛś asi viśaḥ viśvāḥ anu prabhuḥ
translated: For thou art like unto many, the lord over all the people,

original: samatsu tvā havāmahe //
analyzed: samatsu tvā havāmahe
translated: In the battles we invoke thee.

original: samatsv agnim avase vājayanto havāmahe /
analyzed: samatsu agnim avase vājayantaḥ havāmahe
translated: In the battles we invoke Agni for help, we who strive for strength,

original: vājeṣu citrarādhasam //
analyzed: vājeṣu citra rādhasam
translated: In the contests, the one of wondrous gifts.

original: pratno hi kam īḍyo adhvareṣu sanāc ca hotā navyaś ca satsi /
analyzed: pratnaḥ hi kam īḍyaḥ adhvareṣu sanāt ca hotā navyaḥ ca satsi
translated: For thou art the ancient one, to be praised in sacrifices; from of old thou sittest as the Hotar, and art new.

original: svāṃ cāgne tanvam piprayasvāsmabhyaṃ ca saubhagam ā yajasva //
analyzed: svām ca agne tanvam piprayasva asmabhyam ca saubhagam ā yajasva
translated: And, O Agni, do thou nourish thy own body, and bring us good fortune and worship.

original: ya indra somapātamo madaḥ śaviṣṭha cetati /
analyzed: yaḥ indra soma pātamaḥ madaḥ śaviṣṭha cetati
translated: That gladdening drink of thine, O Indra, which is best to drink of Soma, O most powerful,

original: yenā haṃsi ny atriṇaṃ tam īmahe //
analyzed: yena haṃsi ni atriṇam tam īmahe
translated: Wherewith thou slayest the greedy one, that we seek.

original: yenā daśagvam adhriguṃ vepayantaṃ svarṇaram /
analyzed: yena daśagvam adhrigum vepayantam svarṇaram
translated: By whom thou didst shake Adhrigu of the Dasagvas, the golden one,

original: yenā samudram āvithā tam īmahe //
analyzed: yena samudram āvitha tam īmahe
translated: By whom thou didst penetrate the ocean, we implore that (help of thine).

original: yena sindhum mahīr apo rathāṃ iva pracodayaḥ /
analyzed: yena sindhum mahīḥ apaḥ rathān iva pracodayaḥ
translated: By whom thou didst impel the mighty waters, the rivers, like chariots,

original: panthām ṛtasya yātave tam īmahe //
analyzed: panthām ṛtasya yātave tam īmahe
translated: The path of holy order to travel, we implore that (help of thine).

original: imaṃ stomam abhiṣṭaye ghṛtaṃ na pūtam adrivaḥ /
analyzed: imam stomam abhiṣṭaye ghṛtam na pūtam adrivas
translated: This hymn of praise for help, O wielder of the thunderbolt, like pure ghee,

original: yenā nu sadya ojasā vavakṣitha //
analyzed: yena nu sadyas ojasā vavakṣitha
translated: By which thou didst wax mighty in an instant.

original: imaṃ juṣasva girvaṇaḥ samudra iva pinvate /
analyzed: imam juṣasva girvaṇaḥ samudraḥ iva pinvate
translated: Accept this, O lover of song, it swells like the ocean,

original: indra viśvābhir ūtibhir vavakṣitha //🔽yo no devaḥ parāvataḥ sakhitvanāya māmahe /
analyzed: indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ vavakṣitha  yaḥ naḥ devaḥ parāvataḥ sakhitvanāya māmahe
translated: O Indra, with all thy aids thou hast waxed great.🔽The god who is here for us from afar to be a friend,

original: divo na vṛṣṭim prathayan vavakṣitha //
analyzed: divaḥ na vṛṣṭim prathayan vavakṣitha
translated: Like the rain of heaven, he hath waxed great, extending.

original: vavakṣur asya ketavo uta vajro gabhastyoḥ /
analyzed: vavakṣuḥ asya ketavaḥ uta vajraḥ gabhastyoḥ
translated: His banners have waxed great, and also his thunderbolt in his arms,

original: yat sūryo na rodasī avardhayat //🔽yadi pravṛddha satpate sahasram mahiṣāṃ aghaḥ /
analyzed: yat sūryaḥ na rodasī avardhayat  yadi pravṛddha satpate sahasram mahiṣān aghaḥ
translated: When the sun hath made the two worlds grow.🔽If, O lord of the brave, thou hast waxed great, O Indra, with a thousand buffaloes,

original: ād it ta indriyam mahi pra vāvṛdhe //
analyzed: āt id te indriyam mahi pra vāvṛdhe
translated: Then hath thy power, O great one, grown great.

original: indraḥ sūryasya raśmibhir ny arśasānam oṣati /
analyzed: indraḥ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ ni arśasānam oṣati
translated: Indra with the rays of the sun smites down the Nyarasha,

original: agnir vaneva sāsahiḥ pra vāvṛdhe //
analyzed: agniḥ vanā iva sāsahiḥ pra vāvṛdhe
translated: Agni, the unconquerable, hath grown great like a forest.

original: iyaṃ ta ṛtviyāvatī dhītir eti navīyasī /
analyzed: iyam te ṛtviyāvatī dhītiḥ eti navīyasī
translated: This newest hymn, this most recent, which is full of holy rites, comes to thee,

original: saparyantī purupriyā mimīta it //
analyzed: saparyantī puru priyā mimīte id
translated: The beloved of many is measuring out.

original: garbho yajñasya devayuḥ kratum punīta ānuṣak /
analyzed: garbhaḥ yajñasya devayuḥ kratum punīte ānuṣak
translated: The embryo of the sacrifice, devoted to the gods, purifies the rite in due order.

original: stomair indrasya vāvṛdhe mimīta it //
analyzed: stomaiḥ indrasya vāvṛdhe mimīte id
translated: He has grown through Indra's praises. He is measuring out.

original: sanir mitrasya papratha indraḥ somasya pītaye /🔽prācī vāśīva sunvate mimīta it //
analyzed: saniḥ mitrasya paprathe indraḥ somasya pītaye  prācī vāśī iva sunvate mimīte id
translated: Indra, the son of Mitra, is extended for the drinking of the Soma.🔽Like a bird flying to the east for the one who presses (Soma). He is measuring out.

original: yaṃ viprā ukthavāhaso 'bhipramandur āyavaḥ /
analyzed: yam viprāḥ uktha vāhasaḥ bhipramanduḥ āyavaḥ
translated: Whom the inspired bards, the bearers of praise, have gladdened, the living ones,

original: ghṛtaṃ na pipya āsany ṛtasya yat //
analyzed: ghṛtam na pipye āsani ṛtasya yat
translated: He has become full like ghee, as is the law.

original: uta svarāje aditi stomam indrāya jījanat /
analyzed: uta sva rāje aditiḥ stomam indrāya jījanat
translated: And Aditi, the self-ruling one, has generated praise for Indra,

original: purupraśastam ūtaya ṛtasya yat //
analyzed: puru praśastam ūtaye ṛtasya yat
translated: Highly praised, as is the law.

original: abhi vahnaya ūtaye 'nūṣata praśastaye /
analyzed: abhi vahnayaḥ ūtaye nūṣata praśastaye
translated: The bards have sung to Agni for help, for praise.

original: na deva vivratā harī ṛtasya yat //
analyzed: na deva vivratā harī ṛtasya yat
translated: O god, your two bay horses are not turned away from the law.

original: yat somam indra viṣṇavi yad vā gha trita āptye /
analyzed: yat somam indra viṣṇavi yat vā gha trite āptye
translated: When, O Indra, you rejoice in Soma with Vishṇu, or in the Āptyas with Trita,

original: yad vā marutsu mandase sam indubhiḥ //
analyzed: yat vā marutsu mandase sam indubhiḥ
translated: Or when you delight in the Maruts with the drops of Soma.

original: yad vā śakra parāvati samudre adhi mandase /
analyzed: yat vā śakra parāvati samudre adhi mandase
translated: When, O Śakra, you delight in the ocean far away,

original: asmākam it sute raṇā sam indubhiḥ //🔽yad vāsi sunvato vṛdho yajamānasya satpate /
analyzed: asmākam id sute raṇa sam indubhiḥ  yat vā asi sunvataḥ vṛdhaḥ yajamānasya satpate
translated: In our libation, O lord of the house, with the drops of Soma.🔽When you are the increaser of the one who presses Soma, O lord of the house,

original: ukthe vā yasya raṇyasi sam indubhiḥ //
analyzed: ukthe vā yasya raṇyasi sam indubhiḥ
translated: Or when you delight in the praise of the one who sacrifices, with the drops of Soma.

original: devaṃdevaṃ vo 'vasa indramindraṃ gṛṇīṣaṇi /
analyzed: devam devam vaḥ vase indram indram gṛṇīṣaṇi
translated: To each of you I sing Indra, the god among the gods.

original: adhā yajñāya turvaṇe vy ānaśuḥ //
analyzed: adhā yajñāya turvaṇe vi ānaśuḥ
translated: Now they have gone forth for the sacrifice to be performed.

original: yajñebhir yajñavāhasaṃ somebhiḥ somapātamam /
analyzed: yajñebhiḥ yajña vāhasam somebhiḥ soma pātamam
translated: With sacrifices, the bearer of sacrifice, with Soma juices, the drinker of Soma,

original: hotrābhir indraṃ vāvṛdhur vy ānaśuḥ //🔽mahīr asya praṇītayaḥ pūrvīr uta praśastayaḥ /
analyzed: hotrābhiḥ indram vāvṛdhuḥ vi ānaśuḥ  mahīḥ asya praṇītayaḥ pūrvīḥ uta praśastayaḥ
translated: With oblations they have magnified Indra. They have gone forth.🔽Great are his ordinances, and many his praises,

original: viśvā vasūni dāśuṣe vy ānaśuḥ //
analyzed: viśvā vasūni dāśuṣe vi ānaśuḥ
translated: All goods and chattels for the worshipper. They have gone forth.

original: indraṃ vṛtrāya hantave devāso dadhire puraḥ /
analyzed: indram vṛtrāya hantave devāsaḥ dadhire puras
translated: The gods have set Indra in the front for the slaying of Vritra.

original: indraṃ vāṇīr anūṣatā sam ojase //🔽mahāntam mahinā vayaṃ stomebhir havanaśrutam /
analyzed: indram vāṇīḥ anūṣata sam ojase  mahāntam mahinā vayam stomebhiḥ havana śrutam
translated: The songs have sung to Indra for his strength.🔽The great one, who hears our invocation with his greatness and our hymns,

original: arkair abhi pra ṇonumaḥ sam ojase //🔽na yaṃ vivikto rodasī nāntarikṣāṇi vajriṇam /
analyzed: arkaiḥ abhi pra nonumaḥ sam ojase  na yam viviktaḥ rodasī na antarikṣāṇi vajriṇam
translated: With praises we exalt for his strength.🔽Him whom the two worlds, the two expanses, the two mid-regions, the wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: amād id asya titviṣe sam ojasaḥ //
analyzed: amāt id asya titviṣe sam ojasaḥ
translated: Do not divide from his own strength.

original: yad indra pṛtanājye devās tvā dadhire puraḥ /
analyzed: yat indra pṛtanājye devāḥ tvā dadhire puras
translated: When, O Indra, the gods have set thee in the front for the slaying of foes,

original: ād it te haryatā harī vavakṣatuḥ //
analyzed: āt id te haryatā harī vavakṣatuḥ
translated: Then have thy two tawny coursers carried thee.

original: yadā vṛtraṃ nadīvṛtaṃ śavasā vajrinn avadhīḥ /
analyzed: yadā vṛtram nadīvṛtam śavasā vajrin avadhīḥ
translated: When, O Indra, thou with might hast slain Vritra who was girt about with streams,

original: ād it te haryatā harī vavakṣatuḥ //
analyzed: āt id te haryatā harī vavakṣatuḥ
translated: Then have thy two tawny coursers carried thee.

original: yadā te viṣṇur ojasā trīṇi padā vicakrame /
analyzed: yadā te viṣṇuḥ ojasā trīṇi padā vicakrame
translated: When, O Indra, with thy might Vishnu hath strode his three strides,

original: ād it te haryatā harī vavakṣatuḥ //
analyzed: āt id te haryatā harī vavakṣatuḥ
translated: Then have thy two tawny coursers carried thee.

original: yadā te haryatā harī vāvṛdhāte divedive /
analyzed: yadā te haryatā harī vāvṛdhāte dive dive
translated: When thy two tawny coursers have waxed great day by day,

original: ād it te viśvā bhuvanāni yemire //
analyzed: āt id te viśvā bhuvanāni yemire
translated: Then all the worlds have turned to thee.

original: yadā te mārutīr viśas tubhyam indra niyemire /
analyzed: yadā te mārutīḥ viśaḥ tubhyam indra niyemire
translated: When the Maruts' tribes have turned to thee, O Indra,

original: ād it te viśvā bhuvanāni yemire //
analyzed: āt id te viśvā bhuvanāni yemire
translated: Then all the worlds have turned to thee.

original: yadā sūryam amuṃ divi śukraṃ jyotir adhārayaḥ /
analyzed: yadā sūryam amum divi śukram jyotiḥ adhārayaḥ
translated: When thou hast set in heaven this bright light, the sun,

original: ād it te viśvā bhuvanāni yemire //
analyzed: āt id te viśvā bhuvanāni yemire
translated: Then all the worlds have turned to thee.

original: imāṃ ta indra suṣṭutiṃ vipra iyarti dhītibhiḥ /
analyzed: imām te indra suṣṭutim vipraḥ iyarti dhītibhiḥ
translated: This eulogy, O Indra, the sage impels with his thoughts,

original: jāmim padeva pipratīm prādhvare //
analyzed: jāmim padā iva pipratīm pra adhvare
translated: Like a sister to the place of sacrifice.

original: yad asya dhāmani priye samīcīnāso asvaran /
analyzed: yat asya dhāmani priye samīcīnāsaḥ asvaran
translated: When in his dear abode they have sung together,

original: nābhā yajñasya dohanā prādhvare //
analyzed: nābhā yajñasya dohanā pra adhvare
translated: The navel of the sacrifice, the milkings, to the place of sacrifice.

original: suvīryaṃ svaśvyaṃ sugavyam indra daddhi naḥ /
analyzed: su vīryam su aśvyam su gavyam indra daddhi naḥ
translated: O Indra, grant us good heroism, good horses, good cattle,

original: hoteva pūrvacittaye prādhvare //
analyzed: hotā iva pūrvacittaye pra adhvare
translated: Like a Hotri priest, for the first thought, to the place of sacrifice.

original: indraḥ suteṣu someṣu kratum punīta ukthyam /
analyzed: indraḥ suteṣu someṣu kratum punīte ukthyam
translated: Indra, purify the rite meet for lauds among the pressed Soma juices,

original: vide vṛdhasya dakṣaso mahān hi ṣaḥ //
analyzed: vide vṛdhasya dakṣasaḥ mahān hi saḥ
translated: For he is great, for he knows the power of the strong.

original: sa prathame vyomani devānāṃ sadane vṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: sa prathame vyomani devānām sadane vṛdhaḥ
translated: He, the strong one, in the first wide region, in the abode of the gods,

original: supāraḥ suśravastamaḥ sam apsujit //
analyzed: su pāraḥ su śravastamaḥ sam apsujit
translated: The good deliverer, most famous, the winner of battles.

original: tam ahve vājasātaya indram bharāya śuṣmiṇam /
analyzed: tam ahve vājasātaye indram bharāya śuṣmiṇam
translated: I invoke that Indra, the mighty one, for the winning of booty,

original: bhavā naḥ sumne antamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe //
analyzed: bhavā naḥ sumne antamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe
translated: Be thou our nearest friend in prosperity.

original: iyaṃ ta indra girvaṇo rātiḥ kṣarati sunvataḥ /
analyzed: iyam te indra girvaṇaḥ rātiḥ kṣarati sunvataḥ
translated: This, O Indra, is thy gift, O lover of song, to the presser who pours libations.

original: mandāno asya barhiṣo vi rājasi //🔽nūnaṃ tad indra daddhi no yat tvā sunvanta īmahe /
analyzed: mandānaḥ asya barhiṣaḥ vi rājasi  nūnam tat indra daddhi naḥ yat tvā sunvantaḥ īmahe
translated: Rejoicing in his grass, thou shinest forth.🔽Now give us that, O Indra, for which we who press out the juice implore thee.

original: rayiṃ naś citram ā bharā svarvidam //🔽stotā yat te vicarṣaṇir atipraśardhayad giraḥ /
analyzed: rayim naḥ citram ā bhara svar vidam  stotā yat te vicarṣaṇiḥ atipraśardhayat giraḥ
translated: Bring us wealth, wondrous, finding the light.🔽When the singer, most active, exalts thy praises,

original: vayā ivānu rohate juṣanta yat //🔽pratnavaj janayā giraḥ śṛṇudhī jaritur havam /
analyzed: vayāḥ iva anu rohate juṣanta yat  pratna vat janayā giraḥ śṛṇudhi jarituḥ havam
translated: He mounts as it were upon thy back, when thou art pleased.🔽Beget songs as of old: listen to the singer's call.

original: mademade vavakṣithā sukṛtvane //
analyzed: mademade vavakṣitha su kṛtvane
translated: We will rejoice in thee, O thou who art good to us, at every feast.

original: krīḷanty asya sūnṛtā āpo na pravatā yatīḥ /
analyzed: krīḍanti asya sūnṛtāḥ āpaḥ na pravatā yatīḥ
translated: His delights move on, like waters flowing down a slope.

original: ayā dhiyā ya ucyate patir divaḥ //
analyzed: ayā dhiyā yaḥ ucyate patiḥ divaḥ
translated: He who is called the lord of the sky by this hymn.

original: uto patir ya ucyate kṛṣṭīnām eka id vaśī /
analyzed: uta u patiḥ yaḥ ucyate kṛṣṭīnām ekaḥ id vaśī
translated: And he who is called the lord of the people, the sole ruler,

original: namovṛdhair avasyubhiḥ sute raṇa //🔽stuhi śrutaṃ vipaścitaṃ harī yasya prasakṣiṇā /
analyzed: namaḥ vṛdhaiḥ avasyubhiḥ sute raṇa  stuhi śrutam vipaścitam harī yasya prasakṣiṇā
translated: With those who worship with homage, rejoice in the juice.🔽Praise him who is renowned, the wise one, whose two bay steeds carry him,

original: gantārā dāśuṣo gṛhaṃ namasvinaḥ //
analyzed: gantārā dāśuṣaḥ gṛham namasvinaḥ
translated: The messengers of the worshipper's house, the humble ones.

original: tūtujāno mahemate 'śvebhiḥ pruṣitapsubhiḥ /
analyzed: tūtujānaḥ mahemate śvebhiḥ pruṣitapsubhiḥ
translated: Urged on, with steeds that drip with moisture, to the great thought,

original: ā yāhi yajñam āśubhiḥ śam id dhi te //
analyzed: ā yāhi yajñam āśubhiḥ śam id hi te
translated: Come to the sacrifice with thy fleetest (steeds), for thou art auspicious to us.

original: indra śaviṣṭha satpate rayiṃ gṛṇatsu dhāraya /
analyzed: indra śaviṣṭha satpate rayim gṛṇatsu dhāraya
translated: O Indra, most powerful, lord of the brave, sustain wealth among the singers.

original: śravaḥ sūribhyo amṛtaṃ vasutvanam //🔽have tvā sūra udite have madhyandine divaḥ /
analyzed: śravaḥ sūribhyaḥ amṛtam vasutvanam  have tvā sūre udite have madhyandine divaḥ
translated: Immortal fame, and the bestowal of goods, to the princes.🔽I call thee when the sun has risen, I call thee at midday, O Indra.

original: juṣāṇa indra saptibhir na ā gahi //
analyzed: juṣāṇaḥ indra saptibhiḥ naḥ ā gahi
translated: Accepting (my call), come to us with thy bay steeds.

original: ā tū gahi pra tu drava matsvā sutasya gomataḥ /
analyzed: ā tū gahi pra tu drava matsva sutasya gomataḥ
translated: Come hither, hasten forward, rejoice in the juice of the wealthy one.

original: tantuṃ tanuṣva pūrvyaṃ yathā vide //
analyzed: tantum tanuṣva pūrvyam yathā vide
translated: Weave the ancient thread as is known.

original: yac chakrāsi parāvati yad arvāvati vṛtrahan /
analyzed: yat śakra asi parāvati yat arvāvati vṛtrahan
translated: If thou art, O Sakra, in the distance, if thou art, O Vrtra-slayer, near,

original: yad vā samudre andhaso 'vited asi //🔽indraṃ vardhantu no gira indraṃ sutāsa indavaḥ /
analyzed: yat vā samudre andhasaḥ vitā id asi  indram vardhantu naḥ giraḥ indram sutāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: Or if thou art in the ocean of the juice, thou art the protector.🔽Let our songs strengthen Indra, let the pressed Soma juices, O Indra,

original: indre haviṣmatīr viśo arāṇiṣuḥ //🔽tam id viprā avasyavaḥ pravatvatībhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: indre haviṣmatīḥ viśaḥ arāṇiṣuḥ  tam id viprāḥ avasyavaḥ pravatvatībhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: The people who offer oblations have delighted in Indra.🔽The sages, seeking help, with their powerful aids,

original: indraṃ kṣoṇīr avardhayan vayā iva //
analyzed: indram kṣoṇīḥ avardhayan vayāḥ iva
translated: Have strengthened Indra, as (one strengthens) wings.

original: trikadrukeṣu cetanaṃ devāso yajñam atnata /
analyzed: trikadrukeṣu cetanam devāsaḥ yajñam atnata
translated: The wise one, whom the gods have established as the sacrifice on the Trikadrukas,

original: tam id vardhantu no giraḥ sadāvṛdham //
analyzed: tam id vardhantu naḥ giraḥ sadāvṛdham
translated: Let our songs strengthen him, the ever-waxing one.

original: stotā yat te anuvrata ukthāny ṛtuthā dadhe /
analyzed: stotā yat te anuvrataḥ ukthāni ṛtuthā dadhe
translated: When the singer, following thee, has set forth the praises in due season,

original: śuciḥ pāvaka ucyate so adbhutaḥ //
analyzed: śuciḥ pāvakaḥ ucyate saḥ adbhutaḥ
translated: The pure, the purifying one is called, he who is wonderful.

original: tad id rudrasya cetati yahvam pratneṣu dhāmasu /
analyzed: tat id rudrasya cetati yahvam pratneṣu dhāmasu
translated: That is the mighty thought of Rudra in the ancient abodes.

original: mano yatrā vi tad dadhur vicetasaḥ //🔽yadi me sakhyam āvara imasya pāhy andhasaḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ yatrā vi tat vicetasaḥ  yadi me sakhyam āvaraḥ imasya pāhi andhasaḥ
translated: Where they have placed the mind, the discerning ones.🔽If thou hast accepted my friendship, protect thou this my drink.

original: yena viśvā ati dviṣo atārima //
analyzed: yena viśvāḥ ati dviṣaḥ atārima
translated: By which we may overcome all enmities.

original: kadā ta indra girvaṇa stotā bhavāti śantamaḥ /
analyzed: kadā te indra girvaṇaḥ stotā bhavāti śantamaḥ
translated: When, O Indra, the singer shall become most delightful to thee?

original: kadā no gavye aśvye vasau dadhaḥ //
analyzed: kadā naḥ gavye aśvye vasau dadhaḥ
translated: When wilt thou bestow on us wealth in cattle and horses?

original: uta te suṣṭutā harī vṛṣaṇā vahato ratham /🔽ajuryasya madintamaṃ yam īmahe //
analyzed: uta te suṣṭutā harī vṛṣaṇā vahataḥ ratham  ajuryasya madintamam yam īmahe
translated: And when will thy two well-praised strong Bay Steeds bear thy car,🔽The most delightful of the undecaying one, whom we seek?

original: tam īmahe puruṣṭutaṃ yahvam pratnābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: tam īmahe puruṣṭutam yahvam pratnābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: We seek him, much lauded, the youthful one, with ancient aids.

original: ni barhiṣi priye sadad adha dvitā //
analyzed: ni barhiṣi priye sadat adha dvitā
translated: Let him sit on the dear sacrificial grass, both times.

original: vardhasvā su puruṣṭuta ṛṣiṣṭutābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: vardhasva su puruṣṭuta ṛṣiṣṭutābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Grow thou, O much-lauded one, with the praises of the Ṛṣis.

original: dhukṣasva pipyuṣīm iṣam avā ca naḥ //
analyzed: dhukṣasva pipyuṣīm iṣam ava ca naḥ
translated: Milk out the swelling food for us.

original: indra tvam avited asītthā stuvato adrivaḥ /
analyzed: indra tvam avitā id asi itthā stuvataḥ adrivas
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the protector, even so of the lauding one, O Thunderer.

original: ṛtād iyarmi te dhiyam manoyujam //🔽iha tyā sadhamādyā yujānaḥ somapītaye /
analyzed: ṛtāt iyarmi te dhiyam manaḥ yujam  iha tyā sadhamādyā yujānaḥ soma pītaye
translated: From truth I urge thy thought, yoked with the mind.🔽Here, O Indra, yoking the most delightful ones for the drinking of Soma,

original: harī indra pratadvasū abhi svara //
analyzed: harī indra pratadvasū abhi svara
translated: Call hither thy Bay Steeds, O Indra, who bring good things.

original: abhi svarantu ye tava rudrāsaḥ sakṣata śriyam /
analyzed: abhi svarantu ye tava rudrāsaḥ sakṣata śriyam
translated: Let those Rudras who have gained glory through thee,

original: uto marutvatīr viśo abhi prayaḥ //
analyzed: uta u marutvatīḥ viśaḥ abhi prayaḥ
translated: And the Marut-attended clans to the oblation.

original: imā asya pratūrtayaḥ padaṃ juṣanta yad divi /
analyzed: imāḥ asya pratūrtayaḥ padam juṣanta yat divi
translated: These are his swift feet which the heaven delights in,

original: nābhā yajñasya saṃ dadhur yathā vide //
analyzed: nābhā yajñasya sam dadhuḥ yathā vide
translated: The navel of the sacrifice they join together as he knows.

original: ayaṃ dīrghāya cakṣase prāci prayaty adhvare /
analyzed: ayam dīrghāya cakṣase prāci prayati adhvare
translated: This one for long-seeing, in the east, at the sacrifice,

original: mimīte yajñam ānuṣag vicakṣya //
analyzed: mimīte yajñam ānuṣak vicakṣya
translated: Measures the sacrifice according to the rule, discerning.

original: vṛṣāyam indra te ratha uto te vṛṣaṇā harī /
analyzed: vṛṣā ayam indra te rathaḥ uta u te vṛṣaṇā harī
translated: This is the bull, O Indra, your chariot, and also your bulls are your two bay horses.

original: vṛṣā tvaṃ śatakrato vṛṣā havaḥ //
analyzed: vṛṣā tvam śatakrato vṛṣā havaḥ
translated: You are the bull, O Shakra, the bull is the invocation.

original: vṛṣā grāvā vṛṣā mado vṛṣā somo ayaṃ sutaḥ /🔽vṛṣā yajño yam invasi vṛṣā havaḥ //
analyzed: vṛṣā grāvā vṛṣā madaḥ vṛṣā somaḥ ayam sutaḥ  vṛṣā yajñaḥ yam invasi vṛṣā havaḥ
translated: The pressing-stone is a bull, the rapture is a bull, this Soma is pressed out, a bull.🔽The sacrifice which you quicken is a bull, the bull is the invocation.

original: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṃ huve vajriñ citrābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇam huve vajrim citrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: I invoke you, O bull, the bull, O wielder of the thunderbolt, with wondrous aids.

original: vāvantha hi pratiṣṭutiṃ vṛṣā havaḥ //
analyzed: vāvantha hi pratiṣṭutim vṛṣā havaḥ
translated: For you delight in praise, the bull is the invocation.

original: yad indrāhaṃ yathā tvam īśīya vasva eka it /
analyzed: yat indra aham yathā tvam īśīya vasvaḥ ekaḥ id
translated: If, O Indra, I were to rule over wealth as you do alone,

original: stotā me goṣakhā syāt //
analyzed: stotā me go sakhā syāt
translated: May my praiser be a friend of mine in cattle.

original: śikṣeyam asmai ditseyaṃ śacīpate manīṣiṇe /
analyzed: śikṣeyam asmai ditseyam śacīpate manīṣiṇe
translated: I would learn from him, I would give to the wise one, O lord of might,

original: yad ahaṃ gopatiḥ syām //
analyzed: yat aham gopatiḥ syām
translated: If I were to be the lord of cattle.

original: dhenuṣ ṭa indra sūnṛtā yajamānāya sunvate /
analyzed: dhenuḥ te indra sūnṛtā yajamānāya sunvate
translated: The milch cow is your bounty, O Indra, to the sacrificer who presses (Soma).

original: gām aśvam pipyuṣī duhe //
analyzed: gām aśvam pipyuṣī duhe
translated: The milch cow yields a cow and a horse.

original: na te vartāsti rādhasa indra devo na martyaḥ /
analyzed: na te vartā asti rādhasaḥ indra devaḥ na martyaḥ
translated: There is no turning back for your bounty, O Indra, whether you are a god or a mortal.

original: yad ditsasi stuto magham //
analyzed: yat ditsasi stutaḥ magham
translated: When thou art willing to bestow wealth, being praised.

original: yajña indram avardhayad yad bhūmiṃ vy avartayat /
analyzed: yajñaḥ indram avardhayat yat bhūmim vi avartayat
translated: The sacrifice exalted Indra, when he made the earth tremble.

original: cakrāṇa opaśaṃ divi //🔽vāvṛdhānasya te vayaṃ viśvā dhanāni jigyuṣaḥ /
analyzed: cakrāṇaḥ opaśam divi  vāvṛdhānasya te vayam viśvā dhanāni jigyuṣaḥ
translated: He made the sky favourable.

original: ūtim indrā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: ūtim indra vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose the help of thee, O Indra, who hast waxed strong, who hast overcome all treasures.

original: vy antarikṣam atiran made somasya rocanā /
analyzed: vi antarikṣam atirat made somasya rocanā
translated: The firmament, the lights of heaven, have been extended in the joy of Soma,

original: indro yad abhinad valam //
analyzed: indraḥ yat abhinat valam
translated: When Indra cleft Vala.

original: ud gā ājad aṅgirobhya āviṣ kṛṇvan guhā satīḥ /
analyzed: ud gāḥ ājat aṅgirobhyaḥ āvis kṛṇvan guhā satīḥ
translated: The songs have risen to the Angirases, revealing the hidden ones.

original: arvāñcaṃ nunude valam //
analyzed: arvāñcam nunude valam
translated: He hath driven Vala downward.

original: indreṇa rocanā divo dṛḷhāni dṛṃhitāni ca /
analyzed: indreṇa rocanā divaḥ dṛḍhāni dṛṃhitāni ca
translated: The firm and well-bolted fastenings of the light of heaven by Indra,

original: sthirāṇi na parāṇude //
analyzed: sthirāṇi na parāṇude
translated: The firm ones, I cannot move.

original: apām ūrmir madann iva stoma indrājirāyate /
analyzed: apām ūrmiḥ madan iva stomaḥ indra ajirāyate
translated: The hymn of praise, like a wave of the waters, swells, O Indra, for the race.

original: vi te madā arājiṣuḥ //
analyzed: vi te madāḥ arājiṣuḥ
translated: Thy gladdening draughts have not rejoiced thee.

original: tvaṃ hi stomavardhana indrāsy ukthavardhanaḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi stoma vardhanaḥ indra asi uktha vardhanaḥ
translated: For thou, O Indra, art the increaser of the hymn, the increaser of the song of praise,

original: stotṝṇām uta bhadrakṛt //
analyzed: stotṝṇām uta bhadra kṛt
translated: And the bestower of good things to the praisers.

original: indram it keśinā harī somapeyāya vakṣataḥ /
analyzed: indram id keśinā harī soma peyāya vakṣataḥ
translated: With the strong-jawed pair, O Indra, the Bay Steeds, they will bear thee to the drinking of the Soma,

original: upa yajñaṃ surādhasam //
analyzed: upa yajñam su rādhasam
translated: To the sacrifice, O thou of ample wealth.

original: apām phenena namuceḥ śira indrod avartayaḥ /
analyzed: apām phenena namuceḥ śiraḥ indra ud avartayaḥ
translated: With the foam of the waters thou, O Indra, didst roll away the head of Namuci,

original: viśvā yad ajaya spṛdhaḥ //
analyzed: viśvāḥ yat ajayaḥ spṛdhaḥ
translated: When thou didst win all the contending hosts.

original: māyābhir utsisṛpsata indra dyām ārurukṣataḥ /
analyzed: māyābhiḥ utsisṛpsataḥ indra dyām ārurukṣataḥ
translated: With the illusions of Namuci, O Indra, thou didst pursue him, as he was about to ascend to heaven.

original: ava dasyūṃr adhūnuthāḥ //
analyzed: ava dasyūṃr adhūnuthāḥ
translated: Thou hast crushed the Dasyus down.🔽Thou, O Indra, hast scattered afar,

original: asunvām indra saṃsadaṃ viṣūcīṃ vy anāśayaḥ /🔽somapā uttaro bhavan //
analyzed: asunvām indra saṃsadam viṣūcīm vi anāśayaḥ  soma pāḥ uttaraḥ bhavan
translated: the assembly of the libationless one.🔽Becoming the drinker of Soma, thou art the highest.

original: tam v abhi pra gāyata puruhūtam puruṣṭutam /
analyzed: tam u abhi pra gāyata puru hūtam puruṣṭutam
translated: Him, much-invoked, much-praised,

original: indraṃ gīrbhis taviṣam ā vivāsata //
analyzed: indram gīrbhiḥ taviṣam ā vivāsata
translated: Indra, do ye all exalt with songs, with praises.

original: yasya dvibarhaso bṛhat saho dādhāra rodasī /🔽girīṃr ajrāṃ apaḥ svar vṛṣatvanā //
analyzed: yasya dvibarhasaḥ bṛhat sahaḥ dādhāra rodasī  girīṃr ajrān apaḥ svar vṛṣatvanā
translated: Whose great strength, in its twofold greatness, supports the two world-halves,🔽The mountains, the floods, the light, through his manly power.

original: sa rājasi puruṣṭutaṃ eko vṛtrāṇi jighnase /
analyzed: sa rājasi puruṣṭutam ekaḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnase
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the king, to be much praised, thou alone slayest the Vr̥itras.

original: indra jaitrā śravasyā ca yantave //🔽taṃ te madaṃ gṛṇīmasi vṛṣaṇam pṛtsu sāsahim /
analyzed: indra jaitrā śravasyā ca yantave  tam te madam gṛṇīmasi vṛṣaṇam pṛtsu sāsahim
translated: O Indra, for victory and for winning glory.🔽We praise that thy most manly, irresistible rapture in battles,

original: u lokakṛtnum adrivo hariśriyam //🔽yena jyotīṃṣy āyave manave ca viveditha /
analyzed: u loka kṛtnum adrivas hari śriyam  yena jyotīṃṣi āyave manave ca viveditha
translated: O thou who createst the worlds, O thou who hast the stone for thy abode, O thou who hast tawny steeds.🔽By which thou hast discovered the lights for Âyu and for Manu,

original: mandāno asya barhiṣo vi rājasi //
analyzed: mandānaḥ asya barhiṣaḥ vi rājasi
translated: Thou, rejoicing, dost shine forth on this grass.

original: tad adyā cit ta ukthino 'nu ṣṭuvanti pūrvathā /
analyzed: tat adyā cit te ukthinaḥ nu stuvanti pūrvathā
translated: Even that, O Indra, the singers of praise still sing as of old,

original: vṛṣapatnīr apo jayā divedive //🔽tava tyad indriyam bṛhat tava śuṣmam uta kratum /
analyzed: vṛṣa patnīḥ apaḥ jaya dive dive  tava tyad indriyam bṛhat tava śuṣmam uta kratum
translated: The waters, whose lord thou art, O thou who givest room, day by day.🔽That thy power, O Indra, is great, thy strength and thy wisdom,

original: vajraṃ śiśāti dhiṣaṇā vareṇyam //
analyzed: vajram śiśāti dhiṣaṇā vareṇyam
translated: The thought sharpens thy thunderbolt, which is to be chosen.

original: tava dyaur indra pauṃsyam pṛthivī vardhati śravaḥ /
analyzed: tava dyauḥ indra pauṃsyam pṛthivī vardhati śravaḥ
translated: Thy manly power, O Indra, heaven and earth increase, thy glory,

original: tvām āpaḥ parvatāsaś ca hinvire //
analyzed: tvām āpaḥ parvatāsaḥ ca hinvire
translated: The waters and the mountains impel you.

original: tvāṃ viṣṇur bṛhan kṣayo mitro gṛṇāti varuṇaḥ /
analyzed: tvām viṣṇuḥ bṛhan kṣayaḥ mitraḥ gṛṇāti varuṇaḥ
translated: You whom Vishnu, the great lord, Mitra and Varuna praise,

original: tvāṃ śardho madaty anu mārutam //
analyzed: tvām śardhaḥ madati anu mārutam
translated: You whom the Marut host exults in, following the Maruts.

original: tvaṃ vṛṣā janānām maṃhiṣṭha indra jajñiṣe /
analyzed: tvam vṛṣā janānām maṃhiṣṭhaḥ indra jajñiṣe
translated: You, O Indra, are born as the most bountiful bull of men,

original: satrā viśvā svapatyāni dadhiṣe //
analyzed: satrā viśvā su apatyāni dadhiṣe
translated: You always enjoy all the best things.

original: satrā tvam puruṣṭutaṃ eko vṛtrāṇi tośase /
analyzed: satrā tvam puruṣṭutam ekaḥ vṛtrāṇi tośase
translated: You, O Indra, praised by many, alone delight in the Vr̥itras,

original: nānya indrāt karaṇam bhūya invati //
analyzed: na anyaḥ indrāt karaṇam bhūyaḥ invati
translated: No other than Indra is there who can do more.

original: yad indra manmaśas tvā nānā havanta ūtaye /🔽asmākebhir nṛbhir atrā svar jaya //
analyzed: yat indra manmaśas tvā nānā havante ūtaye  asmākebhiḥ nṛbhiḥ atra svar jaya
translated: When, O Indra, they call upon you in various ways with hymns, for help,🔽With our men here, win the light.

original: araṃ kṣayāya no mahe viśvā rūpāṇy āviśan /
analyzed: aram kṣayāya naḥ mahe viśvā rūpāṇi āviśan
translated: Easy to approach for our great prosperity, he has entered into all forms,

original: indraṃ jaitrāya harṣayā śacīpatim //
analyzed: indram jaitrāya harṣaya śacīpatim
translated: Exhilarate Indra, the lord of power, for victory.

original: pra samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnām indraṃ stotā navyaṃ gīrbhiḥ /
analyzed: pra samrājam carṣaṇīnām indram stota navyam gīrbhiḥ
translated: The praise-singer, with new songs, should praise Indra, the emperor of men,

original: naraṃ nṛṣāham maṃhiṣṭham //
analyzed: naram nṛṣāham maṃhiṣṭham
translated: The hero, the most bountiful, the conqueror of men.

original: yasminn ukthāni raṇyanti viśvāni ca śravasyā /
analyzed: yasmin ukthāni raṇyanti viśvāni ca śravasyā
translated: In whom the hymns delight, and all the glories,

original: apām avo na samudre //🔽taṃ suṣṭutyā vivāse jyeṣṭharājam bhare kṛtnum /
analyzed: apām avaḥ na samudre  tam suṣṭutyā vivāse jyeṣṭha rājam bhare kṛtnum
translated: Like the waters in the ocean.🔽I will delight him with good praise, the most royal, the powerful, the performer,

original: maho vājinaṃ sanibhyaḥ //
analyzed: mahaḥ vājinam sanibhyaḥ
translated: The great strong one for the gains.

original: yasyānūnā gabhīrā madā uravas tarutrāḥ /
analyzed: yasya anūnāḥ gabhīrāḥ madāḥ uravaḥ tarutrāḥ
translated: Whose unimpaired, deep, wide, far-reaching delights,

original: harṣumantaḥ śūrasātau //
analyzed: harṣumantaḥ śūrasātau
translated: The joyful ones in the battle for the hero's prize.

original: tam id dhaneṣu hiteṣv adhivākāya havante /
analyzed: tam id dhaneṣu hiteṣu adhivākāya havante
translated: They call upon him for the sake of wealth and benefits, for the sake of the verdict.

original: yeṣām indras te jayanti //
analyzed: yeṣām indraḥ te jayanti
translated: Those who have Indra, they are victorious.

original: tam ic cyautnair āryanti taṃ kṛtebhiś carṣaṇayaḥ /
analyzed: tam id cyautnaiḥ āryanti tam kṛtebhiḥ carṣaṇayaḥ
translated: They honor him with their strength, the people with their deeds.

original: eṣa indro varivaskṛt //
analyzed: eṣaḥ indraḥ varivaskṛt
translated: This Indra is the one who grants space.

original: indro brahmendra ṛṣir indraḥ purū puruhūtaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ brahmā indraḥ ṛṣiḥ indraḥ purū puruhūtaḥ
translated: Indra is the Brahman, Indra is the sage, Indra is the many, the invoked by many.

original: mahān mahībhiḥ śacībhiḥ //
analyzed: mahān mahībhiḥ śacībhiḥ
translated: The great one with his mighty powers.

original: sa stomyaḥ sa havyaḥ satyaḥ satvā tuvikūrmiḥ /
analyzed: sa stomyaḥ sa havyaḥ satyaḥ satvā tuvikūrmiḥ
translated: He is to be praised, he is to be offered, he is true, he is powerful, he has great power.

original: ekaś cit sann abhibhūtiḥ //
analyzed: ekaḥ cit san abhibhūtiḥ
translated: Though he is one, he is the overlord.

original: tam arkebhis taṃ sāmabhis taṃ gāyatraiś carṣaṇayaḥ /
analyzed: tam arkebhiḥ tam sāmabhiḥ tam gāyatraiḥ carṣaṇayaḥ
translated: The people, with their hymns, with their Sāmans, with their Gāyatrī verses,

original: indraṃ vardhanti kṣitayaḥ //🔽praṇetāraṃ vasyo acchā kartāraṃ jyotiḥ samatsu /
analyzed: indram vardhanti kṣitayaḥ  praṇetāram vasyaḥ acchā kartāram jyotiḥ samatsu
translated: they exalt Indra, the supporter.🔽The leader to better things, the maker of light in battles,

original: sāsahvāṃsaṃ yudhāmitrān //🔽sa naḥ papriḥ pārayāti svasti nāvā puruhūtaḥ /
analyzed: sāsahvāṃsam yudhā amitrān  sa naḥ papriḥ pārayāti svasti nāvā puruhūtaḥ
translated: the one who challenges enemies and friends.

original: indro viśvā ati dviṣaḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ viśvāḥ ati dviṣaḥ
translated: He, the protector, will lead us across safely, the much-invoked Indra,🔽across all enmities.

original: sa tvaṃ na indra vājebhir daśasyā ca gātuyā ca /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ indra vājebhiḥ daśasya ca gātuya ca
translated: And you, O Indra, with your powers, for the sake of our welfare and our going,

original: acchā ca naḥ sumnaṃ neṣi //
analyzed: acchā ca naḥ sumnam neṣi
translated: lead us to bliss.

original: ā yāhi suṣumā hi ta indra somam pibā imam /
analyzed: ā yāhi suṣuma hi te indra somam pibā imam
translated: Come, for you are well-disposed. O Indra, drink this Soma.

original: edam barhiḥ sado mama //
analyzed: ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ mama
translated: This is my seat on the sacrificial grass.

original: ā tvā brahmayujā harī vahatām indra keśinā /
analyzed: ā tvā brahma yujā harī vahatām indra keśinā
translated: May thy two tawny Bay Steeds yoked with prayer bring thee hither, O Indra, with the reins.

original: upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu //
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu
translated: Listen to our invocations.

original: brahmāṇas tvā vayaṃ yujā somapām indra sominaḥ /
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ tvā vayam yujā soma pām indra sominaḥ
translated: We Brahmans, O Indra, who have pressed the Soma, who have offered Soma, call thee,

original: sutāvanto havāmahe //🔽ā no yāhi sutāvato 'smākaṃ suṣṭutīr upa /
analyzed: sutāvantaḥ havāmahe  ā naḥ yāhi sutāvataḥ smākam suṣṭutīḥ upa
translated: Who art to be invoked, to the feast.🔽Come to us, O thou who hast drunk Soma, to the praises of us who have pressed Soma.

original: pibā su śiprinn andhasaḥ //
analyzed: pibā su śiprin andhasaḥ
translated: Drink, O thou of fair cheeks, of the juice.

original: ā te siñcāmi kukṣyor anu gātrā vi dhāvatu /
analyzed: ā te siñcāmi kukṣyoḥ anu gātrā vi dhāvatu
translated: I pour it into thy belly; let it spread through all thy limbs.

original: gṛbhāya jihvayā madhu //🔽svāduṣ ṭe astu saṃsude madhumān tanve tava /
analyzed: gṛbhāya jihvayā madhu  svāduḥ te astu saṃsude madhumān tanve tava
translated: Take the sweet with thy tongue.🔽Let it be sweet for thee to digest; full of sweetness be it for thy body.

original: somaḥ śam astu te hṛde //
analyzed: somaḥ śam astu te hṛde
translated: Let the Soma be sweet to thy heart.

original: ayam u tvā vicarṣaṇe janīr ivābhi saṃvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ayam u tvā vicarṣaṇe janīḥ iva abhi saṃvṛtaḥ
translated: This, O thou of much activity, hath been pressed for thee, as it were, by women.

original: pra soma indra sarpatu //
analyzed: pra somaḥ indra sarpatu
translated: Let the Soma, O Indra, glide along.

original: tuvigrīvo vapodaraḥ subāhur andhaso made /
analyzed: tuvi grīvaḥ vapā udaraḥ su bāhuḥ andhasaḥ made
translated: With mighty neck, with ample belly, with strong arms, in the rapture of the juice,

original: indro vṛtrāṇi jighnate //
analyzed: indraḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnate
translated: Indra slays the Vritras.

original: indra prehi puras tvaṃ viśvasyeśāna ojasā /
analyzed: indra prehi puras tvam viśvasya īśānaḥ ojasā
translated: Go forward, O Indra, thou who art in front of all, as lord with might.

original: vṛtrāṇi vṛtrahañ jahi //
analyzed: vṛtrāṇi vṛtraham jahi
translated: Slay the Vritras, O Vrtra-killer.

original: dīrghas te astv aṅkuśo yenā vasu prayacchasi /
analyzed: dīrghaḥ te astu aṅkuśaḥ yena vasu prayacchasi
translated: Long be thy goad wherewith thou givest wealth

original: yajamānāya sunvate //
analyzed: yajamānāya sunvate
translated: To the sacrificer who presses Soma.

original: ayaṃ ta indra somo nipūto adhi barhiṣi /
analyzed: ayam te indra somaḥ nipūtaḥ adhi barhiṣi
translated: This Soma, O Indra, is purified for thee upon the sacred grass.

original: ehīm asya dravā piba //
analyzed: ehi īm asya drava piba
translated: Come and drink of it.

original: śācigo śācipūjanāyaṃ raṇāya te sutaḥ /
analyzed: śācigo śācipūjana ayam raṇāya te sutaḥ
translated: The Soma is pressed for thee, O Indra, the lover of the sweet, the worshipper of the sweet, for battle.

original: ākhaṇḍala pra hūyase //
analyzed: ākhaṇḍala pra hūyase
translated: Thou art invoked, O thou of the thunderbolt.

original: yas te śṛṅgavṛṣo napāt praṇapāt kuṇḍapāyyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te śṛṅgavṛṣaḥ napāt praṇapāt kuṇḍapāyyaḥ
translated: Thy bull, the breaker of forts, the son of the cloud, the one who breaks down forts,

original: ny asmin dadhra ā manaḥ //
analyzed: ni asmin dadhre ā manaḥ
translated: Hath placed his mind in this one.

original: vāstoṣ pate dhruvā sthūṇāṃsatraṃ somyānām /
analyzed: vāstoḥ pate dhruvā sthūṇā aṃsatram somyānām
translated: O lord of the house, firm is the sacrificial post of the Soma-drinkers.

original: drapso bhettā purāṃ śaśvatīnām indro munīnāṃ sakhā //
analyzed: drapsaḥ bhettā purām śaśvatīnām indraḥ munīnām sakhā
translated: The drop, the breaker of the ancient forts, is Indra, the friend of the sages.

original: pṛdākusānur yajato gaveṣaṇa ekaḥ sann abhi bhūyasaḥ /
analyzed: pṛdākusānuḥ yajataḥ gaveṣaṇaḥ ekaḥ san abhi bhūyasaḥ
translated: The one who seeks the cow, with the broad back of the sacrificer, being alone, overcomes the many.

original: bhūrṇim aśvaṃ nayat tujā puro gṛbhendraṃ somasya pītaye //
analyzed: bhūrṇim aśvam nayat tujā puras gṛbhā indram somasya pītaye
translated: He leads the tawny horse with force to the front, seizes Indra, for the drinking of Soma.

original: idaṃ ha nūnam eṣāṃ sumnam bhikṣeta martyaḥ /
analyzed: idam ha nūnam eṣām sumnam bhikṣeta martyaḥ
translated: This indeed is their bliss which a mortal should beg for.

original: ādityānām apūrvyaṃ savīmani //🔽anarvāṇo hy eṣām panthā ādityānām /
analyzed: ādityānām apūrvyam savīmani  anarvāṇaḥ hi eṣām panthāḥ ādityānām
translated: The unprecedented of the Adityas in the assembly.🔽For the path of the Adityas is not obstructed.

original: adabdhāḥ santi pāyavaḥ sugevṛdhaḥ //🔽tat su naḥ savitā bhago varuṇo mitro aryamā /
analyzed: adabdhāḥ santi pāyavaḥ sugevṛdhaḥ  tat su naḥ savitā bhagaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: Their ways are undeceiving, increasing good fortune.🔽May that Savitar, Bhaga, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman,

original: śarma yacchantu sapratho yad īmahe //
analyzed: śarma yacchantu saprathaḥ yat īmahe
translated: Grant us wide protection, what we seek.

original: devebhir devy adite 'riṣṭabharmann ā gahi /
analyzed: devebhiḥ devi adite riṣṭa bharman ā gahi
translated: O divine Aditi, with the gods, come hither with uninjured protection,

original: smat sūribhiḥ purupriye suśarmabhiḥ //
analyzed: smat sūribhiḥ puru priye su śarmabhiḥ
translated: With our princes, O thou who art much loved, with those who bestow good protection.

original: te hi putrāso aditer vidur dveṣāṃsi yotave /
analyzed: te hi putrāsaḥ aditeḥ viduḥ dveṣāṃsi yotave
translated: For they, the sons of Aditi, know how to avert enmities.

original: aṃhoś cid urucakrayo 'nehasaḥ //
analyzed: aṃhoḥ cit uru cakrayaḥ na īhasaḥ
translated: Even from distress, O ye whose wheel is wide, O ye who have no foes.

original: aditir no divā paśum aditir naktam advayāḥ /
analyzed: aditiḥ naḥ divā paśum aditiḥ naktam advayāḥ
translated: May Aditi by day, may Aditi by night, may Aditi, the matchless,

original: aditiḥ pātv aṃhasaḥ sadāvṛdhā //
analyzed: aditiḥ pātu aṃhasaḥ sadā vṛdhā
translated: May Aditi protect us from distress, ever increasing.

original: uta syā no divā matir aditir ūtyā gamat /
analyzed: uta syā naḥ divā matiḥ aditiḥ ūtyā gamat
translated: And may our thought by day be with Aditi, and may Aditi come to us for help.

original: sā śantāti mayas karad apa sridhaḥ //🔽uta tyā daivyā bhiṣajā śaṃ naḥ karato aśvinā /
analyzed: sā śantāti mayaḥ karat apa sridhaḥ  uta tyā daivyā bhiṣajā śam naḥ karataḥ aśvinā
translated: May she make us most prosperous, and drive away our enemies.🔽And may the two divine physicians, the two Âsvins, bring us health.

original: yuyuyātām ito rapo apa sridhaḥ //🔽śam agnir agnibhiḥ karac chaṃ nas tapatu sūryaḥ /
analyzed: yuyuyātām itas rapaḥ apa sridhaḥ  śam agniḥ agnibhiḥ karat śam naḥ tapatu sūryaḥ
translated: May they drive away disease from us, and all our enemies.🔽May Agni with the fires bring us health, may the sun heat us with his heat for health.

original: śaṃ vāto vātv arapā apa sridhaḥ //
analyzed: śam vātaḥ vātu arapāḥ apa sridhaḥ
translated: May the wind blow for health, and drive away all our enemies.

original: apāmīvām apa sridham apa sedhata durmatim /🔽ādityāso yuyotanā no aṃhasaḥ //
analyzed: apa amīvām apa sridham apa sedhata durmatim  ādityāsaḥ yuyotana naḥ aṃhasaḥ
translated: Drive ye away the evil spell, drive ye away the enemy, drive ye away the evil thought.🔽Ye Âdityas, deliver us from sin.

original: yuyotā śarum asmad āṃ ādityāsa utāmatim /
analyzed: yuyota śarum asmat ām ādityāsaḥ uta amatim
translated: Drive ye the arrow from us, O Âdityas, and the shaft that flieth through the air.

original: ṛdhag dveṣaḥ kṛṇuta viśvavedasaḥ //
analyzed: ṛdhak dveṣaḥ kṛṇuta viśva vedasaḥ
translated: Make ye our foes to perish, O ye all-knowers.

original: tat su naḥ śarma yacchatādityā yan mumocati /
analyzed: tat su naḥ śarma yacchata ādityāḥ yat mumocati
translated: Grant ye us that shelter, O Âdityas, whereby ye deliver us.

original: enasvantaṃ cid enasaḥ sudānavaḥ //🔽yo naḥ kaś cid ririkṣati rakṣastvena martyaḥ /
analyzed: enasvantam cit enasaḥ sudānavaḥ  yaḥ naḥ kaḥ cit ririkṣati rakṣaḥ tvena martyaḥ
translated: Even from sin, O ye bountiful ones.🔽Whatever mortal man there be who fain would injure us through hate,

original: svaiḥ ṣa evai ririṣīṣṭa yur janaḥ //
analyzed: svaiḥ saḥ evaiḥ ririṣīṣṭa janaḥ
translated: Let him himself be injured through his own hate, let him be utterly destroyed.

original: sam it tam agham aśnavad duḥśaṃsam martyaṃ ripum /🔽yo asmatrā durhaṇāvāṃ upa dvayuḥ //
analyzed: sam id tam agham aśnavat duḥśaṃsam martyam ripum  yaḥ asmatrā upa dvayuḥ
translated: That sin, O ye Âdityas, that is hidden in the heart of man,🔽The evil-working mortal foe who is against us, may it recoil upon him.

original: pākatrā sthana devā hṛtsu jānītha martyam /
analyzed: pākatrā sthana devāḥ hṛtsu jānītha martyam
translated: Ye Gods, be ye the guardians of our souls: in your hearts ye know the mortal man.

original: upa dvayuṃ cādvayuṃ ca vasavaḥ //🔽ā śarma parvatānām otāpāṃ vṛṇīmahe /
analyzed: upa dvayum ca advayum ca vasavaḥ  ā śarma parvatānām ā uta apām vṛṇīmahe
translated: O Vasus, to the one who is to be overcome and to the one who is not to be overcome.🔽We choose the shelter of the mountains and the waters.

original: dyāvākṣāmāre asmad rapas kṛtam //
analyzed: dyāvākṣāmā āre asmat rapaḥ kṛtam
translated: Keep far from us, O ye Dyaus and Prithivî, the sin that hath been committed.

original: te no bhadreṇa śarmaṇā yuṣmākaṃ nāvā vasavaḥ /
analyzed: te naḥ bhadreṇa śarmaṇā yuṣmākam nāvā vasavaḥ
translated: O ye Vasus, with your gracious shelter, O ye Gods,

original: ati viśvāni duritā pipartana //🔽tuce tanāya tat su no drāghīya āyur jīvase /
analyzed: ati viśvāni duritā pipartana  tuce tanāya tat su naḥ drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ jīvase
translated: Carry us over all our troubles.

original: ādityāsaḥ sumahasaḥ kṛṇotana //
analyzed: ādityāsaḥ su mahasaḥ kṛṇotana
translated: That we may live long and enjoy life, grant us this, O ye Âdityas, of great glory.

original: yajño hīḷo vo antara ādityā asti mṛḷata /
analyzed: yajñaḥ hīḍaḥ vaḥ antare ādityāḥ asti mṛḍata
translated: O Âdityas, there is a sacrifice among you, a sin: be ye propitious.

original: yuṣme id vo api ṣmasi sajātye //
analyzed: yuṣme id vaḥ api smasi sajātye
translated: We are indeed among you, O ye Âdityas, in the common birth.

original: bṛhad varūtham marutāṃ devaṃ trātāram aśvinā /
analyzed: bṛhat varūtham marutām devam trātāram aśvinā
translated: The great protection of the Maruts, the God, the saviour, the two Asvins,

original: mitram īmahe varuṇaṃ svastaye //
analyzed: mitram īmahe varuṇam svastaye
translated: We implore Mitra, Varuṇa, for our welfare.

original: aneho mitrāryaman nṛvad varuṇa śaṃsyam /
analyzed: anehaḥ mitra aryaman nṛvat varuṇa śaṃsyam
translated: O Mitra-Aryaman-Varuṇa, worthy of praise among men, free from sickness,

original: trivarūtham maruto yanta naś chardiḥ //
analyzed: tri varūtham marutaḥ yanta naḥ chardiḥ
translated: The Maruts come to us with a threefold protection, with a refuge.

original: ye cid dhi mṛtyubandhava ādityā manavaḥ smasi /
analyzed: ye cit hi mṛtyu bandhavaḥ ādityāḥ manavaḥ smasi
translated: Whatever bonds of death, O Âdityas, we have, O ye wise ones,

original: pra sū na āyur jīvase tiretana //
analyzed: pra su naḥ āyuḥ jīvase tiretana
translated: Stretch out to us our life that we may live.

original: taṃ gūrdhayā svarṇaraṃ devāso devam aratiṃ dadhanvire /
analyzed: tam gūrdhayā svarṇaram devāsaḥ devam aratim dadhanvire
translated: The gods have made him, the golden-hued, the god, the messenger, to be worshipped with reverence.

original: devatrā havyam ohire //
analyzed: devatrā havyam ohire
translated: Let the offering go to the gods, O messenger.

original: vibhūtarātiṃ vipra citraśociṣam agnim īḷiṣva yanturam /
analyzed: vibhūta rātim vipra citra śociṣam agnim īḍiṣva yanturam
translated: Agni, the guest, the liberal, the sage, of wondrous light, seek to win him as your charioteer.

original: asya medhasya somyasya sobhare prem adhvarāya pūrvyam //
analyzed: asya medhasya somyasya sobhare pra īm adhvarāya pūrvyam
translated: For this our sacrifice, O Soma, for this our offering, seek him first.

original: yajiṣṭhaṃ tvā vavṛmahe devaṃ devatrā hotāram amartyam /
analyzed: yajiṣṭham tvā vavṛmahe devam devatrā hotāram amartyam
translated: We have chosen thee best sacrificer, O god, as priest among the gods, the immortal one.

original: asya yajñasya sukratum //
analyzed: asya yajñasya sukratum
translated: For this our sacrifice, O wise one.

original: ūrjo napātaṃ subhagaṃ sudīditim agniṃ śreṣṭhaśociṣam /
analyzed: ūrjaḥ napātam subhagam su dīditim agnim śreṣṭha śociṣam
translated: The son of strength, the fortunate one, the well-shining one, Agni, of most excellent light,

original: sa no mitrasya varuṇasya so apām ā sumnaṃ yakṣate divi //
analyzed: sa naḥ mitrasya varuṇasya saḥ apām ā sumnam yakṣate divi
translated: He will win for us the bliss of Mitra, of Varuna, of the waters, in the sky.

original: yaḥ samidhā ya āhutī yo vedena dadāśa marto agnaye /
analyzed: yaḥ samidhā yaḥ āhutī yaḥ vedena dadāśa martaḥ agnaye
translated: The mortal man who with the kindling-stick, with the oblation, with the Veda, has worshipped Agni,

original: yo namasā svadhvaraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ namasā su adhvaraḥ
translated: The self-controlled one with homage,

original: tasyed arvanto raṃhayanta āśavas tasya dyumnitamaṃ yaśaḥ /
analyzed: tasya id arvantaḥ raṃhayantaḥ āśavaḥ tasya dyumnitamam yaśaḥ
translated: His swift horses rush on, his glory is most splendid.

original: na tam aṃho devakṛtaṃ kutaś cana na martyakṛtaṃ naśat //🔽svagnayo vo agnibhiḥ syāma sūno sahasa ūrjām pate /🔽suvīras tvam asmayuḥ //
analyzed: na tam aṃhaḥ deva kṛtam kutas cana na martya kṛtam naśat  su agnayaḥ vaḥ agnibhiḥ syāma sūno sahasaḥ ūrjām pate  su vīraḥ tvam asmayuḥ
translated: No evil from any quarter, whether wrought by the gods or by men, shall harm him.🔽With your fires we will be well-kindled, O son of strength, O lord of strength,🔽You are the one with good heroes, the one who delights in the people.

original: praśaṃsamāno atithir na mitriyo 'gnī ratho na vedyaḥ /
analyzed: praśaṃsamānaḥ atithiḥ na mitriyaḥ gniḥ rathaḥ na vedyaḥ
translated: Praised, like a dear guest, Agni, the chariot, to be known like a chariot,

original: tve kṣemāso api santi sādhavas tvaṃ rājā rayīṇām //
analyzed: tve kṣemāsaḥ api santi sādhavaḥ tvam rājā rayīṇām
translated: In thee are the good and prosperous ones, thou art the king of riches.

original: so addhā dāśvadhvaro 'gne martaḥ subhaga sa praśaṃsyaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ addhā dāśu adhvaraḥ gne martaḥ subhaga sa praśaṃsyaḥ
translated: That mortal, O Agni, who is a frequent worshipper, is fortunate, he is to be praised.

original: sa dhībhir astu sanitā //
analyzed: sa dhībhiḥ astu sanitā
translated: May he be successful with his thoughts.

original: yasya tvam ūrdhvo adhvarāya tiṣṭhasi kṣayadvīraḥ sa sādhate /
analyzed: yasya tvam ūrdhvaḥ adhvarāya tiṣṭhasi kṣayadvīraḥ sa sādhate
translated: He whose hero-destroying fire stands erect for the sacrifice, he prospers.

original: so arvadbhiḥ sanitā sa vipanyubhiḥ sa śūraiḥ sanitā kṛtam //
analyzed: saḥ arvadbhiḥ sanitā sa vipanyubhiḥ sa śūraiḥ sanitā kṛtam
translated: He is successful with his horses, with his cattle, with his heroes, with his deeds.

original: yasyāgnir vapur gṛhe stomaṃ cano dadhīta viśvavāryaḥ /
analyzed: yasya agniḥ vapuḥ gṛhe stomam canaḥ dadhīta viśva vāryaḥ
translated: Whose Agni, the all-bountiful one, makes his dwelling in the house, and accepts the praise,

original: havyā vā veviṣad viṣaḥ //🔽viprasya vā stuvataḥ sahaso yaho makṣūtamasya rātiṣu /
analyzed: havyā vā veviṣat viṣaḥ  viprasya vā stuvataḥ sahasaḥ yaho makṣūtamasya rātiṣu
translated: Or if he wishes to offer oblations.🔽O Vasu, make the god, the highest mortal, listen to the words of the wise, the swift one, in his gifts.

original: avodevam uparimartyaṃ kṛdhi vaso vividuṣo vacaḥ //
analyzed: avas udevam upari martyam kṛdhi vaso vividuṣaḥ vacaḥ
translated: Make him listen to the praise of the sage.

original: yo agniṃ havyadātibhir namobhir vā sudakṣam āvivāsati /
analyzed: yaḥ agnim havya dātibhiḥ namobhiḥ vā su dakṣam āvivāsati
translated: He who with oblations and salutations worships Agni, the very skilful one,

original: girā vājiraśociṣam //
analyzed: girā vājira śociṣam
translated: With a song, the strong one, the radiant one.

original: samidhā yo niśitī dāśad aditiṃ dhāmabhir asya martyaḥ /
analyzed: samidhā yaḥ niśitī dāśat aditim dhāmabhiḥ asya martyaḥ
translated: The mortal who with fuel, with sharp (words), with gifts, with the powers of this (Agni), would serve Aditi,

original: viśvet sa dhībhiḥ subhago janāṃ ati dyumnair udna iva tāriṣat //
analyzed: viśvā id sa dhībhiḥ subhagaḥ janān ati dyumnaiḥ udnaḥ iva tāriṣat
translated: May he, the fortunate one, with all his thoughts, with his glories, cross over the people, as if over a flood.

original: tad agne dyumnam ā bhara yat sāsahat sadane kaṃ cid atriṇam /
analyzed: tat agne dyumnam ā bhara yat sāsahat sadane kam cit atriṇam
translated: Bring that glory, O Agni, which conquers every devourer here in the house,

original: manyuṃ janasya dūḍhyaḥ //
analyzed: manyum janasya dūḍhyaḥ
translated: The punisher of the man who acts deceitfully.

original: yena caṣṭe varuṇo mitro aryamā yena nāsatyā bhagaḥ /
analyzed: yena caṣṭe varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā yena nāsatyā bhagaḥ
translated: By whom Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, by whom the Nâsatyas, Bhaga,

original: vayaṃ tat te śavasā gātuvittamā indratvotā vidhemahi //
analyzed: vayam tat te śavasā gātu vittamāḥ indra tva utāḥ vidhemahi
translated: We, O Indra, would serve thee with that might which best deserves to be served, with thee as our helper.

original: te ghed agne svādhyo ye tvā vipra nidadhire nṛcakṣasam /
analyzed: te gha id agne su ādhyaḥ ye tvā vipra nidadhire nṛ cakṣasam
translated: They, O Agni, are thy own, O sage, who have placed thee, O thou who beholdest men,

original: viprāso deva sukratum //🔽ta id vediṃ subhaga ta āhutiṃ te sotuṃ cakrire divi /
analyzed: viprāsaḥ deva sukratum  te id vedim subhaga te āhutim te sotum cakrire divi
translated: The sages, O god, who hast great wisdom.🔽They have made the altar, O prosperous one, they have made the offering, they have made the pressing in the sky.

original: ta id vājebhir jigyur mahad dhanaṃ ye tve kāmaṃ nyerire //
analyzed: te id vājebhiḥ jigyuḥ mahat dhanam ye tve kāmam nyerire
translated: They have won great wealth with their powers, they who have turned to thee with desire.

original: bhadro no agnir āhuto bhadrā rātiḥ subhaga bhadro adhvaraḥ /
analyzed: bhadraḥ naḥ agniḥ āhutaḥ bhadrā rātiḥ subhaga bhadraḥ adhvaraḥ
translated: May Agni be auspicious to us when offered, may the gift be auspicious, O prosperous one, may the sacrifice be auspicious.

original: bhadrā uta praśastayaḥ //
analyzed: bhadrāḥ uta praśastayaḥ
translated: And may the praises be auspicious.

original: bhadram manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye yenā samatsu sāsahaḥ /
analyzed: bhadram manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye yena samatsu sāsahaḥ
translated: Make thou an auspicious mind for the battle with Vritra, wherewith thou mayest be victorious in the contests.

original: ava sthirā tanuhi bhūri śardhatāṃ vanemā te abhiṣṭibhiḥ //
analyzed: ava sthirā tanuhi bhūri śardhatām vanema te abhiṣṭibhiḥ
translated: Break thou the firm ones, crush the many proud ones: we will serve thee with thy protections.

original: īḷe girā manurhitaṃ yaṃ devā dūtam aratiṃ nyerire /
analyzed: īḍe girā manuḥ hitam yam devāḥ dūtam aratim nyerire
translated: I praise with a song him who is dear to Manu, whom the gods have made their envoy and messenger,

original: yajiṣṭhaṃ havyavāhanam //
analyzed: yajiṣṭham havyavāhanam
translated: The best sacrificer, the bearer of the oblation.

original: tigmajambhāya taruṇāya rājate prayo gāyasy agnaye /
analyzed: tigma jambhāya taruṇāya rājate prayaḥ gāyasi agnaye
translated: To the young one with sharp teeth, to the king who is bright, to the one who is to be praised, to Agni,

original: yaḥ piṃśate sūnṛtābhiḥ suvīryam agnir ghṛtebhir āhutaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ piṃśate sūnṛtābhiḥ su vīryam agniḥ ghṛtebhiḥ āhutaḥ
translated: He who, with his sweet songs, adorns good heroism, Agni, when offered with ghee.

original: yadī ghṛtebhir āhuto vāśīm agnir bharata uc cāva ca /
analyzed: yadī ghṛtebhiḥ āhutaḥ vāśīm agniḥ bharate ud ca ava ca
translated: If, when offered with ghee, Agni, the bearer of the oblation, is high and low for the Bharatas.

original: asura iva nirṇijam //
analyzed: asuraḥ iva nirṇijam
translated: Like an Asura, his own self.

original: yo havyāny airayatā manurhito deva āsā sugandhinā /
analyzed: yaḥ havyāni airayata manuḥ hitaḥ devaḥ āsā sugandhinā
translated: He who carries the oblations, Manu's friend, the god, with his fragrant (oblation),

original: vivāsate vāryāṇi svadhvaro hotā devo amartyaḥ //
analyzed: vivāsate vāryāṇi su adhvaraḥ hotā devaḥ amartyaḥ
translated: Invites the best boons, the priest, the god, the immortal.

original: yad agne martyas tvaṃ syām aham mitramaho amartyaḥ /
analyzed: yat agne martyaḥ tvam syām aham mitra mahas amartyaḥ
translated: If, O Agni, I were to be mortal, O you whose friends are great, you immortal,

original: sahasaḥ sūnav āhuta //
analyzed: sahasaḥ sūno āhuta
translated: O son of strength, when offered.

original: na tvā rāsīyābhiśastaye vaso na pāpatvāya santya /
analyzed: na tvā rāsīya abhiśastaye vaso na pāpa tvāya santya
translated: I would not place you in danger, O Vasu, nor for evil, O you who are to be worshipped.

original: na me stotāmatīvā na durhitaḥ syād agne na pāpayā //
analyzed: na me stotā amatīvā na durhitaḥ syāt agne na pāpayā
translated: My praiser should not be too much, nor should he be badly disposed, O Agni, nor for evil.

original: pitur na putraḥ subhṛto duroṇa ā devāṃ etu pra ṇo haviḥ //
analyzed: pituḥ na putraḥ su bhṛtaḥ duroṇe ā devān etu pra naḥ haviḥ
translated: Like a son his well-cared-for father in his house, may the god come to the oblations we offer.

original: tavāham agna ūtibhir nediṣṭhābhiḥ saceya joṣam ā vaso /
analyzed: tava aham agne ūtibhiḥ nediṣṭhābhiḥ saceya joṣam ā vaso
translated: With your nearest aids, O Agni, O Vasu, may I always be in your favour.

original: sadā devasya martyaḥ //🔽tava kratvā saneyaṃ tava rātibhir agne tava praśastibhiḥ /
analyzed: sadā devasya martyaḥ  tava kratvā saneyam tava rātibhiḥ agne tava praśastibhiḥ
translated: A mortal with the god.🔽By your wisdom, O Agni, by your gifts, by your praises, I may obtain.

original: tvām id āhuḥ pramatiṃ vaso mamāgne harṣasva dātave //
analyzed: tvām id āhuḥ pramatim vaso mama agne harṣasva dātave
translated: You, O Vasu, they call my praiser, O Agni, rejoice in giving.

original: pra so agne tavotibhiḥ suvīrābhis tirate vājabharmabhiḥ /
analyzed: pra saḥ agne tava ūtibhiḥ su vīrābhiḥ tirate vāja bharmabhiḥ
translated: He, O Agni, is victorious through your aids, through your heroic aids, through your aids that carry booty,

original: yasya tvaṃ sakhyam āvaraḥ //
analyzed: yasya tvam sakhyam āvaraḥ
translated: Through whose friendship you are the nearest.

original: tava drapso nīlavān vāśa ṛtviya indhānaḥ siṣṇav ā dade /
analyzed: tava drapsaḥ nīlavān vāśaḥ ṛtviyaḥ indhānaḥ siṣṇo ā dade
translated: Your drop, O Agni, is blue, your tongue is red, you, being kindled, O you who are to be worshipped, have taken the oblations.

original: tvam mahīnām uṣasām asi priyaḥ kṣapo vastuṣu rājasi //
analyzed: tvam mahīnām uṣasām asi priyaḥ kṣapaḥ vastuṣu rājasi
translated: You are dear to the great, to the dawns; you rule the nights among the dwellings.

original: tam āganma sobharayaḥ sahasramuṣkaṃ svabhiṣṭim avase /
analyzed: tam āganma sobharayaḥ sahasra muṣkam su abhiṣṭim avase
translated: To you, O you who have a thousand testicles, we come, O you who are to be praised, for help,

original: samrājaṃ trāsadasyavam //
analyzed: samrājam trāsadasyavam
translated: To you, O you who frighten away the foe, O you who are a great king.

original: yasya te agne anye agnaya upakṣito vayā iva /🔽vipo na dyumnā ni yuve janānāṃ tava kṣatrāṇi vardhayan //
analyzed: yasya te agne anye agnayaḥ upakṣitaḥ vayāḥ iva  vipaḥ na dyumnā ni yuve janānām tava kṣatrāṇi vardhayan
translated: To you, O Agni, whose other fires, like birds, have flown away,🔽To you, O you who are to be worshipped, the people have come with their thoughts and their glories, increasing your powers.

original: yam ādityāso adruhaḥ pāraṃ nayatha martyam /
analyzed: yam ādityāsaḥ adruhaḥ pāram nayatha martyam
translated: Whom, O ye Âdityas, who are free from guile, ye lead to the further shore, O ye who are mortal,

original: maghonāṃ viśveṣāṃ sudānavaḥ //
analyzed: maghonām viśveṣām sudānavaḥ
translated: To the most bountiful of the bountiful, to all.

original: yūyaṃ rājānaḥ kaṃ cic carṣaṇīsahaḥ kṣayantam mānuṣāṃ anu /
analyzed: yūyam rājānaḥ kam cit carṣaṇī sahaḥ kṣayantam mānuṣām anu
translated: You, O kings, (lead) some man who conquers the people, who dwells among men,

original: vayaṃ te vo varuṇa mitrāryaman syāmed ṛtasya rathyaḥ //
analyzed: vayam te vaḥ varuṇa mitra aryaman syāma id ṛtasya rathyaḥ
translated: To you, O Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, may we be, O you who are to be worshipped by truth,

original: adān me paurukutsyaḥ pañcāśataṃ trasadasyur vadhūnām /
analyzed: adāt me paurukutsyaḥ pañcāśatam trasadasyuḥ vadhūnām
translated: The son of Purukutsa has given me five hundred maidens, Trasadasyu,

original: maṃhiṣṭho aryaḥ satpatiḥ //
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭhaḥ aryaḥ satpatiḥ
translated: The most bountiful, the noble lord of the people.

original: uta me prayiyor vayiyoḥ suvāstvā adhi tugvani /
analyzed: uta me prayiyoḥ vayiyoḥ su vāstvā adhi tugvani
translated: And in the two most excellent, the two most youthful, may you, O you who have good abodes, be on the side of the Tugra.

original: tisṝṇāṃ saptatīnāṃ śyāvaḥ praṇetā bhuvad vasur diyānām patiḥ //
analyzed: tisṝṇām saptatīnām śyāvaḥ praṇetā bhuvat vasuḥ diyānām patiḥ
translated: The lord of the three seven-times-seven (Maruts), the leader of the dark ones, has become the possessor of wealth.

original: ā gantā mā riṣaṇyata prasthāvāno māpa sthātā samanyavaḥ /
analyzed: ā ganta mā riṣaṇyata prasthāvānaḥ mā apa sthāta samanyavaḥ
translated: Come, do not be angry! The most powerful ones, do not stand still with mutual hatred.

original: sthirā cin namayiṣṇavaḥ //
analyzed: sthirā cit namayiṣṇavaḥ
translated: Even the firm ones are inclined to bow down.

original: vīḷupavibhir maruta ṛbhukṣaṇa ā rudrāsaḥ sudītibhiḥ /
analyzed: vīḍu pavibhiḥ marutaḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ ā rudrāsaḥ su dītibhiḥ
translated: With the Vīlu-vibhī Maruts, the Ṛbhu-kṣan Rudras, with the splendid ones,

original: iṣā no adyā gatā puruspṛho yajñam ā sobharīyavaḥ //
analyzed: iṣā naḥ adya ā gata puruspṛhaḥ yajñam ā sobharīyavaḥ
translated: With food, come to us today, you who are sought by many, to the sacrifice, you who are to be praised.

original: vidmā hi rudriyāṇāṃ śuṣmam ugram marutāṃ śimīvatām /
analyzed: vidma hi rudriyāṇām śuṣmam ugram marutām śimīvatām
translated: We know the fierce power of the Rudras, of the Maruts who are swift in action,

original: viṣṇor eṣasya mīḷhuṣām //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ eṣasya mīḷhuṣām
translated: Of Viṣṇu, of the bountiful ones.

original: vi dvīpāni pāpatan tiṣṭhad ducchunobhe yujanta rodasī /🔽pra dhanvāny airata śubhrakhādayo yad ejatha svabhānavaḥ //
analyzed: vi dvīpāni pāpatan tiṣṭhat ducchunā ubhe yujanta rodasī  pra dhanvāni airata śubhra khādayaḥ yat ejatha sva bhānavaḥ
translated: You who are crossing over the islands, standing in the midst of misfortune, you yoke the two worlds.🔽You have gone to the deserts, you who have bright teeth, when you move, you who are self-shining.

original: acyutā cid vo ajmann ā nānadati parvatāso vanaspatiḥ /
analyzed: acyutā cit vaḥ ajman ā nānadati parvatāsaḥ vanaspatiḥ
translated: Even the unmoving ones roar for you on your path, the mountains, the lord of the forest.

original: bhūmir yāmeṣu rejate //
analyzed: bhūmiḥ yāmeṣu rejate
translated: The earth trembles in your footsteps.

original: amāya vo maruto yātave dyaur jihīta uttarā bṛhat /
analyzed: amāya vaḥ marutaḥ yātave dyauḥ jihīte uttarā bṛhat
translated: O Maruts, for your coming, may the sky, the lofty one, be measured out above,

original: yatrā naro dediśate tanūṣv ā tvakṣāṃsi bāhvojasaḥ //
analyzed: yatrā naraḥ dediśate tanūṣu ā tvakṣāṃsi bāhu ojasaḥ
translated: Where the men distribute their bodies, their powers, their arms, their strength.

original: svadhām anu śriyaṃ naro mahi tveṣā amavanto vṛṣapsavaḥ /
analyzed: svadhām anu śriyam naraḥ mahi tveṣāḥ amavantaḥ vṛṣapsavaḥ
translated: The men, according to their own nature, their glory, are great, splendid, free from debt, powerful.

original: vahante ahrutapsavaḥ //
analyzed: vahante ahrutapsavaḥ
translated: They carry on, with unerring strength.

original: gobhir vāṇo ajyate sobharīṇāṃ rathe kośe hiraṇyaye /
analyzed: gobhiḥ vāṇaḥ ajyate sobharīṇām rathe kośe hiraṇyaye
translated: The shaft is drawn by the Soabhri cows, in the golden quiver on the chariot.

original: gobandhavaḥ sujātāsa iṣe bhuje mahānto na sparase nu //
analyzed: go bandhavaḥ sujātāsaḥ iṣe bhuje mahāntaḥ naḥ sparase nu
translated: The well-born ones, with cows as their wealth, are great, not to be despised, for food and enjoyment.

original: prati vo vṛṣadañjayo vṛṣṇe śardhāya mārutāya bharadhvam /
analyzed: prati vaḥ vṛṣat añjayaḥ vṛṣṇe śardhāya mārutāya bharadhvam
translated: To the bull-adorning, to the bull, to the Marut host, bring offerings!

original: havyā vṛṣaprayāvṇe //
analyzed: havyā vṛṣa prayāvṇe
translated: To the bull-driving one,

original: vṛṣaṇaśvena maruto vṛṣapsunā rathena vṛṣanābhinā /
analyzed: vṛṣaṇaśvena marutaḥ vṛṣapsunā rathena vṛṣa nābhinā
translated: O Maruts, with the bull-strong, bull-naveled chariot, with the bull-drawn horse,

original: ā śyenāso na pakṣiṇo vṛthā naro havyā no vītaye gata //
analyzed: ā śyenāsaḥ na pakṣiṇaḥ vṛthā naraḥ havyā naḥ vītaye gata
translated: The hawks, like birds, the men without wings, have come to our offerings to enjoy.

original: samānam añjy eṣāṃ vi bhrājante rukmāso adhi bāhuṣu /
analyzed: samānam añji eṣām vi bhrājante rukmāsaḥ adhi bāhuṣu
translated: Their tawny hue is the same, but their bright ornaments shine on their arms.

original: davidyutaty ṛṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: davidyutati ṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Their swords flash forth.

original: ta ugrāso vṛṣaṇa ugrabāhavo nakiṣ ṭanūṣu yetire /
analyzed: te ugrāsaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ ugra bāhavaḥ nakir tanūṣu yetire
translated: Those fierce ones, with fierce arms and mighty strength, do not encroach on human bodies.

original: sthirā dhanvāny āyudhā ratheṣu vo 'nīkeṣv adhi śriyaḥ //
analyzed: sthirā dhanvāni āyudhā ratheṣu vaḥ nīkeṣu adhi śriyaḥ
translated: Their bows are firm, their weapons are on their chariots, their glory is on their formations.

original: yeṣām arṇo na sapratho nāma tveṣaṃ śaśvatām ekam id bhuje /
analyzed: yeṣām arṇaḥ na saprathaḥ nāma tveṣam śaśvatām ekam id bhuje
translated: Whose flood is not spread out, whose one bright form is to be enjoyed by all.

original: vayo na pitryaṃ sahaḥ //🔽tān vandasva marutas tāṃ upa stuhi teṣāṃ hi dhunīnām /
analyzed: vayaḥ na pitryam sahaḥ  tān vandasva marutaḥ tām upa stuhi teṣām hi dhunīnām
translated: Their strength is like the ancestral home.🔽Worship those Maruts, praise them, for they are the last of their moving

original: arāṇāṃ na caramas tad eṣāṃ dānā mahnā tad eṣām //
analyzed: arāṇām na caramaḥ tat eṣām dānā mahnā tat eṣām
translated: wheels, the last of their spokes. That is their greatness, that is their bounty.

original: subhagaḥ sa va ūtiṣv āsa pūrvāsu maruto vyuṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: subhagaḥ sa vaḥ ūtiṣu āsa pūrvāsu marutaḥ vyuṣṭiṣu
translated: He, O Maruts, was prosperous in your former aids, in your rising up,

original: yo vā nūnam utāsati //
analyzed: yaḥ vā nūnam uta asati
translated: Or who now is, or who will be.

original: yasya vā yūyam prati vājino nara ā havyā vītaye gatha /
analyzed: yasya vā yūyam prati vājinaḥ naraḥ ā havyā vītaye
translated: To whomsoever of you, O ye strong ones, O men, the offerings come for enjoyment,

original: abhi ṣa dyumnair uta vājasātibhiḥ sumnā vo dhūtayo naśat //
analyzed: abhi sa dyumnaiḥ uta vājasātibhiḥ sumnā vaḥ dhūtayaḥ naśat
translated: May your gifts, O ye who are shaken, grant you bliss, together with your glories and your conquests.

original: yathā rudrasya sūnavo divo vaśanty asurasya vedhasaḥ /
analyzed: yathā rudrasya sūnavaḥ divaḥ vaśanti asurasya vedhasaḥ
translated: As the sons of Rudra, the sons of Dyaus, the sons of the Asura the creator,

original: yuvānas tathed asat //
analyzed: yuvānaḥ tathā id asat
translated: So let the young ones be to us.

original: ye cārhanti marutaḥ sudānavaḥ sman mīḷhuṣaś caranti ye /
analyzed: ye ca arhanti marutaḥ sudānavaḥ smat mīḍhuṣaḥ caranti ye
translated: And those who are worthy, O ye bountiful Maruts, who move about bestowing rain,

original: ataś cid ā na upa vasyasā hṛdā yuvāna ā vavṛdhvam //🔽yūna ū ṣu naviṣṭhayā vṛṣṇaḥ pāvakāṃ abhi sobhare girā /
analyzed: atas cit ā naḥ upa vasyasā hṛdā yuvānaḥ ā vavṛdhvam  yūnaḥ u su naviṣṭhayā vṛṣṇaḥ pāvakām abhi sobhare girā
translated: From thence, O young ones, do ye increase with a more excellent heart.🔽To the young, to the most youthful, to the strong, to the purifying, to the splendid one, with a song,

original: gāya gā iva carkṛṣat //
analyzed: gāya gāḥ iva carkṛṣat
translated: Sing, as if driving the cows.

original: sāhā ye santi muṣṭiheva havyo viśvāsu pṛtsu hotṛṣu /
analyzed: sāhāḥ ye santi muṣṭi hā iva havyaḥ viśvāsu pṛtsu hotṛṣu
translated: Those who are mighty, like a fist, to be invoked in all battles, among the Hotrakas,

original: vṛṣṇaś candrān na suśravastamān girā vandasva maruto aha //
analyzed: vṛṣṇaḥ candrān na su śravastamān girā vandasva marutaḥ aha
translated: Praise the strong ones, O Maruts, with a song, more famous than the famous.

original: gāvaś cid ghā samanyavaḥ sajātyena marutaḥ sabandhavaḥ /
analyzed: gāvaḥ cit gha samanyavaḥ sajātyena marutaḥ sa bandhavaḥ
translated: Even the cows, O ye of one mind, O Maruts, of the same race, of the same bond,

original: rihate kakubho mithaḥ //
analyzed: rihate kakubhaḥ mithas
translated: Kiss each other's cheeks.

original: martaś cid vo nṛtavo rukmavakṣasa upa bhrātṛtvam āyati /
analyzed: martaḥ cit vaḥ nṛtavaḥ rukma vakṣasaḥ upa bhrātṛ tvam āyati
translated: Even a mortal, O ye who are to be praised, O ye whose breasts are adorned, comes to the state of brotherhood.

original: adhi no gāta marutaḥ sadā hi va āpitvam asti nidhruvi //
analyzed: adhi naḥ gāta marutaḥ sadā hi vaḥ āpi tvam asti nidhruvi
translated: O Maruts, always come to us, for your help is firm, O you who are to be worshipped.

original: maruto mārutasya na ā bheṣajasya vahatā sudānavaḥ /
analyzed: marutaḥ mārutasya naḥ ā bheṣajasya vahata sudānavaḥ
translated: O Maruts, O you who are bountiful, bring us the medicine of the Marut,

original: yūyaṃ sakhāyaḥ saptayaḥ //
analyzed: yūyam sakhāyaḥ saptayaḥ
translated: You who are friends, who are swift.

original: yābhiḥ sindhum avatha yābhis tūrvatha yābhir daśasyathā krivim /
analyzed: yābhiḥ sindhum avatha yābhiḥ tūrvatha yābhiḥ daśasyatha krivim
translated: By which you help the river, by which you speed, by which you favor Krivi,

original: mayo no bhūtotibhir mayobhuvaḥ śivābhir asacadviṣaḥ //
analyzed: mayaḥ naḥ bhūta ūtibhiḥ mayobhuvaḥ śivābhiḥ a saca dviṣaḥ
translated: Be medicine for us with your most powerful medicines, be auspicious, not causing enmity.

original: yat sindhau yad asiknyāṃ yat samudreṣu marutaḥ subarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: yat sindhau yat asiknyām yat samudreṣu marutaḥ su barhiṣaḥ
translated: Whatever is in the river, in the Asakna, whatever is in the oceans, O Maruts, on good grass,

original: yat parvateṣu bheṣajam //
analyzed: yat parvateṣu bheṣajam
translated: Whatever healing is in the mountains.

original: viśvam paśyanto bibhṛthā tanūṣv ā tenā no adhi vocata /
analyzed: viśvam paśyantaḥ bibhṛtha tanūṣu ā tena naḥ adhi vocata
translated: Seeing all, you support in your bodies, by that help us.

original: kṣamā rapo maruta āturasya na iṣkartā vihrutam punaḥ //
