analyzed: kṣamā rapaḥ marutaḥ āturasya naḥ iṣkarta vihrutam punar
translated: Forgive the sin of the sick one, O Maruts, make whole what is broken.

original: vayam u tvām apūrvya sthūraṃ na kac cid bharanto 'vasyavaḥ /
analyzed: vayam u tvām apūrvya sthūram na kad cit bharantaḥ vasyavaḥ
translated: We, O you who are unsurpassed, carrying you as a heavy burden, seeking help,

original: vāje citraṃ havāmahe //🔽upa tvā karmann ūtaye sa no yuvograś cakrāma yo dhṛṣat /
analyzed: vāje citram havāmahe  upa tvā karman ūtaye sa naḥ yuvā ugraḥ cakrāma yaḥ dhṛṣat
translated: We call you, O wondrous one, in the race.🔽To you, O you who are to be worshipped, for help, you who are young, fierce, daring, have come to us,

original: tvām id dhy avitāraṃ vavṛmahe sakhāya indra sānasim //🔽ā yāhīma indavo 'śvapate gopata urvarāpate /
analyzed: tvām id hi avitāram vavṛmahe sakhāyaḥ indra sānasim 🔽ā yāhi ime indavaḥ śva pate go pate urvarā pate
translated: For we have chosen you as the protector, O friend Indra, the one who prospers.🔽Come to us, O juices, O you who rule over horses, cattle, and fields.

original: somaṃ somapate piba //
analyzed: somam soma pate piba
translated: Drink the Soma, O Soma-lord.

original: vayaṃ hi tvā bandhumantam abandhavo viprāsa indra yemima /🔽yā te dhāmāni vṛṣabha tebhir ā gahi viśvebhiḥ somapītaye //
analyzed: vayam hi tvā bandhumantam abandhavaḥ viprāsaḥ indra yemima  yā te dhāmāni vṛṣabha tebhiḥ ā gahi viśvebhiḥ soma pītaye
translated: For we, O Indra, the priests, kinsmen though we be, are kinsmenless.🔽Come hither with all those forms of thine, O bull, to drink the Soma.

original: sīdantas te vayo yathā gośrīte madhau madire vivakṣaṇe /
analyzed: sīdantaḥ te vayaḥ yathā go śrīte madhau madire vivakṣaṇe
translated: As they sit down to thy strength, to the sweet, gladdening, well-pressed juice,

original: abhi tvām indra nonumaḥ //🔽acchā ca tvainā namasā vadāmasi kim muhuś cid vi dīdhayaḥ /
analyzed: abhi tvām indra nonumaḥ  acchā ca tvā enā namasā vadāmasi kim muhur cit vi dīdhayaḥ
translated: We, O Indra, sing to thee.🔽And now we come to thee with homage, what time we think upon thee.

original: santi kāmāso harivo dadiṣ ṭvaṃ smo vayaṃ santi no dhiyaḥ //
analyzed: santi kāmāsaḥ harivas dadiḥ tvam smaḥ vayam santi naḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: The wishes are thine, O thou of tawny steeds, to give: we are thy people, and these our thoughts.

original: nūtnā id indra te vayam ūtī abhūma nahi nū te adrivaḥ /
analyzed: nūtnāḥ id indra te vayam ūtī abhūma nahi nu te adrivas
translated: We are thy new allies, O Indra, for we are not thine already, O Thunderer.

original: vidmā purā parīṇasaḥ //🔽vidmā sakhitvam uta śūra bhojyam ā te tā vajrinn īmahe /
analyzed: vidma purā parīṇasaḥ  vidma sakhi tvam uta śūra bhojyam ā te tā vajrin īmahe
translated: We know thee in the days of old.🔽We know thy friendship and thy bounty, O hero: we ask these things of thee, O Thunderer.

original: uto samasminn ā śiśīhi no vaso vāje suśipra gomati //
analyzed: uta u samasmin ā śiśīhi naḥ vaso vāje su śipra gomati
translated: And in this matter, O Vasu, sharpen us, O thou of fair jaw, in the winning of spoil and of kine.

original: yo na idamidam purā pra vasya ānināya tam u va stuṣe /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ idam idam purā pra vasyaḥ ānināya tam u vaḥ stuṣe
translated: Him who hath brought us this and this aforetime, him I will praise,

original: sakhāya indram ūtaye //
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ indram ūtaye
translated: The friend, O friends, for help.

original: haryaśvaṃ satpatiṃ carṣaṇīsahaṃ sa hi ṣmā yo amandata /
analyzed: haryaśvam satpatim carṣaṇīsaham sa hi sma yaḥ amandata
translated: The lord of the brave, the hero, the conqueror of men, for he hath delighted in🔽us,

original: ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyam aśvyaṃ stotṛbhyo maghavā śatam //
analyzed: ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyam aśvyam stotṛbhyaḥ maghavā śatam
translated: May he distribute to us, the praisers, a hundred head of cattle and horses, the bountiful one.

original: tvayā ha svid yujā vayam prati śvasantaṃ vṛṣabha bruvīmahi /
analyzed: tvayā ha svid yujā vayam prati śvasantam vṛṣabha bruvīmahi
translated: O bull, with you as our ally, we would speak to the panting one.

original: saṃsthe janasya gomataḥ //🔽jayema kāre puruhūta kāriṇo 'bhi tiṣṭhema dūḍhyaḥ /🔽nṛbhir vṛtraṃ hanyāma śūśuyāma cāver indra pra ṇo dhiyaḥ //
analyzed: saṃsthe janasya gomataḥ  jayema kāre puruhūta kāriṇaḥ bhi tiṣṭhema dūḍhyaḥ  nṛbhiḥ vṛtram hanyāma śūśuyāma ca aveḥ indra pra naḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: In the gathering of the people rich in cattle.🔽We would win the prize, O much-invoked one, we would overcome the evildoers.🔽With men we would slay Vrtra and rejoice in the cow, O Indra, further our thoughts.

original: abhrātṛvyo anā tvam anāpir indra januṣā sanād asi /
analyzed: a bhrātṛvyaḥ anā tvam an āpiḥ indra januṣā sanāt asi
translated: You are without a rival, O Indra, without an enemy, from birth you have been without a kinsman.

original: yudhed āpitvam icchase //
analyzed: yudhā id āpi tvam icchase
translated: In the contest you desire to be the only one.

original: nakī revantaṃ sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ /
analyzed: nakir revantam sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ
translated: You do not find a friend who is as rich as you. They drink the Soma, O good horse.

original: yadā kṛṇoṣi nadanuṃ sam ūhasy ād it piteva hūyase //
analyzed: yadā kṛṇoṣi nadanum sam ūhasi āt id pitā iva hūyase
translated: When you make the river roar, when you gather it, then, O father, you are invoked.

original: mā te amājuro yathā mūrāsa indra sakhye tvāvataḥ /
analyzed: mā te amājuraḥ yathā mūrāsaḥ indra sakhye tvāvataḥ
translated: Let not your friends, O Indra, like the foolish ones, be without offspring in your friendship, O you who are to be invoked.

original: ni ṣadāma sacā sute //🔽mā te godatra nir arāma rādhasa indra mā te gṛhāmahi /
analyzed: ni ṣadāma sacā sute  mā te go datra niḥ arāma rādhasaḥ indra mā te gṛhāmahi
translated: Let us sit together with the pressed (Soma).🔽Do not let us, O giver of cattle, miss your favour, O Indra, do not let us enter your house.

original: dṛḷhā cid aryaḥ pra mṛśābhy ā bhara na te dāmāna ādabhe //
analyzed: dṛḍhā cit aryaḥ pra mṛśa abhi ā bhara na te dāmānaḥ ādabhe
translated: Even the firm foe do thou crush, bring (him to us), I do not transgress thy bonds.

original: indro vā ghed iyan maghaṃ sarasvatī vā subhagā dadir vasu /
analyzed: indraḥ vā gha id iyat magham sarasvatī vā subhagā dadiḥ vasu
translated: Indra, or Sarasvatî, the prosperous, hath given wealth.

original: tvaṃ vā citra dāśuṣe //
analyzed: tvam vā citra dāśuṣe
translated: Or thou, O wondrous one, to the worshipper.

original: citra id rājā rājakā id anyake yake sarasvatīm anu /
analyzed: citraḥ id rājā rājakāḥ id anyake yake sarasvatīm anu
translated: Wondrous indeed is the king, the others are mere kings, along the course of Sarasvatī.

original: parjanya iva tatanad dhi vṛṣṭyā sahasram ayutā dadat //
analyzed: parjanyaḥ iva tatanat hi vṛṣṭyā sahasram ayutā dadat
translated: Like Parjanya, he spreads with rain, giving thousands and myriads.

original: o tyam ahva ā ratham adyā daṃsiṣṭham ūtaye /
analyzed: ā u tyam ahve ā ratham adyā daṃsiṣṭham ūtaye
translated: We call to that most bountiful chariot today for help,

original: yam aśvinā suhavā rudravartanī ā sūryāyai tasthathuḥ //
analyzed: yam aśvinā su havā rudravartanī ā sūryāyai tasthathuḥ
translated: Which, O Aśvins, swift to listen, ye who follow the Rudras, ye have set up for Sūryā.

original: pūrvāyuṣaṃ suhavam puruspṛham bhujyuṃ vājeṣu pūrvyam /
analyzed: pūrva āyuṣam su havam puruspṛham bhujyum vājeṣu pūrvyam
translated: The early-rising one, easy to invoke, much-desired, the strong one in battles, the first,

original: sacanāvantaṃ sumatibhiḥ sobhare vidveṣasam anehasam //🔽iha tyā purubhūtamā devā namobhir aśvinā /
analyzed: sacanāvantam sumatibhiḥ sobhare vidveṣasam anehasam  iha tyā puru bhūtamā devā namobhiḥ aśvinā
translated: The one to be invoked together, the prosperous one with good thoughts, the one free from hatred and guile.🔽Here, O Aśvins, we would serve you with homage, O ye Gods, most powerful,

original: arvācīnā sv avase karāmahe gantārā dāśuṣo gṛham //
analyzed: arvācīnā su avase karāmahe gantārā dāśuṣaḥ gṛham
translated: To come hither to help us, to the house of the worshipper.

original: yuvo rathasya pari cakram īyata īrmānyad vām iṣaṇyati /
analyzed: yuvoḥ rathasya pari cakram īyate īrmā anyat vām iṣaṇyati
translated: Your chariot's wheel has rolled around, whatever measure of yours is moving.

original: asmāṃ acchā sumatir vāṃ śubhas patī ā dhenur iva dhāvatu //
analyzed: asmān acchā sumatiḥ vām śubhaḥ patī ā dhenuḥ iva dhāvatu
translated: May your favour, O lords of splendour, come to us, may it run like a milch cow.

original: ratho yo vāṃ trivandhuro hiraṇyābhīśur aśvinā /
analyzed: rathaḥ yaḥ vām tri vandhuraḥ hiraṇya abhīśuḥ aśvinā
translated: The chariot which has three seats for you, O Aśvins, with golden reins,

original: pari dyāvāpṛthivī bhūṣati śrutas tena nāsatyā gatam //
analyzed: pari dyāvāpṛthivī bhūṣati śrutaḥ tena nāsatyā gatam
translated: It goes around heaven and earth, O ye renowned ones. By that, O Nāsatyas, come hither.

original: daśasyantā manave pūrvyaṃ divi yavaṃ vṛkeṇa karṣathaḥ /
analyzed: daśasyantā manave pūrvyam divi yavam vṛkeṇa karṣathaḥ
translated: Favouring Manu, ye plough the ancient seed in heaven with the ploughshare.

original: tā vām adya sumatibhiḥ śubhas patī aśvinā pra stuvīmahi //
analyzed: tā vām adya sumatibhiḥ śubhaḥ patī aśvinā pra stuvīmahi
translated: We will praise you today, O lords of splendour, O Aśvins, with your gracious favours.

original: upa no vājinīvasū yātam ṛtasya pathibhiḥ /
analyzed: upa naḥ vājinīvasū yātam ṛtasya pathibhiḥ
translated: Come to us, O ye rich in wealth, on the paths of holy order,

original: yebhis tṛkṣiṃ vṛṣaṇā trāsadasyavam mahe kṣatrāya jinvathaḥ //
analyzed: yebhiḥ tṛkṣim vṛṣaṇā trāsadasyavam mahe kṣatrāya jinvathaḥ
translated: Whereby, O ye mighty ones, ye quicken Trasadasyu for great lordship.

original: ayaṃ vām adribhiḥ sutaḥ somo narā vṛṣaṇvasū /
analyzed: ayam vām adribhiḥ sutaḥ somaḥ narā vṛṣaṇvasū
translated: This Soma, O ye heroes, is pressed for you with the stones, O ye rich in wealth.

original: ā yātaṃ somapītaye pibataṃ dāśuṣo gṛhe //
analyzed: ā yātam soma pītaye pibatam dāśuṣaḥ gṛhe
translated: Come to drink the Soma, drink in the house of the worshipper.

original: ā hi ruhatam aśvinā rathe kośe hiraṇyaye vṛṣaṇvasū /
analyzed: ā hi ruhatam aśvinā rathe kośe hiraṇyaye vṛṣaṇvasū
translated: Come hither, O ye Aśvins, on the chariot, in the golden vessel, O ye rich in wealth.

original: yuñjāthām pīvarīr iṣaḥ //
analyzed: yuñjāthām pīvarīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: Yoke your fat-filled food supplies.

original: yābhiḥ paktham avatho yābhir adhriguṃ yābhir babhruṃ vijoṣasam /🔽tābhir no makṣū tūyam aśvinā gatam bhiṣajyataṃ yad āturam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ paktham avathaḥ yābhiḥ adhrigum yābhiḥ babhrum vijoṣasam  tābhiḥ naḥ makṣū tūyam aśvinā gatam bhiṣajyatam yat āturam
translated: By which ye help Paktha, by which Adhrigu, by which the tawny one who delights in the same thing,🔽Come to us quickly with those (supplies), O Aśvins, and heal what is diseased.

original: yad adhrigāvo adhrigū idā cid ahno aśvinā havāmahe /
analyzed: yat adhrigāvaḥ adhrigū idā cit ahnaḥ aśvinā havāmahe
translated: When, O ye Aśvins, we call upon you even now, O ye who go far away, in the day,

original: vayaṃ gīrbhir vipanyavaḥ //
analyzed: vayam gīrbhiḥ vipanyavaḥ
translated: With our songs, O ye who look around.

original: tābhir ā yātaṃ vṛṣaṇopa me havaṃ viśvapsuṃ viśvavāryam /
analyzed: tābhiḥ ā yātam vṛṣaṇā upa me havam viśvapsum viśva vāryam
translated: Come to me, O ye mighty ones, to my invocation, which is all-sustaining, which contains all good things,

original: iṣā maṃhiṣṭhā purubhūtamā narā yābhiḥ kriviṃ vāvṛdhus tābhir ā gatam //
analyzed: iṣā maṃhiṣṭhā puru bhūtamā narā yābhiḥ krivim vāvṛdhuḥ tābhiḥ ā gatam
translated: With that which is most bountiful in food, O ye most powerful among men, wherewith ye have strengthened Krivi, come hither with that.

original: tāv idā cid ahānāṃ tāv aśvinā vandamāna upa bruve /
analyzed: tau idā cit ahānām tau aśvinā vandamānaḥ upa bruve
translated: Even them, O ye Aṣvins, I address with homage in the days.

original: tā u namobhir īmahe //
analyzed: tāḥ u namobhiḥ īmahe
translated: We implore them with adorations.

original: tāv id doṣā tā uṣasi śubhas patī tā yāman rudravartanī /
analyzed: tau id doṣā tau uṣasi śubhaḥ patī tā yāman rudravartanī
translated: They are the lords of splendour in the evening and in the dawn, they who in their course are Rudra's guardians.

original: mā no martāya ripave vājinīvasū paro rudrāv ati khyatam //🔽ā sugmyāya sugmyam prātā rathenāśvinā vā sakṣaṇī /
analyzed: mā naḥ martāya ripave vājinīvasū paras rudrau ati khyatam  ā sugmyāya sugmyam prātar rathena aśvinā vā sakṣaṇī
translated: Do not, O ye rich in wealth, O Rudras, pass by us for the mortal foe.

original: huve piteva sobharī //
analyzed: huve pitā iva sobharī
translated: To the most friendly, O ye friendly ones, come in the morning with the chariot, O ye Aṣvins, to the feast.🔽I call you, as a father calls his son.

original: manojavasā vṛṣaṇā madacyutā makṣuṅgamābhir ūtibhiḥ /🔽ārāttāc cid bhūtam asme avase pūrvībhiḥ purubhojasā //
analyzed: manaḥ javasā vṛṣaṇā mada cyutā makṣuṅgamābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ  ārāttāt cit bhūtam asme avase pūrvībhiḥ puru bhojasā
translated: Ye mighty ones, swift as thought, ye who reel in joy, who come with rapid succours,🔽Even from afar be ye our help with many a rich enjoyment.

original: ā no aśvāvad aśvinā vartir yāsiṣṭam madhupātamā narā /
analyzed: ā naḥ aśvāvat aśvinā vartiḥ yāsiṣṭam madhu pātamā narā
translated: O ye rich in wealth, come to our call, O ye Aṣvins, with your chariot, O ye Heroes, to the feast

original: gomad dasrā hiraṇyavat //
analyzed: gomat dasrā hiraṇyavat
translated: Which brings with it a cow, O ye Wonder-Workers, and gold.

original: suprāvargaṃ suvīryaṃ suṣṭhu vāryam anādhṛṣṭaṃ rakṣasvinā /🔽asminn ā vām āyāne vājinīvasū viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi //
analyzed: su prāvargam su vīryam suṣṭhu vāryam an ādhṛṣṭam rakṣasvinā  asmin ā vām āyāne vājinīvasū viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi
translated: Easy of access, with good choice, good hero strength, good choice of food, unassailable by Raksases,🔽In this your coming, O ye rich in wealth, we will think of all your gifts.

original: īḷiṣvā hi pratīvyaṃ yajasva jātavedasam /
analyzed: īḍiṣva hi pratīvyam yajasva jātavedasam
translated: Do thou invoke the gracious one, worship the all-observing God.

original: cariṣṇudhūmam agṛbhītaśociṣam //
analyzed: cariṣṇu dhūmam a gṛbhīta śociṣam
translated: Moving smoke, not grasped, shining.

original: dāmānaṃ viśvacarṣaṇe 'gniṃ viśvamano girā /
analyzed: dāmānam viśvacarṣaṇe gnim viśvamanaḥ girā
translated: The yoke, all-conquering, Agni, all-minded with the song,

original: uta stuṣe viṣpardhaso rathānām //🔽yeṣām ābādha ṛgmiya iṣaḥ pṛkṣaś ca nigrabhe /
analyzed: uta stuṣe viṣpardhasaḥ rathānām  yeṣām ābādhaḥ ṛgmiyaḥ iṣaḥ pṛkṣaḥ ca nigrabhe
translated: And I praise the chariots in competition.🔽Whose food is to be praised, and whose abundance is grasped,

original: upavidā vahnir vindate vasu //🔽ud asya śocir asthād dīdiyuṣo vy ajaram /
analyzed: upavidā vahniḥ vindate vasu  ud asya śociḥ asthāt dīdiyuṣaḥ vi ajaram
translated: By the one who comes, Agni finds wealth.🔽His radiance has arisen, shining forth, imperishable,

original: tapurjambhasya sudyuto gaṇaśriyaḥ //
analyzed: tapuḥ jambhasya su dyutaḥ gaṇa śriyaḥ
translated: Of the one with burning jaws, of the one with brilliant splendor, of the one with the glory of a multitude.

original: ud u tiṣṭha svadhvara stavāno devyā kṛpā /
analyzed: ud u tiṣṭha su adhvara stavānaḥ devyā kṛpā
translated: Rise up, O one who is self-controlled, being praised with the divine ladle,

original: abhikhyā bhāsā bṛhatā śuśukvaniḥ //
analyzed: abhikhyā bhāsā bṛhatā śuśukvaniḥ
translated: With brilliant light, shining brightly.

original: agne yāhi suśastibhir havyā juhvāna ānuṣak /
analyzed: agne yāhi su śastibhiḥ havyā juhvānaḥ ānuṣak
translated: O Agni, come with the beautiful praises, offering the oblations in due order,

original: yathā dūto babhūtha havyavāhanaḥ //
analyzed: yathā dūtaḥ babhūtha havyavāhanaḥ
translated: As you have become the messenger, the bearer of oblations.

original: agniṃ vaḥ pūrvyaṃ huve hotāraṃ carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: agnim vaḥ pūrvyam huve hotāram carṣaṇīnām
translated: I invoke your ancient Agni, the priest of the people,

original: tam ayā vācā gṛṇe tam u va stuṣe //
analyzed: tam ayā vācā gṛṇe tam u vaḥ stuṣe
translated: I praise him with this speech, and I extol him.

original: yajñebhir adbhutakratuṃ yaṃ kṛpā sūdayanta it /
analyzed: yajñebhiḥ adbhuta kratum yam kṛpā sūdayante id
translated: With sacrifices, the one of wondrous power, whom the Kripa people delight in,

original: mitraṃ na jane sudhitam ṛtāvani //
analyzed: mitram na jane sudhitam ṛtāvani
translated: Like a friend well-established among the people, the one who upholds truth.

original: ṛtāvānam ṛtāyavo yajñasya sādhanaṃ girā /
analyzed: ṛtāvānam ṛtāyavaḥ yajñasya sādhanam girā
translated: The truthful one, the truthful ones, the means of accomplishing the sacrifice with the song,

original: upo enaṃ jujuṣur namasas pade //
analyzed: upa u enam jujuṣuḥ namasaḥ pade
translated: They have accepted him in the place of reverence.

original: acchā no aṅgirastamaṃ yajñāso yantu saṃyataḥ /
analyzed: acchā naḥ aṅgirastamam yajñāsaḥ yantu saṃyataḥ
translated: Let the sacrifices come to us, well-controlled, to the one most like Angiras.

original: hotā yo asti vikṣv ā yaśastamaḥ //
analyzed: hotā yaḥ asti vikṣu ā yaśastamaḥ
translated: He who is the priest, most famous in all places.

original: agne tava tye ajarendhānāso bṛhad bhāḥ /
analyzed: agne tava tye ajara indhānāsaḥ bṛhat bhās
translated: O Agni, these, O you of long life, your kindlers, have great radiance.

original: aśvā iva vṛṣaṇas taviṣīyavaḥ //
analyzed: aśvāḥ iva vṛṣaṇaḥ taviṣīyavaḥ
translated: Like bulls, like horses, they are powerful and vigorous.

original: sa tvaṃ na ūrjām pate rayiṃ rāsva suvīryam /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ ūrjām pate rayim rāsva su vīryam
translated: You, O lord of strength, grant us wealth with good heroism.

original: prāva nas toke tanaye samatsv ā //
analyzed: prāva naḥ toke tanaye samatsu ā
translated: Help us in our children, in our offspring, in our battles.

original: yad vā u viśpatiḥ śitaḥ suprīto manuṣo viśi /
analyzed: yat vai u viśpatiḥ śitaḥ su prītaḥ manuṣaḥ viśi
translated: Or if the sharp, well-pleased lord of the people is in the people of men,

original: viśved agniḥ prati rakṣāṃsi sedhati //
analyzed: viśvā id agniḥ prati rakṣāṃsi sedhati
translated: Agni repels all the Raksases.

original: śruṣṭy agne navasya me stomasya vīra viśpate /
analyzed: śruṣṭī agne navasya me stomasya vīra viśpate
translated: O Agni, O hero, lord of the people, listen to this new hymn of mine.

original: ni māyinas tapuṣā rakṣaso daha //
analyzed: ni māyinaḥ tapuṣā rakṣasaḥ daha
translated: Burn up the deceitful Raksases with your heat.

original: na tasya māyayā cana ripur īśīta martyaḥ /
analyzed: na tasya māyayā cana ripuḥ īśīta martyaḥ
translated: No mortal enemy can prevail over him by his magic,

original: yo agnaye dadāśa havyadātibhiḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ agnaye dadāśa havya dātibhiḥ
translated: Who offers to Agni with oblations.

original: vyaśvas tvā vasuvidam ukṣaṇyur aprīṇād ṛṣiḥ /
analyzed: vyaśvaḥ tvā vasu vidam ukṣaṇyuḥ aprīṇāt ṛṣiḥ
translated: The Rṣi Uksan, whose horses were lost, gratified you, the finder of treasure.

original: maho rāye tam u tvā sam idhīmahi //
analyzed: mahaḥ rāye tam u tvā sam idhīmahi
translated: We kindle you for great wealth.

original: uśanā kāvyas tvā ni hotāram asādayat /
analyzed: uśanā kāvyaḥ tvā ni hotāram asādayat
translated: Uśanâ Kâvya has placed you as the Hotri priest.

original: āyajiṃ tvā manave jātavedasam //
analyzed: āyajim tvā manave jātavedasam
translated: You, O Jâtavedas, as the offerer to men.

original: viśve hi tvā sajoṣaso devāso dūtam akrata /
analyzed: viśve hi tvā sajoṣasaḥ devāsaḥ dūtam akrata
translated: For all the gods of one accord have made you their messenger.

original: śruṣṭī deva prathamo yajñiyo bhuvaḥ //
analyzed: śruṣṭī deva prathamaḥ yajñiyaḥ bhuvaḥ
translated: O god, you have become the first to be worshipped at sacrifices.

original: imaṃ ghā vīro amṛtaṃ dūtaṃ kṛṇvīta martyaḥ /
analyzed: imam gha vīraḥ amṛtam dūtam kṛṇvīta martyaḥ
translated: This mortal man should make this hero, this immortal one, his messenger.

original: pāvakaṃ kṛṣṇavartaniṃ vihāyasam //
analyzed: pāvakam kṛṣṇa vartanim vihāyasam
translated: The purifier, with the black track, the one in the sky.

original: taṃ huvema yatasrucaḥ subhāsaṃ śukraśociṣam /
analyzed: tam huvema yata srucaḥ su bhāsam śukra śociṣam
translated: To him we should offer with uplifted ladles, the well-shining one, the one with pure radiance,

original: viśām agnim ajaram pratnam īḍyam //
analyzed: viśām agnim ajaram pratnam īḍyam
translated: The imperishable Agni of the people, the ancient one to be praised.

original: yo asmai havyadātibhir āhutim marto 'vidhat /
analyzed: yaḥ asmai havya dātibhiḥ āhutim martaḥ vidhat
translated: The mortal who offers oblations to him with gifts of oblations,

original: bhūri poṣaṃ sa dhatte vīravad yaśaḥ //🔽prathamaṃ jātavedasam agniṃ yajñeṣu pūrvyam /🔽prati srug eti namasā haviṣmatī //
analyzed: bhūri poṣam sa dhatte vīravat yaśaḥ  prathamam jātavedasam agnim yajñeṣu pūrvyam  prati sruc eti namasā haviṣmatī
translated: He obtains abundant nourishment and heroic fame.🔽The first Jātavedas, Agni, the ancient one at sacrifices,🔽The ladle goes forth to him with homage, accompanied by oblations.

original: ābhir vidhemāgnaye jyeṣṭhābhir vyaśvavat /
analyzed: ābhiḥ vidhema agnaye jyeṣṭhābhiḥ vyaśva vat
translated: With these best offerings, like a horse, we should honor Agni,

original: maṃhiṣṭhābhir matibhiḥ śukraśociṣe //🔽nūnam arca vihāyase stomebhi sthūrayūpavat /
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭhābhiḥ matibhiḥ śukra śociṣe  nūnam arca vihāyase stomebhiḥ sthūra yūpa vat
translated: With the most bountiful thoughts, to the one with pure radiance.🔽Now, O Arch, to the one in the sky, with the praises of Sthūrayūpa,

original: ṛṣe vaiyaśva damyāyāgnaye //
analyzed: ṛṣe vaiyaśva damyāya agnaye
translated: O Ṛṣi Vyaśva, to the tamed Agni.

original: atithim mānuṣāṇāṃ sūnuṃ vanaspatīnām /
analyzed: atithim mānuṣāṇām sūnum vanaspatīnām
translated: The guest of humans, the son of the trees,

original: viprā agnim avase pratnam īḷate //
analyzed: viprāḥ agnim avase pratnam īḍate
translated: The seers invoke the ancient Agni for help.

original: maho viśvāṃ abhi ṣato 'bhi havyāni mānuṣā /
analyzed: mahaḥ viśvān abhi sataḥ bhi havyāni mānuṣā
translated: The great one, surpassing all, the offerings of humans,

original: agne ni ṣatsi namasādhi barhiṣi //🔽vaṃsvā no vāryā puru vaṃsva rāyaḥ puruspṛhaḥ /
analyzed: agne ni satsi namasā adhi barhiṣi  vaṃsva naḥ vāryā puru vaṃsva rāyaḥ puruspṛhaḥ
translated: O Agni, sit down on the sacred grass with homage.🔽Grant us, O Agni, many boons, grant riches, O you who are desired by many,

original: suvīryasya prajāvato yaśasvataḥ //
analyzed: su vīryasya prajāvataḥ yaśasvataḥ
translated: For great valor, offspring, and glory.🔽You, O Agni, the boon, should incite for the good-natured one,

original: tvaṃ varo suṣāmṇe 'gne janāya codaya /
analyzed: tvam suṣāmṇe gne janāya codaya
translated: For the people,

original: sadā vaso rātiṃ yaviṣṭha śaśvate //
analyzed: sadā vasoḥ rātim yaviṣṭha śaśvate
translated: O Vasu, always bestow your gift on the eternal one.

original: tvaṃ hi supratūr asi tvaṃ no gomatīr iṣaḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi supratur asi tvam naḥ gomatīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: For you are the one who grants good protection, you the one who gives us cattle and food.

original: maho rāyaḥ sātim agne apā vṛdhi //
analyzed: mahaḥ rāyaḥ sātim agne apa vṛdhi
translated: O Agni, increase our great wealth and power.

original: agne tvaṃ yaśā asy ā mitrāvaruṇā vaha /
analyzed: agne tvam yaśāḥ asi ā mitrāvaruṇā vaha
translated: O Agni, you are the glory of this (world), bring Mitra and Varuna,

original: ṛtāvānā samrājā pūtadakṣasā //🔽sakhāya ā śiṣāmahi brahmendrāya vajriṇe /
analyzed: ṛtāvānā samrājā pūta dakṣasā  sakhāyaḥ ā śiṣāmahi brahma indrāya vajriṇe
translated: The righteous, the universal kings, the ones with pure power.🔽O friends, let us serve the prayer to Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: stuṣa ū ṣu vo nṛtamāya dhṛṣṇave //
analyzed: stuṣe u su vaḥ nṛtamāya dhṛṣṇave
translated: Let us praise you, the most manly one, the daring one.

original: śavasā hy asi śruto vṛtrahatyena vṛtrahā /
analyzed: śavasā hi asi śrutaḥ vṛtra hatyena vṛtrahā
translated: For by your strength you are renowned, O slayer of Vrtra, by the slaying of Vrtra.

original: maghair maghono ati śūra dāśasi //
analyzed: maghaiḥ maghonaḥ ati śūra dāśasi
translated: O hero, you surpass the generous ones with your generosity.

original: sa na stavāna ā bhara rayiṃ citraśravastamam /
analyzed: sa naḥ stavānaḥ ā bhara rayim citraśravastamam
translated: Bring that wealth to us, O Indra, which is most famous in fame,

original: nireke cid yo harivo vasur dadiḥ //🔽ā nirekam uta priyam indra darṣi janānām /
analyzed: nireke cit yaḥ harivas vasuḥ dadiḥ  ā nirekam uta priyam indra darṣi janānām
translated: Which, O you who love the tawny (horses), is to be given even to the poor.🔽O Indra, look upon the dear one, the one who is to be looked upon by the people,

original: dhṛṣatā dhṛṣṇo stavamāna ā bhara //🔽na te savyaṃ na dakṣiṇaṃ hastaṃ varanta āmuraḥ /
analyzed: dhṛṣatā dhṛṣṇo stavamānaḥ ā bhara  na te savyam na dakṣiṇam hastam varante āmuraḥ
translated: Bring it, O daring one, to be praised.🔽Neither your left nor your right hand is obstructed, O mighty one,

original: na paribādho harivo gaviṣṭiṣu //
analyzed: na paribādhaḥ harivas gaviṣṭiṣu
translated: Nor your pursuit, O you who love the tawny (horses), in the contests for cattle.

original: ā tvā gobhir iva vrajaṃ gīrbhir ṛṇomy adrivaḥ /🔽ā smā kāmaṃ jaritur ā manaḥ pṛṇa //
analyzed: ā tvā gobhiḥ iva vrajam gīrbhiḥ ṛṇomi adrivas  ā smā kāmam jarituḥ ā manaḥ pṛṇa
translated: I attract you, O you who have thunder, with songs, as a pen with cattle,🔽Satisfy the desire of the worshipper, satisfy the mind.

original: viśvāni viśvamanaso dhiyā no vṛtrahantama /
analyzed: viśvāni viśvamanasaḥ dhiyā naḥ vṛtra hantama
translated: O you who are most famous for slaying Vrtra, with our thought, which is in all (our) minds,

original: ugra praṇetar adhi ṣū vaso gahi //🔽vayaṃ te asya vṛtrahan vidyāma śūra navyasaḥ /
analyzed: ugra praṇetar adhi su vaso gahi  vayam te asya vṛtrahan vidyāma śūra navyasaḥ
translated: O mighty leader, O good one, come down to us.

original: vaso spārhasya puruhūta rādhasaḥ //
analyzed: vaso spārhasya puruhūta rādhasaḥ
translated: O Vṛtra-slayer, O hero, may we know this new bounty of yours,🔽O good one, O much-invoked one, of the desirable gift.

original: indra yathā hy asti te 'parītaṃ nṛto śavaḥ /
analyzed: indra yathā hi asti te parītam nṛto śavaḥ
translated: O Indra, as your unrestricted heroic strength exists, O leader of men,

original: amṛktā rātiḥ puruhūta dāśuṣe //🔽ā vṛṣasva mahāmaha mahe nṛtama rādhase /
analyzed: amṛktā rātiḥ puruhūta dāśuṣe  ā vṛṣasva mahā maha mahe nṛtama rādhase
translated: Your uncensured gift is for the worshipper, O much-invoked one.🔽Be strong, O great one, for the great gift, O best of men.

original: dṛḷhaś cid dṛhya maghavan maghattaye //🔽nū anyatrā cid adrivas tvan no jagmur āśasaḥ /
analyzed: dṛḍhaḥ cit dṛhya maghavan maghattaye  nu anyatrā cit adrivas tvat naḥ jagmuḥ āśasaḥ
translated: Be firm, O bountiful one, for the sake of prosperity.🔽O wielder of the thunderbolt, your worshippers have not gone elsewhere for help.

original: maghavañ chagdhi tava tan na ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: maghavan śagdhi tava tat naḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Be gracious, O bountiful one, through your aids.

original: nahy aṅga nṛto tvad anyaṃ vindāmi rādhase /
analyzed: nahi aṅga nṛto tvat anyam vindāmi rādhase
translated: O leader, I find none other than you for the gift.

original: rāye dyumnāya śavase ca girvaṇaḥ //
analyzed: rāye dyumnāya śavase ca girvaṇaḥ
translated: For wealth, for glory, for strength, O you who love the song.

original: endum indrāya siñcata pibāti somyam madhu /🔽pra rādhasā codayāte mahitvanā //
analyzed: ā indum indrāya siñcata pibāti somyam madhu  pra rādhasā codayāte mahitvanā
translated: Pour out the drop for Indra; he drinks the sweet Soma.🔽They urge him on with bounty and greatness.

original: upo harīṇām patiṃ dakṣam pṛñcantam abravam /
analyzed: upa u harīṇām patim dakṣam pṛñcantam abravam
translated: I have spoken to the lord of the tawny ones, to the powerful one who is being cleansed.

original: nūnaṃ śrudhi stuvato aśvyasya //🔽nahy aṅga purā cana jajñe vīrataras tvat /
analyzed: nūnam śrudhi stuvataḥ aśvyasya  nahi aṅga purā cana jajñe vīrataraḥ tvat
translated: Listen now, O you who have horses, to the one who praises you.🔽For no one else has been born more heroic than you, O Indra, in ancient times.

original: nakī rāyā naivathā na bhandanā //
analyzed: nakir rāyā na evathā na bhandanā
translated: By no means is your wealth like his, nor your praise.

original: ed u madhvo madintaraṃ siñca vādhvaryo andhasaḥ /
analyzed: ā id u madhvaḥ madintaram siñca vā adhvaryo andhasaḥ
translated: Pour out, O Adhvaryu, of the juice, the most gladdening of the sweet,

original: evā hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ //🔽indra sthātar harīṇāṃ nakiṣ ṭe pūrvyastutim /
analyzed: eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ  indra sthātar harīṇām nakir te pūrvya stutim
translated: For so, O hero, the ever-waxing one is praised.🔽O Indra, Lord of the Bay Steeds, none hath attained to thy ancient praise,

original: ud ānaṃśa śavasā na bhandanā //
analyzed: ud ānaṃśa śavasā na bhandanā
translated: Thou hast raised up the hymn with might.

original: taṃ vo vājānām patim ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ /
analyzed: tam vaḥ vājānām patim ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ
translated: We have invoked that Lord of strength, O ye who long for glory,

original: aprāyubhir yajñebhir vāvṛdhenyam //
analyzed: aprāyubhiḥ yajñebhiḥ vāvṛdhenyam
translated: Him who is to be magnified by sacrifices that have not failed.

original: eto nv indraṃ stavāma sakhāya stomyaṃ naram /
analyzed: eta u nu indram stavāma sakhāyaḥ stomyam naram
translated: Come now, let us praise Indra, O friends, the man who is to be praised with lauds,

original: kṛṣṭīr yo viśvā abhy asty eka it //🔽agorudhāya gaviṣe dyukṣāya dasmyaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: kṛṣṭīḥ yaḥ viśvāḥ abhī asti ekaḥ id  agorudhāya gaviṣe dyukṣāya dasmyam vacaḥ
translated: Who alone is over all the people.🔽To the far-reaching, to the bull in the contest, to the sky-like one, the wondrous one,

original: ghṛtāt svādīyo madhunaś ca vocata //
analyzed: ghṛtāt svādīyaḥ madhunaḥ ca vocata
translated: Speak the wondrous word, sweeter than ghee and than honey.

original: yasyāmitāni vīryā na rādhaḥ paryetave /
analyzed: yasya amitāni vīryā na rādhaḥ paryetave
translated: Whose boundless are his powers, whose bounty is not to be measured,

original: jyotir na viśvam abhy asti dakṣiṇā //
analyzed: jyotiḥ na viśvam abhī asti dakṣiṇā
translated: Whose gift of wealth is like the light that is over all.

original: stuhīndraṃ vyaśvavad anūrmiṃ vājinaṃ yamam /
analyzed: stuhi indram vyaśva vat anūrmim vājinam yamam
translated: Praise Indra, as one with a good horse, the irresistible, the strong, the just,

original: aryo gayam maṃhamānaṃ vi dāśuṣe //
analyzed: aryaḥ gayam maṃhamānam vi dāśuṣe
translated: The bountiful, the giver to the worshipper.

original: evā nūnam upa stuhi vaiyaśva daśamaṃ navam /
analyzed: eva nūnam upa stuhi vaiyaśva daśamam navam
translated: Even now praise thou him, O thou of good horses, the tenth, the new,

original: suvidvāṃsaṃ carkṛtyaṃ caraṇīnām //
analyzed: su vidvāṃsam carkṛtyam caraṇīnām
translated: The well-knowing one, the doer of deeds among the people.

original: vetthā hi nirṛtīnāṃ vajrahasta parivṛjam /
analyzed: vettha hi nirṛtīnām vajrahasta parivṛjam
translated: For thou knowest the snares of Nirrti, O thou with the thunderbolt in thy hand,

original: aharahaḥ śundhyuḥ paripadām iva //
analyzed: ahar ahar śundhyuḥ paripadām iva
translated: Day after day, like the steps of a straight-going one.

original: tad indrāva ā bhara yenā daṃsiṣṭha kṛtvane /
analyzed: tat indra avaḥ ā bhara yena daṃsiṣṭha kṛtvane
translated: That, O Indra, bring thou hither, wherewith thou art most bountiful to the generous one.

original: dvitā kutsāya śiśnatho ni codaya //🔽tam u tvā nūnam īmahe navyaṃ daṃsiṣṭha sanyase /
analyzed: dvitā kutsāya śiśnathaḥ ni codaya  tam u tvā nūnam īmahe navyam daṃsiṣṭha sanyase
translated: Sharpen the two for Kutsa, and impel them.🔽We implore thee now for that new bounty, O most bountiful one, for the battle.

original: sa tvaṃ no viśvā abhimātīḥ sakṣaṇiḥ //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ viśvāḥ abhimātīḥ sakṣaṇiḥ
translated: And thou, O all-destroying one, for all our hostilities.

original: ya ṛkṣād aṃhaso mucad yo vāryāt sapta sindhuṣu /
analyzed: yaḥ ṛkṣāt aṃhasaḥ mucat yaḥ vā āryāt sapta sindhuṣu
translated: He who is freed from the Raksas, from the Varas, from the seven rivers,

original: vadhar dāsasya tuvinṛmṇa nīnamaḥ //🔽yathā varo suṣāmṇe sanibhya āvaho rayim /
analyzed: vadhar dāsasya tuvi nṛmṇa nīnamaḥ  yathā suṣāmṇe sanibhyaḥ āvahaḥ rayim
translated: The destruction of the Dasa, O invincible one, is brought low.🔽As thou, O good one, hast brought wealth to the good sacrificers,

original: vyaśvebhyaḥ subhage vājinīvati //
analyzed: vyaśvebhyaḥ subhage vājinīvati
translated: To the Vyaśvas, O blessed one, rich in booty.

original: ā nāryasya dakṣiṇā vyaśvāṃ etu sominaḥ /
analyzed: ā nāryasya dakṣiṇā vyaśvān etu sominaḥ
translated: Let the Dakṣiṇā of the noble one go to the Vyaśvas, to the Soma-offerer.

original: sthūraṃ ca rādhaḥ śatavat sahasravat //
analyzed: sthūram ca rādhaḥ śatavat sahasravat
translated: And let the gift be abundant, in hundreds and thousands.

original: yat tvā pṛcchād ījānaḥ kuhayā kuhayākṛte /
analyzed: yat tvā pṛcchāt ījānaḥ kuhayā kuhayākṛte
translated: When the sacrificer asks thee, O thou who art called Kuhayā, Kuhayā,

original: eṣo apaśrito valo gomatīm ava tiṣṭhati //
analyzed: eṣa u apaśritaḥ valaḥ gomatīm ava tiṣṭhati
translated: This hidden Vala stands by the Gomatī.

original: tā vāṃ viśvasya gopā devā deveṣu yajñiyā /
analyzed: tā vām viśvasya gopā devā deveṣu yajñiyā
translated: You two, the guardians of all, the gods, are to be worshipped by the gods.

original: ṛtāvānā yajase pūtadakṣasā //
analyzed: ṛtāvānā yajase pūta dakṣasā
translated: You, the truthful ones, worship with pure power.

original: mitrā tanā na rathyā varuṇo yaś ca sukratuḥ /
analyzed: mitrā tanā na rathyā varuṇaḥ yaḥ ca su kratuḥ
translated: Mitra, Tvaṣṭar, and Varuṇa, who is of good thought,

original: sanāt sujātā tanayā dhṛtavratā //
analyzed: sanāt sujātā tanayā dhṛtavratā
translated: From birth well-born, the sons, of firm vow.

original: tā mātā viśvavedasāsuryāya pramahasā /
analyzed: tā mātā viśva vedasā asuryāya pramahasā
translated: Those two, the mother of all wealth, the two most glorious,

original: mahī jajānāditir ṛtāvarī //
analyzed: mahī jajāna aditiḥ ṛtāvarī
translated: the great Aditi, born of truth, has brought forth.

original: mahāntā mitrāvaruṇā samrājā devāv asurā /🔽ṛtāvānāv ṛtam ā ghoṣato bṛhat //
analyzed: mahāntā mitrāvaruṇā samrājā devau asurā  ṛtāvānau ṛtam ā ghoṣataḥ bṛhat
translated: The two great kings, the two gods Mitra and Varuna, the two who are righteous,🔽the two who proclaim the great truth.

original: napātā śavaso mahaḥ sūnū dakṣasya sukratū /
analyzed: napātā śavasaḥ mahaḥ sūnū dakṣasya su kratū
translated: The two sons of Daksha, the two who distribute great strength, the two who are very wise,

original: sṛpradānū iṣo vāstv adhi kṣitaḥ //
analyzed: sṛpra dānū iṣaḥ vāstū adhi kṣitaḥ
translated: the two who give abundant gifts, are established in the abode of food.

original: saṃ yā dānūni yemathur divyāḥ pārthivīr iṣaḥ /
analyzed: sam yā dānūni yemathuḥ divyāḥ pārthivīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: The two who distribute the heavenly and earthly gifts,

original: nabhasvatīr ā vāṃ carantu vṛṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: nabhasvatīḥ ā vām carantu vṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: may the rain-bearing clouds move towards you.

original: adhi yā bṛhato divo 'bhi yūtheva paśyataḥ /🔽ṛtāvānā samrājā namase hitā //🔽ṛtāvānā ni ṣedatuḥ sāmrājyāya sukratū /
analyzed: adhi yā bṛhataḥ divaḥ bhi yūthā iva paśyataḥ  ṛtāvānā samrājā namase hitā  ṛtāvānā ni sedatuḥ sāmrājyāya su kratū
translated: The two who are established on the great heaven, as if looking on a herd,🔽the two righteous kings, are set for worship.🔽The two who are righteous, the two who are very wise, have sat down

original: dhṛtavratā kṣatriyā kṣatram āśatuḥ //🔽akṣṇaś cid gātuvittarānulbaṇena cakṣasā /
analyzed: dhṛta vratā kṣatriyā kṣatram āśatuḥ  akṣṇaḥ cit gātu vittarā an ulbaṇena cakṣasā
translated: for sovereignty, the two who uphold the vow, the two who are Kshatriyas, have obtained the kingdom.🔽Even from the eye, the two who find the path, with their unobstructed sight,

original: ni cin miṣantā nicirā ni cikyatuḥ //
analyzed: ni cit miṣantā nicirā ni cikyatuḥ
translated: the two who are watchful, have looked out.

original: uta no devy aditir uruṣyatāṃ nāsatyā /
analyzed: uta naḥ devī aditiḥ uruṣyatām nāsatyā
translated: And may the goddess Aditi, and the two Asvins, protect us, O goddess.

original: uruṣyantu maruto vṛddhaśavasaḥ //🔽te no nāvam uruṣyata divā naktaṃ sudānavaḥ /
analyzed: uruṣyantu marutaḥ vṛddha śavasaḥ  te naḥ nāvam uruṣyata divā naktam sudānavaḥ
translated: May the Maruts, of increased strength, protect us.🔽Protect us, O you who give good gifts, day and night,

original: ariṣyanto ni pāyubhiḥ sacemahi //
analyzed: a riṣyantaḥ ni pāyubhiḥ sacemahi
translated: may we be protected by you, the protectors, free from enemies.

original: aghnate viṣṇave vayam ariṣyantaḥ sudānave /
analyzed: a ghnate viṣṇave vayam a riṣyantaḥ sudānave
translated: To the non-violent Vishnu, we, being free from enemies, to the very generous one,

original: śrudhi svayāvan sindho pūrvacittaye //🔽tad vāryaṃ vṛṇīmahe variṣṭhaṃ gopayatyam /
analyzed: śrudhi sva yāvan sindho pūrva cittaye  tat vāryam vṛṇīmahe variṣṭham gopayatyam
translated: Listen, O you who are to be praised, O river, for the sake of our former thoughts.🔽We choose that best, most excellent, most hidden treasure,

original: mitro yat pānti varuṇo yad aryamā //
analyzed: mitraḥ yat pānti varuṇaḥ yat aryamā
translated: Which Mitra, Varuna, and Aryaman protect.

original: uta naḥ sindhur apāṃ tan marutas tad aśvinā /
analyzed: uta naḥ sindhuḥ apām tat marutaḥ tat aśvinā
translated: And for us, O river of the waters, that, O Maruts, that, O Asvins,

original: indro viṣṇur mīḍhvāṃsaḥ sajoṣasaḥ //🔽te hi ṣmā vanuṣo naro 'bhimātiṃ kayasya cit /
analyzed: indraḥ viṣṇuḥ mīḍhvāṃsaḥ sajoṣasaḥ  te hi sma vanuṣaḥ naraḥ bhimātim kayasya cit
translated: Indra, Vishnu, the bountiful ones, of one mind,🔽For they, indeed, are the most powerful men, the impetuous ones, who ward off

original: tigmaṃ na kṣodaḥ pratighnanti bhūrṇayaḥ //
analyzed: tigmam na kṣodaḥ pratighnanti bhūrṇayaḥ
translated: The sharp attack of anyone who is hostile.

original: ayam eka itthā purūru caṣṭe vi viśpatiḥ /
analyzed: ayam ekaḥ itthā puru uru caṣṭe vi viśpatiḥ
translated: This one alone here, the lord of many, shines forth,

original: tasya vratāny anu vaś carāmasi //
analyzed: tasya vratāni anu vaḥ carāmasi
translated: We follow his ordinances, as you do.

original: anu pūrvāṇy okyā sāmrājyasya saścima /
analyzed: anu pūrvāṇi okyā sāmrājyasya saścima
translated: After the former, the last of the royal powers,

original: mitrasya vratā varuṇasya dīrghaśrut //
analyzed: mitrasya vratā varuṇasya dīrgha śrut
translated: The long-renowned ordinances of Mitra and Varuna.

original: pari yo raśminā divo 'ntān mame pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: pari yaḥ raśminā divaḥ ntāt mame pṛthivyāḥ
translated: He who with his ray measures the ends of heaven and earth,

original: ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā //
analyzed: ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā
translated: With his greatness he has filled both the worlds.

original: ud u ṣya śaraṇe divo jyotir ayaṃsta sūryaḥ /
analyzed: ud u sya śaraṇe divaḥ jyotiḥ ayaṃsta sūryaḥ
translated: The sun has risen as light in the shelter of heaven,

original: agnir na śukraḥ samidhāna āhutaḥ //
analyzed: agniḥ na śukraḥ samidhānaḥ āhutaḥ
translated: Like Agni, the pure one, when kindled and offered to.

original: vaco dīrghaprasadmanīśe vājasya gomataḥ /
analyzed: vacaḥ dīrghaprasadmani īśe vājasya gomataḥ
translated: He rules over speech, which goes far, over the treasure of strength, of cattle,

original: īśe hi pitvo 'viṣasya dāvane //
analyzed: īśe hi pitvaḥ viṣasya dāvane
translated: For you are the lords of the house to give the gift of food.

original: tat sūryaṃ rodasī ubhe doṣā vastor upa bruve /
analyzed: tat sūryam rodasī ubhe doṣā vastoḥ upa bruve
translated: I address that sun, both the heaven and earth, at dawn and dusk.

original: bhojeṣv asmāṃ abhy uc carā sadā //🔽ṛjram ukṣaṇyāyane rajataṃ harayāṇe /
analyzed: bhojeṣu asmām abhī ud cara sadā  ṛjram ukṣaṇyāyane rajatam harayāṇe
translated: Always rise up to us among the bountiful.🔽The red one for the ox-drawn chariot, the silver one for the horse-drawn chariot.

original: rathaṃ yuktam asanāma suṣāmaṇi //
analyzed: ratham yuktam asanāma suṣāmaṇi
translated: We have yoked the chariot, O good lord.

original: tā me aśvyānāṃ harīṇāṃ nitośanā /
analyzed: tā me aśvyānām harīṇām nitośanā
translated: Those two, the best of my horses, the tawny ones,

original: uto nu kṛtvyānāṃ nṛvāhasā //
analyzed: uta u nu kṛtvyānām nṛ vāhasā
translated: And also the two that carry men, the Krivi horses.

original: smadabhīśū kaśāvantā viprā naviṣṭhayā matī /
analyzed: smat abhīśū kaśāvantā viprāḥ naviṣṭhayā matī
translated: The two priests, with reins and whips, with the newest thought,

original: maho vājināv arvantā sacāsanam //
analyzed: mahaḥ vājinau arvantā sacā asanam
translated: The two great strong horses, the two swift horses, have come together.

original: yuvor u ṣū rathaṃ huve sadhastutyāya sūriṣu /
analyzed: yuvoḥ u su ratham huve sadhastutyāya sūriṣu
translated: I invoke your chariot, O Aśvins, to be praised together among the lords,

original: atūrtadakṣā vṛṣaṇā vṛṣaṇvasū //
analyzed: a tūrta dakṣā vṛṣaṇā vṛṣaṇvasū
translated: With unimpeded power, O mighty ones, rich in strength.

original: yuvaṃ varo suṣāmṇe mahe tane nāsatyā /🔽avobhir yātho vṛṣaṇā vṛṣaṇvasū //
analyzed: yuvam suṣāmṇe mahe tane nāsatyā  avobhiḥ yāthaḥ vṛṣaṇā vṛṣaṇvasū
translated: You two, O Nāsatyas, for the great task of the good one,🔽With your aids, O mighty ones, rich in strength, you two come.

original: tā vām adya havāmahe havyebhir vājinīvasū /
analyzed: tā vām adya havāmahe havyebhiḥ vājinīvasū
translated: We invoke you today with offerings, O you two rich in wealth,

original: pūrvīr iṣa iṣayantāv ati kṣapaḥ //
analyzed: pūrvīḥ iṣaḥ iṣayantau ati kṣapaḥ
translated: Desiring many provisions, passing over the nights.

original: ā vāṃ vāhiṣṭho aśvinā ratho yātu śruto narā /
analyzed: ā vām vāhiṣṭhaḥ aśvinā rathaḥ yātu śrutaḥ narā
translated: O Aśvins, may your best chariot come, renowned, O men,

original: upa stomān turasya darśathaḥ śriye //
analyzed: upa stomān turasya darśathaḥ śriye
translated: To the praises of the strong one, to be seen for glory.

original: juhurāṇā cid aśvinā manyethāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū /
analyzed: juhurāṇā cit aśvinā manyethām vṛṣaṇvasū
translated: Even though you are to be invoked, O Aśvins, I think of you, O you two rich in goods,

original: yuvaṃ hi rudrā parṣatho ati dviṣaḥ //🔽dasrā hi viśvam ānuṣaṅ makṣūbhiḥ paridīyathaḥ /🔽dhiyañjinvā madhuvarṇā śubhas patī //🔽upa no yātam aśvinā rāyā viśvapuṣā saha /
analyzed: yuvam hi rudrā parṣathaḥ ati dviṣaḥ  dasrā hi viśvam ānuṣak makṣūbhiḥ paridīyathaḥ  dhiyañjinvā madhu varṇā śubhaḥ patī  upa naḥ yātam aśvinā rāyā viśva puṣā saha
translated: For you, O Rudras, do carry us over the haters.🔽For you, O Wonder-Workers, with your rays go round all that is good.🔽Inspiring the hymn, O Lords of splendour, O you whose hue is honey.

original: maghavānā suvīrāv anapacyutā //🔽ā me asya pratīvyam indranāsatyā gatam /
analyzed: maghavānā su vīrau an apacyutā  ā me asya pratīvyam indra nāsatyāḥ gatam
translated: Come to us, O you rich in wealth, O you rich in all things, O you rich in heroes, O you who never fail.

original: devā devebhir adya sacanastamā //
analyzed: devā devebhiḥ adya sacanastamā
translated: Come to me, O you two who are to be praised, O Indra, O Nâsatyas, with the gods, O you who are most to be sought after by the gods.

original: vayaṃ hi vāṃ havāmaha ukṣaṇyanto vyaśvavat /
analyzed: vayam hi vām havāmahe ukṣaṇyantaḥ vyaśva vat
translated: For we call you, O you who are to be invoked, as one who has lost his horses, with our good thoughts.

original: sumatibhir upa viprāv ihā gatam //
analyzed: sumatibhiḥ upa viprau iha ā gatam
translated: Come hither, O you two sages, to us.

original: aśvinā sv ṛṣe stuhi kuvit te śravato havam /
analyzed: aśvinā su ṛṣe stuhi kuvid te śravataḥ havam
translated: O you two Aṣvins, praise the good sage; will he not hear your call?

original: nedīyasaḥ kūḷayātaḥ paṇīṃr uta //🔽vaiyaśvasya śrutaṃ naroto me asya vedathaḥ /🔽sajoṣasā varuṇo mitro aryamā //🔽yuvādattasya dhiṣṇyā yuvānītasya sūribhiḥ /🔽aharahar vṛṣaṇa mahyaṃ śikṣatam //🔽yo vāṃ yajñebhir āvṛto 'dhivastrā vadhūr iva /🔽saparyantā śubhe cakrāte aśvinā //
analyzed: nedīyasaḥ kūḷayātaḥ paṇīṃr uta  vaiyaśvasya śrutam narā uta u me asya vedathaḥ  sajoṣasā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā  yuvādattasya dhiṣṇyā yuvānītasya sūribhiḥ  ahar ahar mahyam śikṣatam  yaḥ vām yajñebhiḥ āvṛtaḥ dhivastrā vadhūḥ iva  saparyantā śubhe cakrāte aśvinā
translated: From the nearest place, from the farthest, from the middle.

original: yo vām uruvyacastamaṃ ciketati nṛpāyyam /
analyzed: yaḥ vām uru vyacastamam ciketati nṛ pāyyam
translated: O you two who are to be invoked, O you two who are to be praised, O you two who are to be sought after by the people, O you two who are to be praised by the people, O you two who are to be sought after by the people, O you two who are to be praised by the people, O you two who are to be sought after by the people, O you two who are to be praised by the people, O you two who are to be sought after by the people, O you two who are to be praised by the people, O you two who are to be sought after by the people, O you two who are to be praised by the people, O you two who are to be sought after by the people, O you two who are to be praised by the people, O you two who are to be sought after by the people, O you two who are to be praised by the people, O you two who are to be sought after by the people, O you two who are to be praised by the people, O you two who are to be sought after by the people, O you two who are to be praised by the people, O you two who are to be sought after by the people, O you two who are to be praised by the people, O you two who are to be sought after by the people, O you two who are to be praised by the people, O you two who are to be sought after by the people, O you two who are to be praised by the

original: vartir aśvinā pari yātam asmayū //🔽asmabhyaṃ su vṛṣaṇvasū yātaṃ vartir nṛpāyyam /🔽viṣudruheva yajñam ūhathur girā //
analyzed: vartiḥ aśvinā pari yātam asmayū  asmabhyam su vṛṣaṇvasū yātam vartiḥ nṛ pāyyam  viṣu druhā iva yajñam ūhathuḥ girā
translated: O Asvins, come to us for our help.🔽Come to us, O you rich in good things, for our help, for the lordship of men.🔽You have brought the sacrifice to ripeness with your voice, as one who ploughs a field.

original: vāhiṣṭho vāṃ havānāṃ stomo dūto huvan narā /
analyzed: vāhiṣṭhaḥ vām havānām stomaḥ dūtaḥ huvat narā
translated: Best bearer of our invocations, the hymn, O heroes, is sent forth as a messenger

original: yuvābhyām bhūtv aśvinā //
analyzed: yuvābhyām bhūtu aśvinā
translated: To you, O Asvins.

original: yad ado divo arṇava iṣo vā madatho gṛhe /
analyzed: yat adaḥ divaḥ arṇave iṣaḥ vā madathaḥ gṛhe
translated: If now, O ye of heaven, in the ocean of food, or in your own house, ye rejoice,

original: śrutam in me amartyā //🔽uta syā śvetayāvarī vāhiṣṭhā vāṃ nadīnām /
analyzed: śrutam id me amartyā  uta syā śveta yāvarī vāhiṣṭhā vām nadīnām
translated: Do ye, O immortal ones, hear my call.🔽And may the most rapid of your rivers, with white waves,

original: sindhur hiraṇyavartaniḥ //
analyzed: sindhuḥ hiraṇya vartaniḥ
translated: The river with golden windings, bring you hither.

original: smad etayā sukīrtyāśvinā śvetayā dhiyā /🔽vahethe śubhrayāvānā //
analyzed: smat etayā su kīrtyā aśvinā śvetayā dhiyā  vahethe śubhra yāvānā
translated: With this our well-praised fame, O Asvins, with this white thought🔽Do ye, O ye of fair seed, bring (us) hither.

original: yukṣvā hi tvaṃ rathāsahā yuvasva poṣyā vaso /
analyzed: yukṣvā hi tvam rathāsahā yuvasva poṣyā vaso
translated: For thou art to be yoked, O thou who art strong in chariots, to be gratified, O good one.

original: ān no vāyo madhu pibāsmākaṃ savanā gahi //
analyzed: āt naḥ vāyo madhu piba asmākam savanā gahi
translated: Drink the sweet drink, O Vayu, come to our libations.

original: tava vāyav ṛtaspate tvaṣṭur jāmātar adbhuta /
analyzed: tava vāyo ṛtaspate tvaṣṭuḥ jāmātar adbhuta
translated: O Vayu, O lord of truth, son-in-law of Tvashtar, wondrous one,

original: avāṃsy ā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: avāṃsi ā vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose thee as the lowest (god).

original: tvaṣṭur jāmātaraṃ vayam īśānaṃ rāya īmahe /
analyzed: tvaṣṭuḥ jāmātaram vayam īśānam rāyaḥ īmahe
translated: We implore the son-in-law of Tvashtar, the lord of wealth,

original: sutāvanto vāyuṃ dyumnā janāsaḥ //
analyzed: sutāvantaḥ vāyum dyumnā janāsaḥ
translated: The people with pressed (Soma), with bright glory, Vayu.

original: vāyo yāhi śivā divo vahasvā su svaśvyam /
analyzed: vāyo yāhi śiva ā divaḥ vahasva su su aśvyam
translated: O Vayu, come with auspicious (favours) from heaven; bring us good fortune in horses.

original: vahasva mahaḥ pṛthupakṣasā rathe //
analyzed: vahasva mahaḥ pṛthu pakṣasā rathe
translated: Bring on the chariot the great (treasure), O thou of wide wings.

original: tvāṃ hi supsarastamaṃ nṛṣadaneṣu hūmahe /
analyzed: tvām hi su psarastamam nṛṣadaneṣu hūmahe
translated: For we invoke you, O most beautiful one, in the assemblies of men,

original: grāvāṇaṃ nāśvapṛṣṭham maṃhanā //
analyzed: grāvāṇam na aśva pṛṣṭham maṃhanā
translated: Like a stone on a horse's back, with abundance.

original: sa tvaṃ no deva manasā vāyo mandāno agriyaḥ /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ deva manasā vāyo mandānaḥ agriyaḥ
translated: You, O god Vayu, being delighted in your mind, as the foremost,

original: kṛdhi vājāṃ apo dhiyaḥ //
analyzed: kṛdhi vājān apaḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: Make our thoughts and prayers fruitful, O you who give strength.

original: agnir ukthe purohito grāvāṇo barhir adhvare /
analyzed: agniḥ ukthe purohitaḥ grāvāṇaḥ barhiḥ adhvare
translated: Agni is the priest in the praise, the stones in the altar in the sacrifice,

original: ṛcā yāmi maruto brahmaṇas patiṃ devāṃ avo vareṇyam //
analyzed: ṛcā yāmi marutaḥ brahmaṇaḥ patim devān avaḥ vareṇyam
translated: With the Rg verse I go to the Maruts, to the lord of prayer, to the gods, to the most excellent boon.

original: ā paśuṃ gāsi pṛthivīṃ vanaspatīn uṣāsā naktam oṣadhīḥ /
analyzed: ā paśum gāsi pṛthivīm vanaspatīn uṣāsā naktam oṣadhīḥ
translated: I invoke the earth, the cattle, the trees, the dawn, the night, the plants,

original: viśve ca no vasavo viśvavedaso dhīnām bhūta prāvitāraḥ //
analyzed: viśve ca naḥ vasavaḥ viśva vedasaḥ dhīnām bhūta prāvitāraḥ
translated: And may all the Vasus, who know all, be the promoters of our thoughts.

original: pra sū na etv adhvaro 'gnā deveṣu pūrvyaḥ /
analyzed: pra su naḥ etu adhvaraḥ gnāḥ deveṣu pūrvyaḥ
translated: May the sacrifice come to us today, O Agni, the ancient one among the gods,

original: ādityeṣu pra varuṇe dhṛtavrate marutsu viśvabhānuṣu //
analyzed: ādityeṣu pra varuṇe dhṛta vrate marutsu viśva bhānuṣu
translated: To the Adityas, to Varuna who holds the vow, to the Maruts who shine everywhere.

original: viśve hi ṣmā manave viśvavedaso bhuvan vṛdhe riśādasaḥ /
analyzed: viśve hi sma manave viśva vedasaḥ bhuvan vṛdhe riśādasaḥ
translated: For all of them are for Manu, the all-knowing ones, for prosperity, the destroyers of enemies.

original: ariṣṭebhiḥ pāyubhir viśvavedaso yantā no 'vṛkaṃ chardiḥ //
analyzed: ariṣṭebhiḥ pāyubhiḥ viśva vedasaḥ yanta naḥ vṛkam chardiḥ
translated: With your unfailing protections, O all-knowing ones, protect us from the weapon.

original: ā no adya samanaso gantā viśve sajoṣasaḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ adya samanasaḥ ganta viśve sajoṣasaḥ
translated: All of you, with the same mind, come to us today, all of you with the same intention,

original: ṛcā girā maruto devy adite sadane pastye mahi //
analyzed: ṛcā girā marutaḥ devi adite sadane pastye mahi
translated: With the Rg verse, O Maruts, with the divine song, O Aditi, in the house, in the abode, in the great one.

original: abhi priyā maruto yā vo aśvyā havyā mitra prayāthana /
analyzed: abhi priyā marutaḥ yā vaḥ aśvyā havyā mitra prayāthana
translated: The dear Maruts, to whom you offer your best horses, O Mitra, come!

original: ā barhir indro varuṇas turā nara ādityāsaḥ sadantu naḥ //
analyzed: ā barhiḥ indraḥ varuṇaḥ turāḥ naraḥ ādityāsaḥ sadantu naḥ
translated: Let Indra, Varuṇa, the strong men, the Ādityas sit on our sacred grass.

original: vayaṃ vo vṛktabarhiṣo hitaprayasa ānuṣak /🔽sutasomāso varuṇa havāmahe manuṣvad iddhāgnayaḥ //
analyzed: vayam vaḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ hita prayasaḥ ānuṣak  suta somāsaḥ varuṇa havāmahe manuṣvat iddha agnayaḥ
translated: We, with trimmed grass, with prepared food, in due order,🔽with Soma pressed, O Varuṇa, we invoke you, with fires kindled like Manu.

original: ā pra yāta maruto viṣṇo aśvinā pūṣan mākīnayā dhiyā /
analyzed: ā pra yāta marutaḥ viṣṇo aśvinā pūṣan mākīnayā dhiyā
translated: Come, O Maruts, O Viṣṇu, O Aśvins, O Pūṣan, with your most kind thought.

original: indra ā yātu prathamaḥ saniṣyubhir vṛṣā yo vṛtrahā gṛṇe //
analyzed: indraḥ ā yātu prathamaḥ saniṣyubhiḥ vṛṣā yaḥ vṛtra hā gṛṇe
translated: Let Indra come first with the victorious, the bull who is praised as the slayer of Vrtra.

original: vi no devāso adruho 'cchidraṃ śarma yacchata /
analyzed: vi naḥ devāsaḥ adruhaḥ chidram śarma yacchata
translated: O gods, grant us shelter that is free from guile and without gaps,

original: na yad dūrād vasavo nū cid antito varūtham ādadharṣati //
analyzed: na yat dūrāt vasavaḥ nu cit antitas varūtham ādadharṣati
translated: so that from far away or even near, O Vasus, no one may overpower our protection.

original: asti hi vaḥ sajātyaṃ riśādaso devāso asty āpyam /
analyzed: asti hi vaḥ sajātyam riśādasaḥ devāsaḥ asti āpyam
translated: For you have a common origin, O R̥ishi-slayers, O gods, and you have a share.

original: pra ṇaḥ pūrvasmai suvitāya vocata makṣū sumnāya navyase //
analyzed: pra naḥ pūrvasmai suvitāya vocata makṣū sumnāya navyase
translated: Speak to us for that earliest prosperity, so that soon (we may have) new bliss.

original: idā hi va upastutim idā vāmasya bhaktaye /
analyzed: idā hi vaḥ upastutim idā vāmasya bhaktaye
translated: For now is your praise, now is (the time) for the gift of wealth.

original: upa vo viśvavedaso namasyur āṃ asṛkṣy anyām iva //
analyzed: upa vaḥ viśva vedasaḥ namasyuḥ ām asṛkṣi anyām iva
translated: To you, O all-knowing ones, I have come with homage, as if to another.

original: ud u ṣya vaḥ savitā supraṇītayo 'sthād ūrdhvo vareṇyaḥ /
analyzed: ud u sya vaḥ savitā su praṇītayaḥ sthāt ūrdhvaḥ vareṇyaḥ
translated: Now indeed has Savitar risen for you, well-guided, lofty, to be chosen.

original: ni dvipādaś catuṣpādo arthino 'viśran patayiṣṇavaḥ //
analyzed: ni dvipādaḥ catuṣpādaḥ arthinaḥ viśran patayiṣṇavaḥ
translated: The two-footed and the four-footed, the suppliants, the restless ones, have entered.

original: devaṃdevaṃ vo 'vase devaṃdevam abhiṣṭaye /
analyzed: devaṃdevam vaḥ vase devaṃdevam abhiṣṭaye
translated: To each God for your help, to each God for protection,

original: devaṃdevaṃ huvema vājasātaye gṛṇanto devyā dhiyā //
analyzed: devam devam huvema vājasātaye gṛṇantaḥ devyā dhiyā
translated: to each God let us call, singing with divine thought, for the winning of strength.

original: devāso hi ṣmā manave samanyavo viśve sākaṃ sarātayaḥ /
analyzed: devāsaḥ hi sma manave samanyavaḥ viśve sākam sa rātayaḥ
translated: For the Gods are indeed of one mind with Manu, all the All-Gods are our allies.

original: te no adya te aparaṃ tuce tu no bhavantu varivovidaḥ //
analyzed: te naḥ adya te aparam tuce tu naḥ bhavantu varivaḥ vidaḥ
translated: May they be gracious to us today and hereafter. May they be our benefactors, finding room for us.

original: pra vaḥ śaṃsāmy adruhaḥ saṃstha upastutīnām /
analyzed: pra vaḥ śaṃsāmi adruhaḥ saṃsthe upastutīnām
translated: I proclaim to you, O ye guileless ones, the assembly of your praises.

original: na taṃ dhūrtir varuṇa mitra martyaṃ yo vo dhāmabhyo 'vidhat //
analyzed: na tam dhūrtiḥ varuṇa mitra martyam yaḥ vaḥ dhāmabhyaḥ vidhat
translated: That mortal, O Varuna and Mitra, whom ye have not deprived of your abodes,

original: pra sa kṣayaṃ tirate vi mahīr iṣo yo vo varāya dāśati /
analyzed: pra sa kṣayam tirate vi mahīḥ iṣaḥ yaḥ vaḥ varāya dāśati
translated: he passes over the place of destruction, and the great gifts of food which ye give to him who serves you.

original: pra prajābhir jāyate dharmaṇas pary ariṣṭaḥ sarva edhate //
analyzed: pra prajābhiḥ jāyate dharmaṇaḥ pari ariṣṭaḥ sarvaḥ edhate
translated: He is born again and again through offspring, and by the law he prospers without fail.

original: ṛte sa vindate yudhaḥ sugebhir yāty adhvanaḥ /
analyzed: ṛte sa vindate yudhaḥ sugebhiḥ yāti adhvanaḥ
translated: By the easy paths he goes to the battles which he wins by your favour.

original: aryamā mitro varuṇaḥ sarātayo yaṃ trāyante sajoṣasaḥ //
analyzed: aryamā mitraḥ varuṇaḥ sa rātayaḥ yam trāyante sajoṣasaḥ
translated: Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna, the allies, who protect him in unison.

original: ajre cid asmai kṛṇuthā nyañcanaṃ durge cid ā susaraṇam /
analyzed: ajre cit asmai kṛṇutha nyañcanam durge cit ā su saraṇam
translated: Even on the steep path make ye an easy descent for him, and on the difficult path an easy passage.

original: eṣā cid asmād aśaniḥ paro nu sāsredhantī vi naśyatu //
analyzed: eṣā cit asmāt aśaniḥ paras nu sā a sredhantī vi naśyatu
translated: Even from him may this thunderbolt pass away, burning with fire, and perish.

original: yad adya sūrya udyati priyakṣatrā ṛtaṃ dadha /
analyzed: yat adya sūrye udyati priya kṣatrāḥ ṛtam
translated: What today, O Sun, at rising, O Rulers of the dear people, ye establish as truth,

original: yan nimruci prabudhi viśvavedaso yad vā madhyandine divaḥ //
analyzed: yat nimruci prabudhi viśva vedasaḥ yat vā madhyandine divaḥ
translated: What at setting, O ye all-knowing ones, or at midday of the day,

original: yad vābhipitve asurā ṛtaṃ yate chardir yema vi dāśuṣe /
analyzed: yat vā abhipitve asurāḥ ṛtam yate chardiḥ yema vi dāśuṣe
translated: Or what, O Asuras, ye grant in the evening to the one who offers, to the one who spreads the oblation,

original: vayaṃ tad vo vasavo viśvavedasa upa stheyāma madhya ā //
analyzed: vayam tat vaḥ vasavaḥ viśva vedasaḥ upa stheyāma madhye ā
translated: May we, O Vasus, all-knowing ones, come to that of yours in the middle.

original: yad adya sūra udite yan madhyandina ātuci /
analyzed: yat adya sūre udite yat madhyandine ātuci
translated: What today at sunrise, what at midday, O ye all-knowing ones,

original: vāmaṃ dhattha manave viśvavedaso juhvānāya pracetase //
analyzed: vāmam dhattha manave viśva vedasaḥ juhvānāya pracetase
translated: Ye grant as good to Manu, to the offering priest, to the wise one.

original: vayaṃ tad vaḥ samrāja ā vṛṇīmahe putro na bahupāyyam /
analyzed: vayam tat vaḥ samrājaḥ ā vṛṇīmahe putraḥ na bahu pāyyam
translated: We choose that from you, O Emperors, as a son chooses his father's wealth.

original: aśyāma tad ādityā juhvato havir yena vasyo 'naśāmahai //
analyzed: aśyāma tat ādityāḥ juhvataḥ haviḥ yena vasyaḥ naśāmahai
translated: May we, O Ādityas, enjoy the oblation of the offering priest, by which we may attain well-being.

original: ye triṃśati trayas paro devāso barhir āsadan /
analyzed: ye triṃśati trayaḥ paras devāsaḥ barhiḥ āsadan
translated: Those thirty-three gods who have sat down on the sacred grass,

original: vidann aha dvitāsanan //
analyzed: vidan aha dvitā asanan
translated: May they know the two-fold day.

original: varuṇo mitro aryamā smadrātiṣāco agnayaḥ /
analyzed: varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā smat rātiṣācaḥ agnayaḥ
translated: Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, the bountiful Agnis,

original: patnīvanto vaṣaṭkṛtāḥ //
analyzed: patnīvantaḥ vaṣaṭkṛtāḥ
translated: With their wives, consecrated with the Vasat cry.

original: te no gopā apācyās ta udak ta itthā nyak /
analyzed: te naḥ gopāḥ apācyāḥ te udak te itthā nyak
translated: They are our protectors in the west, in the north, and here below,

original: purastāt sarvayā viśā //
analyzed: purastāt sarvayā viśā
translated: In the east, with the whole people.

original: yathā vaśanti devās tathed asat tad eṣāṃ nakir ā minat /
analyzed: yathā vaśanti devāḥ tathā id asat tat eṣām nakir ā minat
translated: As the gods wish, so let it be. No one shall obstruct that of theirs.

original: arāvā cana martyaḥ //🔽saptānāṃ sapta ṛṣṭayaḥ sapta dyumnāny eṣām /
analyzed: arāvā cana martyaḥ  saptānām sapta ṛṣṭayaḥ sapta dyumnāni eṣām
translated: No mortal man is equal to you.🔽Seven are the Ṛṣṭis of the seven, seven their splendours,

original: sapto adhi śriyo dhire //
analyzed: sapta u adhi śriyaḥ dhire
translated: Seven upon their glories are established.

original: babhrur eko viṣuṇaḥ sūnaro yuvāñjy aṅkte hiraṇyayam //
analyzed: babhruḥ ekaḥ viṣuṇaḥ sūnaraḥ yuvāñji aṅkte hiraṇyayam
translated: One is the tawny, piercing, youthful, well-formed one, who anoints the golden one.

original: yonim eka ā sasāda dyotano 'ntar deveṣu medhiraḥ //🔽vāśīm eko bibharti hasta āyasīm antar deveṣu nidhruviḥ //
analyzed: yonim ekaḥ ā sasāda dyotanaḥ ntar deveṣu medhiraḥ  vāśīm ekaḥ bibharti haste āyasīm antar deveṣu nidhruviḥ
translated: One has sat down in the womb, the illuminating one, the wise one among the gods.🔽One bears in his hand the iron axe, the firm one among the gods.

original: vajram eko bibharti hasta āhitaṃ tena vṛtrāṇi jighnate //
analyzed: vajram ekaḥ bibharti haste āhitam tena vṛtrāṇi jighnate
translated: One bears in his hand the thunderbolt, with which he slays the Vr̥itras.

original: tigmam eko bibharti hasta āyudhaṃ śucir ugro jalāṣabheṣajaḥ //
analyzed: tigmam ekaḥ bibharti haste āyudham śuciḥ ugraḥ jalāṣa bheṣajaḥ
translated: One bears in his hand the sharp weapon, pure, strong, the medicine for wounds.

original: patha ekaḥ pīpāya taskaro yathāṃ eṣa veda nidhīnām //
analyzed: pathaḥ ekaḥ pīpāya taskaraḥ yathā eṣa veda nidhīnām
translated: One has gone on his way like a thief, he knows the treasures.

original: trīṇy eka urugāyo vi cakrame yatra devāso madanti //
analyzed: trīṇi ekaḥ urugāyaḥ vi cakrame yatra devāsaḥ madanti
translated: The far-reaching one has gone over the three, where the gods rejoice.

original: vibhir dvā carata ekayā saha pra pravāseva vasataḥ //
analyzed: vibhiḥ dvā carataḥ ekayā saha pra pravāsā iva vasataḥ
translated: Two go together on one path, as if dwelling on a long journey.

original: sado dvā cakrāte upamā divi samrājā sarpirāsutī //
analyzed: sadaḥ dvā cakrāte upamā divi samrājā sarpiḥ āsutī
translated: Two have made their seat, the two compared in heaven, the two kings, served with ghee.

original: arcanta eke mahi sāma manvata tena sūryam arocayan //
analyzed: arcantaḥ eke mahi sāma manvata tena sūryam arocayan
translated: Some have sung the great Sāman, with that they have made the sun shine.

original: nahi vo asty arbhako devāso na kumārakaḥ /
analyzed: nahi vaḥ asti arbhakaḥ devāsaḥ na kumārakaḥ
translated: For you, O gods, there is no child, no youth,

original: viśve satomahānta it //
analyzed: viśve satomahāntaḥ id
translated: All of you are great, indeed.

original: iti stutāso asathā riśādaso ye stha trayaś ca triṃśac ca /
analyzed: iti stutāsaḥ asatha riśādasaḥ ye stha trayaḥ ca triṃśat ca
translated: Thus praised, O ye three and thirty, ye who are seated, ye destroyers of enemies,

original: manor devā yajñiyāsaḥ //
analyzed: manoḥ devāḥ yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: Ye gods who are worthy of sacrifice, of Manu.

original: te nas trādhvaṃ te 'vata ta u no adhi vocata /
analyzed: te naḥ trādhvam te vata te u naḥ adhi vocata
translated: Do ye protect us, do ye deliver us, do ye speak to us.

original: mā naḥ pathaḥ pitryān mānavād adhi dūraṃ naiṣṭa parāvataḥ //
analyzed: mā naḥ pathaḥ pitryāt mānavāt adhi dūram naiṣṭa parāvataḥ
translated: Do not lead us far away from the path of our fathers, from the path of men, to a distant place.

original: ye devāsa iha sthana viśve vaiśvānarā uta /
analyzed: ye devāsaḥ iha sthana viśve vaiśvānarāḥ uta
translated: Ye gods who are here, all ye who are Vaisvānara,

original: asmabhyaṃ śarma sapratho gave 'śvāya yacchata //
analyzed: asmabhyam śarma saprathaḥ gave śvāya yacchata
translated: Grant us wide protection for the sake of the cow and the horse.

original: yo yajāti yajāta it sunavac ca pacāti ca /
analyzed: yaḥ yajāti yajāte id sunavat ca pacāti ca
translated: He who sacrifices, who has sacrificed, who presses and cooks,

original: brahmed indrasya cākanat //
analyzed: brahmā id indrasya cākanat
translated: Has desired the Brahman of Indra.

original: puroḷāśaṃ yo asmai somaṃ rarata āśiram /
analyzed: puroḷāśam yaḥ asmai somam rarate āśiram
translated: He who has offered to him the cake, the Soma, the libation,

original: pād it taṃ śakro aṃhasaḥ //
analyzed: pāt id tam śakraḥ aṃhasaḥ
translated: Indra has delivered him from misfortune.

original: tasya dyumāṃ asad ratho devajūtaḥ sa śūśuvat /
analyzed: tasya dyumān asat rathaḥ deva jūtaḥ sa śūśuvat
translated: His chariot shall be resplendent, urged by the gods, it shall be swift,

original: viśvā vanvann amitriyā //
analyzed: viśvā vanvan amitriyā
translated: Conquering all hostilities.

original: asya prajāvatī gṛhe 'saścantī divedive /
analyzed: asya prajāvatī gṛhe saścantī dive dive
translated: In his house, which is full of offspring, the unfailing

original: iḷā dhenumatī duhe //
analyzed: iḍā dhenumatī duhe
translated: Ilā milks the cow that gives all desired things.

original: yā dampatī samanasā sunuta ā ca dhāvataḥ /
analyzed: yā dampatī samanasā sunutaḥ ā ca dhāvataḥ
translated: The two who are husband and wife, who pour libations with a united mind, and who run to (the sacrifice),

original: devāso nityayāśirā //
analyzed: devāsaḥ nityayā āśirā
translated: The gods who are always to be invoked.

original: prati prāśavyāṃ itaḥ samyañcā barhir āśāte /
analyzed: prati prāśavyān itaḥ samyañcā barhiḥ āśāte
translated: They have come to the sprinkling, they have sat down facing each other on the sacrificial grass,

original: na tā vājeṣu vāyataḥ //
analyzed: na tā vājeṣu vāyataḥ
translated: They are not to be deceived in (granting) strength.

original: na devānām api hnutaḥ sumatiṃ na jugukṣataḥ /
analyzed: na devānām api hnutaḥ sumatim na jugukṣataḥ
translated: You do not neglect the good will of the gods, nor do you seek to deceive them,

original: śravo bṛhad vivāsataḥ //
analyzed: śravaḥ bṛhat vivāsataḥ
translated: When you dwell in great glory.

original: putriṇā tā kumāriṇā viśvam āyur vy aśnutaḥ /
analyzed: putriṇā tā kumāriṇā viśvam āyuḥ vi aśnutaḥ
translated: You, who have sons, you, who have young sons, have fully attained all life.

original: ubhā hiraṇyapeśasā //🔽vītihotrā kṛtadvasū daśasyantāmṛtāya kam /
analyzed: ubhā hiraṇya peśasā  vītihotrā kṛtadvasū daśasyantā amṛtāya kam
translated: Both of you are adorned with gold.🔽Having offered the oblation, having accomplished wealth, may they be gracious to the immortal one.

original: sam ūdho romaśaṃ hato deveṣu kṛṇuto duvaḥ //
analyzed: sam ūdhaḥ romaśam hataḥ deveṣu kṛṇutaḥ duvaḥ
translated: You have made the hairy udder subservient to the gods.

original: ā śarma parvatānāṃ vṛṇīmahe nadīnām /
analyzed: ā śarma parvatānām vṛṇīmahe nadīnām
translated: We choose the protection of the mountains and the rivers,

original: ā viṣṇoḥ sacābhuvaḥ //
analyzed: ā viṣṇoḥ sacābhuvaḥ
translated: And of Vishnu, who shares the same abode.

original: aitu pūṣā rayir bhagaḥ svasti sarvadhātamaḥ /
analyzed: aitu pūṣā rayiḥ bhagaḥ svasti sarva dhātamaḥ
translated: May Pusan, wealth, and Bhaga come, most auspicious of all givers,

original: urur adhvā svastaye //
analyzed: uruḥ adhvā svastaye
translated: For wide is the path to well-being.

original: aramatir anarvaṇo viśvo devasya manasā /
analyzed: aramatiḥ anarvaṇaḥ viśvaḥ devasya manasā
translated: The hymn, free from contention, is all in the mind of the god,

original: ādityānām aneha it //
analyzed: ādityānām anehaḥ id
translated: The hymn of the Adityas, which is faultless.

original: yathā no mitro aryamā varuṇaḥ santi gopāḥ /
analyzed: yathā naḥ mitraḥ aryamā varuṇaḥ santi gopāḥ
translated: As Mitra, Aryaman, and Varuna are our guardians,

original: sugā ṛtasya panthāḥ //
analyzed: su gāḥ ṛtasya panthāḥ
translated: The path of truth is easy to travel.

original: agniṃ vaḥ pūrvyaṃ girā devam īḷe vasūnām /
analyzed: agnim vaḥ pūrvyam girā devam īḍe vasūnām
translated: I praise Agni, the ancient one, with a hymn, the god of wealth,

original: saparyantaḥ purupriyam mitraṃ na kṣetrasādhasam //
analyzed: saparyantaḥ puru priyam mitram na kṣetrasādhasam
translated: Honoring the one who is loved by many, like a friend who accomplishes the task in the field.

original: makṣū devavato rathaḥ śūro vā pṛtsu kāsu cit /
analyzed: makṣū devavataḥ rathaḥ śūraḥ vā pṛtsu kāsu cit
translated: The chariot of the one who has the gods, or the hero in any battles,

original: devānāṃ ya in mano yajamāna iyakṣaty abhīd ayajvano bhuvat //
analyzed: devānām yaḥ id manaḥ yajamānaḥ iyakṣati abhi id ayajvanaḥ bhuvat
translated: Whoever worships with the mind of the gods, will surpass the one who does not sacrifice.

original: na yajamāna riṣyasi na sunvāna na devayo /
analyzed: na yajamāna riṣyasi na sunvāna na devayo
translated: O sacrificer, you are not harmed, nor he who presses the Soma, nor he who worships the gods.

original: devānāṃ ya in mano yajamāna iyakṣaty abhīd ayajvano bhuvat //
analyzed: devānām yaḥ id manaḥ yajamānaḥ iyakṣati abhi id ayajvanaḥ bhuvat
translated: He who worships the gods' mind, the sacrificer who strives, may he be safe from the one who has not sacrificed.

original: nakiṣ ṭaṃ karmaṇā naśan na pra yoṣan na yoṣati /
analyzed: nakir tam karmaṇā naśat na pra yoṣat na yoṣati
translated: No one can reach him with work, nor can he be deceived, nor can he be deceived.

original: devānāṃ ya in mano yajamāna iyakṣaty abhīd ayajvano bhuvat //
analyzed: devānām yaḥ id manaḥ yajamānaḥ iyakṣati abhi id ayajvanaḥ bhuvat
translated: He who worships the gods' mind, the sacrificer who strives, may he be safe from the one who has not sacrificed.

original: asad atra suvīryam uta tyad āśvaśvyam /
analyzed: asat atra su vīryam uta tyad āśu aśvyam
translated: Here is the good heroism, and also that which is most excellent for horses.

original: devānāṃ ya in mano yajamāna iyakṣaty abhīd ayajvano bhuvat //
analyzed: devānām yaḥ id manaḥ yajamānaḥ iyakṣati abhi id ayajvanaḥ bhuvat
translated: He who worships the gods' mind, the sacrificer who strives, may he be safe from the one who has not sacrificed.

original: pra kṛtāny ṛjīṣiṇaḥ kaṇvā indrasya gāthayā /
analyzed: pra kṛtāni ṛjīṣiṇaḥ kaṇvāḥ indrasya gāthayā
translated: The Kanvas, O you who shake off the chaff, with Indra's song,

original: made somasya vocata //
analyzed: made somasya vocata
translated: have sung forth their deeds in the rapture of Soma.

original: yaḥ sṛbindam anarśanim pipruṃ dāsam ahīśuvam /
analyzed: yaḥ sṛbindam anarśanim piprum dāsam ahīśuvam
translated: He who slew Sṛbiṇda, the irresistible, Piprū, the Dāsa, and Ahīśuva,

original: vadhīd ugro riṇann apaḥ //
analyzed: vadhīt ugraḥ riṇan apaḥ
translated: the mighty one, while destroying the waters.

original: ny arbudasya viṣṭapaṃ varṣmāṇam bṛhatas tira /
analyzed: ni arbudasya viṣṭapam varṣmāṇam bṛhataḥ tira
translated: You have crossed over the wide expanse of the Arbuda, the lofty one,

original: kṛṣe tad indra pauṃsyam //
analyzed: kṛṣe tat indra pauṃsyam
translated: that manly deed of yours, O Indra, you have done.

original: prati śrutāya vo dhṛṣat tūrṇāśaṃ na girer adhi /
analyzed: prati śrutāya vaḥ dhṛṣat tūrṇāśam na gireḥ adhi
translated: To the one who listens, to you who are bold, to the swift one, I call, as if from the top of a mountain,

original: huve suśipram ūtaye //🔽sa gor aśvasya vi vrajam mandānaḥ somyebhyaḥ /
analyzed: huve su śipram ūtaye  sa goḥ aśvasya vi vrajam mandānaḥ somyebhyaḥ
translated: to the well-formed one for help.🔽You, while rejoicing, O hero, break open the stall of the cow and the horse,

original: puraṃ na śūra darṣasi //
analyzed: puram na śūra darṣasi
translated: as if it were a fortress, for the Soma-drinkers.

original: yadi me rāraṇaḥ suta ukthe vā dadhase canaḥ /
analyzed: yadi me rāraṇaḥ sute ukthe vā dadhase canaḥ
translated: If thou art pleased with the pressed (juice), or if thou grantest favour to the hymn,

original: ārād upa svadhā gahi //🔽vayaṃ ghā te api ṣmasi stotāra indra girvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: ārāt upa svadhā gahi  vayam gha te api smasi stotāraḥ indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: Come quickly from of old to our oblation.🔽We also are thine, O Indra, O lover of song, to praise thee.

original: tvaṃ no jinva somapāḥ //
analyzed: tvam naḥ jinva soma pāḥ
translated: Do thou, O Soma-drinker, stimulate us.

original: uta naḥ pitum ā bhara saṃrarāṇo avikṣitam /
analyzed: uta naḥ pitum ā bhara saṃrarāṇaḥ a vikṣitam
translated: And bring us also, O thou who rejoicest, what is not to be surpassed,

original: maghavan bhūri te vasu //
analyzed: maghavan bhūri te vasu
translated: O bountiful one, thou hast much wealth.

original: uta no gomatas kṛdhi hiraṇyavato aśvinaḥ /
analyzed: uta naḥ gomataḥ kṛdhi hiraṇyavataḥ aśvinaḥ
translated: And make us rich in cattle, in gold, in horses,

original: iḷābhiḥ saṃ rabhemahi //
analyzed: iḷābhiḥ sam rabhemahi
translated: That we may rejoice in food.

original: bṛbadukthaṃ havāmahe sṛprakarasnam ūtaye /
analyzed: bṛbaduktham havāmahe sṛpra karasnam ūtaye
translated: We call on him of the great hymn, whose arms are strong, to help us,

original: sādhu kṛṇvantam avase //
analyzed: sādhu kṛṇvantam avase
translated: Who acts well for help.🔽He who in the assembly, O thou of a hundred powers, even now,

original: yaḥ saṃsthe cic chatakratur ād īṃ kṛṇoti vṛtrahā /
analyzed: yaḥ saṃsthe cit śatakratuḥ āt īm kṛṇoti vṛtrahā
translated: The Vr̥itra-slayer, makes him rich,

original: jaritṛbhyaḥ purūvasuḥ //
analyzed: jaritṛbhyaḥ purūvasuḥ
translated: The bountiful one, for the singers.

original: sa naḥ śakraś cid ā śakad dānavāṃ antarābharaḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ śakraḥ cit ā śakat dānavān antarābharaḥ
translated: May he, Indra, even he, be able to help us, between the Dânava and us,

original: indro viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Indra with all his aids.

original: yo rāyo 'vanir mahān supāraḥ sunvataḥ sakhā /
analyzed: yaḥ rāyaḥ vaniḥ mahān su pāraḥ sunvataḥ sakhā
translated: Him who is the great bestower of wealth, the good friend of him who presses (the Soma),

original: tam indram abhi gāyata //🔽āyantāram mahi sthiram pṛtanāsu śravojitam /
analyzed: tam indram abhi gāyata  āyantāram mahi sthiram pṛtanāsu śravaḥ jitam
translated: Sing ye forth to that Indra.🔽Him who cometh, the great supporter, victorious in battles,

original: bhūrer īśānam ojasā //
analyzed: bhūreḥ īśānam ojasā
translated: The lord of ample wealth, by his might.

original: nakir asya śacīnāṃ niyantā sūnṛtānām /
analyzed: nakir asya śacīnām niyantā sūnṛtānām
translated: None restraineth the might of him, the truth of him,

original: nakir vaktā na dād iti //
analyzed: nakir vaktā na dāt iti
translated: None saith, 'Give,' none, 'Do not give.'

original: na nūnam brahmaṇām ṛṇam prāśūnām asti sunvatām /
analyzed: na nūnam brahmaṇām ṛṇam prāśūnām asti sunvatām
translated: The Brahmans who have offered Soma have no debt, surely, to the Fathers.

original: na somo apratā pape //
analyzed: na somaḥ apratā pape
translated: Soma has not failed them.

original: panya id upa gāyata panya ukthāni śaṃsata /
analyzed: panye id upa gāyata panye ukthāni śaṃsata
translated: Sing to the one who brings good things! Sing praises to the one who brings good things!

original: brahmā kṛṇota panya it //
analyzed: brahmā kṛṇota panye id
translated: The Brahman makes good things.

original: panya ā dardirac chatā sahasrā vājy avṛtaḥ /
analyzed: panyaḥ ā dardirat śatā sahasrā vājī avṛtaḥ
translated: The good thing has been extended, a hundred thousand times, the good thing, the prize, the unvanquished,

original: indro yo yajvano vṛdhaḥ //🔽vi ṣū cara svadhā anu kṛṣṭīnām anv āhuvaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ yaḥ yajvanaḥ vṛdhaḥ  vi su cara svadhāḥ anu kṛṣṭīnām anu āhuvaḥ
translated: Indra, who prospers the sacrificer.🔽Go forth, O Indra, to the people, to the tribes, according to your own nature, to the invocations.

original: indra piba sutānām //
analyzed: indra piba sutānām
translated: Drink, O Indra, of the pressed (Soma).

original: piba svadhainavānām uta yas tugrye sacā /
analyzed: piba uta yaḥ tugrye sacā
translated: Drink of the naturally flowing (Soma), and of that which is in the trough,

original: utāyam indra yas tava //
analyzed: uta ayam indra yaḥ tava
translated: And of this, O Indra, which is thine.

original: atīhi manyuṣāviṇaṃ suṣuvāṃsam upāraṇe /
analyzed: atīhi manyuṣāviṇam suṣuvāṃsam upāraṇe
translated: Go past the wrathful one, past the one who has pressed (Soma), to the one who has not pressed (Soma).

original: imaṃ rātaṃ sutam piba //
analyzed: imam rātam sutam piba
translated: Drink this offered Soma which is pressed.

original: ihi tisraḥ parāvata ihi pañca janāṃ ati /
analyzed: ihi tisraḥ parāvataḥ ihi pañca janān ati
translated: Go past the three distant (worlds), go past the five peoples.

original: dhenā indrāvacākaśat //
analyzed: dhenāḥ indra avacākaśat
translated: The milch cow has called to Indra.

original: sūryo raśmiṃ yathā sṛjā tvā yacchantu me giraḥ /🔽nimnam āpo na sadhryak //
analyzed: sūryaḥ raśmim yathā sṛja tvā yacchantu me giraḥ  nimnam āpaḥ na sadhryak
translated: As the sun sends forth a ray, so let my songs send thee forth.🔽Like waters to a low place, so let them come together.

original: adhvaryav ā tu hi ṣiñca somaṃ vīrāya śipriṇe /
analyzed: adhvaryo ā tu hi siñca somam vīrāya śipriṇe
translated: Adhvaryu, pour out the Soma for the hero with the beautiful teeth.

original: bharā sutasya pītaye //
analyzed: bhara sutasya pītaye
translated: Bring the pressed (Soma) for him to drink.

original: ya udnaḥ phaligam bhinan nyak sindhūṃr avāsṛjat /
analyzed: yaḥ udnaḥ phaligam bhinat nyak sindhūṃr avāsṛjat
translated: He who burst the water-filled cloud, and let loose the rivers downward,

original: yo goṣu pakvaṃ dhārayat //
analyzed: yaḥ goṣu pakvam dhārayat
translated: He who holds the ripe (Soma) in the cows.
