original: ahan vṛtram ṛcīṣama aurṇavābham ahīśuvam /
analyzed: ahan vṛtram ṛcīṣamaḥ aurṇavābham ahīśuvam
translated: He slew Vr̥itra, Richiṣvan, Aurṇavâbha, Âhishivan,

original: himenāvidhyad arbudam //🔽pra va ugrāya niṣṭure 'ṣāḷhāya prasakṣiṇe /
analyzed: himena avidhyat arbudam  pra vaḥ ugrāya niṣṭure ṣāḷhāya prasakṣiṇe
translated: And with the frost he pierced Arbuda.🔽Sing forth the God-adoring prayer to him the strong, the fierce, the swift,

original: devattam brahma gāyata //
analyzed: devattam brahma gāyata
translated: To him who hath his seat in heaven.

original: yo viśvāny abhi vratā somasya made andhasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ viśvāni abhi vratā somasya made andhasaḥ
translated: He who in Soma's rapture, in the joy of sacrifice, hath all the laws in mind,

original: indro deveṣu cetati //
analyzed: indraḥ deveṣu cetati
translated: Indra regardeth all the Gods.

original: iha tyā sadhamādyā harī hiraṇyakeśyā /
analyzed: iha tyā sadhamādyā harī hiraṇya keśyā
translated: Here let thy two Bay Horses, O most wealthy One, whose hair is gold,

original: voḷhām abhi prayo hitam //
analyzed: voḍhām abhi prayaḥ hitam
translated: Be yoked to bring thee hitherward.

original: arvāñcaṃ tvā puruṣṭuta priyamedhastutā harī /
analyzed: arvāñcam tvā puruṣṭuta priyamedha stutā harī
translated: Thee, O most lauded Indra, let the two Bay Steeds, dear to Priyamedha, bring,

original: somapeyāya vakṣataḥ //🔽vayaṃ gha tvā sutāvanta āpo na vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: soma peyāya vakṣataḥ  vayam gha tvā sutāvantaḥ āpaḥ na vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: To drink the Soma, to the feast.🔽We, O most wealthy Indra, like the waters, with our pressed juice,

original: pavitrasya prasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāra āsate //
analyzed: pavitrasya prasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāraḥ āsate
translated: Sit round about thee, O thou Vritra-slayer, at the outpourings of the juice.

original: svaranti tvā sute naro vaso nireka ukthinaḥ /
analyzed: svaranti tvā sute naraḥ vaso nireke ukthinaḥ
translated: Men with the juice effused, O Vasu, with lauds, sing forth to thee.

original: kadā sutaṃ tṛṣāṇa oka ā gama indra svabdīva vaṃsagaḥ //
analyzed: kadā sutam tṛṣāṇaḥ okaḥ ā gamaḥ indra svabdī iva vaṃsagaḥ
translated: When wilt thou come, as one athirst, to the juice we shed, O Indra, like a bee to the wood?

original: kaṇvebhir dhṛṣṇav ā dhṛṣad vājaṃ darṣi sahasriṇam /
analyzed: kaṇvebhiḥ dhṛṣṇo ā dhṛṣat vājam darṣi sahasriṇam
translated: O thou most daring with the Kaṇvas, daring One, win thou the thousandfold spoil.

original: piśaṅgarūpam maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū gomantam īmahe //
analyzed: piśaṅga rūpam maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū gomantam īmahe
translated: O Maghavan, most active God, we seek the tawny-hued with store of kine.

original: pāhi gāyāndhaso mada indrāya medhyātithe /
analyzed: pāhi gāya andhasaḥ made indrāya medhyātithe
translated: Protect the juice, O Medhyâtithi, for Indra, for the gladdening draught.

original: yaḥ sammiślo haryor yaḥ sute sacā vajrī ratho hiraṇyayaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ sammiślaḥ haryoḥ yaḥ sute sacā vajrī rathaḥ hiraṇyayaḥ
translated: He who is yoked with the two bays, who in the draught is joined with the pressed (Soma), the wielder of the thunderbolt, the golden car.

original: yaḥ suṣavyaḥ sudakṣiṇa ino yaḥ sukratur gṛṇe /
analyzed: yaḥ suṣavyaḥ su dakṣiṇaḥ inaḥ yaḥ su kratuḥ gṛṇe
translated: He who is right-handed, right-guiding, the bountiful, the wise, whom I praise,

original: ya ākaraḥ sahasrā yaḥ śatāmagha indro yaḥ pūrbhid āritaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ ākaraḥ sahasrā yaḥ śatāmaghaḥ indraḥ yaḥ pūrbhid āritaḥ
translated: He who is the store of thousands, the hundred-giver, Indra, who is to be praised with songs.

original: yo dhṛṣito yo 'vṛto yo asti śmaśruṣu śritaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ dhṛṣitaḥ yaḥ vṛtaḥ yaḥ asti śmaśruṣu śritaḥ
translated: He who is bold, he who is covered, he who is hidden in the beard,

original: vibhūtadyumnaś cyavanaḥ puruṣṭutaḥ kratvā gaur iva śākinaḥ //
analyzed: vibhūta dyumnaḥ cyavanaḥ puruṣṭutaḥ kratvā gauḥ iva śākinaḥ
translated: The one whose glory is spread abroad, who is to be praised by many, who by his wisdom is strong like a bull.

original: ka īṃ veda sute sacā pibantaṃ kad vayo dadhe /
analyzed: kaḥ īm veda sute sacā pibantam kad vayaḥ dadhe
translated: Who knows him when he is drunk with the pressed (Soma)? Who has set his heart on him?

original: ayaṃ yaḥ puro vibhinatty ojasā mandānaḥ śipry andhasaḥ //🔽dānā mṛgo na vāraṇaḥ purutrā carathaṃ dadhe /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ puras vibhinatti ojasā mandānaḥ śiprī andhasaḥ  dānā mṛgaḥ na vāraṇaḥ purutrā caratham dadhe
translated: This one who with might breaks down the forts, rejoicing, with the tawny juice.🔽Like a wild beast, like a boar, he has set his course in many a place.

original: nakiṣ ṭvā ni yamad ā sute gamo mahāṃś carasy ojasā //
analyzed: nakir tvā ni yamat ā sute gamaḥ mahān carasi ojasā
translated: None can restrain thee when thou goest to the draught. Thou movest mightily with thy power.

original: ya ugraḥ sann aniṣṭṛta sthiro raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ugraḥ san a niṣṭṛta sthiraḥ raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ
translated: Thou who art fierce, though not to be resisted, art made firm for the fight.

original: yadi stotur maghavā śṛṇavad dhavaṃ nendro yoṣaty ā gamat //
analyzed: yadi stotuḥ maghavā śṛṇavat havam na indraḥ yoṣati ā gamat
translated: If the bountiful one, when he is strong, will listen to the singer's call, let Indra come to the woman.

original: satyam itthā vṛṣed asi vṛṣajūtir no 'vṛtaḥ /
analyzed: satyam itthā vṛṣā id asi vṛṣa jūtiḥ naḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: Thou art indeed, O bull, the truth; thou art the bull's speed, thou art the covering for us.

original: vṛṣā hy ugra śṛṇviṣe parāvati vṛṣo arvāvati śrutaḥ //
analyzed: vṛṣā hi ugra śṛṇviṣe parāvati vṛṣaḥ arvāvati śrutaḥ
translated: For thou, O mighty one, art to be heard from afar, thou, O bull, art to be heard from near.

original: vṛṣaṇas te abhīśavo vṛṣā kaśā hiraṇyayī /
analyzed: vṛṣaṇaḥ te abhīśavaḥ vṛṣā kaśā hiraṇyayī
translated: Your bulls are the reins, O mighty one, the whip is golden,

original: vṛṣā ratho maghavan vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣā tvaṃ śatakrato //🔽vṛṣā sotā sunotu te vṛṣann ṛjīpinn ā bhara /
analyzed: vṛṣā rathaḥ maghavan vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣā tvam śatakrato  vṛṣā sotā sunotu te vṛṣan ṛjīpin ā bhara
translated: the chariot is a bull, O Maghavan, the two bulls are your bay steeds, you are a bull, O Shatakratu.🔽Let the bull, the presser, press for you, O bull, O tawny one, bring (the Soma).

original: vṛṣā dadhanve vṛṣaṇaṃ nadīṣv ā tubhyaṃ sthātar harīṇām //
analyzed: vṛṣā dadhanve vṛṣaṇam nadīṣu ā tubhyam sthātar harīṇām
translated: The bull flows to the bull, to the rivers. To you, O lord of the bay steeds, (I offer this).

original: endra yāhi pītaye madhu śaviṣṭha somyam /
analyzed: ā indra yāhi pītaye madhu śaviṣṭha somyam
translated: O Indra, come to drink the sweet Soma, O strongest one.

original: nāyam acchā maghavā śṛṇavad giro brahmokthā ca sukratuḥ //
analyzed: na ayam acchā maghavā śṛṇavat giraḥ brahma ukthā ca su kratuḥ
translated: May this Maghavan not hear the songs, the prayers and praises, O wise one.

original: vahantu tvā ratheṣṭhām ā harayo rathayujaḥ /
analyzed: vahantu tvā ratheṣṭhām ā harayaḥ ratha yujaḥ
translated: Let the bay horses, yoked to the chariot, carry you, O chariot-rider.

original: tiraś cid aryaṃ savanāni vṛtrahann anyeṣāṃ yā śatakrato //
analyzed: tiras cit aryam savanāni vṛtrahan anyeṣām yā śatakrato
translated: Even the distant libations, O Vrtra-slayer, of others, O Shatakratu.

original: asmākam adyāntamaṃ stomaṃ dhiṣva mahāmaha /
analyzed: asmākam adya antamam stomam dhiṣva mahā maha
translated: Today, O Indra, accept our most distant praise, O great one.

original: asmākaṃ te savanā santu śantamā madāya dyukṣa somapāḥ //
analyzed: asmākam te savanā santu śantamā madāya dyukṣa soma pāḥ
translated: May our libations be most delightful to you, O you who delight in heaven, O you who drink Soma, for your joy.

original: nahi ṣas tava no mama śāstre anyasya raṇyati /
analyzed: nahi saḥ tava na u mama śāstre anyasya raṇyati
translated: For in your teaching, O Indra, or in mine, no one else finds delight,

original: yo asmān vīra ānayat //
analyzed: yaḥ asmān vīraḥ ānayat
translated: Who has brought us, O hero, to this.

original: indraś cid ghā tad abravīt striyā aśāsyam manaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ cit gha tat abravīt striyāḥ a śāsyam manaḥ
translated: Even Indra has said this, that the mind of a woman is difficult to rule.

original: uto aha kratuṃ raghum //
analyzed: uta u aha kratum raghum
translated: And yet I have a swift resolve.

original: saptī cid ghā madacyutā mithunā vahato ratham /
analyzed: saptī cit gha mada cyutā mithunā vahataḥ ratham
translated: Even the two mares, intoxicated with joy, draw the chariot, the two

original: eved dhūr vṛṣṇa uttarā //🔽adhaḥ paśyasva mopari saṃtarām pādakau hara /
analyzed: eva id dhūḥ vṛṣṇaḥ uttarā  adhas paśyasva mā upari saṃtarām pādakau hara
translated: So, O mighty one, look down from above.🔽Look down, not up, O woman, remove your feet.

original: mā te kaśaplakau dṛśan strī hi brahmā babhūvitha //
analyzed: mā te kaśaplakau dṛśan strī hi brahmā babhūvitha
translated: Let not your testicles be seen, for you have become a woman.

original: endra yāhi haribhir upa kaṇvasya suṣṭutim /
analyzed: ā indra yāhi haribhiḥ upa kaṇvasya suṣṭutim
translated: O Indra, come with your tawny (horses) to Kanva's praise.

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the command of this highest heaven, go to heaven, O you who shine in the day.

original: ā tvā grāvā vadann iha somī ghoṣeṇa yacchatu /
analyzed: ā tvā grāvā vadan iha somī ghoṣeṇa yacchatu
translated: Let the stone, calling out, attract you here with the sound of Soma.

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the command of this highest heaven, go to heaven, O you who shine in the day.

original: atrā vi nemir eṣām urāṃ na dhūnute vṛkaḥ /
analyzed: atrā vi nemiḥ eṣām urām na dhūnute vṛkaḥ
translated: Here the wheel of these (horses) does not shake like a wolf shaking a sheep.

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the command of this highest heaven, go to heaven, O you who shine in the day.

original: ā tvā kaṇvā ihāvase havante vājasātaye /
analyzed: ā tvā kaṇvāḥ iha avase havante vājasātaye
translated: The Kanvas call you here for help, for the sake of strength.

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the command of this highest heaven, go to heaven, O you who shine in the day.

original: dadhāmi te sutānāṃ vṛṣṇe na pūrvapāyyam /
analyzed: dadhāmi te sutānām vṛṣṇe na pūrva pāyyam
translated: I place before you, O mighty one, the first drink of the pressed (Soma).

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //🔽smatpurandhir na ā gahi viśvatodhīr na ūtaye /
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso  smat purandhiḥ naḥ ā gahi viśvatas dhīḥ naḥ ūtaye
translated: From the command of this highest heaven, go to heaven, O you who shine in the day.🔽Come to us, O you who have all thought, for help.

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the command of this highest heaven, go to heaven, O you who shine in the day.

original: ā no yāhi mahemate sahasrote śatāmagha /
analyzed: ā naḥ yāhi mahemate sahasra ūte śatāmagha
translated: Come to us, O you of great mind, O you who have a hundred riches, O you who have a thousand streams.

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the rule of this highest heaven, go to the heaven, O you who shine in the heaven.

original: ā tvā hotā manurhito devatrā vakṣad īḍyaḥ /
analyzed: ā tvā hotā manuḥ hitaḥ devatrā vakṣat īḍyaḥ
translated: May the priest, dear to Manu, worthy of worship, carry you to the gods,

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the rule of this highest heaven, go to the heaven, O you who shine in the heaven.

original: ā tvā madacyutā harī śyenam pakṣeva vakṣataḥ /
analyzed: ā tvā mada cyutā harī śyenam pakṣā iva vakṣataḥ
translated: May your two horses, who cause intoxication, carry you like wings to the eagle,

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the rule of this highest heaven, go to the heaven, O you who shine in the heaven.

original: ā yāhy arya ā pari svāhā somasya pītaye /
analyzed: ā yāhi aryaḥ ā pari svāhā somasya pītaye
translated: Come to us, O noble one, for the sake of the sacrifice, for the drinking of Soma.

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the rule of this highest heaven, go to the heaven, O you who shine in the heaven.

original: ā no yāhy upaśruty uktheṣu raṇayā iha /
analyzed: ā naḥ yāhi upaśrutī uktheṣu raṇaya iha
translated: Come to us, listening to our hymns, delighting in them here,

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the rule of this highest heaven, go to the heaven, O you who shine in the heaven.

original: sarūpair ā su no gahi sambhṛtaiḥ sambhṛtāśvaḥ /
analyzed: sa rūpaiḥ ā su naḥ gahi sambhṛtaiḥ sambhṛta aśvaḥ
translated: Come to us with your forms that are the same, with your collected, well-collected horses,

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the rule of this highest heaven, go to the heaven, O you who shine in the heaven.

original: ā yāhi parvatebhyaḥ samudrasyādhi viṣṭapaḥ /
analyzed: ā yāhi parvatebhyaḥ samudrasya adhi viṣṭapaḥ
translated: Come to us from the mountains, from the surface of the ocean,

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the rule of this highest heaven, go to the heaven, O you who shine in the heaven.

original: ā no gavyāny aśvyā sahasrā śūra dardṛhi /
analyzed: ā naḥ gavyāni aśvyā sahasrā śūra dardṛhi
translated: O hero, show us cattle, horses, and thousands,

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the rule of this highest heaven, go to the heaven, O you who shine in the heaven.

original: ā naḥ sahasraśo bharāyutāni śatāni ca /
analyzed: ā naḥ sahasraśas bhara ayutāni śatāni ca
translated: Bring to us thousands, ten thousands, and hundreds,

original: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso //
analyzed: divaḥ amuṣya śāsataḥ divam yaya divāvaso
translated: From the command of this heaven, go to heaven, O you who shine in the day.

original: ā yad indraś ca dadvahe sahasraṃ vasurociṣaḥ /
analyzed: ā yat indraḥ ca dadvahe sahasram vasurociṣaḥ
translated: When Indra and he will give a thousand shining cattle,

original: ojiṣṭham aśvyam paśum //
analyzed: ojiṣṭham aśvyam paśum
translated: The strongest horse as a beast.

original: ya ṛjrā vātaraṃhaso 'ruṣāso raghuṣyadaḥ /
analyzed: ye ṛjrāḥ vāta raṃhasaḥ ruṣāsaḥ raghuṣyadaḥ
translated: Those red ones with swift wind-like speed, quickly flying,

original: bhrājante sūryā iva //
analyzed: bhrājante sūryāḥ iva
translated: Shine like suns.

original: pārāvatasya rātiṣu dravaccakreṣv āśuṣu /
analyzed: pārāvatasya rātiṣu dravat cakreṣu āśuṣu
translated: On the gifts of the pigeon, with swiftly moving wheels,

original: tiṣṭhaṃ vanasya madhya ā //
analyzed: tiṣṭham vanasya madhye ā
translated: Standing in the middle of the forest.

original: agninendreṇa varuṇena viṣṇunādityai rudrair vasubhiḥ sacābhuvā /
analyzed: agninā indreṇa varuṇena viṣṇunā ādityaiḥ rudraiḥ vasubhiḥ sacābhuvā
translated: With Agni, Indra, Varuna, Vishnu, the Adityas, Rudras, Vasus, in accord,

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somam pibatam aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somam pibatam aśvinā
translated: With the same intention as the dawn and the sun, O Ashvins, drink the soma.

original: viśvābhir dhībhir bhuvanena vājinā divā pṛthivyādribhiḥ sacābhuvā /
analyzed: viśvābhiḥ dhībhiḥ bhuvanena vājinā divā pṛthivyā adribhiḥ sacābhuvā
translated: With all the thoughts, with the strength of the world, with the earth, the mountains, in accord,

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somam pibatam aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somam pibatam aśvinā
translated: With the same intention as the dawn and the sun, O Ashvins, drink the soma.

original: viśvair devais tribhir ekādaśair ihādbhir marudbhir bhṛgubhiḥ sacābhuvā /
analyzed: viśvaiḥ devaiḥ tribhiḥ ekādaśaiḥ iha adbhiḥ marudbhiḥ bhṛgubhiḥ sacābhuvā
translated: With all the gods, with the three and the eleven, here with the waters, the Maruts, the Bhrigus, in accord,

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somam pibatam aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somam pibatam aśvinā
translated: With the same intention as the dawn and the sun, O Ashvins, drink the soma.

original: juṣethāṃ yajñam bodhataṃ havasya me viśveha devau savanāva gacchatam /
analyzed: juṣethām yajñam bodhatam havasya me viśvā iha devau savanā ava gacchatam
translated: Accept the sacrifice, be aware of my call, come here to all the libations, O you two gods,🔽With the same intention as the dawn and the sun, O Ashvins, drink the soma.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ceṣaṃ no voḷham aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca iṣam naḥ voḷham aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, fulfil for us our hope, O you two who are to be invoked by many, O you two who are to be invoked by many, O Aśvins.

original: stomaṃ juṣethāṃ yuvaśeva kanyanāṃ viśveha devau savanāva gacchatam /
analyzed: stomam juṣethām yuvaśā iva kanyanām viśvā iha devau savanā ava gacchatam
translated: Accept the praise, as a young man accepts a maiden. Come to all libations here, O you two who are to be invoked by many, O you two who are to be invoked by many, O Aśvins.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ceṣaṃ no voḷham aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca iṣam naḥ voḷham aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, fulfil for us our hope, O you two who are to be invoked by many, O you two who are to be invoked by many, O Aśvins.

original: giro juṣethām adhvaraṃ juṣethāṃ viśveha devau savanāva gacchatam /
analyzed: giraḥ juṣethām adhvaram juṣethām viśvā iha devau savanā ava gacchatam
translated: Accept the songs, accept the sacrifice. Come to all libations here, O you two who are to be invoked by many, O you two who are to be invoked by many, O Aśvins.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ceṣaṃ no voḷham aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca iṣam naḥ voḷham aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, fulfil for us our hope, O you two who are to be invoked by many, O you two who are to be invoked by many, O Aśvins.

original: hāridraveva patatho vaned upa somaṃ sutam mahiṣevāva gacchathaḥ /
analyzed: hāridravā iva patathaḥ vanā id upa somam sutam mahiṣā iva ava gacchathaḥ
translated: You two fly like two tawny ones to the wood. You two go to the pressed Soma like two buffaloes.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca trir vartir yātam aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca tris vartiḥ yātam aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O Aśvins, come thrice on your way.

original: haṃsāv iva patatho adhvagāv iva somaṃ sutam mahiṣevāva gacchathaḥ /
analyzed: haṃsau iva patathaḥ adhvagau iva somam sutam mahiṣā iva ava gacchathaḥ
translated: You two fly like two swans, like two travellers on the way. You two go to the pressed Soma like two buffaloes.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca trir vartir yātam aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca tris vartiḥ yātam aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O Aśvins, come thrice on your way.

original: śyenāv iva patatho havyadātaye somaṃ sutam mahiṣevāva gacchathaḥ /
analyzed: śyenau iva patathaḥ havya dātaye somam sutam mahiṣā iva ava gacchathaḥ
translated: You two fly like two hawks to the giver of oblations. You two go to the pressed Soma like two buffaloes.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca trir vartir yātam aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca tris vartiḥ yātam aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O Aśvins, come thrice on your way.

original: pibataṃ ca tṛpṇutaṃ cā ca gacchatam prajāṃ ca dhattaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattam /
analyzed: pibatam ca tṛpṇutam ca ā ca gacchatam prajām ca dhattam draviṇam ca dhattam
translated: Drink and be satisfied, and then depart. Give us offspring and wealth.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa corjaṃ no dhattam aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca ūrjam naḥ dhattam aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O Aśvins, grant us strength.

original: jayataṃ ca pra stutaṃ ca pra cāvatam prajāṃ ca dhattaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattam /
analyzed: jayatam ca pra stutam ca pra ca avatam prajām ca dhattam draviṇam ca dhattam
translated: Conquer and praise, and help, and give us offspring and wealth.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa corjaṃ no dhattam aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca ūrjam naḥ dhattam aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O Aśvins, grant us strength.

original: hataṃ ca śatrūn yatataṃ ca mitriṇaḥ prajāṃ ca dhattaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattam /
analyzed: hatam ca śatrūn yatatam ca mitriṇaḥ prajām ca dhattam draviṇam ca dhattam
translated: Destroy our enemies and befriend our friends, and give us offspring and wealth.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa corjaṃ no dhattam aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca ūrjam naḥ dhattam aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O Aśvins, grant us strength.

original: mitrāvaruṇavantā uta dharmavantā marutvantā jaritur gacchatho havam /
analyzed: mitrāvaruṇavantau uta dharmavantā marutvantā jarituḥ gacchathaḥ havam
translated: Honored by Mitra and Varuṇa, united with Dharma, accompanied by the Maruts, come to the singer's invocation.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cādityair yātam aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca ādityaiḥ yātam aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O Aśvins, come with the Ādityas.

original: aṅgirasvantā uta viṣṇuvantā marutvantā jaritur gacchatho havam /
analyzed: aṅgirasvantau uta viṣṇuvantā marutvantā jarituḥ gacchathaḥ havam
translated: Honored by the Angirases, by Viṣṇu, accompanied by the Maruts, come to the singer's invocation.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cādityair yātam aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca ādityaiḥ yātam aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O Aśvins, come with the Ādityas.

original: ṛbhumantā vṛṣaṇā vājavantā marutvantā jaritur gacchatho havam /
analyzed: ṛbhumantā vṛṣaṇā vājavantā marutvantā jarituḥ gacchathaḥ havam
translated: Honored by the Ṛbhus, O mighty ones, by Vāja, accompanied by the Maruts, come to the singer's invocation.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cādityair yātam aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca ādityaiḥ yātam aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun and the Adityas, O you two Asvins, come.

original: brahma jinvatam uta jinvataṃ dhiyo hataṃ rakṣāṃsi sedhatam amīvāḥ /
analyzed: brahma jinvatam uta jinvatam dhiyaḥ hatam rakṣāṃsi sedhatam amīvāḥ
translated: Inspire the prayer, inspire the thoughts, slay the Raksases, drive away the maladies.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somaṃ sunvato aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somam sunvataḥ aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O you two Asvins, of him who presses Soma.

original: kṣatraṃ jinvatam uta jinvataṃ nṝn hataṃ rakṣāṃsi sedhatam amīvāḥ /
analyzed: kṣatram jinvatam uta jinvatam nṝn hatam rakṣāṃsi sedhatam amīvāḥ
translated: Inspire the nobility, inspire the men, slay the Raksases, drive away the maladies.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somaṃ sunvato aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somam sunvataḥ aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O you two Asvins, of him who presses Soma.

original: dhenūr jinvatam uta jinvataṃ viśo hataṃ rakṣāṃsi sedhatam amīvāḥ /
analyzed: dhenūḥ jinvatam uta jinvatam viśaḥ hatam rakṣāṃsi sedhatam amīvāḥ
translated: Inspire the milch cows, inspire the people, slay the Raksases, drive away the maladies.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somaṃ sunvato aśvinā //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somam sunvataḥ aśvinā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O you two Asvins, of him who presses Soma.

original: atrer iva śṛṇutam pūrvyastutiṃ śyāvāśvasya sunvato madacyutā /
analyzed: atreḥ iva śṛṇutam pūrvya stutim śyāvāśvasya sunvataḥ mada cyutā
translated: Listen to the praise of Atri, as of old, of Syamavasu who presses Soma, O you who delight in the same.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cāśvinā tiroahnyam //🔽sargāṃ iva sṛjataṃ suṣṭutīr upa śyāvāśvasya sunvato madacyutā /
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca aśvinā tiroahnyam  sargān iva sṛjatam suṣṭutīḥ upa śyāvāśvasya sunvataḥ mada cyutā
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O you two Asvins, for a whole day.🔽As creators create good praises, of Syamavasu who presses Soma, O you who delight in the same.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cāśvinā tiroahnyam //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca aśvinā tiroahnyam
translated: In unison with Dawn and the Sun, O you two Asvins, for a whole day.

original: raśmīṃr iva yacchatam adhvarāṃ upa śyāvāśvasya sunvato madacyutā /
analyzed: raśmīṃr iva yacchatam adhvarān upa śyāvāśvasya sunvataḥ mada cyutā
translated: As you control the rays, come to the sacrifices, of Syamavasu who presses Soma, O you who delight in the same.

original: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cāśvinā tiroahnyam //
analyzed: sajoṣasau uṣasā sūryeṇa ca aśvinā tiroahnyam
translated: In unison with the dawn and the sun, O Asvins, across the day.

original: arvāg rathaṃ ni yacchatam pibataṃ somyam madhu /
analyzed: arvāk ratham ni yacchatam pibatam somyam madhu
translated: Turn your chariot back, drink the Soma-mixed mead.

original: ā yātam aśvinā gatam avasyur vām ahaṃ huve dhattaṃ ratnāni dāśuṣe //
analyzed: ā yātam aśvinā gatam avasyuḥ vām aham huve dhattam ratnāni dāśuṣe
translated: Come, O Asvins, I call you, longing for help, grant treasures to the worshipper.

original: namovāke prasthite adhvare narā vivakṣaṇasya pītaye /
analyzed: namovāke prasthite adhvare narā vivakṣaṇasya pītaye
translated: In the invocation, when the sacrifice is begun, O heroes, for the drinking of the well-pressed (Soma),

original: ā yātam aśvinā gatam avasyur vām ahaṃ huve dhattaṃ ratnāni dāśuṣe //
analyzed: ā yātam aśvinā gatam avasyuḥ vām aham huve dhattam ratnāni dāśuṣe
translated: Come, O Asvins, I call you, longing for help, grant treasures to the worshipper.

original: svāhākṛtasya tṛmpataṃ sutasya devāv andhasaḥ /
analyzed: svāhākṛtasya tṛmpatam sutasya devau andhasaḥ
translated: Be satisfied with the Svâhâ-consecrated, O gods, with the pressed Soma juice.

original: ā yātam aśvinā gatam avasyur vām ahaṃ huve dhattaṃ ratnāni dāśuṣe //
analyzed: ā yātam aśvinā gatam avasyuḥ vām aham huve dhattam ratnāni dāśuṣe
translated: Come, O Asvins, I call you, longing for help, grant treasures to the worshipper.

original: avitāsi sunvato vṛktabarhiṣaḥ pibā somam madāya kaṃ śatakrato /
analyzed: avitāsi sunvataḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ pibā somam madāya kam śatakrato
translated: You are the protector of the one who presses (Soma), whose sacrificial grass is trimmed, drink Soma for delight, O you of a hundred powers,

original: yaṃ te bhāgam adhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanā uru jrayaḥ sam apsujin marutvāṃ indra satpate //
analyzed: yam te bhāgam adhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanāḥ uru jrayaḥ sam apsujit marutvān indra satpate
translated: The share which they have assigned to you, overcoming all the enemies, O you of wide conquests, together with the Maruts, O Indra, O lord of the people.

original: prāva stotāram maghavann ava tvām pibā somam madāya kaṃ śatakrato /
analyzed: prāva stotāram maghavan ava tvām pibā somam madāya kam śatakrato
translated: Protect the praiser, O Maghavan, come to you, drink Soma for delight, O you of a hundred powers,

original: yaṃ te bhāgam adhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanā uru jrayaḥ sam apsujin marutvāṃ indra satpate //
analyzed: yam te bhāgam adhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanāḥ uru jrayaḥ sam apsujit marutvān indra satpate
translated: The share which they have assigned to thee, O thou who hast overcome all foes, O thou of wide sway, O thou who hast conquered in the waters, O Indra, O Lord of the brave!

original: ūrjā devāṃ avasy ojasā tvām pibā somam madāya kaṃ śatakrato /
analyzed: ūrjā devām avasi ojasā tvām pibā somam madāya kam śatakrato
translated: With food come to the Gods, with strength to thee. Drink thou the Soma to make thee glad, O thou of a hundred powers!

original: yaṃ te bhāgam adhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanā uru jrayaḥ sam apsujin marutvāṃ indra satpate //
analyzed: yam te bhāgam adhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanāḥ uru jrayaḥ sam apsujit marutvān indra satpate
translated: The share which they have assigned to thee, O thou who hast overcome all foes, O thou of wide sway, O thou who hast conquered in the waters, O Indra, O Lord of the brave!

original: janitā divo janitā pṛthivyāḥ pibā somam madāya kaṃ śatakrato /
analyzed: janitā divaḥ janitā pṛthivyāḥ pibā somam madāya kam śatakrato
translated: Thou art the begetter of the heaven, the begetter of the earth. Drink thou the Soma to make thee glad, O thou of a hundred powers!

original: yaṃ te bhāgam adhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanā uru jrayaḥ sam apsujin marutvāṃ indra satpate //
analyzed: yam te bhāgam adhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanāḥ uru jrayaḥ sam apsujit marutvān indra satpate
translated: The share which they have assigned to thee, O thou who hast overcome all foes, O thou of wide sway, O thou who hast conquered in the waters, O Indra, O Lord of the brave!

original: janitāśvānāṃ janitā gavām asi pibā somam madāya kaṃ śatakrato /
analyzed: janitā aśvānām janitā gavām asi pibā somam madāya kam śatakrato
translated: Thou art the begetter of the horses, the begetter of the cows. Drink thou the Soma to make thee glad, O thou of a hundred powers!

original: yaṃ te bhāgam adhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanā uru jrayaḥ sam apsujin marutvāṃ indra satpate //
analyzed: yam te bhāgam adhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanāḥ uru jrayaḥ sam apsujit marutvān indra satpate
translated: The share which they have assigned to thee, O thou who hast overcome all foes, O thou of wide sway, O thou who hast conquered in the waters, O Indra, O Lord of the brave!

original: atrīṇāṃ stomam adrivo mahas kṛdhi pibā somam madāya kaṃ śatakrato /
analyzed: atrīṇām stomam adrivas mahaḥ kṛdhi pibā somam madāya kam śatakrato
translated: O thou who hast the thunderbolt, make great the praise of the Atri folk. Drink thou the Soma to make thee glad, O thou of a hundred powers!

original: yaṃ te bhāgam adhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanā uru jrayaḥ sam apsujin marutvāṃ indra satpate //
analyzed: yam te bhāgam adhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanāḥ uru jrayaḥ sam apsujit marutvān indra satpate
translated: The share which they assigned to thee, O thou who shinest far and wide, conquering all the people in thy wrath, O thou who art dear to the Maruts, O lord of the brave.

original: śyāvāśvasya sunvatas tathā śṛṇu yathāśṛṇor atreḥ karmāṇi kṛṇvataḥ /
analyzed: śyāvāśvasya sunvataḥ tathā śṛṇu yathā aśṛṇoḥ atreḥ karmāṇi kṛṇvataḥ
translated: Listen, O Indra, to the pressing of the dark-steeds, as thou hast listened to the deeds of Atri, who performed the sacrifice.

original: pra trasadasyum āvitha tvam eka in nṛṣāhya indra brahmāṇi vardhayan //
analyzed: pra trasadasyum āvitha tvam ekaḥ id nṛṣāhye indra brahmāṇi vardhayan
translated: Thou alone hast helped Trasadasyu in the battle of men, O Indra, exalting the prayers (of the sacrificer).

original: predam brahma vṛtratūryeṣv āvitha pra sunvataḥ śacīpata indra viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: pra idam brahma vṛtratūryeṣu āvitha pra sunvataḥ śacīpate indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: This prayer hath helped thee in the battles with Vr̥itra, O Lord of power, O Indra, with all thy helps.

original: mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahann anedya pibā somasya vajrivaḥ //
analyzed: mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahan anedya pibā somasya vajrivas
translated: O Vr̥itra-slayer, drink thou of the uncensured Soma juice at the midday libation, O thou who hast the thunderbolt in thine arm.

original: sehāna ugra pṛtanā abhi druhaḥ śacīpata indra viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: sehānaḥ ugra pṛtanāḥ abhi druhaḥ śacīpate indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Thou, O mighty one, hast overcome the foe, hast overcome the wicked in the battles, O Lord of power, O Indra, with all thy helps.

original: mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahann anedya pibā somasya vajrivaḥ //
analyzed: mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahan anedya pibā somasya vajrivas
translated: O Vr̥itra-slayer, drink thou of the uncensured Soma juice at the midday libation, O thou who hast the thunderbolt in thine arm.

original: ekarāḷ asya bhuvanasya rājasi śacīpata indra viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: eka rāj asya bhuvanasya rājasi śacīpate indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Thou rulest alone over this world, O Lord of power, O Indra, with all thy helps.

original: mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahann anedya pibā somasya vajrivaḥ //
analyzed: mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahan anedya pibā somasya vajrivas
translated: O Vr̥itra-slayer, drink thou of the uncensured Soma juice at the midday libation, O thou who hast the thunderbolt in thine arm.

original: sasthāvānā yavayasi tvam eka ic chacīpata indra viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: sasthāvānā yavayasi tvam ekaḥ id śacīpate indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, Lord of Strength, alone in the place of the barley, with all thy helps,

original: mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahann anedya pibā somasya vajrivaḥ //
analyzed: mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahan anedya pibā somasya vajrivas
translated: Of the midday pressing, O Vr̥itra-slayer, uncensured drink thou of the Soma, O Thunderer.

original: kṣemasya ca prayujaś ca tvam īśiṣe śacīpata indra viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: kṣemasya ca prayujaḥ ca tvam īśiṣe śacīpate indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Thou art the Lord of Strength, O Indra, Lord of Strength, with all thy helps, thou rulest over the place of rest and the place of exertion.

original: mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahann anedya pibā somasya vajrivaḥ //
analyzed: mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahan anedya pibā somasya vajrivas
translated: Of the midday pressing, O Vr̥itra-slayer, uncensured drink thou of the Soma, O Thunderer.

original: kṣatrāya tvam avasi na tvam āvitha śacīpata indra viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: kṣatrāya tvam avasi na tvam āvitha śacīpate indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Thou art the Lord of Strength, O Indra, Lord of Strength, with all thy helps, thou hast protected the Kshatriya.

original: mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahann anedya pibā somasya vajrivaḥ //
analyzed: mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahan anedya pibā somasya vajrivas
translated: Of the midday pressing, O Vr̥itra-slayer, uncensured drink thou of the Soma, O Thunderer.

original: śyāvāśvasya rebhatas tathā śṛṇu yathāśṛṇor atreḥ karmāṇi kṛṇvataḥ /
analyzed: śyāvāśvasya rebhataḥ tathā śṛṇu yathā aśṛṇoḥ atreḥ karmāṇi kṛṇvataḥ
translated: Listen as thou hast heard to the singing of Syamavasu, and to the deeds of Atri when he performed them.

original: pra trasadasyum āvitha tvam eka in nṛṣāhya indra kṣatrāṇi vardhayan //
analyzed: pra trasadasyum āvitha tvam ekaḥ id nṛṣāhye indra kṣatrāṇi vardhayan
translated: Thou alone hast helped Trasadasyu, O Indra, increasing the Kshatriyas' power in the conflict.

original: yajñasya hi stha ṛtvijā sasnī vājeṣu karmasu /
analyzed: yajñasya hi sthaḥ ṛtvijā sasnī vājeṣu karmasu
translated: For ye are the priests of the sacrifice, to be remembered in the contests for strength.

original: indrāgnī tasya bodhatam //
analyzed: indra agnī tasya bodhatam
translated: O Indra and Agni, be ye aware of this.

original: tośāsā rathayāvānā vṛtrahaṇāparājitā /
analyzed: tośasā ratha yāvānā vṛtra haṇā aparājitā
translated: The two who are to be praised, who travel in a chariot, the two Vr̥itra-slayers, the two unconquered,

original: indrāgnī tasya bodhatam //
analyzed: indra agnī tasya bodhatam
translated: O Indra and Agni, be ye aware of this.

original: idaṃ vām madiram madhv adhukṣann adribhir naraḥ /
analyzed: idam vām madiram madhu adhukṣan adribhiḥ naraḥ
translated: With stones, O men, they have pressed this gladdening sweet drink for you both.

original: indrāgnī tasya bodhatam //
analyzed: indra agnī tasya bodhatam
translated: Indra and Agni, be aware of it.

original: juṣethāṃ yajñam iṣṭaye sutaṃ somaṃ sadhastutī /
analyzed: juṣethām yajñam iṣṭaye sutam somam sadhastutī
translated: Enjoy the sacrifice for prosperity, the pressed Soma, and the same praises.

original: indrāgnī ā gataṃ narā //
analyzed: indra agnī ā gatam narā
translated: Indra and Agni, come, O Heroes.

original: imā juṣethāṃ savanā yebhir havyāny ūhathuḥ /
analyzed: imā juṣethām savanā yebhiḥ havyāni ūhathuḥ
translated: Accept these libations with which ye bring the offerings.

original: indrāgnī ā gataṃ narā //
analyzed: indra agnī ā gatam narā
translated: Indra and Agni, come, O Heroes.

original: imāṃ gāyatravartaniṃ juṣethāṃ suṣṭutim mama /
analyzed: imām gāyatra vartanim juṣethām suṣṭutim mama
translated: Accept this hymn of mine, which follows the path of the Gayatri.

original: indrāgnī ā gataṃ narā //
analyzed: indra agnī ā gatam narā
translated: Indra and Agni, come, O Heroes.

original: prātaryāvabhir ā gataṃ devebhir jenyāvasū /
analyzed: prātaryāvabhiḥ ā gatam devebhiḥ jenyāvasū
translated: Come with the Prâtar-yâmas, with the Gods, O ye most rich in gifts.

original: indrāgnī somapītaye //
analyzed: indra agnī soma pītaye
translated: Indra and Agni, come to drink the Soma.

original: śyāvāśvasya sunvato 'trīṇāṃ śṛṇutaṃ havam /
analyzed: śyāvāśvasya sunvataḥ trīṇām śṛṇutam havam
translated: Hear the call of Shyâvâśva, of the sons of Atri, while he presses.

original: indrāgnī somapītaye //
analyzed: indra agnī soma pītaye
translated: Indra and Agni, come to drink the Soma.

original: evā vām ahva ūtaye yathāhuvanta medhirāḥ /
analyzed: eva vām ahve ūtaye yathā ahuvanta medhirāḥ
translated: Even thus I call you to my aid, as the wise have called you.

original: indrāgnī somapītaye //
analyzed: indra agnī soma pītaye
translated: Indra and Agni, come to drink the Soma.

original: āhaṃ sarasvatīvator indrāgnyor avo vṛṇe /
analyzed: ā aham sarasvatīvatoḥ indra agnyoḥ avaḥ vṛṇe
translated: I choose the favour of Indra and Agni, who are aided by Sarasvatî,

original: yābhyāṃ gāyatram ṛcyate //
analyzed: yābhyām gāyatram ṛcyate
translated: By whom the Gâyatrî metre is recited.

original: agnim astoṣy ṛgmiyam agnim īḷā yajadhyai /
analyzed: agnim astoṣi ṛgmiyam agnim īḍā yajadhyai
translated: I will praise Agni, worthy of praise; I will worship Agni with my song.

original: agnir devāṃ anaktu na ubhe hi vidathe kavir antaś carati dūtyaṃ nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: agniḥ devān anaktu naḥ ubhe hi vidathe kaviḥ antar carati dūtyam nabhantām anyake same
translated: May Agni anoint the Gods for us. For in both sacrifices the sage moves as a messenger within. Let the others perish, let them perish.

original: ny agne navyasā vacas tanūṣu śaṃsam eṣām /
analyzed: ni agne navyasā vacaḥ tanūṣu śaṃsam eṣām
translated: O Agni, with a new song of praise, on their bodies, punish these.

original: ny arātī rarāvṇāṃ viśvā aryo arātīr ito yucchantv āmuro nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: ni arātīḥ viśvāḥ aryaḥ arātīḥ itas yucchantu āmuraḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: Punish the evil-minded, all the wicked enemies. Let them be driven away from here, like a cloud. Let the others perish together.

original: agne manmāni tubhyaṃ kaṃ ghṛtaṃ na juhva āsani /
analyzed: agne manmāni tubhyam kam ghṛtam na juhve āsani
translated: O Agni, I offer to you, in the flame, oblations of ghee, my thoughts.

original: sa deveṣu pra cikiddhi tvaṃ hy asi pūrvyaḥ śivo dūto vivasvato nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: sa deveṣu pra cikiddhi tvam hi asi pūrvyaḥ śivaḥ dūtaḥ vivasvataḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: Do you proclaim this among the gods, for you are the ancient, auspicious messenger of Vivasvat. Let the others perish together.

original: tattad agnir vayo dadhe yathāyathā kṛpaṇyati /
analyzed: tat tat agniḥ vayaḥ dadhe yathā yathā kṛpaṇyati
translated: Agni has taken on him that form by which he is to be worshipped.

original: ūrjāhutir vasūnāṃ śaṃ ca yoś ca mayo dadhe viśvasyai devahūtyai nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: ūrjā āhutiḥ vasūnām śam ca yoḥ ca mayaḥ dadhe viśvasyai deva hūtyai nabhantām anyake same
translated: He has taken on him the oblation of strength, the blessing and joy of the Vasus, for the invocation of all the gods. Let the others perish together.

original: sa ciketa sahīyasāgniś citreṇa karmaṇā /
analyzed: sa ciketa sahīyasā agniḥ citreṇa karmaṇā
translated: He has thought with his most powerful form, Agni, with his wondrous work.

original: sa hotā śaśvatīnāṃ dakṣiṇābhir abhīvṛta inoti ca pratīvyaṃ nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: sa hotā śaśvatīnām dakṣiṇābhiḥ abhīvṛtaḥ inoti ca pratīvyam nabhantām anyake same
translated: He, the priest, is surrounded with perpetual gifts. He offers both the new and the old. Let the others perish together.

original: agnir jātā devānām agnir veda martānām apīcyam /
analyzed: agniḥ jātā devānām agniḥ veda martānām apīcyam
translated: Agni is the born of the gods, Agni knows the secret of mortals.

original: agniḥ sa draviṇodā agnir dvārā vy ūrṇute svāhuto navīyasā nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: agniḥ sa draviṇaḥ dāḥ agniḥ dvārā vi ūrṇute su āhutaḥ navīyasā nabhantām anyake same
translated: Agni is the giver of wealth, Agni opens the doors, well-offered, with the new. Let the others perish together.

original: agnir deveṣu saṃvasuḥ sa vikṣu yajñiyāsv ā /
analyzed: agniḥ deveṣu saṃvasuḥ sa vikṣu yajñiyāsu ā
translated: Agni, having good among the gods, is in the sacrificial families.

original: sa mudā kāvyā puru viśvam bhūmeva puṣyati devo deveṣu yajñiyo nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: sa mudā kāvyā puru viśvam bhūma iva puṣyati devaḥ deveṣu yajñiyaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: He, the wise one, nourishes all the people with joy, like the earth. Let the other gods perish.

original: yo agniḥ saptamānuṣaḥ śrito viśveṣu sindhuṣu /
analyzed: yaḥ agniḥ sapta mānuṣaḥ śritaḥ viśveṣu sindhuṣu
translated: The Agni who is the seventh man, who dwells in all the rivers,

original: tam āganma tripastyam mandhātur dasyuhantamam agniṃ yajñeṣu pūrvyaṃ nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: tam āganma tri pastyam mandhātuḥ dasyu hantamam agnim yajñeṣu pūrvyam nabhantām anyake same
translated: we have come to that bountiful one, the best slayer of the Dasyus of Mandhātri, to Agni, the ancient one at sacrifices. Let the other gods perish.

original: agnis trīṇi tridhātūny ā kṣeti vidathā kaviḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ trīṇi tri dhātūni ā kṣeti vidathā kaviḥ
translated: Agni, the wise one, moves around the three threefold fires.

original: sa trīṃr ekādaśāṃ iha yakṣac ca piprayac ca no vipro dūtaḥ pariṣkṛto nabhantām anyake same //🔽tvaṃ no agna āyuṣu tvaṃ deveṣu pūrvya vasva eka irajyasi /
analyzed: sa trīn ekādaśān iha yakṣat ca piprayat ca naḥ vipraḥ dūtaḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ nabhantām anyake same  tvam naḥ agne āyuṣu tvam deveṣu pūrvya vasvaḥ ekaḥ irajyasi
translated: He, the sage, should serve the three elevenfold ones here and favor us. Let the messenger, the purified one, the sage, let the other gods perish.🔽You, O Agni, among our lives, you, O ancient one, among the gods, rule alone over wealth.

original: tvām āpaḥ parisrutaḥ pari yanti svasetavo nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: tvām āpaḥ parisrutaḥ pari yanti sva setavaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: You, O Agni, whom the flowing waters go around as their own lord. Let the other gods perish.

original: indrāgnī yuvaṃ su naḥ sahantā dāsatho rayim /
analyzed: indra agnī yuvam su naḥ sahantā dāsathaḥ rayim
translated: O Indra and Agni, you two, the strong ones, grant us wealth.

original: yena dṛḷhā samatsv ā vīḷu cit sāhiṣīmahy agnir vaneva vāta in nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: yena dṛḍhā samatsu ā vīḍu cit sāhiṣīmahi agniḥ vanā iva vāte id nabhantām anyake same
translated: By which, O strong ones, in battles, we may conquer even the invincible. Let the other gods perish.

original: nahi vāṃ vavrayāmahe 'thendram id yajāmahe śaviṣṭhaṃ nṛṇāṃ naram /
analyzed: nahi vām thā indram id yajāmahe śaviṣṭham nṛṇām naram
translated: For we do not choose you two, but we worship Indra, the strongest man among men.

original: sa naḥ kadā cid arvatā gamad ā vājasātaye gamad ā medhasātaye nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: sa naḥ kadā cit arvatā gamat ā vāja sātaye gamat ā medha sātaye nabhantām anyake same
translated: May he come to us at some time with his chariot to the winning of booty, to the winning of wisdom. Let the others be as stubble.

original: tā hi madhyam bharāṇām indrāgnī adhikṣitaḥ /
analyzed: tā hi madhyam bharāṇām indra agnī adhikṣitaḥ
translated: For they are the middle of treasures, O Indra and Agni, the overlords.

original: tā u kavitvanā kavī pṛcchyamānā sakhīyate saṃ dhītam aśnutaṃ narā nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: tā u kavitvanā kavī pṛcchyamānā sakhīyate sam dhītam aśnutam narā nabhantām anyake same
translated: Those two, as poets, are to be asked as friends. They win the song, O heroes. Let the others be as stubble.

original: abhy arca nabhākavad indrāgnī yajasā girā /
analyzed: abhī arca nabhāka vat indra agnī yajasā girā
translated: Praise Indra and Agni as Nâbhâgâsva, with a hymn of praise.

original: yayor viśvam idaṃ jagad iyaṃ dyauḥ pṛthivī mahy upasthe bibhṛto vasu nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: yayoḥ viśvam idam jagat iyam dyauḥ pṛthivī mahī upasthe bibhṛtaḥ vasu nabhantām anyake same
translated: By whom this whole world is supported, this great heaven and earth, and they bear treasure in their lap. Let the others be as stubble.

original: pra brahmāṇi nabhākavad indrāgnibhyām irajyata /
analyzed: pra brahmāṇi nabhāka vat indra agnibhyām irajyata
translated: The prayers of Nâbhâgâsva are exalted for Indra and Agni.

original: yā saptabudhnam arṇavaṃ jihmabāram aporṇuta indra īśāna ojasā nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: yā sapta budhnam arṇavam jihma bāram aporṇutaḥ indraḥ īśānaḥ ojasā nabhantām anyake same
translated: He who opened the seven-bottomed flood, the crooked-barred, Indra, the lord by his strength. Let the others be as stubble.

original: api vṛśca purāṇavad vratater iva guṣpitam ojo dāsasya dambhaya /🔽vayaṃ tad asya sambhṛtaṃ vasv indreṇa vi bhajemahi nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: api vṛśca purāṇa vat vratateḥ iva guṣpitam ojaḥ dāsasya dambhaya  vayam tat asya sambhṛtam vasu indreṇa vi bhajemahi nabhantām anyake same
translated: Cut off as of old, as if from a vow, the hidden strength of the Dâsa.🔽We will divide that wealth of his which is gathered together, with Indra. Let the others be as stubble.

original: yad indrāgnī janā ime vihvayante tanā girā /
analyzed: yat indra agnī janāḥ ime vihvayante tanā girā
translated: When these people, O Indra and Agni, rejoice in you with song and body,

original: asmākebhir nṛbhir vayaṃ sāsahyāma pṛtanyato vanuyāma vanuṣyato nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: asmākebhiḥ nṛbhiḥ vayam sāsahyāma pṛtanyataḥ vanuyāma vanuṣyataḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: With our men may we conquer the foemen, and overcome the overcome. Let the others be as dust beneath our feet.

original: yā nu śvetāv avo diva uccarāta upa dyubhiḥ /
analyzed: yā nu śvetau avas divaḥ uccarātaḥ upa dyubhiḥ
translated: Those which, white, have come down from the sky with the lights,

original: indrāgnyor anu vratam uhānā yanti sindhavo yān sīm bandhād amuñcatāṃ nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: indra agnyoḥ anu vratam uhānāḥ yanti sindhavaḥ yān sīm bandhāt amuñcatām nabhantām anyake same
translated: following the rule of Indra and Agni, the rivers which he has loosed from the bond, let the others be as dust beneath our feet.

original: pūrvīṣ ṭa indropamātayaḥ pūrvīr uta praśastayaḥ sūno hinvasya harivaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvīḥ te indra upamātayaḥ pūrvīḥ uta praśastayaḥ sūno hinvasya harivas
translated: Many are the praises of Indra, many the eulogies, O son of Hinvān, O lord of bays,

original: vasvo vīrasyāpṛco yā nu sādhanta no dhiyo nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: vasvaḥ vīrasya āpṛcaḥ yāḥ nu sādhanta naḥ dhiyaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: of the good hero, which they accomplish for us. Let the others be as dust beneath our feet.

original: taṃ śiśītā suvṛktibhis tveṣaṃ satvānam ṛgmiyam /
analyzed: tam śiśīta suvṛktibhiḥ tveṣam satvānam ṛgmiyam
translated: Sharpen him with good hymns, the bright, strong one, worthy of the hymn,

original: uto nu cid ya ojasā śuṣṇasyāṇḍāni bhedati jeṣat svarvatīr apo nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: uta u nu cit yaḥ ojasā śuṣṇasya aṇḍāni bhedati jeṣat svarvatīḥ apaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: and he who with his might will burst asunder the eggs of Ṣushṇa, will win the waters that lead to heaven. Let the others be as dust beneath our feet.

original: taṃ śiśītā svadhvaraṃ satyaṃ satvānam ṛtviyam /
analyzed: tam śiśīta su adhvaram satyam satvānam ṛtviyam
translated: Sharpen him, the self-controlled, the true, the strong, the proper one,

original: uto nu cid ya ohata āṇḍā śuṣṇasya bhedaty ajaiḥ svarvatīr apo nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: uta u nu cit yaḥ ohate āṇḍā śuṣṇasya bhedati ajaiḥ svarvatīḥ apaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: and he who will burst asunder the eggs of Ṣushṇa, will win the waters that lead to heaven. Let the others be as dust beneath our feet.

original: evendrāgnibhyām pitṛvan navīyo mandhātṛvad aṅgirasvad avāci /
analyzed: eva indra agnibhyām pitṛ vat navīyaḥ mandhātṛ vat aṅgirasvat avāci
translated: Thus to Indra and Agni I have sung a newer song than the fathers', O Angiras, like Mandhâtar.

original: tridhātunā śarmaṇā pātam asmān vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām //
analyzed: tri dhātunā śarmaṇā pātam asmān vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: Protect us with your three-fold shelter, may we be lords of wealth.

original: asmā ū ṣu prabhūtaye varuṇāya marudbhyo 'rcā viduṣṭarebhyaḥ /
analyzed: asmai u su prabhūtaye varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ rca viduṣṭarebhyaḥ
translated: To him, to Varuna, to the Maruts, to the most excellent ones, offer praise.

original: yo dhītā mānuṣāṇām paśvo gā iva rakṣati nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: yaḥ dhītā mānuṣāṇām paśvaḥ gāḥ iva rakṣati nabhantām anyake same
translated: He who protects the offspring of men like cattle, like cows. Let the others perish.

original: tam ū ṣu samanā girā pitṝṇāṃ ca manmabhiḥ /
analyzed: tam u su samanā girā pitṝṇām ca manmabhiḥ
translated: To him, to the navel, with a hymn in unison with the thoughts of the fathers,

original: nābhākasya praśastibhir yaḥ sindhūnām upodaye saptasvasā sa madhyamo nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: nābhākasya praśastibhiḥ yaḥ sindhūnām upodaye sapta svasā sa madhyamaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: with the praises of Nabhaga, he who is at the rising of the rivers, the middle one with seven sisters. Let the others perish.

original: sa kṣapaḥ pari ṣasvaje ny usro māyayā dadhe sa viśvam pari darśataḥ /
analyzed: sa kṣapaḥ pari sasvaje ni usraḥ māyayā dadhe sa viśvam pari darśataḥ
translated: He, the night, has embraced, the dawn has set down with her magic. He is all around, visible.

original: tasya venīr anu vratam uṣas tisro avardhayan nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: tasya venīḥ anu vratam uṣaḥ tisraḥ avardhayan nabhantām anyake same
translated: His braids, according to his vow, the three dawns have increased. Let the others perish.

original: yaḥ kakubho nidhārayaḥ pṛthivyām adhi darśataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ kakubhaḥ nidhārayaḥ pṛthivyām adhi darśataḥ
translated: He who supports the directions, who is visible on the earth,

original: sa mātā pūrvyam padaṃ tad varuṇasya saptyaṃ sa hi gopā iveryo nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: sa mātā pūrvyam padam tat varuṇasya saptyam sa hi gopāḥ iva iryaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: he is the mother, the ancient place, that is Varuna's power. He is like a guardian. Let the others perish.

original: yo dhartā bhuvanānāṃ ya usrāṇām apīcyā veda nāmāni guhyā /
analyzed: yaḥ dhartā bhuvanānām yaḥ usrāṇām apīcyā veda nāmāni guhyā
translated: He who is the supporter of the worlds, who knows the hidden names of the dawns,

original: sa kaviḥ kāvyā puru rūpaṃ dyaur iva puṣyati nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: sa kaviḥ kāvyā puru rūpam dyauḥ iva puṣyati nabhantām anyake same
translated: He, the wise one, the poet, increases his multi-formed glory like the sky. Let the others be destroyed!

original: yasmin viśvāni kāvyā cakre nābhir iva śritā /
analyzed: yasmin viśvāni kāvyā cakre nābhiḥ iva śritā
translated: In whom all the poetic compositions are placed, as if in a navel.

original: tritaṃ jūtī saparyata vraje gāvo na saṃyuje yuje aśvāṃ ayukṣata nabhantām anyake same //🔽ya āsv atka āśaye viśvā jātāny eṣām /🔽pari dhāmāni marmṛśad varuṇasya puro gaye viśve devā anu vrataṃ nabhantām anyake same //🔽sa samudro apīcyas turo dyām iva rohati ni yad āsu yajur dadhe /
analyzed: tritam jūtī saparyata vraje gāvaḥ na saṃyuje yuje aśvān ayukṣata nabhantām anyake same  yaḥ āsu atkaḥ āśaye viśvā jātāni eṣām  pari dhāmāni marmṛśat varuṇasya puras gaye viśve devāḥ anu vratam nabhantām anyake same  sa samudraḥ apīcyaḥ turaḥ dyām iva rohati ni yat āsu yajuḥ dadhe
translated: They served Trita with speed, like cows to a pen, like horses to a yoke. Let the others be destroyed!

original: sa māyā arcinā padāstṛṇān nākam āruhan nabhantām anyake same //🔽yasya śvetā vicakṣaṇā tisro bhūmīr adhikṣitaḥ /🔽trir uttarāṇi papratur varuṇasya dhruvaṃ sadaḥ sa saptānām irajyati nabhantām anyake same //🔽yaḥ śvetāṃ adhinirṇijaś cakre kṛṣṇāṃ anu vratā /
analyzed: sa māyāḥ arcinā padā astṛṇāt nākam āruhat nabhantām anyake same 🔽yasya śvetā vicakṣaṇā tisraḥ bhūmīḥ adhikṣitaḥ 🔽tris uttarāṇi papratuḥ varuṇasya dhruvam sadaḥ sa saptānām irajyati nabhantām anyake same 🔽yaḥ śvetām adhinirṇijaḥ cakre kṛṣṇām anu vratā
translated: He who in the womb of the waters, in the abode of the waters, in the highest heaven, in the highest light, in the highest firmament, in the highest abode, in the highest heaven, in the original: sa dhāma pūrvyam mame ya skambhena vi rodasī ajo na dyām adhārayan nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: sa dhāma pūrvyam mame ya skambhena vi rodasī ajaḥ na dyām adhārayat nabhantām anyake same
translated: He who with the prop hath measured out the two world-halves, the ancient abode of mine, the goat hath upheld the sky. Let the others be confounded.

original: astabhnād dyām asuro viśvavedā amimīta varimāṇam pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: astabhnāt dyām asuraḥ viśva vedāḥ amimīta varimāṇam pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The Asura, all-knowing, hath propped the sky, hath measured out the breadth of the earth.

original: āsīdad viśvā bhuvanāni samrāḍ viśvet tāni varuṇasya vratāni //
analyzed: āsīdat viśvā bhuvanāni samrāj viśvā id tāni varuṇasya vratāni
translated: He hath sat down, the emperor, over all existing things. All these are the ordinances of Varuna.

original: evā vandasva varuṇam bṛhantaṃ namasyā dhīram amṛtasya gopām /
analyzed: eva vandasva varuṇam bṛhantam namasya dhīram amṛtasya gopām
translated: So worship thou Varuna the mighty, pay homage to the wise guardian of immortality.

original: sa naḥ śarma trivarūthaṃ vi yaṃsat pātaṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī upasthe //
analyzed: sa naḥ śarma tri varūtham vi yaṃsat pātam naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī upasthe
translated: May he grant us protection threefold, may Heaven and Earth grant it in their lap.

original: imāṃ dhiyaṃ śikṣamāṇasya deva kratuṃ dakṣaṃ varuṇa saṃ śiśādhi /
analyzed: imām dhiyam śikṣamāṇasya deva kratum dakṣam varuṇa sam śiśādhi
translated: This thought of him who is training, O God, this wisdom, this skill, O Varuna, sharpen thou.

original: yayāti viśvā duritā tarema sutarmāṇam adhi nāvaṃ ruhema //
analyzed: yayā ati viśvā duritā tarema su tarmāṇam adhi nāvam ruhema
translated: By which we may pass over all distresses, may we mount the well-going ship.

original: ā vāṃ grāvāṇo aśvinā dhībhir viprā acucyavuḥ /
analyzed: ā vām grāvāṇaḥ aśvinā dhībhiḥ viprāḥ acucyavuḥ
translated: The priests, O Asvins, have urged you with thoughts, with hymns, the pressing-stones.

original: nāsatyā somapītaye nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: nāsatyā soma pītaye nabhantām anyake same
translated: O Nâsatyas, for the drinking of the Soma. Let the others be confounded.

original: yathā vām atrir aśvinā gīrbhir vipro ajohavīt /
analyzed: yathā vām atriḥ aśvinā gīrbhiḥ vipraḥ ajohavīt
translated: As the sage Atri, O Asvins, hath invoked you with songs,

original: nāsatyā somapītaye nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: nāsatyā soma pītaye nabhantām anyake same
translated: O Nâsatyas, for the drinking of the Soma. Let the others be confounded.

original: evā vām ahva ūtaye yathāhuvanta medhirāḥ /
analyzed: eva vām ahve ūtaye yathā ahuvanta medhirāḥ
translated: So I call you to help, as the wise have called you,

original: nāsatyā somapītaye nabhantām anyake same //
analyzed: nāsatyā soma pītaye nabhantām anyake same
translated: O Nāsatyas, let the others be crushed for you to drink the Soma.

original: ime viprasya vedhaso 'gner astṛtayajvanaḥ /
analyzed: ime viprasya vedhasaḥ gneḥ astṛta yajvanaḥ
translated: These are the songs of praise of the wise priest, of Agni who offers without fail,

original: gira stomāsa īrate //
analyzed: giraḥ stomāsaḥ īrate
translated: The hymns rise up.

original: asmai te pratiharyate jātavedo vicarṣaṇe /
analyzed: asmai te pratiharyate jātavedaḥ vicarṣaṇe
translated: To you, O all-active Jātavedas, to whom the oblation is presented,

original: agne janāmi suṣṭutim //
analyzed: agne janāmi suṣṭutim
translated: O Agni, I offer this good praise.

original: ārokā iva ghed aha tigmā agne tava tviṣaḥ /
analyzed: ārokāḥ iva gha id aha tigmāḥ agne tava tviṣaḥ
translated: O Agni, your flames are like arrows,

original: dadbhir vanāni bapsati //🔽harayo dhūmaketavo vātajūtā upa dyavi /
analyzed: dadbhiḥ vanāni bapsati  harayaḥ dhūma ketavaḥ vāta jūtāḥ upa dyavi
translated: With your teeth you crush the woods.🔽The tawny ones, with smoke as their banner, driven by the wind to the sky,

original: yatante vṛthag agnayaḥ //
analyzed: yatante vṛthak agnayaḥ
translated: The fires strive in vain.

original: ete tye vṛthag agnaya iddhāsaḥ sam adṛkṣata /
analyzed: ete tye vṛthak agnayaḥ iddhāsaḥ sam adṛkṣata
translated: These are the fires striving in vain, seen together, kindled,

original: uṣasām iva ketavaḥ //
analyzed: uṣasām iva ketavaḥ
translated: Like the banners of the dawns.

analyzed: yat vīḍayāsi vīḷu tat

analyzed: rathītamaḥ rathīnām

analyzed: asmākam su ratham puras indraḥ kṛṇotu sātaye

analyzed: na yam dhūrvanti dhūrtayaḥ

analyzed: vṛjyāma te pari dviṣaḥ ram te śakra dāvane

original: gamemed indra gomataḥ //
analyzed: gamema id indra gomataḥ

analyzed: vivakṣaṇāḥ anehasaḥ

original: ūrdhvā hi te divedive sahasrā sūnṛtā śatā /
analyzed: ūrdhvā hi te dive dive sahasrā sūnṛtā śatā
translated: For to thy worshippers, O Indra, the thousands and hundreds of thy bounties

original: jaritṛbhyo vimaṃhate //
analyzed: jaritṛbhyaḥ vimaṃhate

analyzed: vidma hi tvā dhanañjayam indra dṛḷhā cit ārujam

analyzed: ādāriṇam yathā gayam

analyzed: ā tvā paṇim yat īmahe

original: yas te revāṃ adāśuriḥ pramamarṣa maghattaye /
analyzed: yaḥ te revān adāśuriḥ pramamarṣa maghattaye
translated: Thy most bountiful favour, which thou hast not endured for the sake of wealth,

original: tasya no veda ā bhara //
analyzed: tasya naḥ vedaḥ ā bhara

original: ima u tvā vi cakṣate sakhāya indra sominaḥ /
analyzed: ime u tvā vi cakṣate sakhāyaḥ indra sominaḥ

original: dūrād iha havāmahe //
analyzed: dūrāt iha havāmahe

original: godā id indra bodhi naḥ //
analyzed: go dāḥ id indra bodhi naḥ

analyzed: uśmasi tvā sadhasthe ā

analyzed: stotram indrāya gāyata puru nṛmṇāya satvane

original: mākīm brahmadviṣo vanaḥ //
analyzed: mākīm brahma dviṣaḥ vanaḥ

original: iha tvā goparīṇasā mahe mandantu rādhase /
analyzed: iha tvā go parīṇasā mahe mandantu rādhase
translated: Here let the milk-surrounded (waters) gladden you for the great gift.

original: saro gauro yathā piba //
analyzed: saraḥ gauraḥ yathā piba

original: yā vṛtrahā parāvati sanā navā ca cucyuve /

analyzed: tā saṃsatsu pra vocata

analyzed: apibat kadruvaḥ sutam indraḥ sahasra bāhve

analyzed: atra adediṣṭa pauṃsyam

analyzed: samānam u pra śaṃsiṣam

analyzed: jigātu indra te manaḥ

analyzed: yat indra mṛḍayāsi naḥ

analyzed: vadhīḥ mā śūra bhūriṣu

analyzed: dasmāt aham ṛtīṣahaḥ

analyzed: vasu spārham tat ā bhara

analyzed: vasu spārham tat ā bhara
translated: Bring thou that desirable wealth.

analyzed: yasya te viśva mānuṣaḥ bhūreḥ dattasya vedati

analyzed: vasu spārham tat ā bhara

analyzed: gīrbhiḥ gṛṇanti kāravaḥ

analyzed: su nīthaḥ gha sa martyaḥ yam marutaḥ yam aryamā
translated: Blessed is that mortal, O Maruts, whom Aryaman

analyzed: sadā rāyā puruspṛhā

original: nūnam atha //
analyzed: nūnam atha

analyzed: viśveṣām irajyantam vasūnām sāsahvāṃsam cit asya varpasaḥ

analyzed: kṛpayataḥ nūnam ati atha

original: ye pātayante ajmabhir girīṇāṃ snubhir eṣām /

analyzed: yajñam mahiṣvaṇīnām sumnam tuviṣvaṇīnām pra adhvare

analyzed: prabhaṅgam durmatīnām indra śaviṣṭha ā bhara
translated: Bring, O Indra, most powerful, the destruction of evil counsels,

analyzed: yaḥ aśvebhiḥ vahate usrāḥ tris sapta saptatīnām
translated: He who is borne by horses, by the wealth of the sun, by the three times seven and seventy.

translated: By these Soma-pressings, by these Soma-pressers, by these Soma-drinkers, purified by the pure, for the sake of gifts.

original: mahi vo mahatām avo varuṇa mitra dāśuṣe /
analyzed: mahi vaḥ mahatām avaḥ varuṇa mitra dāśuṣe
translated: Great is your great help, O Varuṇa and Mitra, to the worshipper,

original: yam ādityā abhi druho rakṣathā nem aghaṃ naśad anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: yam ādityāḥ abhi druhaḥ rakṣatha na īm agham naśat anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: Whom, O Âdityas, ye protect from the spiteful man: let not his sin come nigh him. Your aids are free from anger, your aids are well-yoked.

original: vidā devā aghānām ādityāso apākṛtim /
analyzed: vida devāḥ aghānām ādityāsaḥ apākṛtim
translated: Ye Gods, find ye the sinners' sin, O Âdityas, and destroy it.

original: pakṣā vayo yathopari vy asme śarma yacchatānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: pakṣā vayaḥ yathā upari vi asme śarma yacchata anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: As wings and feathers are above, so spread ye out your sheltering wings over us. Your aids are free from anger, your aids are well-yoked.

original: vy asme adhi śarma tat pakṣā vayo na yantana /
analyzed: vi asme adhi śarma tat pakṣā vayaḥ na yantana
translated: Ye have spread out over us that shelter which,

original: viśvāni viśvavedaso varūthyā manāmahe 'nehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: viśvāni viśva vedasaḥ varūthyā manāmahe nehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: Like wings and feathers, ye have brought. We think upon you, O ye finders of all wealth, as our protectors. Your aids are free from anger, your aids are well-yoked.

original: yasmā arāsata kṣayaṃ jīvātuṃ ca pracetasaḥ /
analyzed: yasmai arāsata kṣayam jīvātum ca pracetasaḥ
translated: From whom, the wise, ye have made us to turn away destruction and to live,

original: manor viśvasya ghed ima ādityā rāya īśate 'nehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: manoḥ viśvasya gha id ime ādityāḥ rāyaḥ īśate nehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: The Âdityas, O ye finders of all wealth, have power over all this world's riches. Your aids are free from anger, your aids are well-yoked.

original: pari ṇo vṛṇajann aghā durgāṇi rathyo yathā /
analyzed: pari naḥ vṛṇajan aghā durgāṇi rathyaḥ yathā
translated: As a good chariot-seat may we sit down, and turn away the sins and troubles that beset us.

original: syāmed indrasya śarmaṇy ādityānām utāvasy anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: syāma id indrasya śarmaṇi ādityānām uta avasi anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: May we be in the shelter of Indra, and in the shelter of the Âdityas. Your aids are free from anger, your aids are well-yoked.

original: parihvṛted anā jano yuṣmādattasya vāyati /
analyzed: parihvṛtā id anā janaḥ yuṣmādattasya vāyati
translated: The people who are round about us, who are under your control,

original: devā adabhram āśa vo yam ādityā ahetanānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: devāḥ adabhram āśa vaḥ yam ādityāḥ ahetana anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: The Gods, the irresistible, whose help, O Âdityas, is not to be deceived, whose succours are not to be deceived, whose succours are good,

original: na taṃ tigmaṃ cana tyajo na drāsad abhi taṃ guru /
analyzed: na tam tigmam cana tyajaḥ na drāsat abhi tam guru
translated: Him not the keenest weapon wounds, nor the most powerful one pierces.

original: yasmā u śarma sapratha ādityāso arādhvam anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: yasmai u śarma saprathaḥ ādityāsaḥ arādhvam anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: To him, O Âdityas, to whom ye grant wide shelter, to him who worships you, whose succours are not to be deceived, whose succours are good,

original: yuṣme devā api ṣmasi yudhyanta iva varmasu /
analyzed: yuṣme devāḥ api smasi yudhyantaḥ iva varmasu
translated: Even as men fighting on in mail, O Gods, are ye to us.

original: yūyam maho na enaso yūyam arbhād uruṣyatānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: yūyam mahaḥ naḥ enasaḥ yūyam arbhāt uruṣyata anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: Ye from the great offence, ye from the lesser sin preserve us, whose succours are not to be deceived, whose succours are good,

original: aditir na uruṣyatv aditiḥ śarma yacchatu /
analyzed: aditiḥ naḥ uruṣyatu aditiḥ śarma yacchatu
translated: May Aditi protect us, may Aditi give shelter.

original: mātā mitrasya revato 'ryamṇo varuṇasya cānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //🔽yad devāḥ śarma śaraṇaṃ yad bhadraṃ yad anāturam /
analyzed: mātā mitrasya revataḥ ryamṇaḥ varuṇasya ca anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ  yat devāḥ śarma śaraṇam yat bhadram yat anāturam
translated: The mother of Mitra, of Varuna, of the bountiful Aryaman, whose succours are not to be deceived, whose succours are good,🔽What shelter, what protection, what bliss, what freedom from disease,

original: tridhātu yad varūthyaṃ tad asmāsu vi yantanānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: tri dhātu yat varūthyam tat asmāsu vi yantana anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: What threefold shelter ye have, O Gods, that shelter be with us, whose succours are not to be deceived, whose succours are good,

original: ādityā ava hi khyatādhi kūlād iva spaśaḥ /
analyzed: ādityāḥ ava hi khyata adhi kūlāt iva spaśaḥ
translated: O Âdityas, come ye down from heaven, as Sûrya's rays from heaven,

original: sutīrtham arvato yathānu no neṣathā sugam anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: su tīrtham arvataḥ yathā anu naḥ neṣatha sugam anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: As ye lead us to a good ford, O ye swift ones, so lead us to a good path, O ye guileless ones, to good deliverances, to very good deliverances.

original: neha bhadraṃ rakṣasvine nāvayai nopayā uta /
analyzed: na iha bhadram rakṣasvine na avayai na upayai uta
translated: Here is no good for the Raksas, nor for the deceitful, nor for the niggardly.

original: gave ca bhadraṃ dhenave vīrāya ca śravasyate 'nehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: gave ca bhadram dhenave vīrāya ca śravasyate nehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: And good for the cow, the milch cow, and for the hero who desires glory. To us come deliverances free from guile, very good deliverances.

original: yad āvir yad apīcyaṃ devāso asti duṣkṛtam /
analyzed: yat āvis yat apīcyam devāsaḥ asti duṣkṛtam
translated: Whatever misfortune, whatever evil is among the gods, whether manifest or hidden,

original: trite tad viśvam āptya āre asmad dadhātanānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: trite tat viśvam āptye āre asmat dadhātana anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: All that, O Trita, O Aptya, place thou far away from us. To us come deliverances free from guile, very good deliverances.

original: yac ca goṣu duṣṣvapnyaṃ yac cāsme duhitar divaḥ /
analyzed: yat ca goṣu duṣṣvapnyam yat ca asme duhitar divaḥ
translated: And whatever misfortune is among the cows, and whatever is among us, O daughter of the sky,

original: tritāya tad vibhāvary āptyāya parā vahānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: tritāya tat vibhāvari āptyāya parā vaha anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: To Trita, O Vibhvanî, O Aptya, bear it away. To us come deliverances free from guile, very good deliverances.

original: niṣkaṃ vā ghā kṛṇavate srajaṃ vā duhitar divaḥ /
analyzed: niṣkam vā gha kṛṇavate srajam vā duhitar divaḥ
translated: Or make it a necklace, O daughter of the sky,

original: trite duṣṣvapnyaṃ sarvam āptye pari dadmasy anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: trite duṣṣvapnyam sarvam āptye pari dadmasi anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: To Trita, to Aptya, we give all misfortune. To us come deliverances free from guile, very good deliverances.

original: tadannāya tadapase tam bhāgam upaseduṣe /
analyzed: tad annāya tad apase tam bhāgam upaseduṣe
translated: That food, that refreshment, that portion to the guest who hath come nigh,

original: tritāya ca dvitāya coṣo duṣṣvapnyaṃ vahānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: tritāya ca dvitāya ca uṣaḥ duṣṣvapnyam vaha anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: To the three-fold and the two-fold, to the dawn, bear away evil dreams, O ye who have no foes, your aids are good aids, your aids are very good.

original: yathā kalāṃ yathā śaphaṃ yatha ṛṇaṃ saṃnayāmasi /
analyzed: yathā kalām yathā śapham yathā ṛṇam saṃnayāmasi
translated: Even as we pay off a debt, a fine, a forfeit,

original: evā duṣṣvapnyaṃ sarvam āptye saṃ nayāmasy anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: eva duṣṣvapnyam sarvam āptye sam nayāmasi anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: even so do we pay off all evil dreams to the All-surpassing One. I have no foes, your aids are good aids, your aids are very good.

original: ajaiṣmādyāsanāma cābhūmānāgaso vayam /🔽uṣo yasmād duṣṣvapnyād abhaiṣmāpa tad ucchatv anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ //
analyzed: ajaiṣma adya asanāma ca abhūma anāgasaḥ vayam  uṣaḥ yasmāt duṣṣvapnyāt abhaiṣma apa tat ucchatu anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: We have conquered, we have won, we have become sinless.🔽From whatever evil dream we have been afraid, O Dawn, drive that away from us. I have no foes, your aids are good aids, your aids are very good.

original: svādor abhakṣi vayasaḥ sumedhāḥ svādhyo varivovittarasya /
analyzed: svādoḥ abhakṣi vayasaḥ sumedhāḥ svādhyaḥ varivaḥ vittarasya
translated: I have eaten of the sweet food of the wise, the wide-ruling, the well-disposed.

original: viśve yaṃ devā uta martyāso madhu bruvanto abhi saṃcaranti //
analyzed: viśve yam devāḥ uta martyāsaḥ madhu bruvantaḥ abhi saṃcaranti
translated: To him whom all the gods and mortal men approach with words of sweetness.

original: antaś ca prāgā aditir bhavāsy avayātā haraso daivyasya /
analyzed: antar ca prāgāḥ aditiḥ bhavāsi avayātā harasaḥ daivyasya
translated: Be thou within and in front, O Aditi, pass by the divine punishment.

original: indav indrasya sakhyaṃ juṣāṇaḥ śrauṣṭīva dhuram anu rāya ṛdhyāḥ //
analyzed: indo indrasya sakhyam juṣāṇaḥ śrauṣṭī iva dhuram anu rāyaḥ ṛdhyāḥ
translated: O Soma, rejoicing in Indra's friendship, prosper in wealth, as one who hears, along the ridge.

original: apāma somam amṛtā abhūmāganma jyotir avidāma devān /
analyzed: apāma somam amṛtāḥ abhūma aganma jyotiḥ avidāma devān
translated: We have become immortal by drinking Soma, we have attained the light, we have found the gods.

original: kiṃ nūnam asmān kṛṇavad arātiḥ kim u dhūrtir amṛta martyasya //
analyzed: kim nūnam asmān kṛṇavat arātiḥ kim u dhūrtiḥ amṛta martyasya
translated: What evil will he do to us? What is the mortal's weapon, O Immortal One?

original: śaṃ no bhava hṛda ā pīta indo piteva soma sūnave suśevaḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ bhava hṛde ā pītaḥ indo pitā iva soma sūnave su śevaḥ
translated: Be auspicious to our heart, O Indu, when drunk, O Soma, be kindly to thy son, as a father.

original: sakheva sakhya uruśaṃsa dhīraḥ pra ṇa āyur jīvase soma tārīḥ //
analyzed: sakhā iva sakhye uru śaṃsa dhīraḥ pra naḥ āyuḥ jīvase soma tārīḥ
translated: As a friend, O thou of wide sway, as a wise friend, O Soma, prolong our life that we may live.

original: ime mā pītā yaśasa uruṣyavo rathaṃ na gāvaḥ sam anāha parvasu /
analyzed: ime mā pītāḥ yaśasaḥ uruṣyavaḥ ratham na gāvaḥ sam anāha parvasu
translated: These, drunk, have preserved me, O famous one, for long life, as the joints of a chariot the horses at the feasts.

original: te mā rakṣantu visrasaś caritrād uta mā srāmād yavayantv indavaḥ //🔽agniṃ na mā mathitaṃ saṃ didīpaḥ pra cakṣaya kṛṇuhi vasyaso naḥ /
analyzed: te mā rakṣantu visrasaḥ caritrāt uta mā srāmāt yavayantu indavaḥ  agnim na mā mathitam sam didīpaḥ pra cakṣaya kṛṇuhi vasyasaḥ naḥ
translated: May they protect me from the snares and from the chase, and may the drops prolong my life.🔽Do thou, O Soma, shine forth like a rubbed (fire) kindled, and make us possessors of prosperity.

original: athā hi te mada ā soma manye revāṃ iva pra carā puṣṭim accha //
analyzed: athā hi te made ā soma manye revān iva pra cara puṣṭim accha
translated: Then, O Soma, I think of thy rapture, as of wealth, do thou send it forth for increase.

original: iṣireṇa te manasā sutasya bhakṣīmahi pitryasyeva rāyaḥ /
analyzed: iṣireṇa te manasā sutasya bhakṣīmahi pitryasya iva rāyaḥ
translated: With a longing for thy juice, we would enjoy it, as of paternal wealth.

original: soma rājan pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tārīr ahānīva sūryo vāsarāṇi //
analyzed: soma rājan pra naḥ āyūṃṣi tārīḥ ahāni iva sūryaḥ vāsarāṇi
translated: O Soma, king, prolong our lives, as the sun the days and nights.

original: soma rājan mṛḷayā naḥ svasti tava smasi vratyās tasya viddhi /
analyzed: soma rājan mṛḍaya naḥ svasti tava smasi vratyāḥ tasya viddhi
translated: O Soma, king, be gracious to us, we are thy servants, know it.

original: alarti dakṣa uta manyur indo mā no aryo anukāmam parā dāḥ //
analyzed: alarti dakṣaḥ uta manyuḥ indo mā naḥ aryaḥ anukāmam parā dāḥ
translated: Let not thy strength fail, nor thy wrath, O Indu, give not up our desire to the enemy.

original: tvaṃ hi nas tanvaḥ soma gopā gātregātre niṣasatthā nṛcakṣāḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi naḥ tanvaḥ soma gopāḥ gātre gātre niṣasattha nṛ cakṣāḥ
translated: For thou, O Soma, art the guardian of our bodies, looking on men, seated in every limb.

original: yat te vayam pramināma vratāni sa no mṛḷa suṣakhā deva vasyaḥ //🔽ṛdūdareṇa sakhyā saceya yo mā na riṣyed dharyaśva pītaḥ /
analyzed: yat te vayam pramināma vratāni sa naḥ mṛḍa su sakhā deva vasyaḥ  ṛdūdareṇa sakhyā saceya yaḥ mā na riṣyet hari aśva pītaḥ
translated: If we have broken thy ordinances, be gracious to us, O God, most friendly to thy suppliants.🔽With the kind-hearted friend may I be united, who shall not injure me, O thou who art drunk by tawny steeds.

original: ayaṃ yaḥ somo ny adhāyy asme tasmā indram pratiram emy āyuḥ //
analyzed: ayam yaḥ somaḥ ni adhāyi asme tasmai indram pratiram emi āyuḥ
translated: This Soma which hath been poured for us, for him I send forth life, O Indra, to return.

original: apa tyā asthur anirā amīvā nir atrasan tamiṣīcīr abhaiṣuḥ /
analyzed: apa tyāḥ asthuḥ anirāḥ amīvāḥ niḥ atrasan tamiṣīcīḥ abhaiṣuḥ
translated: They have departed, the diseases, the maladies; they have been frightened away, the flames of fire.

original: ā somo asmāṃ aruhad vihāyā aganma yatra pratiranta āyuḥ //
analyzed: ā somaḥ asmān aruhat vihāyāḥ aganma yatra pratirante āyuḥ
translated: Soma hath mounted up to us from the earth. We have come to that place where they prolong life.

original: yo na induḥ pitaro hṛtsu pīto 'martyo martyāṃ āviveśa /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ induḥ pitaraḥ hṛtsu pītaḥ martyaḥ martyān āviveśa
translated: The Indu who, drunk in the hearts of the Fathers, hath entered the mortals, immortal.

original: tasmai somāya haviṣā vidhema mṛḷīke asya sumatau syāma //
analyzed: tasmai somāya haviṣā vidhema mṛḷīke asya sumatau syāma
translated: To that Soma let us offer with oblation. May we enjoy his favour and his loving-kindness.

original: tvaṃ soma pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidāno 'nu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha /
analyzed: tvam soma pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ nu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha
translated: Thou, O Soma, in agreement with the Fathers, hast spread thyself along the sky and earth.

original: tasmai ta indo haviṣā vidhema vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām //
analyzed: tasmai te indo haviṣā vidhema vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: To thee, O Indu, let us offer with oblation. May we be lords of wealth.

original: trātāro devā adhi vocatā no mā no nidrā īśata mota jalpiḥ /
analyzed: trātāraḥ devāḥ adhi vocata naḥ mā naḥ nidrā īśata mā uta jalpiḥ
translated: May the protecting Gods grant us their favour. Let not sleep overpower us, nor giddiness.

original: vayaṃ somasya viśvaha priyāsaḥ suvīrāso vidatham ā vadema //
analyzed: vayam somasya viśvaha priyāsaḥ su vīrāsaḥ vidatham ā vadema
translated: We, O Soma, all dear to thee, with brave sons, will speak in the assembly.

original: tvaṃ naḥ soma viśvato vayodhās tvaṃ svarvid ā viśā nṛcakṣāḥ /🔽tvaṃ na inda ūtibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ pāhi paścātād uta vā purastāt //
analyzed: tvam naḥ soma viśvatas vayaḥ dhāḥ tvam svar vid ā viśa nṛ cakṣāḥ  tvam naḥ indo ūtibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ pāhi paścātāt uta vā purastāt
translated: Thou, O Soma, art our all-round bestower of strength, thou art the finder of heaven, thou art the guest who looks on men.🔽Be thou, O Indra, with thy aids, of one mind with us, protect us from the rear and from the front.

original: abhi pra vaḥ surādhasam indram arca yathā vide /🔽yo jaritṛbhyo maghavā purūvasuḥ sahasreṇeva śikṣati //
analyzed: abhi pra vaḥ su rādhasam indram arca yathā vide  yaḥ jaritṛbhyaḥ maghavā purūvasuḥ sahasreṇa iva śikṣati
translated: To him the bestower of good gifts, to Indra, I will sing forth as I have known him,🔽Who, the bountiful, with a thousand (gifts), as it were, helps the praisers.

original: śatānīkeva pra jigāti dhṛṣṇuyā hanti vṛtrāṇi dāśuṣe /
analyzed: śata anīkā iva pra jigāti dhṛṣṇuyā hanti vṛtrāṇi dāśuṣe
translated: He goes forth to conquer in a hundred battles, he slays the Vr̥itras for the worshipper.

original: girer iva pra rasā asya pinvire datrāṇi purubhojasaḥ //🔽ā tvā sutāsa indavo madā ya indra girvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: gireḥ iva pra rasāḥ asya pinvire datrāṇi puru bhojasaḥ  ā tvā sutāsaḥ indavaḥ madāḥ ye indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: As from a mountain so from him flow forth the streams of bounty, O bountiful one.🔽To thee, O Indra, the drops pressed out (are offered), those which, O thou who lovest the song, delight thee.

original: āpo na vajrinn anv okyaṃ saraḥ pṛṇanti śūra rādhase //
analyzed: āpaḥ na vajrin anu okyam saraḥ pṛṇanti śūra rādhase
