translated: As the waters, O thou with the thunderbolt, fill the lake for the hero's bounty.

original: anehasam prataraṇaṃ vivakṣaṇam madhvaḥ svādiṣṭham īm piba /🔽ā yathā mandasānaḥ kirāsi naḥ pra kṣudreva tmanā dhṛṣat //
analyzed: anehasam prataraṇam vivakṣaṇam madhvaḥ svādiṣṭham īm piba  ā yathā mandasānaḥ kirāsi naḥ pra kṣudrā iva tmanā dhṛṣat
translated: Drink thou the most delicious of the sweet, the unstinted, the far-spreading, the gladdening.🔽As thou art wont to rejoice, so be thou bold for us, as for a weakling, of thine own accord.

original: ā na stomam upa dravad dhiyāno aśvo na sotṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ stomam upa dravat dhiyānaḥ aśvaḥ na sotṛbhiḥ
translated: Come to our laud, urged on by our thought, as a horse by the charioteers.

original: yaṃ te svadhāvan svadayanti dhenava indra kaṇveṣu rātayaḥ //
analyzed: yam te svadhāvan svadayanti dhenavaḥ indra kaṇveṣu rātayaḥ
translated: O thou of native strength, the milch-kine make sweet for thee, O Indra, the gifts in the Kanvas' house.

original: ugraṃ na vīraṃ namasopa sedima vibhūtim akṣitāvasum /
analyzed: ugram na vīram namasā upa sedima vibhūtim akṣitāvasum
translated: We have approached the fierce hero with homage, the inexhaustible wealth of greatness.

original: udrīva vajrinn avato na siñcate kṣarantīndra dhītayaḥ //
analyzed: udrī iva vajrin avataḥ na siñcate kṣaranti indra dhītayaḥ
translated: Like a swift-flowing stream, O wielder of the thunderbolt, Indra, your thoughts flow down to us.

original: yad dha nūnaṃ yad vā yajñe yad vā pṛthivyām adhi /
analyzed: yat ha nūnam yat vā yajñe yat vā pṛthivyām adhi
translated: Whether it be now, or at the sacrifice, or on the earth,

original: ato no yajñam āśubhir mahemata ugra ugrebhir ā gahi //
analyzed: atas naḥ yajñam āśubhiḥ mahemate ugraḥ ugrebhiḥ ā gahi
translated: From there, O mighty one, with your swift ones, come to our sacrifice with your fierce ones.

original: ajirāso harayo ye ta āśavo vātā iva prasakṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: ajirāsaḥ harayaḥ ye te āśavaḥ vātāḥ iva prasakṣiṇaḥ
translated: Your swift, fleet-footed, swift horses, like winds,

original: yebhir apatyam manuṣaḥ parīyase yebhir viśvaṃ svar dṛśe //
analyzed: yebhiḥ apatyam manuṣaḥ parīyase yebhiḥ viśvam svar dṛśe
translated: With which you go around Manu's offspring, with which you see all the world,

original: etāvatas ta īmaha indra sumnasya gomataḥ /
analyzed: etāvataḥ te īmahe indra sumnasya gomataḥ
translated: From this much, O Indra, we seek your favor, of one who possesses cattle.

original: yathā prāvo maghavan medhyātithiṃ yathā nīpātithiṃ dhane //
analyzed: yathā prāvaḥ maghavan medhyātithim yathā nīpātithim dhane
translated: As you helped Medhyātithi, O bountiful one, as you helped Nīpātithi in battle,

original: yathā kaṇve maghavan trasadasyavi yathā pakthe daśavraje /
analyzed: yathā kaṇve maghavan trasadasyavi yathā pakthe daśavraje
translated: As you helped Kaṇva, O bountiful one, Trasadasyu, as you helped Paktha in Daśavraja,

original: yathā gośarye asanor ṛjiśvanīndra gomad dhiraṇyavat //
analyzed: yathā gośarye asanoḥ ṛjiśvani indra gomat hiraṇyavat
translated: As you helped Gośṛṅga, Asano, Ṛjiśvān, O Indra, with cattle, with gold.

original: pra su śrutaṃ surādhasam arcā śakram abhiṣṭaye /
analyzed: pra su śrutam su rādhasam arca śakram abhiṣṭaye
translated: Praise the well-known, greatly generous Śakra for protection,

original: yaḥ sunvate stuvate kāmyaṃ vasu sahasreṇeva maṃhate //
analyzed: yaḥ sunvate stuvate kāmyam vasu sahasreṇa iva maṃhate
translated: Who gives desirable wealth to the one who presses (soma) and praises, as if he were giving a thousand.

original: śatānīkā hetayo asya duṣṭarā indrasya samiṣo mahīḥ /
analyzed: śata anīkāḥ hetayaḥ asya duṣṭarāḥ indrasya samiṣaḥ mahīḥ
translated: The many, hard-to-resist missiles of Indra, his abundant provisions, are great.

original: girir na bhujmā maghavatsu pinvate yad īṃ sutā amandiṣuḥ //🔽yad īṃ sutāsa indavo 'bhi priyam amandiṣuḥ /🔽āpo na dhāyi savanam ma ā vaso dughā ivopa dāśuṣe //
analyzed: giriḥ na bhujmā maghavatsu pinvate yat īm sutāḥ amandiṣuḥ  yat īm sutāsaḥ indavaḥ bhi priyam amandiṣuḥ  āpaḥ na dhāyi savanam me ā vaso dughāḥ iva upa dāśuṣe
translated: The mountain, like a milch-cow, swells for the bountiful when the pressed juices have gladdened him.🔽When the pressed juices, the drops, have gladdened the dear one,🔽The waters have filled the oblation for me, O good one, like a milch-cow for the worshipper.

original: anehasaṃ vo havamānam ūtaye madhvaḥ kṣaranti dhītayaḥ /
analyzed: anehasam vaḥ havamānam ūtaye madhvaḥ kṣaranti dhītayaḥ
translated: Your faultless help, O Vasu, the hymns flow with sweetness.

original: ā tvā vaso havamānāsa indava upa stotreṣu dadhire //
analyzed: ā tvā vaso havamānāsaḥ indavaḥ upa stotreṣu dadhire
translated: The drops, O good one, have placed you in the praises, when they are invoked.

original: ā naḥ some svadhvara iyāno atyo na tośate /
analyzed: ā naḥ some su adhvare iyānaḥ atyaḥ na tośate
translated: Come to us, O Soma, who hast good rites, like a horse who delights in the race.

original: yaṃ te svadāvan svadanti gūrtayaḥ paure chandayase havam //
analyzed: yam te sva dāvan svadanti gūrtayaḥ paure chandayase havam
translated: Whom, O you who delight in the sweet, your praises delight, you delight the invocation in the house.

original: pra vīram ugraṃ viviciṃ dhanaspṛtaṃ vibhūtiṃ rādhaso mahaḥ /
analyzed: pra vīram ugram vivicim dhana spṛtam vibhūtim rādhasaḥ mahaḥ
translated: The hero, the strong one, the discerning one, the conqueror of wealth, the all-pervading one, the great one of bounty,

original: udrīva vajrinn avato vasutvanā sadā pīpetha dāśuṣe //
analyzed: udrī iva vajrin avataḥ vasutvanā sadā pīpetha dāśuṣe
translated: Like a swift one, O wielder of the thunderbolt, you always help the worshipper in the bestowal of wealth.

original: yad dha nūnam parāvati yad vā pṛthivyāṃ divi /
analyzed: yat ha nūnam parāvati yat vā pṛthivyām divi
translated: Whether you are far away or on earth or in the sky,

original: yujāna indra haribhir mahemata ṛṣva ṛṣvebhir ā gahi //
analyzed: yujānaḥ indra haribhiḥ mahemate ṛṣvaḥ ṛṣvebhiḥ ā gahi
translated: O Indra, yoking your tawny horses, come with your lofty ones to the great sacrifice.

original: rathirāso harayo ye te asridha ojo vātasya piprati /
analyzed: rathirāsaḥ harayaḥ ye te asridhaḥ ojaḥ vātasya piprati
translated: The swift tawny horses which are yours, O you who have no rival, proclaim your strength like the wind,

original: yebhir ni dasyum manuṣo nighoṣayo yebhiḥ svaḥ parīyase //
analyzed: yebhiḥ ni dasyum manuṣaḥ nighoṣayaḥ yebhiḥ svar parīyase
translated: With which you crush the Dasyu, the human one, with which you go around the heaven.

original: etāvatas te vaso vidyāma śūra navyasaḥ /🔽yathā prāva etaśaṃ kṛtvye dhane yathā vaśaṃ daśavraje //
analyzed: etāvataḥ te vaso vidyāma śūra navyasaḥ  yathā prāvaḥ etaśam kṛtvye dhane yathā vaśam daśavraje
translated: O Vasu, O hero, we would know this new deed of thine,🔽As thou didst help Etasa in the contest, as thou didst help Vas in the Dashavratas.

original: yathā kaṇve maghavan medhe adhvare dīrghanīthe damūnasi /
analyzed: yathā kaṇve maghavan medhe adhvare dīrgha nīthe damūnasi
translated: As thou didst help Kanva, O Maghavan, in the sacrifice, in the long-lasting contest, O thou who art to be invoked in the house,

original: yathā gośarye asiṣāso adrivo mayi gotraṃ hariśriyam //
analyzed: yathā gośarye asiṣāsaḥ adrivas mayi gotram hari śriyam
translated: As thou didst win the cattle, O thou with the thunderbolt, the herd of cattle, O thou of tawny splendour, in the house of Gosarya.

original: yathā manau sāṃvaraṇau somam indrāpibaḥ sutam /
analyzed: yathā manau sāṃvaraṇau somam indra apibaḥ sutam
translated: As thou and Indra drankest Soma, O Manu, in the house of Samvaraṇa,

original: nīpātithau maghavan medhyātithau puṣṭigau śruṣṭigau sacā //
analyzed: nīpātithau maghavan medhyātithau puṣṭigau śruṣṭigau sacā
translated: In the house of Nīpātithi, O Maghavan, in the house of Medhyātithi, in the house of Puṣṭi, in the house of Śruṣṭi.

original: pārṣadvāṇaḥ praskaṇvaṃ sam asādayac chayānaṃ jivrim uddhitam /
analyzed: pārṣadvāṇaḥ praskaṇvam sam asādayat śayānam jivrim uddhitam
translated: Pārṣadvaṇi brought together Praskanva, who was lying down, the wounded one who had been lifted up.

original: sahasrāṇy asiṣāsad gavām ṛṣis tvoto dasyave vṛkaḥ //
analyzed: sahasrāṇi asiṣāsat gavām ṛṣiḥ tvotaḥ dasyave vṛkaḥ
translated: The Ṛṣi, the wolf, for the Dasyu, won thousands of cattle, being thy impeller.

original: ya ukthebhir na vindhate cikid ya ṛṣicodanaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ukthebhiḥ na vindhate cikit yaḥ ṛṣi codanaḥ
translated: He whom the Ṛṣis do not win by hymns, who is to be stirred by the Ṛṣis' urging,

original: indraṃ tam acchā vada navyasyā maty ariṣyantaṃ na bhojase //
analyzed: indram tam acchā vada navyasyā matī a riṣyantam na bhojase
translated: To him, O Indra, speak, to the new one, to the one who is to be feared, not to the one who is to be enjoyed.

original: yasmā arkaṃ saptaśīrṣāṇam ānṛcus tridhātum uttame pade /
analyzed: yasmai arkam sapta śīrṣāṇam ānṛcuḥ tri dhātum uttame pade
translated: From whom they have made the seven-headed Ark, the three-formed one, in the highest place,

original: sa tv imā viśvā bhuvanāni cikradad ād ij janiṣṭa pauṃsyam //
analyzed: sa tu imā viśvā bhuvanāni cikradat āt id janiṣṭa pauṃsyam
translated: He hath roared out over all these worlds. He hath generated manly strength.

original: yo no dātā vasūnām indraṃ taṃ hūmahe vayam /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dātā vasūnām indram tam hūmahe vayam
translated: We invoke that Indra, who is the giver of treasures, we invoke him.

original: vidmā hy asya sumatiṃ navīyasīṃ gamema gomati vraje //
analyzed: vidma hi asya sumatim navīyasīm gamema gomati vraje
translated: For we know his most recent gracious favour: may we go to the cattle-owning home.

original: yasmai tvaṃ vaso dānāya śikṣasi sa rāyas poṣam aśnute /
analyzed: yasmai tvam vaso dānāya śikṣasi sa rāyaḥ poṣam aśnute
translated: O Vasu, he whom thou teachest to give gifts, he obtains the increase of wealth.

original: taṃ tvā vayam maghavann indra girvaṇaḥ sutāvanto havāmahe //
analyzed: tam tvā vayam maghavan indra girvaṇaḥ sutāvantaḥ havāmahe
translated: Thee, O bountiful Indra, O thou who lovest the song, we invoke with the pressed (Soma).

original: kadā cana starīr asi nendra saścasi dāśuṣe /
analyzed: kadā cana starīḥ asi na indra saścasi dāśuṣe
translated: Never art thou barren: thou never failest the worshipper, O Indra.

original: upopen nu maghavan bhūya in nu te dānaṃ devasya pṛcyate //
analyzed: upa upa id nu maghavan bhūyaḥ id nu te dānam devasya pṛcyate
translated: Again and again, O bountiful one, the gift of the God is increased for thee.

original: pra yo nanakṣe abhy ojasā kriviṃ vadhaiḥ śuṣṇaṃ nighoṣayan /
analyzed: pra yaḥ nanakṣe abhī ojasā krivim vadhaiḥ śuṣṇam nighoṣayan
translated: He who hath spread himself with might, proclaiming with blows the death of Kṛvi the wicked,

original: yaded astambhīt prathayann amūṃ divam ād ij janiṣṭa pārthivaḥ //🔽yasyāyaṃ viśva āryo dāsaḥ śevadhipā ariḥ /
analyzed: yadā id astambhīt prathayan amūm divam āt id janiṣṭa pārthivaḥ  yasya ayam viśvaḥ āryaḥ dāsaḥ śevadhi pāḥ ariḥ
translated: When he hath stood firm, extending this sky, then was the earthly one born.🔽Whose is this all-ruling sway, whose is the rule over the Dāsa, the foe, the worthless?

original: tiraś cid arye ruśame parīravi tubhyet so ajyate rayiḥ //🔽turaṇyavo madhumantaṃ ghṛtaścutaṃ viprāso arkam ānṛcuḥ /🔽asme rayiḥ paprathe vṛṣṇyaṃ śavo 'sme suvānāsa indavaḥ //
analyzed: tiras cit arye ruśame tubhya id saḥ ajyate rayiḥ  turaṇyavaḥ madhumantam ghṛtaścutam viprāsaḥ arkam ānṛcuḥ  asme rayiḥ paprathe vṛṣṇyam śavaḥ sme suvānāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: Even over the noble one the reins are drawn: for thee is this wealth prepared.🔽The singers have sung the honey-sweet, the ghee-dropping hymn to the swift one.🔽Wealth hath been spread among us, manly strength: among us are the pressed Soma juices.

original: yathā manau vivasvati somaṃ śakrāpibaḥ sutam /
analyzed: yathā manau vivasvati somam śakra apibaḥ sutam
translated: As thou, O Śakra, didst drink the pressed Soma of Manu and Vivasvan,

original: yathā trite chanda indra jujoṣasy āyau mādayase sacā //
analyzed: yathā trite chandaḥ indra jujoṣasi āyau mādayase sacā
translated: As thou wast delighted with Trita, O Indra, in the house, in the sacrifice, thou madest him glad with the desire [1].

original: pṛṣadhre medhye mātariśvanīndra suvāne amandathāḥ /
analyzed: pṛṣadhre medhye mātariśvani indra suvāne amandathāḥ
translated: In the sacrifice of Prishadhra, O Indra, in the sacrifice of Medhyâtithi, in the sacrifice of Matarigvan, thou wast delighted.

original: yathā somaṃ daśaśipre daśoṇye syūmaraśmāv ṛjūnasi //
analyzed: yathā somam daśaśipre daśoṇye syūmaraśmau ṛjūnasi
translated: As thou wast delighted with Soma in the sacrifice of Dasha-shipri, of Dasha-onyi, of Syumarashmi, of Riju.

original: ya ukthā kevalā dadhe yaḥ somaṃ dhṛṣitāpibat /
analyzed: yaḥ ukthā kevalā dadhe yaḥ somam dhṛṣitā apibat
translated: He who hath the hymns all to himself, who hath drunk Soma boldly,

original: yasmai viṣṇus trīṇi padā vicakrama upa mitrasya dharmabhiḥ //🔽yasya tvam indra stomeṣu cākano vāje vājiñ chatakrato /
analyzed: yasmai viṣṇuḥ trīṇi padā vicakrame upa mitrasya dharmabhiḥ  yasya tvam indra stomeṣu cākanaḥ vāje vājim śatakrato
translated: For whom Vishnu hath stepped with his three feet, with the laws of Mitra,🔽Thee, O Indra, who hast been delighted in our praises, in the contest, O thou of a hundred powers,

original: taṃ tvā vayaṃ sudughām iva goduho juhūmasi śravasyavaḥ //🔽yo no dātā sa naḥ pitā mahāṃ ugra īśānakṛt /
analyzed: tam tvā vayam sudughām iva go duhaḥ juhūmasi śravasyavaḥ  yaḥ naḥ dātā sa naḥ pitā mahān ugraḥ īśāna kṛt
translated: We invoke thee, O Indra, as one who milks a cow well filled with milk, for glory.🔽He who is our giver is our great, terrible, all-ruling father.

original: ayāmann ugro maghavā purūvasur gor aśvasya pra dātu naḥ //
analyzed: a yāman ugraḥ maghavā purūvasuḥ goḥ aśvasya pra dātu naḥ
translated: The terrible, the rich, the very wealthy one hath come to give us cattle and horses.

original: yasmai tvaṃ vaso dānāya maṃhase sa rāyas poṣam invati /
analyzed: yasmai tvam vaso dānāya maṃhase sa rāyaḥ poṣam invati
translated: O Vasu, to whomsoever thou givest for a gift, he increaseth his wealth.

original: vasūyavo vasupatiṃ śatakratuṃ stomair indraṃ havāmahe //
analyzed: vasūyavaḥ vasu patim śatakratum stomaiḥ indram havāmahe
translated: Seeking wealth, we invoke with praises Indra, the lord of wealth, the hundred-powered.

original: kadā cana pra yucchasy ubhe ni pāsi janmanī /
analyzed: kadā cana pra yucchasi ubhe ni pāsi janmanī
translated: Never art thou wearied; thou guardest both races.

original: turīyāditya havanaṃ ta indriyam ā tasthāv amṛtaṃ divi //
analyzed: turīya āditya havanam te indriyam ā tasthau amṛtam divi
translated: The fourth Aditya, thy invocation, thy power, O Indra, hath stood in the sky, immortal.

original: yasmai tvam maghavann indra girvaṇaḥ śikṣo śikṣasi dāśuṣe /
analyzed: yasmai tvam maghavan indra girvaṇaḥ śikṣo śikṣasi dāśuṣe
translated: To whomsoever, O Indra, bountiful, lover of praise, thou teachest, O Maghavan, to be a teacher.

original: asmākaṃ gira uta suṣṭutiṃ vaso kaṇvavac chṛṇudhī havam //🔽astāvi manma pūrvyam brahmendrāya vocata /
analyzed: asmākam giraḥ uta suṣṭutim vaso kaṇva vat śṛṇudhi havam  astāvi manma pūrvyam brahma indrāya vocata
translated: Listen, O Vasu, to our songs and our eulogy, and to Kaṇva's call.🔽Sing forth the ancient hymn, proclaim the prayer to Indra.

original: pūrvīr ṛtasya bṛhatīr anūṣata stotur medhā asṛkṣata //🔽sam indro rāyo bṛhatīr adhūnuta saṃ kṣoṇī sam u sūryam /
analyzed: pūrvīḥ ṛtasya bṛhatīḥ anūṣata stotuḥ medhāḥ asṛkṣata  sam indraḥ rāyaḥ bṛhatīḥ adhūnuta sam kṣoṇī sam sūryam
translated: They have sung forth the great hymns of holy order: the sage's thoughts have flowed.🔽Indra hath shaken loose the great riches, the two world-halves, and Sûrya.

original: saṃ śukrāsaḥ śucayaḥ saṃ gavāśiraḥ somā indram amandiṣuḥ //🔽upamaṃ tvā maghonāṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ ca vṛṣabhāṇām /
analyzed: sam śukrāsaḥ śucayaḥ sam gavāśiraḥ somāḥ indram amandiṣuḥ  upamam tvā maghonām jyeṣṭham ca vṛṣabhāṇām
translated: The bright, the pure, the milk-white Soma-drops have gladdened Indra.🔽Thee, O Indra, the best of the bountiful, the chief of the bulls,

original: pūrbhittamam maghavann indra govidam īśānaṃ rāya īmahe //
analyzed: pūrbhittamam maghavan indra go vidam īśānam rāyaḥ īmahe
translated: The best of the breakers of forts, O Maghavan, the finder of wealth, we implore for lordship of wealth.

original: ya āyuṃ kutsam atithigvam ardayo vāvṛdhāno divedive /
analyzed: yaḥ āyum kutsam atithigvam ardayaḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ dive dive
translated: Thou who hast smitten Âyu, Kutsa, Âtithigva, waxing great day by day,

original: taṃ tvā vayaṃ haryaśvaṃ śatakratuṃ vājayanto havāmahe //
analyzed: tam tvā vayam hari aśvam śatakratum vājayantaḥ havāmahe
translated: We, O thou of the bay steeds, O thou of a hundred powers, call thee to the contest.

original: ā no viśveṣāṃ rasam madhvaḥ siñcantv adrayaḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ viśveṣām rasam madhvaḥ siñcantu adrayaḥ
translated: Let the pressing-stones pour for us the sweet juice of all the (Soma) juices,

original: ye parāvati sunvire janeṣv ā ye arvāvatīndavaḥ //
analyzed: ye parāvati sunvire janeṣu ā ye arvāvati indavaḥ
translated: Those which are pressed in the distance, and those which are (pressed) among the people here.

original: viśvā dveṣāṃsi jahi cāva cā kṛdhi viśve sanvantv ā vasu /
analyzed: viśvā dveṣāṃsi jahi ca ava ca kṛdhi viśve sanvantu ā vasu
translated: Drive away all enmities, and make all (men) friendly. Let all possess wealth.

original: śīṣṭeṣu cit te madirāso aṃśavo yatrā somasya tṛmpasi //
analyzed: śīṣṭeṣu cit te madirāsaḥ aṃśavaḥ yatra somasya tṛmpasi
translated: And in the hearts of the virtuous are thy gladdening portions, where thou art satisfied with Soma.

original: indra nedīya ed ihi mitamedhābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: indra nedīyaḥ ā id ihi mita medhābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Come hither, O Indra, with thy nearest aids, with thy most thoughtful helps.

original: ā śantama śantamābhir abhiṣṭibhir ā svāpe svāpibhiḥ //🔽ājituraṃ satpatiṃ viśvacarṣaṇiṃ kṛdhi prajāsv ābhagam /
analyzed: ā śantama śantamābhiḥ abhiṣṭibhiḥ ā su āpe su āpibhiḥ  āji turam sat patim viśvacarṣaṇim kṛdhi prajāsu ābhagam
translated: With the most delightful delights, with the most gracious protections, with the most refreshing refreshers.🔽Make him the winner, the lord of the people, the all-conquering one, the prosperous one among the people.

original: pra sū tirā śacībhir ye ta ukthinaḥ kratum punata ānuṣak //
analyzed: pra su tira śacībhiḥ ye te ukthinaḥ kratum punate ānuṣak
translated: With his powers, with his strength, those who praise him with hymns, he who purifies his will in due order.

original: yas te sādhiṣṭho 'vase te syāma bhareṣu te /
analyzed: yaḥ te sādhiṣṭhaḥ vase te syāma bhareṣu te
translated: We will be the most faithful to thee for help, in thy battles, in thy gifts.

original: vayaṃ hotrābhir uta devahūtibhiḥ sasavāṃso manāmahe //🔽ahaṃ hi te harivo brahma vājayur ājiṃ yāmi sadotibhiḥ /
analyzed: vayam hotrābhiḥ uta deva hūtibhiḥ sasavāṃsaḥ manāmahe  aham hi te harivas brahma vājayuḥ ājim yāmi sadā ūtibhiḥ
translated: We, with our offerings and our invocations of the gods, with our own people, think of thee.🔽For I, O thou who lovest the Maruts, have a prayer, a prize-winning prayer, with which I approach thee, with my seats.

original: tvām id eva tam ame sam aśvayur gavyur agre mathīnām //
analyzed: tvām id eva tam ame sam aśvayuḥ gavyuḥ agre mathīnām
translated: Thee, O Indra, I, the winner of horses and cattle, first of all the churners.

original: etat ta indra vīryaṃ gīrbhir gṛṇanti kāravaḥ /
analyzed: etat te indra vīryam gīrbhiḥ gṛṇanti kāravaḥ
translated: This, O Indra, is thy hero strength which the singers praise with their songs.

original: te stobhanta ūrjam āvan ghṛtaścutam paurāso nakṣan dhītibhiḥ //🔽nakṣanta indram avase sukṛtyayā yeṣāṃ suteṣu mandase /
analyzed: te stobhantaḥ ūrjam āvan ghṛtaścutam paurāsaḥ nakṣan dhītibhiḥ  nakṣante indram avase su kṛtyayā yeṣām suteṣu mandase
translated: They, the Puras, have obtained thee, the giver of strength, the besprinkler of ghee, with their thoughts.🔽They seek Indra for help with good deeds, whose (Soma) thou delightest in.

original: yathā saṃvarte amado yathā kṛśa evāsme indra matsva //
analyzed: yathā saṃvarte amadaḥ yathā kṛśe eva asme indra matsva
translated: As one who is not intoxicated in a gathering, as one who is lean, so, O Indra, rejoice in us.

original: ā no viśve sajoṣaso devāso gantanopa naḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ viśve sajoṣasaḥ devāsaḥ gantana upa naḥ
translated: All the gods, of one mind, come to us, come near to us.

original: vasavo rudrā avase na ā gamañ chṛṇvantu maruto havam //
analyzed: vasavaḥ rudrāḥ avase naḥ ā gamam śṛṇvantu marutaḥ havam
translated: May the Vasus, Rudras, come to us for help. May the Maruts listen to the call.

original: pūṣā viṣṇur havanam me sarasvaty avantu sapta sindhavaḥ /
analyzed: pūṣā viṣṇuḥ havanam me sarasvatī avantu sapta sindhavaḥ
translated: May Pusan, Vishnu, Sarasvatî, the seven rivers protect my invocation.

original: āpo vātaḥ parvatāso vanaspatiḥ śṛṇotu pṛthivī havam //
analyzed: āpaḥ vātaḥ parvatāsaḥ vanaspatiḥ śṛṇotu pṛthivī havam
translated: May the waters, the wind, the mountains, the trees, and the earth listen to the call.

original: yad indra rādho asti te māghonam maghavattama /
analyzed: yat indra rādhaḥ asti te māghonam maghavattama
translated: O Indra, whatever bounty thou hast, O most bountiful one, that is not to be despised,

original: tena no bodhi sadhamādyo vṛdhe bhago dānāya vṛtrahan //
analyzed: tena naḥ bodhi sadhamādyaḥ vṛdhe bhagaḥ dānāya vṛtrahan
translated: Therewith be thou the impeller of our prosperity, O Vrtra-slayer, for the gift, for bounty.

original: ājipate nṛpate tvam id dhi no vāja ā vakṣi sukrato /
analyzed: āji pate nṛpate tvam id hi naḥ vāje ā vakṣi su krato
translated: O lord of the host, O king, for thou indeed wilt bring us strength, O very wise one,

original: vītī hotrābhir uta devavītibhiḥ sasavāṃso vi śṛṇvire //
analyzed: vītī hotrābhiḥ uta deva vītibhiḥ sasavāṃsaḥ vi śṛṇvire
translated: With the oblations and with the offerings to the gods, the bountiful ones will listen.

original: santi hy arya āśiṣa indra āyur janānām /
analyzed: santi hi aryaḥ āśiṣaḥ indre āyuḥ janānām
translated: For there are good blessings, O noble one, for the life of the people, O Indra.

original: asmān nakṣasva maghavann upāvase dhukṣasva pipyuṣīm iṣam //
analyzed: asmān nakṣasva maghavan upa avase dhukṣasva pipyuṣīm iṣam
translated: Help us, O bountiful one, be near us, milk the swelling food.

original: vayaṃ ta indra stomebhir vidhema tvam asmākaṃ śatakrato /
analyzed: vayam te indra stomebhiḥ vidhema tvam asmākam śatakrato
translated: We will serve thee, O Indra, with our praises, thou, O Sata-krat, with us.

original: mahi sthūraṃ śaśayaṃ rādho ahrayam praskaṇvāya ni tośaya //
analyzed: mahi sthūram śaśayam rādhaḥ ahrayam praskaṇvāya ni tośaya
translated: Bestow upon Pr̥iṣni's son the great, the lasting, the unfailing gift.

original: bhūrīd indrasya vīryaṃ vy akhyam abhy āyati /
analyzed: bhūri id indrasya vīryam vi akhyam abhī āyati
translated: Great is the manly power of Indra, it hath spread abroad and come nigh.

original: rādhas te dasyave vṛka //
analyzed: rādhaḥ te dasyave vṛka
translated: Your gift to the Dasyu, O Vṛka.

original: śataṃ śvetāsa ukṣaṇo divi tāro na rocante /
analyzed: śatam śvetāsaḥ ukṣaṇaḥ divi tāraḥ na rocante
translated: A hundred white oxen, a hundred stars shine in the sky.

original: mahnā divaṃ na tastabhuḥ //
analyzed: mahnā divam na tastabhuḥ
translated: With greatness they have filled the sky.

original: śataṃ veṇūñ chataṃ śunaḥ śataṃ carmāṇi mlātāni /
analyzed: śatam śatam śunaḥ śatam carmāṇi mlātāni
translated: A hundred bamboos, a hundred dogs, a hundred hides are stretched out,

original: śatam me balbajastukā aruṣīṇāṃ catuḥśatam //
analyzed: śatam me balbaja stukāḥ aruṣīṇām catuḥśatam
translated: A hundred of my balbaja plants, four hundred of the red ones.

original: sudevā stha kāṇvāyanā vayovayo vicarantaḥ /
analyzed: su devāḥ stha kāṇvāyanāḥ vayaḥ vayaḥ vicarantaḥ
translated: You are the well-devoted, the descendants of Kaṇva, moving in every direction,

original: aśvāso na caṅkramata //
analyzed: aśvāsaḥ na caṅkramata
translated: Like horses roaming about.

original: ād it sāptasya carkirann ānūnasya mahi śravaḥ /
analyzed: āt id sāptasya carkiran anūnasya mahi śravaḥ
translated: The fame of the weak and the strong has been proclaimed.

original: śyāvīr atidhvasan pathaś cakṣuṣā cana saṃnaśe //🔽prati te dasyave vṛka rādho adarśy ahrayam /
analyzed: śyāvīḥ atidhvasan pathaḥ cakṣuṣā cana saṃnaśe  prati te dasyave vṛka rādhaḥ adarśi ahrayam
translated: Even the dark and the swift cannot be seen with the eye.🔽To you, O Dasyu, O Vṛka, the gift has been shown, the fearless one,

original: dyaur na prathinā śavaḥ //
analyzed: dyauḥ na prathinā śavaḥ
translated: Like the vast sky, your power.

original: daśa mahyam pautakrataḥ sahasrā dasyave vṛkaḥ /
analyzed: daśa mahyam pautakrataḥ sahasrā dasyave vṛkaḥ
translated: Ten thousand for me, O Pūtanakṛta, the Dasyu, O Vṛka,

original: nityād rāyo amaṃhata //
analyzed: nityāt rāyaḥ amaṃhata
translated: Has been given from the eternal wealth.

original: śatam me gardabhānāṃ śatam ūrṇāvatīnām /
analyzed: śatam me gardabhānām śatam ūrṇāvatīnām
translated: A hundred of my donkeys, a hundred of my sheep with wool,

original: śataṃ dāsāṃ ati srajaḥ //
analyzed: śatam dāsām ati srajaḥ
translated: A hundred garlands of slaves.

original: tatro api prāṇīyata pūtakratāyai vyaktā /
analyzed: tatra u api prāṇīyata pūtakratāyai vyaktā
translated: There too, the Pūtanakṛta was made to move for the sake of the sacrifice,

original: aśvānām in na yūthyām //
analyzed: aśvānām id na yūthyām
translated: In the herd of horses.

original: acety agniś cikitur havyavāṭ sa sumadrathaḥ /
analyzed: aceti agniḥ cikituḥ havyavāṭ sa sumat rathaḥ
translated: The Agni who is to be known, the carrier of oblations, he is the good charioteer,

original: agniḥ śukreṇa śociṣā bṛhat sūro arocata divi sūryo arocata //
analyzed: agniḥ śukreṇa śociṣā bṛhat sūraḥ arocata divi sūryaḥ arocata
translated: Agni shines with his bright flame, the sun has risen in his greatness, the sun has risen in the sky.

original: yuvaṃ devā kratunā pūrvyeṇa yuktā rathena taviṣaṃ yajatrā /
analyzed: yuvam devā kratunā pūrvyeṇa yuktā rathena taviṣam yajatrā
translated: O you two divine ones, with your ancient wisdom, yoked to the powerful chariot, O you two worthy of sacrifice,

original: āgacchataṃ nāsatyā śacībhir idaṃ tṛtīyaṃ savanam pibāthaḥ //
analyzed: āgacchatam nāsatyā śacībhiḥ idam tṛtīyam savanam pibāthaḥ
translated: come with your powers, O Nāsatyas, drink this third libation.

original: yuvāṃ devās traya ekādaśāsaḥ satyāḥ satyasya dadṛśe purastāt /
analyzed: yuvām devāḥ trayaḥ ekādaśāsaḥ satyāḥ satyasya dadṛśe purastāt
translated: You two divine ones, the three and the eleven, the true ones, are seen in front of the truth.

original: asmākaṃ yajñaṃ savanaṃ juṣāṇā pātaṃ somam aśvinā dīdyagnī //
analyzed: asmākam yajñam savanam juṣāṇā pātam somam aśvinā dīdi agnī
translated: Accepting our sacrifice and libation, O Aśvins, drink the Soma, O shining ones.

original: panāyyaṃ tad aśvinā kṛtaṃ vāṃ vṛṣabho divo rajasaḥ pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: panāyyam tat aśvinā kṛtam vām vṛṣabhaḥ divaḥ rajasaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
translated: That which is to be drunk, O Aśvins, is done for you, the bull of the realm of heaven and earth.

original: sahasraṃ śaṃsā uta ye gaviṣṭau sarvāṃ it tāṃ upa yātā pibadhyai //
analyzed: sahasram śaṃsāḥ uta ye gaviṣṭau sarvām id tām upa yātā pibadhyai
translated: A thousand praises and those at the cow-pen, come to all of them to drink.

original: ayaṃ vām bhāgo nihito yajatremā giro nāsatyopa yātam /
analyzed: ayam vām bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ yajatrā imāḥ giraḥ nāsatyā upa yātam
translated: This is your share, O you two worthy of sacrifice, come, O Nāsatyas, to these songs.

original: pibataṃ somam madhumantam asme pra dāśvāṃsam avataṃ śacībhiḥ //
analyzed: pibatam somam madhumantam asme pra dāśvāṃsam avatam śacībhiḥ
translated: Drink the sweet Soma with us, come with your powers to the generous one.

original: yam ṛtvijo bahudhā kalpayantaḥ sacetaso yajñam imaṃ vahanti /
analyzed: yam ṛtvijaḥ bahudhā kalpayantaḥ sacetasaḥ yajñam imam vahanti
translated: Those who, being many, prepare this sacrifice, those wise ones who carry it,

original: yo anūcāno brāhmaṇo yukta āsīt kā svit tatra yajamānasya saṃvit //
analyzed: yaḥ anūcānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yuktaḥ āsīt kā svid tatra yajamānasya saṃvid
translated: what is the sacrificer's thought there, if a learned brāhmaṇa is yoked?

original: eka evāgnir bahudhā samiddha ekaḥ sūryo viśvam anu prabhūtaḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ eva agniḥ bahudhā samiddhaḥ ekaḥ sūryaḥ viśvam anu prabhūtaḥ
translated: One only is the fire, kindled in many places; one only is the sun, pervading all the world.

original: ekaivoṣāḥ sarvam idaṃ vi bhāty ekaṃ vā idaṃ vi babhūva sarvam //
analyzed: ekā eva uṣāḥ sarvam idam vi bhāti ekam vai idam vi babhūva sarvam
translated: One only is the dawn, and this whole world shines forth; or all this world hath sprung from one.

original: jyotiṣmantaṃ ketumantaṃ tricakraṃ sukhaṃ rathaṃ suṣadam bhūrivāram /
analyzed: jyotiṣmantam ketumantam tri cakram sukham ratham suṣadam bhūri vāram
translated: The car that hath three wheels, that hath light, that hath a banner, that is easy to ride in, that hath a good seat, that hath much room,

original: citrāmaghā yasya yoge 'dhijajñe taṃ vāṃ huve ati riktam pibadhyai //
analyzed: citrāmaghā yasya yoge tam vām huve ati riktam pibadhyai
translated: Whose yoke was born with wondrous bounty, to you I sing, to drink the draught that overflows.

original: imāni vām bhāgadheyāni sisrata indrāvaruṇā pra mahe suteṣu vām /
analyzed: imāni vām bhāgadheyāni sisrate indrāvaruṇā pra mahe suteṣu vām
translated: These are your shares that flow together, O Indra and Varuna, at your great festivals.

original: yajñeyajñe ha savanā bhuraṇyatho yat sunvate yajamānāya śikṣathaḥ //
analyzed: yajñeyajñe ha savanā bhuraṇyathaḥ yat sunvate yajamānāya śikṣathaḥ
translated: At every sacrifice ye hasten to the libations, when ye help the sacrificer who sheds the juice.

original: niṣṣidhvarīr oṣadhīr āpa āstām indrāvaruṇā mahimānam āśata /
analyzed: niṣṣidhvarīḥ oṣadhīḥ āpaḥ āstām indrāvaruṇā mahimānam āśata
translated: The plants have been made ready, the waters have been made ready; O Indra and Varuna, ye have attained to greatness.

original: yā sisratū rajasaḥ pāre adhvano yayoḥ śatrur nakir ādeva ohate //
analyzed: yā sisratuḥ rajasaḥ pāre adhvanaḥ yayoḥ śatruḥ nakir ādevaḥ ohate
translated: Ye who have stretched out the two ends of the path of the sky, whose foe no god at all can overcome.

original: satyaṃ tad indrāvaruṇā kṛśasya vām madhva ūrmiṃ duhate sapta vāṇīḥ /
analyzed: satyam tat indrāvaruṇā kṛśasya vām madhvaḥ ūrmim duhate sapta vāṇīḥ
translated: This is the truth, O Indra and Varuna: they milk the sweet wave of the lean one, the seven voices.

original: tābhir dāśvāṃsam avataṃ śubhas patī yo vām adabdho abhi pāti cittibhiḥ //
analyzed: tābhiḥ dāśvāṃsam avatam śubhaḥ patī yaḥ vām adabdhaḥ abhi pāti cittibhiḥ
translated: With them help the worshipper, O lords of splendour, he who, faithful, guards you with his thoughts.

original: ghṛtapruṣaḥ saumyā jīradānavaḥ sapta svasāraḥ sadana ṛtasya /
analyzed: ghṛta pruṣaḥ saumyāḥ jīra dānavaḥ sapta svasāraḥ sadane ṛtasya
translated: The seven sisters, the kindly ones, the givers of ghee and Soma, the abode of truth,

original: yā ha vām indrāvaruṇā ghṛtaścutas tābhir dhattaṃ yajamānāya śikṣatam //
analyzed: yāḥ ha vām indrāvaruṇāḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ tābhiḥ dhattam yajamānāya śikṣatam
translated: With those drops of ghee, O Indra and Varuna, bestow upon the sacrificer, instruct him.

original: avocāma mahate saubhagāya satyaṃ tveṣābhyām mahimānam indriyam /
analyzed: avocāma mahate saubhagāya satyam tveṣābhyām mahimānam indriyam
translated: We have spoken for great good fortune, the true greatness and power of you two.

original: asmān sv indrāvaruṇā ghṛtaścutas tribhiḥ sāptebhir avataṃ śubhas patī //
analyzed: asmān su indrāvaruṇā ghṛtaścutaḥ tribhiḥ sāptebhiḥ avatam śubhaḥ patī
translated: O Indra and Varuna, with the three and seven, come to us, O lords of splendor, with those drops of ghee.

original: indrāvaruṇā yad ṛṣibhyo manīṣāṃ vāco matiṃ śrutam adattam agre /
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā yat ṛṣibhyaḥ manīṣām vācaḥ matim śrutam adattam agre
translated: O Indra and Varuna, when you gave to the seers in the beginning the thought, the speech, the understanding, the knowledge,

original: yāni sthānāny asṛjanta dhīrā yajñaṃ tanvānās tapasābhy apaśyam //
analyzed: yāni sthānāni asṛjanta dhīrāḥ yajñam tanvānāḥ tapasā abhi apaśyam
translated: The places which the wise ones created, I have seen them through austerity while fashioning the sacrifice.

original: indrāvaruṇā saumanasam adṛptaṃ rāyas poṣaṃ yajamāneṣu dhattam /
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā saumanasam adṛptam rāyaḥ poṣam yajamāneṣu dhattam
translated: O Indra and Varuna, bestow upon the sacrificers the agreeable, the unassuming increase of wealth.

original: prajām puṣṭim bhūtim asmāsu dhattaṃ dīrghāyutvāya pra tirataṃ na āyuḥ //🔽agna ā yāhy agnibhir hotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe /🔽ā tvām anaktu prayatā haviṣmatī yajiṣṭham barhir āsade //
analyzed: prajām puṣṭim bhūtim asmāsu dhattam dīrgha āyu tvāya pra tiratam naḥ āyuḥ  agne ā yāhi agnibhiḥ hotāram tvā vṛṇīmahe  ā tvām anaktu prayatā haviṣmatī yajiṣṭham barhiḥ āsade
translated: Bestow upon us offspring, prosperity, and well-being, extend our life for a long life.🔽O Agni, come with the fires, we choose you as the Hotar.🔽May the well-prepared oblation anoint you, best to be worshipped, to sit on the sacrificial grass.

original: acchā hi tvā sahasaḥ sūno aṅgiraḥ srucaś caranty adhvare /
analyzed: acchā hi tvā sahasaḥ sūno aṅgiraḥ srucaḥ caranti adhvare
translated: For you, O son of strength, O Angiras, the ladles move in the sacrifice.

original: ūrjo napātaṃ ghṛtakeśam īmahe 'gniṃ yajñeṣu pūrvyam //🔽agne kavir vedhā asi hotā pāvaka yakṣyaḥ /
analyzed: ūrjaḥ napātam ghṛta keśam īmahe gnim yajñeṣu pūrvyam  agne kaviḥ vedhāḥ asi hotā pāvaka yakṣyaḥ
translated: We invoke the son of strength, whose hair is oil, Agni, the ancient one, at sacrifices.🔽O Agni, you are the wise one, the creator, the priest, the purifier, worthy of worship.

original: mandro yajiṣṭho adhvareṣv īḍyo viprebhiḥ śukra manmabhiḥ //
analyzed: mandraḥ yajiṣṭhaḥ adhvareṣu īḍyaḥ viprebhiḥ śukra manmabhiḥ
translated: Delightful, best at sacrifices, to be praised at rituals, O radiant one, by the sages with hymns.

original: adrogham ā vahośato yaviṣṭhya devāṃ ajasra vītaye /
analyzed: adrogham ā vaha uśataḥ yaviṣṭhya devān ajasra vītaye
translated: O most youthful one, bring the gods, the guileless ones, in hundreds, for the feast, O you of uninterrupted (flames).

original: abhi prayāṃsi sudhitā vaso gahi mandasva dhītibhir hitaḥ //
analyzed: abhi prayāṃsi sudhitā vaso gahi mandasva dhītibhiḥ hitaḥ
translated: Accept the well-prepared offerings, O good one, be delighted with the thoughts, being placed (in the altar).

original: tvam it saprathā asy agne trātar ṛtas kaviḥ /
analyzed: tvam id saprathāḥ asi agne trātar kaviḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are the protector, the wise one of truth, the one who spreads widely.

original: tvāṃ viprāsaḥ samidhāna dīdiva ā vivāsanti vedhasaḥ //🔽śocā śociṣṭha dīdihi viśe mayo rāsva stotre mahāṃ asi /
analyzed: tvām viprāsaḥ samidhāna dīdivas ā vivāsanti vedhasaḥ  śoca śociṣṭha dīdihi viśe mayaḥ rāsva stotre mahān asi
translated: The sages, the creators, kindle you, the radiant one, and worship you.🔽Shine, O you who are most radiant, shine for the people with your splendor! Give (us) in the praises! You are great.

original: devānāṃ śarman mama santu sūrayaḥ śatrūṣāhaḥ svagnayaḥ //
analyzed: devānām śarman mama santu sūrayaḥ śatrūṣāhaḥ su agnayaḥ
translated: May my princes be in the protection of the gods, victorious over enemies, with their own fires.

original: yathā cid vṛddham atasam agne saṃjūrvasi kṣami /
analyzed: yathā cit vṛddham atasam agne saṃjūrvasi kṣami
translated: Just as, O Agni, you stir up the old and new (grass), O you who move on the earth,

original: evā daha mitramaho yo asmadhrug durmanmā kaś ca venati //
analyzed: eva daha mitra mahas yaḥ asmadhruk durmanmā kaḥ ca venati
translated: So burn up, O you who have many friends, he who is hostile to us, whoever is ill-disposed and acts perversely.

original: mā no martāya ripave rakṣasvine māghaśaṃsāya rīradhaḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ martāya ripave rakṣasvine mā agha śaṃsāya rīradhaḥ
translated: Do not give (us) to a mortal enemy, to the Raksas who injures, to the slanderer.

original: asredhadbhis taraṇibhir yaviṣṭhya śivebhiḥ pāhi pāyubhiḥ //
analyzed: a sredhadbhiḥ taraṇibhiḥ yaviṣṭhya śivebhiḥ pāhi pāyubhiḥ
translated: O you who are most youthful, protect (us) with your most powerful, swift, and auspicious guardians.

original: pāhi no agna ekayā pāhy uta dvitīyayā /🔽pāhi gīrbhis tisṛbhir ūrjām pate pāhi catasṛbhir vaso //
analyzed: pāhi naḥ agne ekayā pāhi uta dvitīyayā  pāhi gīrbhiḥ tisṛbhiḥ ūrjām pate pāhi catasṛbhiḥ vaso
translated: Protect us, O Agni, with one (protection), protect us also with a second.🔽Protect us with three (protections), O lord of food, protect us with four (protections), O Vasu.

original: pāhi viśvasmād rakṣaso arāvṇaḥ pra sma vājeṣu no 'va /🔽tvām id dhi nediṣṭhaṃ devatātaya āpiṃ nakṣāmahe vṛdhe //🔽ā no agne vayovṛdhaṃ rayim pāvaka śaṃsyam /
analyzed: pāhi viśvasmāt rakṣasaḥ arāvṇaḥ pra sma vājeṣu naḥ vaḥ  tvām id hi nediṣṭham devatātaye āpim nakṣāmahe vṛdhe  ā naḥ agne vayaḥ vṛdham rayim pāvaka śaṃsyam
translated: Protect us from every sinless demon; be thou also our protector in battles.🔽For we long for thee, O Agni, as for a friend most near at hand, for prosperity.

original: rāsvā ca na upamāte puruspṛhaṃ sunītī svayaśastaram //🔽yena vaṃsāma pṛtanāsu śardhatas taranto arya ādiśaḥ /
analyzed: rāsvā ca naḥ upamāte puruspṛham su nītī sva yaśastaram  yena vaṃsāma pṛtanāsu śardhataḥ tarantaḥ aryaḥ ādiśaḥ
translated: O Agni, O purifier, grant us wealth which shall increase our life, which shall be praised.🔽And, O thou who art to be invoked, grant us, O thou of good guidance, wealth most desirable to many, most glorious by nature.

original: sa tvaṃ no vardha prayasā śacīvaso jinvā dhiyo vasuvidaḥ //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ vardha prayasā śacī vaso jinva dhiyaḥ vasu vidaḥ
translated: By which (wealth) we may conquer in battles the daring, and pass over the hostile plans of the foe.🔽Do thou, O Agni, increase that (wealth) by our oblation, O thou of mighty wealth; stimulate our thoughts which find wealth.

original: śiśāno vṛṣabho yathāgniḥ śṛṅge davidhvat /
analyzed: śiśānaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ yathā agniḥ śṛṅge davidhvat
translated: The bull shines forth like Agni, with his horns wide open.

original: tigmā asya hanavo na pratidhṛṣe sujambhaḥ sahaso yahuḥ //
analyzed: tigmāḥ asya hanavaḥ na pratidhṛṣe su jambhaḥ sahasaḥ yahuḥ
translated: His teeth are sharp, they cannot be resisted; he is easily subdued, he is swift to act.

original: nahi te agne vṛṣabha pratidhṛṣe jambhāso yad vitiṣṭhase /
analyzed: nahi te agne vṛṣabha pratidhṛṣe jambhāsaḥ yat vitiṣṭhase
translated: For, O Agni, O bull, thy teeth cannot be resisted, when thou art standing firm.

original: sa tvaṃ no hotaḥ suhutaṃ haviṣ kṛdhi vaṃsvā no vāryā puru //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ hotar su hutam haviḥ kṛdhi vaṃsva naḥ vāryā puru
translated: Do thou, O Hotar, make our oblation well offered; bestow on us, O thou of much wealth, our desired objects.

original: śeṣe vaneṣu mātroḥ saṃ tvā martāsa indhate /
analyzed: śeṣe vaneṣu mātroḥ sam tvā martāsaḥ indhate
translated: He rests in the two worlds, in the two bowls; mortals kindle thee.

original: atandro havyā vahasi haviṣkṛta ād id deveṣu rājasi //
analyzed: atandraḥ havyā vahasi haviṣkṛtaḥ āt id deveṣu rājasi
translated: Unwearied, thou carriest the offerings, and art worshipped with oblations, and among the gods thou reignest.

original: sapta hotāras tam id īḷate tvāgne sutyajam ahrayam /🔽bhinatsy adriṃ tapasā vi śociṣā prāgne tiṣṭha janāṃ ati //🔽agnimagniṃ vo adhriguṃ huvema vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: sapta hotāraḥ tam id īḍate tvā agne sutyajam ahrayam  bhinatsi adrim tapasā vi śociṣā pra agne tiṣṭha janān ati  agnim agnim vaḥ adhrigum huvema vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: The seven Hotars invoke him, O Agni, the easily kindled, the impetuous one.🔽With heat and flame thou breakest the rock asunder. Stand in the front, O Agni, over the people.🔽To Agni, to Agni, the impeller, we will sing, with trimmed grass.

original: agniṃ hitaprayasaḥ śaśvatīṣv ā hotāraṃ carṣaṇīnām //
analyzed: agnim hita prayasaḥ śaśvatīṣu ā hotāram carṣaṇīnām
translated: To Agni, the bountiful, at all seasons, as the Hotar, the priest of men.

original: ketena śarman sacate suṣāmaṇy agne tubhyaṃ cikitvanā /
analyzed: ketena śarman sacate suṣāmaṇi agne tubhyam cikitvanā
translated: By what, O Agni, most gracious one, dost thou attend on him who is to be pitied?

original: iṣaṇyayā naḥ pururūpam ā bhara vājaṃ nediṣṭham ūtaye //
analyzed: iṣaṇyayā naḥ puru rūpam ā bhara vājam nediṣṭham ūtaye
translated: Bring us the manifold treasure by thy impulse, the most desirable, for help.

original: agne jaritar viśpatis tepāno deva rakṣasaḥ /
analyzed: agne jaritar viśpatiḥ tepānaḥ deva rakṣasaḥ
translated: O Agni, the singer, the lord of the people, the purifier, O god, of the Rakshas,

original: aproṣivān gṛhapatir mahāṃ asi divas pāyur duroṇayuḥ //🔽mā no rakṣa ā veśīd āghṛṇīvaso mā yātur yātumāvatām /
analyzed: a proṣivān gṛhapatiḥ mahān asi divaḥ pāyuḥ duroṇayuḥ  mā naḥ rakṣaḥ ā veśīt āghṛṇīvaso mā yātuḥ yātumāvatām
translated: The householder who never goes away, thou art great, the guardian of heaven, the dweller in the house.🔽Let not the Rakshas, the treacherous one, O thou of terrible wealth, nor the sorcerer, the deceiver, approach us.

original: parogavyūty anirām apa kṣudham agne sedha rakṣasvinaḥ //
analyzed: parogavyūtī anirām apa kṣudham agne sedha rakṣasvinaḥ
translated: Drive away hunger beyond the farthest distance, O Agni, and keep off the Rakshas.

original: ubhayaṃ śṛṇavac ca na indro arvāg idaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: ubhayam śṛṇavat ca naḥ indraḥ arvāk idam vacaḥ
translated: May Indra hear both these words of ours, the singer.

original: satrācyā maghavā somapītaye dhiyā śaviṣṭha ā gamat //
analyzed: satrācyā maghavā soma pītaye dhiyā śaviṣṭhaḥ ā gamat
translated: Let the bountiful one, the most powerful, come hither by his mind to drink the Soma, as is his wont.

original: taṃ hi svarājaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tam ojase dhiṣaṇe niṣṭatakṣatuḥ /
analyzed: tam hi sva rājam vṛṣabham tam ojase dhiṣaṇe niṣṭatakṣatuḥ
translated: For him, the self-ruling bull, the two bowls have fashioned for his strength.

original: utopamānām prathamo ni ṣīdasi somakāmaṃ hi te manaḥ //
analyzed: uta upamānām prathamaḥ ni sīdasi soma kāmam hi te manaḥ
translated: And thou sittest first of all the likenesses, for thy mind is set on Soma.

original: ā vṛṣasva purūvaso sutasyendrāndhasaḥ /🔽vidmā hi tvā harivaḥ pṛtsu sāsahim adhṛṣṭaṃ cid dadhṛṣvaṇim //
analyzed: ā vṛṣasva purūvaso sutasya indra andhasaḥ  vidma hi tvā harivas pṛtsu sāsahim adhṛṣṭam cit dadhṛṣvaṇim
translated: Be strong, O thou of many treasures, for the juice, for the rapture of Indra.🔽For we know thee, O thou of the bay steeds, invincible in battles, daring even the daring.

original: aprāmisatya maghavan tathed asad indra kratvā yathā vaśaḥ /
analyzed: aprāmisatya maghavan tathā id asat indra kratvā yathā vaśaḥ
translated: Be true to thy promise, O bountiful one, so be it, O Indra, as thou wilt, by wisdom.

original: sanema vājaṃ tava śiprinn avasā makṣū cid yanto adrivaḥ //
analyzed: sanema vājam tava śiprin avasā makṣū cit yantaḥ adrivas
translated: May we win strength, O thou of the beautiful cheek, through thy favour, O thou of the stone, even when going slowly.

original: śagdhy ū ṣu śacīpata indra viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: śagdhi u su śacīpate indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Be thou, O lord of power, ready for us, O Indra, with all thy helps.

original: bhagaṃ na hi tvā yaśasaṃ vasuvidam anu śūra carāmasi //
analyzed: bhagam na hi tvā yaśasam vasu vidam anu śūra carāmasi
translated: For we follow thee, O hero, as a lucky throw, as one who finds wealth, for thou art not to be deceived.

original: pauro aśvasya purukṛd gavām asy utso deva hiraṇyayaḥ /🔽nakir hi dānam parimardhiṣat tve yadyad yāmi tad ā bhara //
analyzed: pauraḥ aśvasya puru kṛt gavām asi utsaḥ deva hiraṇyayaḥ  nakir hi dānam parimardhiṣat tve yat yat yāmi tat ā bhara
translated: Thou art the lord of the horse, O thou of many benefits, of the cow, O god, of gold.🔽For no one may refuse thy gift, whatever I ask, bring that.

original: tvaṃ hy ehi cerave vidā bhagaṃ vasuttaye /
analyzed: tvam hi ehi cerave vida bhagam vasuttaye
translated: For thou, indeed, must come to me to win good fortune, to find wealth.

original: ud vāvṛṣasva maghavan gaviṣṭaya ud indrāśvamiṣṭaye //
analyzed: ud vāvṛṣasva maghavan gaviṣṭaye ud indra aśvamiṣṭaye
translated: Pour down rain, O bountiful one, for the sake of the cows, for the sake of the horses, O Indra.

original: tvam purū sahasrāṇi śatāni ca yūthā dānāya maṃhase /
analyzed: tvam purū sahasrāṇi śatāni ca yūthā dānāya maṃhase
translated: For many hundreds and thousands of herds thou givest for the gift.

original: ā purandaraṃ cakṛma vipravacasa indraṃ gāyanto 'vase //
analyzed: ā purandaram cakṛma vipra vacasaḥ indram gāyantaḥ vase
translated: We have made Purandara, Indra, the object of our holy songs, singing to him for help.

original: avipro vā yad avidhad vipro vendra te vacaḥ /
analyzed: a vipraḥ vā yat avidhat vipraḥ vā indra te vacaḥ
translated: Whether he be a non-Brahmin or a Brahmin, O Indra, who has uttered your word,

original: sa pra mamandat tvāyā śatakrato prācāmanyo ahaṃsana //
analyzed: sa pra mamandat tvāyā śatakrato prācāmanyo ahaṃsana
translated: He has been gladdened by you, O Shatakratu, and has become a friend to those who are not friends.

original: ugrabāhur mrakṣakṛtvā purandaro yadi me śṛṇavad dhavam /
analyzed: ugra bāhuḥ mrakṣa kṛtvā purandaraḥ yadi me śṛṇavat dhavam
translated: The mighty-armed Purandara, the avenger, if he will listen to my call,

original: vasūyavo vasupatiṃ śatakratuṃ stomair indraṃ havāmahe //
analyzed: vasūyavaḥ vasu patim śatakratum stomaiḥ indram havāmahe
translated: Desiring wealth, we invoke with praises Indra, the lord of wealth, Shatakratu.

original: na pāpāso manāmahe nārāyāso na jaḷhavaḥ /
analyzed: na pāpāsaḥ manāmahe na arāyāsaḥ na jaḷhavaḥ
translated: We do not think evil thoughts, nor do we think thoughts of enmity or hatred,

original: yad in nv indraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ sacā sute sakhāyaṃ kṛṇavāmahai //🔽ugraṃ yuyujma pṛtanāsu sāsahim ṛṇakātim adābhyam /
analyzed: yat id nu indram vṛṣaṇam sacā sute sakhāyam kṛṇavāmahai  ugram yuyujma pṛtanāsu sāsahim ṛṇakātim adābhyam
translated: When we wish to make Indra, the mighty one, our friend in the Soma juice.🔽We yoke the mighty one who conquers in battles, the one who surpasses in debt, the one who is unassailable.

original: vedā bhṛmaṃ cit sanitā rathītamo vājinaṃ yam id ū naśat //
analyzed: veda bhṛmam cit sanitā rathītamaḥ vājinam yam id u naśat
translated: We know him as the one who conquers even the hidden, the best charioteer, the strong one whom we must serve.

original: yata indra bhayāmahe tato no abhayaṃ kṛdhi /
analyzed: yatas indra bhayāmahe tatas naḥ abhayam kṛdhi
translated: From whatever fear we are afraid, O Indra, make us free from that fear.

original: maghavañ chagdhi tava tan na ūtibhir vi dviṣo vi mṛdho jahi //
analyzed: maghavan śagdhi tava tat naḥ ūtibhiḥ vi dviṣaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ jahi
translated: O Maghavan, be gracious, with your help destroy the enemies and the wicked.

original: tvaṃ hi rādhaspate rādhaso mahaḥ kṣayasyāsi vidhataḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi rādhaspate rādhasaḥ mahaḥ kṣayasya asi vidhataḥ
translated: For you, O lord of bounty, are the great bestower of bounty and the dispenser of wealth.

original: taṃ tvā vayam maghavann indra girvaṇaḥ sutāvanto havāmahe //
analyzed: tam tvā vayam maghavan indra girvaṇaḥ sutāvantaḥ havāmahe
translated: To you, O Indra, O Maghavan, we who have pressed the Soma call, O you who love the song.

original: indra spaḷ uta vṛtrahā paraspā no vareṇyaḥ /
analyzed: indra spaṣ uta vṛtrahā paraspāḥ naḥ vareṇyaḥ
translated: Indra, the slayer of Vrtra, the protector, is our excellent one.

original: sa no rakṣiṣac caramaṃ sa madhyamaṃ sa paścāt pātu naḥ puraḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ rakṣiṣat caramam sa madhyamam sa paścāt pātu naḥ puras
translated: May he protect us from the rear, from the middle, and from the front.

original: tvaṃ naḥ paścād adharād uttarāt pura indra ni pāhi viśvataḥ /
analyzed: tvam naḥ paścāt adharāt uttarāt puras indra ni pāhi viśvatas
translated: From the rear, from below, from above, from the front, O Indra, protect us from all sides.

original: āre asmat kṛṇuhi daivyam bhayam āre hetīr adevīḥ //
analyzed: āre asmat kṛṇuhi daivyam bhayam āre hetīḥ adevīḥ
translated: Make far from us the divine fear, far the missiles of the demons.

original: adyādyā śvaḥśva indra trāsva pare ca naḥ /
analyzed: adya adya śvas śvas indra trāsva pare ca naḥ
translated: Today, today, tomorrow, tomorrow, O Indra, protect us.

original: viśvā ca no jaritṝn satpate ahā divā naktaṃ ca rakṣiṣaḥ //
analyzed: viśvā ca naḥ jaritṝn satpate ahā divā naktam ca rakṣiṣaḥ
translated: And all our singers, O lord of the brave, protect day and night.

original: prabhaṅgī śūro maghavā tuvīmaghaḥ sammiślo viryāya kam /
analyzed: prabhaṅgī śūraḥ maghavā tuvīmaghaḥ sammiślaḥ viryāya kam
translated: The hero, the lord of the brave, the mighty one, the very mighty one, is mixed with strength for whom.

original: ubhā te bāhū vṛṣaṇā śatakrato ni yā vajram mimikṣatuḥ //
analyzed: ubhā te bāhū vṛṣaṇā śatakrato ni yā vajram mimikṣatuḥ
translated: Both your arms, O Shatakratu, are powerful, which hold the thunderbolt.

original: pro asmā upastutim bharatā yaj jujoṣati /
analyzed: pra u asmai upastutim bharata yat jujoṣati
translated: He brings the praise that is offered to him, which he approves.

original: ukthair indrasya māhinaṃ vayo vardhanti somino bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ //
analyzed: ukthaiḥ indrasya māhinam vayaḥ vardhanti sominaḥ bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: The Soma-offerers increase the mighty strength of Indra with hymns. The gifts of Indra are good.

original: ayujo asamo nṛbhir ekaḥ kṛṣṭīr ayāsyaḥ /
analyzed: ayujaḥ asamaḥ nṛbhiḥ ekaḥ kṛṣṭīḥ ayāsyaḥ
translated: Unequalled by men, alone, with unclosed jaws, he conquers the peoples.

original: pūrvīr ati pra vāvṛdhe viśvā jātāny ojasā bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ //
analyzed: pūrvīḥ ati pra vāvṛdhe viśvā jātāni ojasā bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: He has grown in power over all the born beings with his strength. The gifts of Indra are good.

original: ahitena cid arvatā jīradānuḥ siṣāsati /
analyzed: a hitena cit arvatā jīra dānuḥ siṣāsati
translated: Even with a weak horse, the giver of wealth desires to conquer.

original: pravācyam indra tat tava vīryāṇi kariṣyato bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ //🔽ā yāhi kṛṇavāma ta indra brahmāṇi vardhanā /
analyzed: pravācyam indra tat tava vīryāṇi kariṣyataḥ bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ  ā yāhi kṛṇavāma te indra brahmāṇi vardhanā
translated: Indra, these are the things to be proclaimed of thee, as thou performest heroic deeds. Excellent are Indra's gifts.🔽Come hither, Indra, let us show thee our prayers that bring increase,

original: yebhiḥ śaviṣṭha cākano bhadram iha śravasyate bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ //
analyzed: yebhiḥ śaviṣṭha cākanaḥ bhadram iha śravasyate bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: With which, O Mightiest One, thou art fain to win glorious fame here. Excellent are Indra's gifts.

original: dhṛṣataś cid dhṛṣan manaḥ kṛṇoṣīndra yat tvam /
analyzed: dhṛṣataḥ cit dhṛṣat manaḥ kṛṇoṣi indra yat tvam
translated: Thou makest bold the bold man's spirit, O Indra, when thou art pleased.

original: tīvraiḥ somaiḥ saparyato namobhiḥ pratibhūṣato bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ //
analyzed: tīvraiḥ somaiḥ saparyataḥ namobhiḥ pratibhūṣataḥ bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: With strong Soma juices and adorations thou art worshipped. Excellent are Indra's gifts.

original: ava caṣṭa ṛcīṣamo 'vatāṃ iva mānuṣaḥ /
analyzed: ava caṣṭe ṛcīṣamaḥ vatām iva mānuṣaḥ
translated: The R̥ishi, like a friend, hath looked on thee, the man who lauds thee.

original: juṣṭvī dakṣasya sominaḥ sakhāyaṃ kṛṇute yujam bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ //
analyzed: juṣṭvī dakṣasya sominaḥ sakhāyam kṛṇute yujam bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: The friend of him who pours the Soma, the wise one, makes him a companion. Excellent are Indra's gifts.

original: viśve ta indra vīryaṃ devā anu kratuṃ daduḥ /
analyzed: viśve te indra vīryam devāḥ anu kratum daduḥ
translated: All Gods, O Indra, have given thee power and strength and mental vigour.

original: bhuvo viśvasya gopatiḥ puruṣṭuta bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ //
analyzed: bhuvaḥ viśvasya gopatiḥ puruṣṭuta bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: Thou art the Lord of all the world, O much-invoked! Excellent are Indra's gifts.

original: gṛṇe tad indra te śava upamaṃ devatātaye /
analyzed: gṛṇe tat indra te śavaḥ upamam devatātaye
translated: I sing that might of thine, O Indra, worthy of the Gods' adoration,

original: yad dhaṃsi vṛtram ojasā śacīpate bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ //
analyzed: yat haṃsi vṛtram ojasā śacīpate bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: When, O Lord of power, thou slewest Vritra with thy strength. Excellent are Indra's gifts.

original: samaneva vapuṣyataḥ kṛṇavan mānuṣā yugā /
analyzed: samanā iva vapuṣyataḥ kṛṇavat mānuṣā yugā
translated: They have made the two human ages like a pair of forms in unison.

original: vide tad indraś cetanam adha śruto bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ //
analyzed: vide tat indraḥ cetanam adha śrutaḥ bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: Indra knows that which is to be thought of, he has heard it. The gifts of Indra are good.

original: uj jātam indra te śava ut tvām ut tava kratum /
analyzed: ud jātam indra te śavaḥ ud tvām ud tava kratum
translated: The strength of thee, O Indra, is born, thy thought is born.

original: bhūrigo bhūri vāvṛdhur maghavan tava śarmaṇi bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ //
analyzed: bhūrigo bhūri vāvṛdhuḥ maghavan tava śarmaṇi bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: They have increased thee, O bountiful one, in many herds, in thy protection. The gifts of Indra are good.

original: ahaṃ ca tvaṃ ca vṛtrahan saṃ yujyāva sanibhya ā /
analyzed: aham ca tvam ca vṛtrahan sam yujyāva sanibhyaḥ ā
translated: Thou and I, O Vr̥itra-slayer, will be joined together for our gains.

original: arātīvā cid adrivo 'nu nau śūra maṃsate bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ //
analyzed: arātīvā cit adrivas nu nau śūra maṃsate bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: Even if hostile, O thou of the stone, the hero will favour us. The gifts of Indra are good.

original: satyam id vā u taṃ vayam indraṃ stavāma nānṛtam /
analyzed: satyam id vai u tam vayam indram stavāma na anṛtam
translated: We will truly praise that Indra, and not falsely.

original: mahāṃ asunvato vadho bhūri jyotīṃṣi sunvato bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ //
analyzed: mahān a sunvataḥ vadhaḥ bhūri jyotīṃṣi sunvataḥ bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: He is the great slayer of the unsacrificer, the bountiful giver of much light to the sacrificer. The gifts of Indra are good.

original: sa pūrvyo mahānāṃ venaḥ kratubhir ānaje /
analyzed: sa pūrvyaḥ mahānām venaḥ kratubhiḥ ānaje
translated: He, the ancient, the great, the wise, has conquered by his powers.

original: yasya dvārā manuṣ pitā deveṣu dhiya ānaje //
analyzed: yasya dvārā manuḥ pitā deveṣu dhiyaḥ ānaje
translated: By whose doors, O Manu, the father, has conquered the thoughts among the gods.

original: divo mānaṃ not sadan somapṛṣṭhāso adrayaḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ mānam na ud sadan soma pṛṣṭhāsaḥ adrayaḥ
translated: The stones, whose back is Soma, have not sat down on the measure of the sky.

original: ukthā brahma ca śaṃsyā //
analyzed: ukthā brahma ca śaṃsyā
translated: The hymns and the Brahman are to be praised.

original: sa vidvāṃ aṅgirobhya indro gā avṛṇod apa /
analyzed: sa vidvān aṅgirobhyaḥ indraḥ gāḥ avṛṇot apa
translated: He, the wise one, has chosen the cows for the Angirases.

original: stuṣe tad asya pauṃsyam //
analyzed: stuṣe tat asya pauṃsyam
translated: I praise that manly deed of his.

original: sa pratnathā kavivṛdha indro vākasya vakṣaṇiḥ /
analyzed: sa pratnathā kavi vṛdhaḥ indraḥ vākasya vakṣaṇiḥ
translated: He, the ancient, the wise one's strengthener, Indra, the bosom of the singer,

original: śivo arkasya homany asmatrā gantv avase //🔽ād ū nu te anu kratuṃ svāhā varasya yajyavaḥ /
analyzed: śivaḥ arkasya homani asmatrā gantu avase  āt u nu te anu kratum svāhā varasya yajyavaḥ
translated: May the auspicious one come to us for help, to the sacrifice of the sun.🔽From now on, in accordance with your will, O Svâhâ! the offerings of the sacrifice.

original: śvātram arkā anūṣatendra gotrasya dāvane //
analyzed: śvātram arkāḥ anūṣata indra gotrasya dāvane
translated: The Arka hymns have sung to you, O Indra, to give us the choice morsel.

original: indre viśvāni vīryā kṛtāni kartvāni ca /
analyzed: indre viśvāni vīryā kṛtāni kartvāni ca
translated: In Indra are all manly powers, those that have been done and those to be done.

original: yam arkā adhvaraṃ viduḥ //
analyzed: yam arkāḥ adhvaram viduḥ
translated: Which the Arka hymns know as the sacrifice.

original: yat pāñcajanyayā viśendre ghoṣā asṛkṣata /🔽astṛṇād barhaṇā vipo 'ryo mānasya sa kṣayaḥ //
analyzed: yat pāñcajanyayā viśā indre ghoṣāḥ asṛkṣata  astṛṇāt barhaṇā vipaḥ ryaḥ mānasya sa kṣayaḥ
translated: When the five-peoples have come forth, the voices have flowed to Indra,🔽He has strewn the grass widely, the abode of the noble thought.

original: iyam u te anuṣṭutiś cakṛṣe tāni pauṃsyā /
analyzed: iyam u te anuṣṭutiḥ cakṛṣe tāni pauṃsyā
translated: This praise of yours, O Indra, has won for you those manly deeds.

original: prāvaś cakrasya vartanim //
analyzed: prāvaḥ cakrasya vartanim
translated: You have set the wheel on its axle.

original: asya vṛṣṇo vyodana uru kramiṣṭa jīvase /
analyzed: asya vṛṣṇaḥ vi odanaḥ uru kramiṣṭa jīvase
translated: Of this bull, of the wide stride, do you step forth to live.

original: yavaṃ na paśva ā dade //
analyzed: yavam na paśve ā dade
translated: As one takes corn for the cattle.

original: tad dadhānā avasyavo yuṣmābhir dakṣapitaraḥ /
analyzed: tat dadhānāḥ avasyavaḥ yuṣmābhiḥ dakṣa pitaraḥ
translated: Endowed with that, O you who are to be served, O you whose father is Daksha,

original: syāma marutvato vṛdhe //🔽baḷ ṛtviyāya dhāmna ṛkvabhiḥ śūra nonumaḥ /
analyzed: syāma marutvataḥ vṛdhe  baṭ ṛtviyāya dhāmnaḥ ṛkvabhiḥ śūra nonumaḥ
translated: May we be for the increase of the Maruts.

original: jeṣāmendra tvayā yujā //
analyzed: jeṣāma indra tvayā yujā
translated: We, O Indra, with you for our ally,🔽Would win with you for our ally.

original: asme rudrā mehanā parvatāso vṛtrahatye bharahūtau sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: asme rudrāḥ mehanā parvatāsaḥ vṛtra hatye bhara hūtau sajoṣāḥ
translated: O Rudras, with the mountains, in the pouring rain, in the slaying of Vrtra, in the call to the feast, of one mind,

original: yaḥ śaṃsate stuvate dhāyi pajra indrajyeṣṭhā asmāṃ avantu devāḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ śaṃsate stuvate dhāyi pajraḥ indra jyeṣṭhāḥ asmān avantu devāḥ
translated: Who supports the one who praises and extols, may the gods, with Indra as their chief, help us.

original: ut tvā mandantu stomāḥ kṛṇuṣva rādho adrivaḥ /
analyzed: ud tvā mandantu stomāḥ kṛṇuṣva rādhaḥ adrivas
translated: Let the praises gladden thee: make room for bounty, O Thunderer.

original: ava brahmadviṣo jahi //
analyzed: ava brahma dviṣaḥ jahi
translated: Slay those who hate devotion.

original: padā paṇīṃr arādhaso ni bādhasva mahāṃ asi /
analyzed: padā paṇīṃr arādhasaḥ ni bādhasva mahān asi
translated: With thy foot crush the niggards: thou art mighty.

original: nahi tvā kaś cana prati //
analyzed: nahi tvā kaḥ cana prati
translated: None at all is equal to thee.

original: tvam īśiṣe sutānām indra tvam asutānām /
analyzed: tvam īśiṣe sutānām indra tvam a sutānām
translated: Thou art the Lord of the pressed (juice), O Indra, thou of the unpressed (juice).

original: tvaṃ rājā janānām //
analyzed: tvam rājā janānām
translated: Thou art the King of the people.

original: ehi prehi kṣayo divy āghoṣañ carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: ehi prehi kṣayaḥ divi āghoṣam carṣaṇīnām
translated: Come hither, go forward, O thou who art to be praised in heaven and on earth among men.

original: obhe pṛṇāsi rodasī //
analyzed: ā ubhe pṛṇāsi rodasī
translated: Thou fillest both worlds.

original: tyaṃ cit parvataṃ giriṃ śatavantaṃ sahasriṇam /
analyzed: tyam cit parvatam girim śatavantam sahasriṇam
translated: Thou hast cleft even the hundred-gated, thousand-teethed mountain, the rock,

original: vi stotṛbhyo rurojitha //
analyzed: vi stotṛbhyaḥ rurojitha
translated: For the worshippers.

original: vayam u tvā divā sute vayaṃ naktaṃ havāmahe /
analyzed: vayam u tvā divā sute vayam naktam havāmahe
translated: We call on thee, O Indra, in the day, we call on thee in the night, at the morning pressing.

original: asmākaṃ kāmam ā pṛṇa //
analyzed: asmākam kāmam ā pṛṇa
translated: Fulfil our desire.

original: kva sya vṛṣabho yuvā tuvigrīvo anānataḥ /
analyzed: kva sya vṛṣabhaḥ yuvā tuvi grīvaḥ an ānataḥ
translated: Where is that young bull, strong-necked, not to be bent,

original: brahmā kas taṃ saparyati //
analyzed: brahmā kaḥ tam saparyati
translated: Whom does the Brahman honour?

original: kasya svit savanaṃ vṛṣā jujuṣvāṃ ava gacchati /
analyzed: kasya svid savanam vṛṣā jujuṣvān ava gacchati
translated: Whose libation does the bull delight in, to whom does he come?

original: indraṃ ka u svid ā cake //🔽kaṃ te dānā asakṣata vṛtrahan kaṃ suvīryā /
analyzed: indram kaḥ u svid ā cake  kam te dānā asakṣata vṛtrahan kam su vīryā
translated: Who at all does choose Indra?🔽Whom of the bountiful, O Vr̥itra-slayer, whom of the heroic,

original: ukthe ka u svid antamaḥ //
analyzed: ukthe kaḥ u svid antamaḥ
translated: Whom of the singers does he most delight?

original: ayaṃ te mānuṣe jane somaḥ pūruṣu sūyate /
analyzed: ayam te mānuṣe jane somaḥ pūruṣu sūyate
translated: This Soma is pressed for thee among men, among the Pûrus.

original: tasyehi pra dravā piba //
analyzed: tasya ihi pra drava piba
translated: Come hither, run forward, and drink.

original: ayaṃ te śaryaṇāvati suṣomāyām adhi priyaḥ /
analyzed: ayam te śaryaṇāvati suṣomāyām adhi priyaḥ
translated: This is your dear (place) in the well-milked (cow) of Śaryṇāvat,

original: ārjīkīye madintamaḥ //
analyzed: ārjīkīye madintamaḥ
translated: In Ārjīkīya, most delightful.

original: tam adya rādhase mahe cārum madāya ghṛṣvaye /
analyzed: tam adya rādhase mahe cārum madāya ghṛṣvaye
translated: For that great bounty of yours today, O bountiful one,

original: ehīm indra dravā piba //
analyzed: ehi īm indra drava piba
translated: Come, O Indra, and drink the flowing (Soma).

original: yad indra prāg apāg udaṅ nyag vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: yat indra prāk apāk udak nyak vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ
translated: When, O Indra, you are invoked by men to the east, west, north, or downward,

original: ā yāhi tūyam āśubhiḥ //
analyzed: ā yāhi tūyam āśubhiḥ
translated: Come hither quickly with the swift (horses).

original: yad vā prasravaṇe divo mādayāse svarṇare /
analyzed: yat vā prasravaṇe divaḥ mādayāse svarṇare
translated: When you rejoice in the stream of the sky, O golden one,

original: yad vā samudre andhasaḥ //
analyzed: yat vā samudre andhasaḥ
translated: Or in the Soma of the ocean.

original: ā tvā gīrbhir mahām uruṃ huve gām iva bhojase /
analyzed: ā tvā gīrbhiḥ mahām urum huve gām iva bhojase
translated: I invoke you, O great one, with songs, like a cow for enjoyment,

original: indra somasya pītaye //
analyzed: indra somasya pītaye
translated: O Indra, to drink the Soma.

original: ā ta indra mahimānaṃ harayo deva te mahaḥ /🔽rathe vahantu bibhrataḥ //
analyzed: ā te indra mahimānam harayaḥ deva te mahaḥ  rathe vahantu bibhrataḥ
translated: O Indra, let your strong Bay Steeds bring you hither, bearing you,🔽To your own great power.

original: indra gṛṇīṣa u stuṣe mahāṃ ugra īśānakṛt /
analyzed: indra gṛṇīṣe u stuṣe mahān ugraḥ īśāna kṛt
translated: O Indra, I praise and extol you, the great, fierce one who acts as lord.

original: ehi naḥ sutam piba //
analyzed: ehi naḥ sutam piba
translated: Come and drink our pressed (Soma).

original: sutāvantas tvā vayam prayasvanto havāmahe /
analyzed: sutāvantaḥ tvā vayam prayasvantaḥ havāmahe
translated: We, the pressed (Soma-offerers), the generous ones, invoke you,

original: idaṃ no barhir āsade //
analyzed: idam naḥ barhiḥ āsade
translated: To sit on this our sacred grass.

original: yac cid dhi śaśvatām asīndra sādhāraṇas tvam /
analyzed: yat cit hi śaśvatām asi indra sādhāraṇaḥ tvam
translated: For you are indeed the common property of all, O Indra,

original: taṃ tvā vayaṃ havāmahe //🔽idaṃ te somyam madhv adhukṣann adribhir naraḥ /
analyzed: tam tvā vayam havāmahe  idam te somyam madhu adhukṣan adribhiḥ naraḥ
translated: We invoke you for that.🔽The men have milked this sweet Soma of yours with the stones, O Indra.

original: juṣāṇa indra tat piba //
analyzed: juṣāṇaḥ indra tat piba
translated: Accept it and drink it.

original: viśvāṃ aryo vipaścito 'ti khyas tūyam ā gahi /
analyzed: viśvān aryaḥ vipaścitaḥ ti khyaḥ tūyam ā gahi
translated: O all-knowing, all-seeing one, come quickly to us.

original: asme dhehi śravo bṛhat //
analyzed: asme dhehi śravaḥ bṛhat
translated: Grant us great fame.

original: dātā me pṛṣatīnāṃ rājā hiraṇyavīnām /
analyzed: dātā me pṛṣatīnām rājā hiraṇyavīnām
translated: The giver of spotted cows, the king of those who possess gold,

original: mā devā maghavā riṣat //
analyzed: mā devāḥ maghavā riṣat
translated: May the generous god not injure me.

original: sahasre pṛṣatīnām adhi ścandram bṛhat pṛthu /
analyzed: sahasre pṛṣatīnām adhi ścandram bṛhat pṛthu
translated: On a thousand spotted cows, on the bright, great, wide,

original: śukraṃ hiraṇyam ā dade //
analyzed: śukram hiraṇyam ā dade
translated: I have taken the pure gold.

original: napāto durgahasya me sahasreṇa surādhasaḥ /
analyzed: napātaḥ durgahasya me sahasreṇa su rādhasaḥ
translated: The son of Durgaha, with a thousand, very generous,

original: śravo deveṣv akrata //
analyzed: śravaḥ deveṣu akrata
translated: Has made fame among the gods.

original: tarobhir vo vidadvasum indraṃ sabādha ūtaye /
analyzed: tarobhiḥ vaḥ vidadvasum indram sabādhas ūtaye
translated: With praises I call Indra, the bestower of wealth, to help,

original: bṛhad gāyantaḥ sutasome adhvare huve bharaṃ na kāriṇam //
analyzed: bṛhat gāyantaḥ suta some adhvare huve bharam na kāriṇam
translated: Singing loudly at the sacrifice where Soma is pressed, the performer of great deeds.

original: na yaṃ dudhrā varante na sthirā muro made suśipram andhasaḥ /
analyzed: na yam dudhrāḥ varante na sthirāḥ muraḥ made su śipram andhasaḥ
translated: Whom the strong ones do not hold back, the firm ones, in the intoxication of the strong drink, the one with beautiful eyebrows, of the juice,

original: ya ādṛtyā śaśamānāya sunvate dātā jaritra ukthyam //
analyzed: yaḥ ādṛtya śaśamānāya sunvate dātā jaritre ukthyam
translated: Who, being honored, gives to the pressing worshiper the praiseworthy gift.

original: yaḥ śakro mṛkṣo aśvyo yo vā kījo hiraṇyayaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ śakraḥ mṛkṣaḥ aśvyaḥ yaḥ vā kījaḥ hiraṇyayaḥ
translated: He who is the horse-like Shakra, or the golden one who is the Kīka,

original: sa ūrvasya rejayaty apāvṛtim indro gavyasya vṛtrahā //
analyzed: saḥ ūrvasya rejayati apāvṛtim indraḥ gavyasya vṛtrahā
translated: Indra stretches out the covering of the cow-pen, the slayer of Vṛtra.

original: nikhātaṃ cid yaḥ purusambhṛtaṃ vasūd id vapati dāśuṣe /
analyzed: nikhātam cit yaḥ puru sambhṛtam vasu ud id vapati dāśuṣe
translated: He who digs out even what is well-hidden, the treasure gathered by many, he gives to the worshiper.

original: vajrī suśipro haryaśva it karad indraḥ kratvā yathā vaśat //
analyzed: vajrī su śipraḥ haryaśvaḥ id karat indraḥ kratvā yathā vaśat
translated: The wielder of the thunderbolt, the one with beautiful eyebrows, the one with tawny horses, Indra, by his wisdom, as he wills.

original: yad vāvantha puruṣṭuta purā cic chūra nṛṇām /
analyzed: yat vāvantha puruṣṭuta purā cit śūra nṛṇām
translated: What, O much-praised one, thou hast done, O hero, before men,

original: vayaṃ tat ta indra sam bharāmasi yajñam ukthaṃ turaṃ vacaḥ //🔽sacā someṣu puruhūta vajrivo madāya dyukṣa somapāḥ /
analyzed: vayam tat te indra sam bharāmasi yajñam uktham turam vacaḥ  sacā someṣu puruhūta vajrivas madāya dyukṣa soma pāḥ
translated: We, O Indra, bring that to thee: the sacrifice, the hymn, the strong word.🔽O much-invoked one, O wielder of the thunderbolt, O you who enjoy Soma in the sky, for the sake of joy in the Soma libations,

original: tvam id dhi brahmakṛte kāmyaṃ vasu deṣṭhaḥ sunvate bhuvaḥ //
analyzed: tvam id hi brahma kṛte kāmyam vasu deṣṭhaḥ sunvate bhuvaḥ
translated: You are indeed the most desirable wealth for the one who creates the prayer, the most desirable for the one who presses (Soma).

original: vayam enam idā hyo 'pīpemeha vajriṇam /
analyzed: vayam enam idā hyas pīpema iha vajriṇam
translated: We have indeed served this very Indra here, the wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: tasmā u adya samanā sutam bharā nūnam bhūṣata śrute //
analyzed: tasmai u adya samanā sutam bhara nūnam bhūṣata śrute
translated: For him we bring the pressed Soma today, now indeed let us serve the famous one.

original: vṛkaś cid asya vāraṇa urāmathir ā vayuneṣu bhūṣati /
analyzed: vṛkaḥ cit asya vāraṇaḥ urāmathiḥ ā vayuneṣu bhūṣati
translated: Even the wolf, his protector, the one who crushes the strong, is adorned in the battles.

original: semaṃ na stomaṃ jujuṣāṇa ā gahīndra pra citrayā dhiyā //🔽kad ū nv asyākṛtam indrasyāsti pauṃsyam /
analyzed: sa imam naḥ stomam jujuṣāṇaḥ ā gahi indra pra citrayā dhiyā  kad u nu asya a kṛtam indrasya asti pauṃsyam
translated: Accept this praise of ours, O Indra, come with wondrous thought.🔽What deed of Indra is not done? What man's strength is equal to his?

original: keno nu kaṃ śromatena na śuśruve januṣaḥ pari vṛtrahā //
analyzed: kena u nu kam śromatena na śuśruve januṣaḥ pari vṛtrahā
translated: By what fame has he not been heard, the Vritra-slayer, from the beginning?

original: kad ū mahīr adhṛṣṭā asya taviṣīḥ kad u vṛtraghno astṛtam /🔽indro viśvān bekanāṭāṃ ahardṛśa uta kratvā paṇīṃr abhi //
analyzed: kad u mahīḥ adhṛṣṭāḥ asya taviṣīḥ kad u vṛtra ghna u astṛtam  indraḥ viśvān bekanāṭām ahardṛśaḥ uta kratvā paṇīṃr abhi
translated: What are his great, unassailable powers? What is the invincible weapon of the Vritra-slayer?🔽Indra, who sees all the days, surpasses the Paṇis by his wisdom.

original: vayaṃ ghā te apūrvyendra brahmāṇi vṛtrahan /
analyzed: vayam gha te apūrvya indra brahmāṇi vṛtrahan
translated: We, O Indra, the Vṛtra-slayer, have brought you, O you of incomparable deeds, prayers,

original: purūtamāsaḥ puruhūta vajrivo bhṛtiṃ na pra bharāmasi //
analyzed: purūtamāsaḥ puruhūta vajrivas bhṛtim na pra bharāmasi
translated: O most bountiful, most invoked, O wielder of the thunderbolt, we bring thee tribute as a fee.

original: pūrvīś cid dhi tve tuvikūrminn āśaso havanta indrotayaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvīḥ cit hi tve tuvikūrmin āśasaḥ havante indrā ūtayaḥ
translated: For even many, O thou of great power, in hope call upon thee, O Indra, for help.

original: tiraś cid aryaḥ savanā vaso gahi śaviṣṭha śrudhi me havam //
analyzed: tiras cit aryaḥ savanā vaso gahi śaviṣṭha śrudhi me havam
translated: Pass over the wicked libations, O good one, accept the most manly one, O mightiest one, listen to my call.

original: vayaṃ ghā te tve id v indra viprā api ṣmasi /
analyzed: vayam gha te tve id u indra viprāḥ api smasi
translated: We, O Indra, are indeed thy priests, O thou of great power.

original: nahi tvad anyaḥ puruhūta kaś cana maghavann asti marḍitā //
analyzed: nahi tvat anyaḥ puruhūta kaḥ cana maghavan asti marḍitā
translated: For there is none other than thee, O bountiful one, to pardon, O much-invoked one.

original: tvaṃ no asyā amater uta kṣudho 'bhiśaster ava spṛdhi /
analyzed: tvam naḥ asyāḥ amateḥ uta kṣudhaḥ bhiśasteḥ ava spṛdhi
translated: Do thou deliver us from this misfortune, from hunger, from the curse.

original: tvaṃ na ūtī tava citrayā dhiyā śikṣā śaciṣṭha gātuvit //
analyzed: tvam naḥ ūtī tava citrayā dhiyā śikṣa śaciṣṭha gātu vid
translated: Do thou, O mighty one, O thou who knowest the way, instruct us with thy wondrous thought for help.

original: soma id vaḥ suto astu kalayo mā bibhītana /
analyzed: somaḥ id vaḥ sutaḥ astu kalayaḥ mā bibhītana
translated: Let the Soma be pressed for you, O people, do not be afraid.

original: aped eṣa dhvasmāyati svayaṃ ghaiṣo apāyati //
analyzed: apa id eṣa dhvasmā ayati svayam gha eṣaḥ apāyati
translated: This evil has departed, this has gone away of itself.

original: tyān nu kṣatriyāṃ ava ādityān yāciṣāmahe /
analyzed: tyān nu kṣatriyām avaḥ ādityān yāciṣāmahe
translated: Now we invoke the Kshatriyas, the Adityas,

original: sumṛḷīkāṃ abhiṣṭaye //
analyzed: su mṛḍīkām abhiṣṭaye
translated: for gracious favour.

original: mitro no aty aṃhatiṃ varuṇaḥ parṣad aryamā /
analyzed: mitraḥ naḥ ati aṃhatim varuṇaḥ parṣat aryamā
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, and Aryaman carry us over the distress,

original: ādityāso yathā viduḥ //
analyzed: ādityāsaḥ yathā viduḥ
translated: as the Adityas know how to do.

original: teṣāṃ hi citram ukthyaṃ varūtham asti dāśuṣe /
analyzed: teṣām hi citram ukthyam varūtham asti dāśuṣe
translated: For they have a wondrous protection for the worshipper,

original: ādityānām araṅkṛte //
analyzed: ādityānām araṅkṛte
translated: of the Adityas, who have made ready.

original: mahi vo mahatām avo varuṇa mitrāryaman /
analyzed: mahi vaḥ mahatām avaḥ varuṇa mitra aryaman
translated: Great is your great help, O Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman.

original: avāṃsy ā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: avāṃsi ā vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose you for our portion.

original: jīvān no abhi dhetanādityāsaḥ purā hathāt /
analyzed: jīvān naḥ abhi dhetana ādityāsaḥ purā hathāt
translated: O Âdityas, protect us from the curse before the curse hath come.

original: kad dha stha havanaśrutaḥ //
analyzed: kad ha stha havana śrutaḥ
translated: How long will ye be slow to hear our call?

original: yad vaḥ śrāntāya sunvate varūtham asti yac chardiḥ /
analyzed: yat vaḥ śrāntāya sunvate varūtham asti yat chardiḥ
translated: That help which ye have for the worshipper who presses out the juice, that shelter,

original: tenā no adhi vocata //
analyzed: tena naḥ adhi vocata
translated: therewith assist us.

original: asti devā aṃhor urv asti ratnam anāgasaḥ /
analyzed: asti devāḥ aṃhoḥ uru asti ratnam anāgasaḥ
translated: Ye Gods, there is a way of bliss, there is a treasure free from pain,

original: ādityā adbhutainasaḥ //
analyzed: ādityāḥ adbhuta enasaḥ
translated: O Âdityas, from the wondrous curse.

original: mā naḥ setuḥ siṣed ayam mahe vṛṇaktu nas pari /
analyzed: mā naḥ setuḥ siṣet ayam mahe vṛṇaktu naḥ pari
translated: Let not this bridge of yours be closed to us: let it be opened wide for us.

original: indra id dhi śruto vaśī //🔽mā no mṛcā ripūṇāṃ vṛjinānām aviṣyavaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ id hi śrutaḥ vaśī  mā naḥ mṛcā ripūṇām vṛjinānām aviṣyavaḥ
translated: For Indra is the known and mighty One.🔽Do not, O Gods, destroy us, as the treacherous, spiteful, and the envious destroy.

original: devā abhi pra mṛkṣata //🔽uta tvām adite mahy ahaṃ devy upa bruve /
analyzed: devāḥ abhi pra mṛkṣata  uta tvām adite mahi aham devi upa bruve
translated: But favour us with blessings.🔽And I, O Aditi, the Goddess, call on thee for help,

original: sumṛḷīkām abhiṣṭaye //
analyzed: su mṛḍīkām abhiṣṭaye
translated: Most gracious One, to succour me.

original: parṣi dīne gabhīra āṃ ugraputre jighāṃsataḥ /
analyzed: parṣi dīne gabhīre ām ugra putre jighāṃsataḥ
translated: Thou savest from the deep the man who sinks, from the impetuous foe.

original: mākis tokasya no riṣat //
analyzed: mākir tokasya naḥ riṣat
translated: Let not our children perish.

original: aneho na uruvraja urūci vi prasartave /
analyzed: anehaḥ naḥ uru vraje urūci vi prasartave
translated: For the wide-spreading, wide-pasturing, free-roaming one,

original: kṛdhi tokāya jīvase //🔽ye mūrdhānaḥ kṣitīnām adabdhāsaḥ svayaśasaḥ /
analyzed: kṛdhi tokāya jīvase  ye mūrdhānaḥ kṣitīnām adabdhāsaḥ sva yaśasaḥ
translated: make thou room that our children may live.🔽They who are heads of men, infallible, of noble fame,

original: vratā rakṣante adruhaḥ //
analyzed: vratā rakṣante adruhaḥ
translated: who guard their laws, and are not false.

original: te na āsno vṛkāṇām ādityāso mumocata /
analyzed: te naḥ āsnaḥ vṛkāṇām ādityāsaḥ mumocata
translated: The Adityas have delivered us from the jaws of the wolves,

original: stenam baddham ivādite //
analyzed: stenam baddham iva adite
translated: As from the sun a bound thief.

original: apo ṣu ṇa iyaṃ śarur ādityā apa durmatiḥ /
analyzed: apa u su naḥ iyam śaruḥ ādityāḥ apa durmatiḥ
translated: O Adityas, may this arrow of yours, this evil thought,

original: asmad etv ajaghnuṣī //🔽śaśvad dhi vaḥ sudānava ādityā ūtibhir vayam /
analyzed: asmat etu a jaghnuṣī  śaśvat hi vaḥ sudānavaḥ ādityāḥ ūtibhiḥ vayam
translated: Turn away from us, O slayers!🔽For ever, O ye bountiful, we have enjoyed, O ye Ādityas,

original: purā nūnam bubhujmahe //🔽śaśvantaṃ hi pracetasaḥ pratiyantaṃ cid enasaḥ /
analyzed: purā nūnam bubhujmahe  śaśvantam hi pracetasaḥ pratiyantam cit enasaḥ
translated: By your protections, O ye of mighty wealth.🔽For ever, O ye wise ones, even him who is turning away from sin,

original: devāḥ kṛṇutha jīvase //
analyzed: devāḥ kṛṇutha jīvase
translated: Ye Gods, make ye alive.

original: tat su no navyaṃ sanyasa ādityā yan mumocati /
analyzed: tat su naḥ navyam sanyase ādityāḥ yat mumocati
translated: That new favour of yours, O Ādityas, whereby ye deliver us,

original: bandhād baddham ivādite //
analyzed: bandhāt baddham iva adite
translated: As from the sun a bound thief.

original: nāsmākam asti tat tara ādityāso atiṣkade /
analyzed: na asmākam asti tat taraḥ ādityāsaḥ atiṣkade
translated: That is not ours, O Ādityas, which ye may surpass,

original: yūyam asmabhyam mṛḷata //
analyzed: yūyam asmabhyam mṛḍata
translated: Be gracious unto us.

original: mā no hetir vivasvata ādityāḥ kṛtrimā śaruḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ hetiḥ vivasvataḥ ādityāḥ kṛtrimā śaruḥ
translated: Let not the dart of Vivasvan, O ye Ādityas, the artificial arrow,

original: purā nu jaraso vadhīt //🔽vi ṣu dveṣo vy aṃhatim ādityāso vi saṃhitam /
analyzed: purā nu jarasaḥ vadhīt  vi su dveṣaḥ vi aṃhatim ādityāsaḥ vi saṃhitam
translated: Slay us before old age.🔽Drive away hatred, drive away affliction, O ye Ādityas, drive away the snare,

original: viṣvag vi vṛhatā rapaḥ //
analyzed: viṣvak vi vṛhata rapaḥ
translated: Drive away the curse on every side.
