original: ā tvā rathaṃ yathotaye sumnāya vartayāmasi /🔽tuvikūrmim ṛtīṣaham indra śaviṣṭha satpate //
analyzed: ā tvā ratham yathā ūtaye sumnāya vartayāmasi  tuvikūrmim ṛtīṣaham indra śaviṣṭha satpate
translated: We guide thee to the car, as it were, to the help, to the bliss,

original: tuviśuṣma tuvikrato śacīvo viśvayā mate /
analyzed: tuvi śuṣma tuvi krato śacīvas viśvayā mate
translated: O Indra, most mighty, lord of the brave, of great far-reaching might, of great triumphs, in all the thought,

original: ā paprātha mahitvanā //
analyzed: ā paprātha mahitvanā
translated: Thou hast extended thy greatness.

original: yasya te mahinā mahaḥ pari jmāyantam īyatuḥ /
analyzed: yasya te mahinā mahaḥ pari jmāyantam īyatuḥ
translated: Whose great might, in its greatness, hath encompassed the moving (world),

original: hastā vajraṃ hiraṇyayam //
analyzed: hastāḥ vajram hiraṇyayam
translated: Whose hand holds the golden thunderbolt.

original: viśvānarasya vas patim anānatasya śavasaḥ /
analyzed: viśvānarasya vaḥ patim an ānatasya śavasaḥ
translated: The lord of the all-encompassing, the unbent, the powerful,

original: evaiś ca carṣaṇīnām ūtī huve rathānām //
analyzed: evaiḥ ca carṣaṇīnām ūtī huve rathānām
translated: The helper of the people and of the chariots, I invoke.

original: abhiṣṭaye sadāvṛdhaṃ svarmīḷheṣu yaṃ naraḥ /
analyzed: abhiṣṭaye sadāvṛdham svarmīḷheṣu yam naraḥ
translated: The ever-waxing (god) for protection, whom men invoke in the battles for heaven,

original: nānā havanta ūtaye //
analyzed: nānā havante ūtaye
translated: For help, each one separately.

original: paromātram ṛcīṣamam indram ugraṃ surādhasam /🔽īśānaṃ cid vasūnām //
analyzed: paromātram ṛcīṣamam indram ugram su rādhasam  īśānam cit vasūnām
translated: The most distant, the most excellent, the strong, the very bountiful Indra,🔽The lord of wealth,

original: taṃtam id rādhase maha indraṃ codāmi pītaye /
analyzed: taṃtam id rādhase mahe indram codāmi pītaye
translated: Him, for the great gift, I urge, Indra, to drink,

original: yaḥ pūrvyām anuṣṭutim īśe kṛṣṭīnāṃ nṛtuḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ pūrvyām anuṣṭutim īśe kṛṣṭīnām nṛtuḥ
translated: Who is the lord of the ancient praise, the dancer of the people.

original: na yasya te śavasāna sakhyam ānaṃśa martyaḥ /
analyzed: na yasya te śavasāna sakhyam ānaṃśa martyaḥ
translated: No mortal hath obtained a share in thy companionship, O thou of power,

original: nakiḥ śavāṃsi te naśat //
analyzed: nakir śavāṃsi te naśat
translated: No one hath obtained thy favours.

original: tvotāsas tvā yujāpsu sūrye mahad dhanam /
analyzed: tvotāsaḥ tvā yujā apsu sūrye mahat dhanam
translated: The worshippers, the sacrificers, in the waters, in the sun, for the great prize,

original: jayema pṛtsu vajrivaḥ //
analyzed: jayema pṛtsu vajrivas
translated: May we win in battles, O wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: taṃ tvā yajñebhir īmahe taṃ gīrbhir girvaṇastama /
analyzed: tam tvā yajñebhiḥ īmahe tam gīrbhiḥ girvaṇastama
translated: Thee we invoke for the sacrifice, thee with the songs, O best lover of song,

original: indra yathā cid āvitha vājeṣu purumāyyam //
analyzed: indra yathā cit āvitha vājeṣu purumāyyam
translated: O Indra, as thou hast helped in the battles, the most bountiful one.

original: yasya te svādu sakhyaṃ svādvī praṇītir adrivaḥ /
analyzed: yasya te svādu sakhyam svādvī praṇītiḥ adrivas
translated: Whose companionship with thee is sweet, whose guidance is sweet, O wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: yajño vitantasāyyaḥ //
analyzed: yajñaḥ vitantasāyyaḥ
translated: Whose sacrifice is to be extended.

original: uru ṇas tanve tana uru kṣayāya nas kṛdhi /
analyzed: uru naḥ tanve tane uru kṣayāya naḥ kṛdhi
translated: Make wide room for our body, make wide room for our dwelling.

original: uru ṇo yandhi jīvase //
analyzed: uru naḥ yandhi jīvase
translated: Make wide room for us to live.

original: uruṃ nṛbhya uruṃ gava uruṃ rathāya panthām /
analyzed: urum nṛbhyaḥ urum gave urum rathāya panthām
translated: Wide room for men, wide room for cattle, wide room for the chariot's path,

original: devavītim manāmahe //
analyzed: deva vītim manāmahe
translated: We think of the way to the gods.

original: upa mā ṣaḍ dvādvā naraḥ somasya harṣyā /
analyzed: upa mā ṣaṭ dvādvāḥ naraḥ somasya harṣyā
translated: Six and twelve men have come to me through the joy of Soma,

original: tiṣṭhanti svādurātayaḥ //
analyzed: tiṣṭhanti svādu rātayaḥ
translated: Standing, with sweet gifts.

original: ṛjrāv indrota ā dade harī ṛkṣasya sūnavi /
analyzed: ṛjrau indrote ā dade harī ṛkṣasya sūnavi
translated: The two red ones, Indra and Vayu, have taken the two tawny mares of Ṛkṣa,

original: āśvamedhasya rohitā //🔽surathāṃ ātithigve svabhīśūṃr ārkṣe /
analyzed: āśvamedhasya rohitā  su rathān ātithigve su abhīśūn ārkṣe
translated: The red ones of the horse sacrifice.🔽With good chariots, Atithigva, with self-moving reins, in the horse sacrifice,

original: āśvamedhe supeśasaḥ //
analyzed: āśvamedhe supeśasaḥ
translated: With beautiful forms.

original: ṣaḷ aśvāṃ ātithigva indrote vadhūmataḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṭ aśvān ātithigve indrote vadhūmataḥ
translated: Six horses, Atithigva, Indra and Vayu, with the bride's father,

original: sacā pūtakratau sanam //🔽aiṣu cetad vṛṣaṇvaty antar ṛjreṣv aruṣī /
analyzed: sacā pūtakratau sanam  ā eṣu cetat vṛṣaṇvatī antar ṛjreṣu aruṣī
translated: Together with Pūtanakrata, they rejoice.🔽This is the strong one among the two red ones, the red one among the strong ones,

original: svabhīśuḥ kaśāvatī //
analyzed: su abhīśuḥ kaśāvatī
translated: With good reins, with whips.

original: na yuṣme vājabandhavo ninitsuś cana martyaḥ /
analyzed: na yuṣme vāja bandhavaḥ ninitsuḥ cana martyaḥ
translated: No mortal, O you who bind the booty, would dare to despise you,

original: avadyam adhi dīdharat //
analyzed: avadyam adhi dīdharat
translated: To place a blemish upon you.

original: prapra vas triṣṭubham iṣam mandadvīrāyendave /
analyzed: pra pra vaḥ triṣṭubham iṣam mandat vīrāya indave
translated: I send forth your Tristubh food to the Indra who delights in heroes,

original: dhiyā vo medhasātaye purandhyā vivāsati //
analyzed: dhiyā vaḥ medha sātaye purandhyā vivāsati
translated: With thought, for the sake of your wisdom, with longing he dwells.

original: nadaṃ va odatīnāṃ nadaṃ yoyuvatīnām /
analyzed: nadam vaḥ odatīnām nadam yoyuvatīnām
translated: The roaring one of the lowing ones, the roaring one of the young ones,

original: patiṃ vo aghnyānāṃ dhenūnām iṣudhyasi //
analyzed: patim vaḥ aghnyānām dhenūnām iṣudhyasi
translated: You honour the lord of your cows, the undying ones, as a milch cow.

original: tā asya sūdadohasaḥ somaṃ śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ
translated: Those dappled ones, his Sûdadohas, mix the Soma for him,

original: janman devānāṃ viśas triṣv ā rocane divaḥ //
analyzed: janman devānām viśaḥ triṣu ā rocane divaḥ
translated: The tribes of Gods in the three luminous realms of heaven.

original: abhi pra gopatiṃ girendram arca yathā vide /
analyzed: abhi pra go patim girā indram arca yathā vide
translated: Praise thou the Lord of cattle, the mountain, Indra, as thou knowest him,

original: sūnuṃ satyasya satpatim //
analyzed: sūnum satyasya sat patim
translated: The son of Truth, the Lord of the brave.

original: ā harayaḥ sasṛjrire 'ruṣīr adhi barhiṣi /
analyzed: ā harayaḥ sasṛjrire ruṣīḥ adhi barhiṣi
translated: The ruddy mares have been let loose upon the sacred grass,

original: yatrābhi saṃnavāmahe //
analyzed: yatra abhi saṃnavāmahe
translated: Where we shall meet together.

original: indrāya gāva āśiraṃ duduhre vajriṇe madhu /
analyzed: indrāya gāvaḥ āśiram duduhre vajriṇe madhu
translated: To Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the cows have yielded the sweet drink, the milk,

original: yat sīm upahvare vidat //
analyzed: yat sīm upahvare vidat
translated: When he hath found it on the sloping (mountains).

original: ud yad bradhnasya viṣṭapaṃ gṛham indraś ca ganvahi /
analyzed: ud yat bradhnasya viṣṭapam gṛham indraḥ ca ganvahi
translated: When he hath mounted the ridge of the vault, Indra and Vâyu have gone to the house,

original: madhvaḥ pītvā sacevahi triḥ sapta sakhyuḥ pade //
analyzed: madhvaḥ pītvā sacevahi tris sapta sakhyuḥ pade
translated: Having drunk the sweet drink, they have gone together to the friend's place, thrice seven times.

original: arcata prārcata priyamedhāso arcata /
analyzed: arcata prārcata priyamedhāsaḥ arcata
translated: Praise ye, praise well the Priyamedhas, praise them.

original: arcantu putrakā uta puraṃ na dhṛṣṇv arcata //🔽ava svarāti gargaro godhā pari saniṣvaṇat /
analyzed: arcantu putrakāḥ uta puram na dhṛṣṇu arcata  ava svarāti gargaraḥ godhā pari saniṣvaṇat
translated: Let the sons praise, let the bold one praise the fort.🔽The frog hath croaked aloud, the lizard hath hissed around,

original: piṅgā pari caniṣkadad indrāya brahmodyatam //
analyzed: piṅgā pari caniṣkadat indrāya brahma udyatam
translated: The tawny one hath howled around: the prayer hath been raised to Indra.

original: ā yat patanty enyaḥ sudughā anapasphuraḥ /
analyzed: ā yat patanti enyaḥ su dughāḥ an apasphuraḥ
translated: When the birds fly down, the well-milked (cows), not drivelling,

original: apasphuraṃ gṛbhāyata somam indrāya pātave //
analyzed: apasphuram gṛbhāyata somam indrāya pātave
translated: Seize the drivelling one: take the Soma to Indra to drink.

original: apād indro apād agnir viśve devā amatsata /
analyzed: apāt indraḥ apāt agniḥ viśve devāḥ amatsata
translated: Indra hath limped, Agni hath limped: all the Gods have limped.

original: varuṇa id iha kṣayat tam āpo abhy anūṣata vatsaṃ saṃśiśvarīr iva //
analyzed: varuṇe id iha kṣayat tam āpaḥ abhī anūṣata vatsam saṃśiśvarīḥ iva
translated: Varuna, who rules here, the waters have sung to him,🔽As a loving mother to her child.

original: sudevo asi varuṇa yasya te sapta sindhavaḥ /
analyzed: su devaḥ asi varuṇa yasya te sapta sindhavaḥ
translated: Thou art a good god, O Varuna, whose seven rivers

original: anukṣaranti kākudaṃ sūrmyaṃ suṣirām iva //
analyzed: anukṣaranti kākudam sūrmyam suṣirām iva
translated: Flow down to the bubbling cauldron, like a sieve.

original: yo vyatīṃr aphāṇayat suyuktāṃ upa dāśuṣe /🔽takvo netā tad id vapur upamā yo amucyata //
analyzed: yaḥ vyatīṃr aphāṇayat su yuktām upa dāśuṣe  takvaḥ netā tat id vapuḥ upamā yaḥ amucyata
translated: He who has loosed the well-yoked teams for the worshipper,🔽The leader, the swift one, that is his wondrous form, he who was set free.

original: atīd u śakra ohata indro viśvā ati dviṣaḥ /
analyzed: ati id u śakraḥ ohate indraḥ viśvāḥ ati dviṣaḥ
translated: Indra, the mighty one, has overcome all enmities,

original: bhinat kanīna odanam pacyamānam paro girā //
analyzed: bhinat kanīnaḥ odanam pacyamānam paras girā
translated: The youngling has burst the pot that was being cooked, with a loud voice.

original: arbhako na kumārako 'dhi tiṣṭhan navaṃ ratham /
analyzed: arbhakaḥ na kumārakaḥ dhi tiṣṭhat navam ratham
translated: Like a boy, like a youth, standing on a new chariot,

original: sa pakṣan mahiṣam mṛgam pitre mātre vibhukratum //
analyzed: sa pakṣat mahiṣam mṛgam pitre mātre vibhu kratum
translated: He has killed the mighty buffalo for his father and mother.

original: ā tū suśipra dampate rathaṃ tiṣṭhā hiraṇyayam /
analyzed: ā tū su śipra dampate ratham tiṣṭha hiraṇyayam
translated: O thou of beautiful eyebrows, O lord of the house, mount thy golden chariot,

original: adha dyukṣaṃ sacevahi sahasrapādam aruṣaṃ svastigām anehasam //
analyzed: adha dyukṣam sacevahi sahasra pādam aruṣam svasti gām anehasam
translated: And then thou shalt travel with the heavenly one, the red one with a thousand feet, who goes to bliss, who is faultless.

original: taṃ ghem itthā namasvina upa svarājam āsate /
analyzed: tam gha īm itthā namasvinaḥ upa svarājam āsate
translated: To him, indeed, in this way, the worshippers sit down near the self-ruler,

original: arthaṃ cid asya sudhitaṃ yad etava āvartayanti dāvane //
analyzed: artham cit asya sudhitam yat etave āvartayanti dāvane
translated: Even to obtain his well-ordered wealth, which they turn back for the sake of giving.

original: anu pratnasyaukasaḥ priyamedhāsa eṣām /
analyzed: anu pratnasya okasaḥ priyamedhāsaḥ eṣām
translated: The ancient ones, the dear ones, the wise ones of these (gods),

original: pūrvām anu prayatiṃ vṛktabarhiṣo hitaprayasa āśata //
analyzed: pūrvām anu prayatim vṛkta barhiṣaḥ hita prayasaḥ āśata
translated: The first, the last, the middle (priests) have come to the sacrifice, the priests whose sacred grass is strewn, who have set their viands forth.

original: yo rājā carṣaṇīnāṃ yātā rathebhir adhriguḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ rājā carṣaṇīnām yātā rathebhiḥ adhriguḥ
translated: He who is the king of men, who moves on his cars, irresistible,

original: viśvāsāṃ tarutā pṛtanānāṃ jyeṣṭho yo vṛtrahā gṛṇe //🔽indraṃ taṃ śumbha puruhanmann avase yasya dvitā vidhartari /
analyzed: viśvāsām tarutā pṛtanānām jyeṣṭhaḥ yaḥ vṛtra hā gṛṇe  indram tam śumbha puru hanman avase yasya dvitā vidhartari
translated: The conqueror of all battles, the eldest, the Vr̥itra-slayer, whom I praise.🔽That Indra, O ye rich in friends, the ever-waxing, the far-extending,

original: hastāya vajraḥ prati dhāyi darśato maho dive na sūryaḥ //
analyzed: hastāya vajraḥ prati dhāyi darśataḥ mahaḥ dive na sūryaḥ
translated: The wondrous bolt hath been deposited in his hand, as the great Sun in heaven.

original: nakiṣ ṭaṃ karmaṇā naśad yaś cakāra sadāvṛdham /🔽indraṃ na yajñair viśvagūrtam ṛbhvasam adhṛṣṭaṃ dhṛṣṇvojasam //
analyzed: nakir tam karmaṇā naśat yaḥ cakāra sadāvṛdham  indram na yajñaiḥ viśva gūrtam ṛbhvasam adhṛṣṭam dhṛṣṇu ojasam
translated: No one by work shall find him who hath made him to wax for evermore,🔽Indra, whom all must laud, the mighty, the invincible, the daring, the impetuous.

original: aṣāḷham ugram pṛtanāsu sāsahiṃ yasmin mahīr urujrayaḥ /
analyzed: aṣāḍham ugram pṛtanāsu sāsahim yasmin mahīḥ urujrayaḥ
translated: The irresistible, the strong, the conqueror in battles, in whom are mighty and far-extending powers,

original: saṃ dhenavo jāyamāne anonavur dyāvaḥ kṣāmo anonavuḥ //
analyzed: sam dhenavaḥ jāyamāne anonavuḥ dyāvaḥ kṣāmaḥ anonavuḥ
translated: When the milch-kine lowed to him as he was born, the heavens and the earth lowed to him.

original: yad dyāva indra te śataṃ śatam bhūmīr uta syuḥ /
analyzed: yat dyāvaḥ indra te śatam śatam bhūmīḥ uta syuḥ
translated: If, O Indra, the heavens were thine, and a hundred times a hundred earths,

original: na tvā vajrin sahasraṃ sūryā anu na jātam aṣṭa rodasī //
analyzed: na tvā vajrin sahasram sūryāḥ anu na jātam aṣṭa rodasī
translated: Not a thousand suns, O Thunderer, could look on thee, O newly-born, on both the worlds.

original: ā paprātha mahinā vṛṣṇyā vṛṣan viśvā śaviṣṭha śavasā /
analyzed: ā paprātha mahinā vṛṣṇyā vṛṣan viśvā śaviṣṭha śavasā
translated: Thou, O strong God, hast spread thee out with might, with power, O strongest One, over all things.

original: asmāṃ ava maghavan gomati vraje vajriñ citrābhir ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: asmān ava maghavan gomati vraje vajrim citrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: O bountiful one, with your wondrous aids, O wielder of the thunderbolt, come to us in the pasture rich in cows.

original: na sīm adeva āpad iṣaṃ dīrghāyo martyaḥ /
analyzed: na sīm adevaḥ āpat iṣam dīrgha āyo martyaḥ
translated: No mortal, O Godless one, has obtained food for a long life.

original: etagvā cid ya etaśā yuyojate harī indro yuyojate //
analyzed: etagvā cit yaḥ etaśā yuyojate harī indraḥ yuyojate
translated: Even he who yokes the two swift ones, Indra yokes the two swift tawny horses.

original: taṃ vo maho mahāyyam indraṃ dānāya sakṣaṇim /
analyzed: tam vaḥ mahāyyam indram dānāya sakṣaṇim
translated: Him, your great, very mighty Indra, the swift one, for the bestowal of gifts,

original: yo gādheṣu ya āraṇeṣu havyo vājeṣv asti havyaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ gādheṣu yaḥ āraṇeṣu havyaḥ vājeṣu asti havyaḥ
translated: Who is to be invoked in the deep places, in the woods, who is to be invoked in the battles.

original: ud ū ṣu ṇo vaso mahe mṛśasva śūra rādhase /
analyzed: ud u su naḥ vaso mahe mṛśasva śūra rādhase
translated: O Vasu, O hero, think of us for the great bounty.

original: ud ū ṣu mahyai maghavan maghattaya ud indra śravase mahe //
analyzed: ud u su mahyai maghavan maghattaye ud indra śravase mahe
translated: O magnanimous one, for the sake of wealth, O Indra, for the sake of the great glory.

original: tvaṃ na indra ṛtayus tvānido ni tṛmpasi /
analyzed: tvam naḥ indraḥ ṛtayuḥ tvānidaḥ ni tṛmpasi
translated: You, O Indra, are the righteous one, you, the sinless one, you are satisfied.

original: madhye vasiṣva tuvinṛmṇorvor ni dāsaṃ śiśnatho hathaiḥ //
analyzed: madhye vasiṣva tuvi nṛmṇa ūrvoḥ ni dāsam śiśnathaḥ hathaiḥ
translated: Sit in the middle of your two invincible arms, crush the Dāsa with your hands.

original: anyavratam amānuṣam ayajvānam adevayum /
analyzed: anya vratam a mānuṣam a yajvānam a devayum
translated: The one with a different vow, the non-human one, the non-sacrificer, the one without devotion to the gods,

original: ava svaḥ sakhā dudhuvīta parvataḥ sughnāya dasyum parvataḥ //
analyzed: ava svaḥ sakhā dudhuvīta parvataḥ su ghnāya dasyum parvataḥ
translated: May the mountain, the friend of heaven, shake for easy killing of the Dāsa, the mountain.

original: tvaṃ na indrāsāṃ haste śaviṣṭha dāvane /
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra āsām haste śaviṣṭha dāvane
translated: You, O Indra, O most powerful one, in the hand of these (women) for the bestowal,

original: dhānānāṃ na saṃ gṛbhāyāsmayur dviḥ saṃ gṛbhāyāsmayuḥ //
analyzed: dhānānām na sam gṛbhāya asmayuḥ dvis sam gṛbhāya asmayuḥ
translated: Of the roasted grains, as one who is not to be resisted, twice as one who is not to be resisted.

original: sakhāyaḥ kratum icchata kathā rādhāma śarasya /
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ kratum icchata kathā rādhāma śarasya
translated: O friends, desire the sacrifice. How shall we obtain the food of the autumn?

original: upastutim bhojaḥ sūrir yo ahrayaḥ //
analyzed: upastutim bhojaḥ sūriḥ yaḥ ahrayaḥ
translated: The generous, the noble, the unoffended Bhoj.

original: bhūribhiḥ samaha ṛṣibhir barhiṣmadbhi staviṣyase /
analyzed: bhūribhiḥ samaha ṛṣibhiḥ barhiṣmadbhiḥ staviṣyase
translated: You will be praised by many great sages, by those who sit on sacred grass,

original: yad ittham ekamekam ic chara vatsān parādadaḥ //
analyzed: yat ittham ekam ekam id śara vatsān parādadaḥ
translated: When you thus give away the calves one by one, like arrows.

original: karṇagṛhyā maghavā śauradevyo vatsaṃ nas tribhya ānayat /
analyzed: karṇa gṛhya maghavā śauradevyaḥ vatsam naḥ tribhyaḥ ānayat
translated: Maghavan, having seized them by the ears, brought our calf to the three Shuradevis.

original: ajāṃ sūrir na dhātave //
analyzed: ajām sūriḥ na dhātave
translated: The noble one to the she-goat for the sacrifice.

original: tvaṃ no agne mahobhiḥ pāhi viśvasyā arāteḥ /
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne mahobhiḥ pāhi viśvasyāḥ arāteḥ
translated: You, O Agni, protect us with your great powers from all hostility,

original: uta dviṣo martyasya //
analyzed: uta dviṣaḥ martyasya
translated: And from the hatred of mortal enemies.

original: nahi manyuḥ pauruṣeya īśe hi vaḥ priyajāta /
analyzed: nahi manyuḥ pauruṣeyaḥ īśe hi vaḥ priya jāta
translated: For human anger does not rule over you, O you who are born of what is dear to you.

original: tvam id asi kṣapāvān //
analyzed: tvam id asi kṣapāvān
translated: You are indeed the protector.

original: sa no viśvebhir devebhir ūrjo napād bhadraśoce /
analyzed: sa naḥ viśvebhiḥ devebhiḥ ūrjaḥ napāt bhadra śoce
translated: With all the gods, O Agni, with the foot of strength, O you who are radiant with good light,

original: rayiṃ dehi viśvavāram //
analyzed: rayim dehi viśva vāram
translated: Give us wealth that is good in every way.

original: na tam agne arātayo martaṃ yuvanta rāyaḥ /
analyzed: na tam agne arātayaḥ martam yuvanta rāyaḥ
translated: O Agni, the evil spirits do not afflict that mortal,

original: yaṃ trāyase dāśvāṃsam //
analyzed: yam trāyase dāśvāṃsam
translated: Whom you protect, the one who offers.

original: yaṃ tvaṃ vipra medhasātāv agne hinoṣi dhanāya /
analyzed: yam tvam vipra medha sātau agne hinoṣi dhanāya
translated: Whom you, O Agni, O sage, urge on to the sacrifice, to gain wealth,

original: sa tavotī goṣu gantā //
analyzed: sa tava ūtī goṣu gantā
translated: He goes to you for the sake of cattle.

original: tvaṃ rayim puruvīram agne dāśuṣe martāya /
analyzed: tvam rayim puru vīram agne dāśuṣe martāya
translated: You, O Agni, give wealth to the mortal who offers, wealth that has many heroes.

original: pra ṇo naya vasyo accha //
analyzed: pra naḥ naya vasyaḥ accha
translated: Lead us to what is better.

original: uruṣyā ṇo mā parā dā aghāyate jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: uruṣya naḥ mā parā dāḥ aghāyate jātavedaḥ
translated: Protect us, do not abandon us to the sinner, O all-knowing one,

original: durādhye martāya //
analyzed: durādhye martāya
translated: To the mortal who is difficult to subdue.

original: agne mākiṣ ṭe devasya rātim adevo yuyota /
analyzed: agne mākir te devasya rātim adevaḥ yuyota
translated: O Agni, let no god hinder the gift of the god to thee.

original: tvam īśiṣe vasūnām //
analyzed: tvam īśiṣe vasūnām
translated: For thou art the lord of treasures.

original: sa no vasva upa māsy ūrjo napān māhinasya /
analyzed: sa naḥ vasvaḥ upa māsi ūrjaḥ napāt māhinasya
translated: Come to us, O son of strength, O son of strength, for our portion of wealth, for our share of food,

original: sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyaḥ //🔽acchā naḥ śīraśociṣaṃ giro yantu darśatam /
analyzed: sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyaḥ  acchā naḥ śīra śociṣam giraḥ yantu darśatam
translated: O friend, O Vasu, for the worshippers.🔽Let our songs go forth to the lovely one, to the radiant one.

original: acchā yajñāso namasā purūvasum purupraśastam ūtaye //
analyzed: acchā yajñāsaḥ namasā purūvasum puru praśastam ūtaye
translated: Let the sacrifices go with homage to the one rich in treasures, to the one praised by many, for help.

original: agniṃ sūnuṃ sahaso jātavedasaṃ dānāya vāryāṇām /
analyzed: agnim sūnum sahasaḥ jātavedasam dānāya vāryāṇām
translated: Agni, the son of strength, the all-knower, for the bestowal of precious things,

original: dvitā yo bhūd amṛto martyeṣv ā hotā mandratamo viśi //🔽agniṃ vo devayajyayāgnim prayaty adhvare /
analyzed: dvitā yaḥ bhūt amṛtaḥ martyeṣu ā hotā mandratamaḥ viśi  agnim vaḥ deva yajyayā agnim prayati adhvare
translated: Who has become the immortal one among mortals, the most delightful Hotar in the assembly.🔽Agni, by worshipping the gods, Agni, when starting the sacrifice,

original: agniṃ dhīṣu prathamam agnim arvaty agniṃ kṣaitrāya sādhase //
analyzed: agnim dhīṣu prathamam agnim arvati agnim kṣaitrāya sādhase
translated: Agni in the prayers, Agni in the race, Agni for the sake of the contest.

original: agnir iṣāṃ sakhye dadātu na īśe yo vāryāṇām /🔽agniṃ toke tanaye śaśvad īmahe vasuṃ santaṃ tanūpām //🔽agnim īḷiṣvāvase gāthābhiḥ śīraśociṣam /
analyzed: agniḥ iṣām sakhye dadātu naḥ īśe yaḥ vāryāṇām  agnim toke tanaye śaśvat īmahe vasum santam tanū pām  agnim īḍiṣva avase gāthābhiḥ śīra śociṣam
translated: May Agni, the lord of food, bestow upon us the treasures,🔽We always invoke Agni, the good protector of the body, in childbirth and in offspring.🔽Worship Agni for help with songs, the radiant one.

original: agniṃ rāye purumīḷha śrutaṃ naro 'gniṃ sudītaye chardiḥ //
analyzed: agnim rāye purumīḷha śrutam naraḥ gnim sudītaye chardiḥ
translated: Worship Agni for wealth, O men, the famous one, worship Agni for the sake of the house, for protection.

original: agniṃ dveṣo yotavai no gṛṇīmasy agniṃ śaṃ yoś ca dātave /
analyzed: agnim dveṣaḥ yotavai naḥ gṛṇīmasi agnim śam yos ca dātave
translated: We praise Agni to remove our hatred, we praise Agni to give us peace and prosperity.

original: viśvāsu vikṣv aviteva havyo bhuvad vastur ṛṣūṇām //
analyzed: viśvāsu vikṣu avitā iva havyaḥ bhuvat vastuḥ ṛṣūṇām
translated: To be worshipped in all the worlds, as if he were the all-pervading one, he has become the lord of the people.

original: haviṣ kṛṇudhvam ā gamad adhvaryur vanate punaḥ /
analyzed: haviṣ kṛṇudhvam ā gamat adhvaryuḥ vanate punar
translated: Make the offering, come to him, the Adhvaryu priest is purified again.

original: vidvāṃ asya praśāsanam //
analyzed: vidvān asya praśāsanam
translated: He knows his rule.

original: ni tigmam abhy aṃśuṃ sīdad dhotā manāv adhi /
analyzed: ni tigmam abhī aṃśum sīdat hotā manau adhi
translated: He has sat down on the mind, the sharp-rayed priest, on the flame.

original: juṣāṇo asya sakhyam //
analyzed: juṣāṇaḥ asya sakhyam
translated: Enjoying his friendship.

original: antar icchanti taṃ jane rudram paro manīṣayā /
analyzed: antar icchanti tam jane rudram paras manīṣayā
translated: They seek him within the people, Rudra, beyond with thought.

original: gṛbhṇanti jihvayā sasam //
analyzed: gṛbhṇanti jihvayā sasam
translated: They seize him with the tongue, in the mouth.

original: jāmy atītape dhanur vayodhā aruhad vanam /
analyzed: jāmī atītape dhanuḥ vayodhāḥ aruhat vanam
translated: The sister has heated the bow, the life-bestower has mounted the tree.

original: dṛṣadaṃ jihvayāvadhīt //
analyzed: dṛṣadam jihvayā avadhīt
translated: He has killed the stone with his tongue.

original: caran vatso ruśann iha nidātāraṃ na vindate /
analyzed: caran vatsaḥ ruśan iha nidātāram na vindate
translated: The young ruddy one wanders here, the calf finds not the one who gives shelter.

original: veti stotava ambyam //
analyzed: veti stotava ambyam
translated: He goes to the mother who is to be praised.

original: uto nv asya yan mahad aśvāvad yojanam bṛhad /
analyzed: uta u nu asya yat mahat aśvāvat yojanam bṛhat
translated: And also this great yoke of his, rich in horses, is lofty.

original: dāmā rathasya dadṛśe //
analyzed: dāmā rathasya dadṛśe
translated: The yoke of the chariot is seen.

original: duhanti saptaikām upa dvā pañca sṛjataḥ /
analyzed: duhanti sapta ekām upa dvā pañca sṛjataḥ
translated: They milk the one with seven, two set free the five.

original: tīrthe sindhor adhi svare //
analyzed: tīrthe sindhoḥ adhi svare
translated: In the ford of the river, in the sound.

original: ā daśabhir vivasvata indraḥ kośam acucyavīt /🔽khedayā trivṛtā divaḥ //
analyzed: ā daśabhiḥ vivasvataḥ indraḥ kośam acucyavīt  khedayā trivṛtā divaḥ
translated: With ten, with Vivasvat, Indra has loosened the reservoir.🔽With the three-versed one, with the honey, the priests anoint the heaven.

original: pari tridhātur adhvaraṃ jūrṇir eti navīyasī /

original: ayam indro marutsakhā vi vṛtrasyābhinac chiraḥ /
analyzed: ayam indraḥ marut sakhā vi vṛtrasya abhinat śiraḥ
translated: This Indra, with the Maruts as his friends, split

original: vajreṇa śataparvaṇā //
analyzed: vajreṇa śata parvaṇā
translated: the head of Vṛtra with his hundred-knotted thunderbolt.

original: vāvṛdhāno marutsakhendro vi vṛtram airayat /
analyzed: vāvṛdhānaḥ marut sakhā indraḥ vi vṛtram airayat
translated: Having grown, with the Maruts as his friends, Indra broke Vṛtra apart,

original: sṛjan samudriyā apaḥ //
analyzed: sṛjan samudriyāḥ apaḥ
translated: releasing the waters of the ocean.

original: ayaṃ ha yena vā idaṃ svar marutvatā jitam /🔽indreṇa somapītaye //🔽marutvantam ṛjīṣiṇam ojasvantaṃ virapśinam /🔽indraṃ gīrbhir havāmahe //🔽indram pratnena manmanā marutvantaṃ havāmahe /🔽asya somasya pītaye //

translated: This Indra, accompanied by the Maruts, by whom this heaven was conquered,

original: marutvāṃ indra mīḍhvaḥ pibā somaṃ śatakrato /🔽asmin yajñe puruṣṭuta //🔽tubhyed indra marutvate sutāḥ somāso adrivaḥ /🔽hṛdā hūyanta ukthinaḥ //🔽pibed indra marutsakhā sutaṃ somaṃ diviṣṭiṣu /🔽vajraṃ śiśāna ojasā //

original: uttiṣṭhann ojasā saha pītvī śipre avepayaḥ /
analyzed: uttiṣṭhan ojasā saha pītvī śipre avepayaḥ
translated: Rising with might, having drunk, thou hast shaken the two fair ones.

original: somam indra camū sutam //
analyzed: somam indra camū sutam
translated: O Indra, the Soma pressed in the bowl.

original: anu tvā rodasī ubhe krakṣamāṇam akṛpetām /
analyzed: anu tvā rodasī ubhe krakṣamāṇam akṛpetām
translated: Both the heaven and earth have trembled at thee, O thou who art to be worshipped,

original: indra yad dasyuhābhavaḥ //
analyzed: indra yat dasyu hā abhavaḥ
translated: When thou, O Indra, hast become the slayer of the Dasyus.

original: vācam aṣṭāpadīm ahaṃ navasraktim ṛtaspṛśam /
analyzed: vācam aṣṭāpadīm aham nava sraktim ṛta spṛśam
translated: I have taken the eight-footed speech, the nine-compartmented one, which touches the truth,

original: indrāt pari tanvam mame //
analyzed: indrāt pari tanvam mame
translated: From Indra I have taken the form.

original: jajñāno nu śatakratur vi pṛcchad iti mātaram /
analyzed: jajñānaḥ nu śatakratuḥ vi pṛcchat iti mātaram
translated: The one born, O thou of a hundred powers, has asked his mother:

original: ka ugrāḥ ke ha śṛṇvire //
analyzed: ke ugrāḥ ke ha śṛṇvire
translated: Who are the fierce ones? Who are the listeners?

original: ād īṃ śavasy abravīd aurṇavābham ahīśuvam /
analyzed: āt īm śavasi abravīt aurṇavābham ahīśuvam
translated: He has told him of the strength of Aurṇavābha, the son of Ahi.

original: te putra santu niṣṭuraḥ //
analyzed: te putra santu niṣṭuraḥ
translated: Let them be thy obedient sons, O son.

original: sam it tān vṛtrahākhidat khe arāṃ iva khedayā /
analyzed: sam id tān vṛtrahā akhidat khe arān iva khedayā
translated: The Vṛtra-slayer has gathered them together, as if they were the spokes of a wheel.

original: pravṛddho dasyuhābhavat //
analyzed: pravṛddhaḥ dasyu hā abhavat
translated: He has become the increaser of the Dasyus.

original: ekayā pratidhāpibat sākaṃ sarāṃsi triṃśatam /
analyzed: ekayā pratidhāpibat sākam sarāṃsi triṃśatam
translated: With one (verse) he has drunk together thirty lakes.

original: indraḥ somasya kāṇukā //
analyzed: indraḥ somasya kāṇukā
translated: Indra has drunk the Soma to the full.

original: abhi gandharvam atṛṇad abudhneṣu rajassv ā /
analyzed: abhi gandharvam atṛṇat abudhneṣu rajassu ā
translated: He has pierced through the Gandharva in the uninhabited regions of the sky.

original: indro brahmabhya id vṛdhe //
analyzed: indraḥ brahmabhyaḥ id vṛdhe
translated: Indra has done this for the sake of the Brahmans.

original: nir āvidhyad giribhya ā dhārayat pakvam odanam /
analyzed: niḥ āvidhyat giribhyaḥ ā dhārayat pakvam odanam
translated: He has rolled away the mountains, and has set the cooked rice in motion.

original: indro bundaṃ svātatam //
analyzed: indraḥ bundam su ātatam
translated: Indra has rolled away the swelling (cloud).

original: śatabradhna iṣus tava sahasraparṇa eka it /
analyzed: śata bradhnaḥ iṣuḥ tava sahasra parṇaḥ ekaḥ id
translated: The arrow of thine, O Indra, is the thunderbolt, with a hundred spikes, with a thousand feathers, and one shaft.

original: yam indra cakṛṣe yujam //
analyzed: yam indra cakṛṣe yujam
translated: Whom you have made your own, O Indra.

original: tena stotṛbhya ā bhara nṛbhyo nāribhyo attave /
analyzed: tena stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara nṛbhyaḥ nāribhyaḥ attave
translated: Thereby bring to the singers, to the men and women, to the eater,

original: sadyo jāta ṛbhuṣṭhira //🔽etā cyautnāni te kṛtā varṣiṣṭhāni parīṇasā /
analyzed: sadyas jātaḥ ṛbhuṣṭhira  etā cyautnāni te kṛtā varṣiṣṭhāni parīṇasā
translated: The newly born, O you who are firm like the Ṛbhus.🔽These most excellent deeds of yours have been done by you, O Indra, with your highest thought.

original: hṛdā vīḍv adhārayaḥ //
analyzed: hṛdā vīḍu adhārayaḥ
translated: You have held them in your heart.

original: viśvet tā viṣṇur ābharad urukramas tveṣitaḥ /
analyzed: viśvā id tā viṣṇuḥ ābharat uru kramaḥ tveṣitaḥ
translated: All of them has Viṣṇu brought, the one of wide stride, the impetuous one.

original: śatam mahiṣān kṣīrapākam odanaṃ varāham indra emuṣam //
analyzed: śatam mahiṣān kṣīra pākam odanam varāham indraḥ emuṣam
translated: A hundred buffaloes, a mess of rice cooked in milk, a boar, and a ram has Indra won.

original: tuvikṣaṃ te sukṛtaṃ sūmayaṃ dhanuḥ sādhur bundo hiraṇyayaḥ /
analyzed: tuvikṣam te su kṛtam sūmayam dhanuḥ sādhuḥ bundaḥ hiraṇyayaḥ
translated: Your bow is well-made, well-fashioned, and strong, O you who are to be praised. Your arrow is good, your quiver is golden.

original: ubhā te bāhū raṇyā susaṃskṛta ṛdūpe cid ṛdūvṛdhā //
analyzed: ubhā te bāhū raṇyā su saṃskṛte ṛdūpe cit ṛdūvṛdhā
translated: Both your arms are good, well-fashioned, and beautiful, even more beautiful than the beautiful.

original: puroḷāśaṃ no andhasa indra sahasram ā bhara /
analyzed: puroḷāśam naḥ andhasaḥ indra sahasram ā bhara
translated: Bring us, O Indra, a thousand cakes of the Soma juice,

original: śatā ca śūra gonām //
analyzed: śatā ca śūra gonām
translated: And a hundred cows, O hero.

original: ā no bhara vyañjanaṃ gām aśvam abhyañjanam /
analyzed: ā naḥ bhara vyañjanam gām aśvam abhyañjanam
translated: Bring us the ointment, the cow, the horse, the ointment,

original: sacā manā hiraṇyayā //
analyzed: sacā manā hiraṇyayā
translated: Together with the mind, and the golden one.

original: uta naḥ karṇaśobhanā purūṇi dhṛṣṇav ā bhara /
analyzed: uta naḥ karṇa śobhanā purūṇi dhṛṣṇo ā bhara
translated: And bring us many things, O bold one, that are beautiful to our ears,

original: tvaṃ hi śṛṇviṣe vaso //
analyzed: tvam hi śṛṇviṣe vaso
translated: For you, O Vasu, are the hearer.

original: nakīṃ vṛdhīka indra te na suṣā na sudā uta /
analyzed: nakīm vṛdhīkaḥ indra te na su sāḥ na su dāḥ uta
translated: Neither Vrīhi nor Sūṣa nor Sudā,

original: nānyas tvac chūra vāghataḥ //
analyzed: na anyaḥ tvat śūra vāghataḥ
translated: Nor any other priest than you, O hero, is able to do it.

original: nakīm indro nikartave na śakraḥ pariśaktave /
analyzed: nakīm indraḥ nikartave na śakraḥ pariśaktave
translated: Neither Indra nor Śakra is able to do it,

original: viśvaṃ śṛṇoti paśyati //
analyzed: viśvam śṛṇoti paśyati
translated: He hears and sees the universe.

original: sa manyum martyānām adabdho ni cikīṣate /
analyzed: sa manyum martyānām adabdhaḥ ni cikīṣate
translated: He, the undeceivable one, seeks out the anger of mortals.

original: purā nidaś cikīṣate //
analyzed: purā nidaḥ cikīṣate
translated: He seeks out the anger of the wicked.

original: kratva it pūrṇam udaraṃ turasyāsti vidhataḥ /
analyzed: kratvaḥ id pūrṇam udaram turasya asti vidhataḥ
translated: In the mind, the full belly of the swift one is for the one who spreads out.

original: vṛtraghnaḥ somapāvnaḥ //
analyzed: vṛtra ghnaḥ soma pāvnaḥ
translated: The slayer of Vrtra, the drinker of Soma.

original: tve vasūni saṃgatā viśvā ca soma saubhagā /
analyzed: tve vasūni saṃgatā viśvā ca soma saubhagā
translated: In you, O Soma, are all the treasures and all good fortune gathered together.

original: sudātv aparihvṛtā //
analyzed: su dātu aparihvṛtā
translated: You are the one who gives well, the one who is not deceived.

original: tvām id yavayur mama kāmo gavyur hiraṇyayuḥ /
analyzed: tvām id yavayuḥ mama kāmaḥ gavyuḥ hiraṇyayuḥ
translated: This desire of mine, O Soma, which seeks barley, cattle, and gold,

original: tvām aśvayur eṣate //
analyzed: tvām aśvayuḥ eṣate
translated: this one seeks you, the one which seeks horses.

original: taved indrāham āśasā haste dātraṃ canā dade /
analyzed: tava id indra aham āśasā haste dātram cana ā dade
translated: In you, O Indra, I place my hope, I place the gift even in your hand.

original: dinasya vā maghavan sambhṛtasya vā pūrdhi yavasya kāśinā //
analyzed: dinasya vā maghavan sambhṛtasya vā pūrdhi yavasya kāśinā
translated: O Maghavan, be pleased with the barley of the gathered day or of the past.

original: ayaṃ kṛtnur agṛbhīto viśvajid udbhid it somaḥ /
analyzed: ayam kṛtnuḥ a gṛbhītaḥ viśva jit udbhid id somaḥ
translated: This Soma, the conqueror of all, the one who has conquered, the one who has risen up, is not grasped.

original: ṛṣir vipraḥ kāvyena //🔽abhy ūrṇoti yan nagnam bhiṣakti viśvaṃ yat turam /
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ vipraḥ kāvyena  abhi ūrṇoti yat nagnam viśvam yat turam
translated: The sage, the Brahmin, by his wisdom.🔽He covers what is naked, he heals all that is swift.

original: prem andhaḥ khyan niḥ śroṇo bhūt //🔽tvaṃ soma tanūkṛdbhyo dveṣobhyo 'nyakṛtebhyaḥ /
analyzed: pra īm andhaḥ khyat niḥ śroṇaḥ bhūt  tvam soma tanū kṛdbhyaḥ dveṣobhyaḥ nya kṛtebhyaḥ
translated: Let the blind one be seen, let the lame one become able to walk.

original: uru yantāsi varūtham //
analyzed: uru yantāsi varūtham
translated: You, O Soma, are the wide protector from the enemies created by others, from the ones who harm the body.

original: tvaṃ cittī tava dakṣair diva ā pṛthivyā ṛjīṣin /
analyzed: tvam cittī tava dakṣaiḥ divaḥ ā pṛthivyāḥ ṛjīṣin
translated: You, O powerful one, by your powers, from the sky and from the earth.

original: yāvīr aghasya cid dveṣaḥ //
analyzed: yāvīḥ aghasya cit dveṣaḥ
translated: Be the averter even of the hatred of the wicked.

original: arthino yanti ced arthaṃ gacchān id daduṣo rātim /
analyzed: arthinaḥ yanti ced artham gacchān id daduṣaḥ rātim
translated: If supplicants go to him for wealth, let him go to the giver's gift.

original: vavṛjyus tṛṣyataḥ kāmam //🔽vidad yat pūrvyaṃ naṣṭam ud īm ṛtāyum īrayat /
analyzed: vavṛjyuḥ tṛṣyataḥ kāmam  vidat yat pūrvyam naṣṭam ud īm ṛtāyum īrayat
translated: They have fulfilled the desire of the thirsty one.🔽He who finds the ancient lost one, and sends forth the one of true life,

original: prem āyus tārīd atīrṇam //🔽suśevo no mṛḷayākur adṛptakratur avātaḥ /
analyzed: pra īm āyuḥ tārīt a tīrṇam  su śevaḥ naḥ mṛḍayākuḥ adṛpta kratuḥ a vātaḥ
translated: May he carry over life that has not yet crossed over.🔽Be gracious to us, O Soma, with a mind to be appeased, not haughty in resolve, not impetuous.

original: bhavā naḥ soma śaṃ hṛde //
analyzed: bhava naḥ soma śam hṛde
translated: Be thou, O Soma, a blessing to our heart.

original: mā naḥ soma saṃ vīvijo mā vi bībhiṣathā rājan /
analyzed: mā naḥ soma sam vīvijaḥ mā vi bībhiṣathāḥ rājan
translated: Do not, O Soma, shake us, O king, do not terrify us.

original: mā no hārdi tviṣā vadhīḥ //
analyzed: mā naḥ hārdi tviṣā vadhīḥ
translated: Do not slay us with the heat of thy heart.

original: ava yat sve sadhasthe devānāṃ durmatīr īkṣe /
analyzed: ava yat sve sadhasthe devānām durmatīḥ īkṣe
translated: When I look upon the evil thoughts of the gods in their own abode,

original: rājann apa dviṣaḥ sedha mīḍhvo apa sridhaḥ sedha //
analyzed: rājan apa dviṣaḥ sedha mīḍhvaḥ apa sridhaḥ sedha
translated: O king, drive away the enemies, O bountiful one, drive away the slayers.

original: nahy anyam baḷākaram marḍitāraṃ śatakrato /
analyzed: nahi anyam baḷākaram marḍitāram śatakrato
translated: For I find no other to praise than thee, O Indra, O thou of a hundred powers.

original: tvaṃ na indra mṛḷaya //
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra mṛḍaya
translated: Be thou, O Indra, gracious to us.

original: yo naḥ śaśvat purāvithāmṛdhro vājasātaye /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ śaśvat purāvitha a mṛdhraḥ vājasātaye
translated: Who hast ever been our helper in the strife for booty,

original: sa tvaṃ na indra mṛḷaya //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ indra mṛḍaya
translated: Be thou, O Indra, gracious to us.

original: kim aṅga radhracodanaḥ sunvānasyāvited asi /
analyzed: kim aṅga radhra codanaḥ sunvānasya avitā id asi
translated: Why dost thou not help the Soma-presser who impels thee to give?

original: kuvit sv indra ṇaḥ śakaḥ //
analyzed: kuvid su indra naḥ śakaḥ
translated: Canst thou not do it, O Indra?

original: indra pra ṇo ratham ava paścāc cit santam adrivaḥ /
analyzed: indra pra naḥ ratham ava paścāt cit santam adrivas
translated: O Indra, draw our chariot even from the rear, O thou who hast thunder.

original: purastād enam me kṛdhi //
analyzed: purastāt enam me kṛdhi
translated: Make it go in front for me.

original: hanto nu kim āsase prathamaṃ no rathaṃ kṛdhi /
analyzed: hanta u nu kim āsase prathamam naḥ ratham kṛdhi
translated: Why then do you lie so long? Make ready our chariot first.

original: upamaṃ vājayu śravaḥ //
analyzed: upamam vājayu śravaḥ
translated: Be it worthy of the prize, O thou who winnest booty, of glory.

original: avā no vājayuṃ rathaṃ sukaraṃ te kim it pari /
analyzed: ava naḥ vājayum ratham sukaram te kim id pari
translated: Turn thou our chariot, O thou who winnest booty, easy to guide for thee,

original: asmān su jigyuṣas kṛdhi //
analyzed: asmān su jigyuṣaḥ kṛdhi
translated: Make us easy to be guided.

original: indra dṛhyasva pūr asi bhadrā ta eti niṣkṛtam /
analyzed: indra dṛhyasva pūḥ asi bhadrā te eti niṣkṛtam
translated: O Indra, be thou gracious, thou art the first. Good is thy return.

original: iyaṃ dhīr ṛtviyāvatī //
analyzed: iyam dhīḥ ṛtviyāvatī
translated: This is the thought that is most meet.

original: mā sīm avadya ā bhāg urvī kāṣṭhā hitaṃ dhanam /
analyzed: mā sīm avadyaḥ ā bhāk urvī kāṣṭhā hitam dhanam
translated: Let not the blameless share the spoil. The wide-spread place is the fixed wealth.

original: apāvṛktā aratnayaḥ //
analyzed: apāvṛktāḥ aratnayaḥ
translated: The bonds are loosed from the fetters.

original: turīyaṃ nāma yajñiyaṃ yadā karas tad uśmasi /
analyzed: turīyam nāma yajñiyam yadā karaḥ tat uśmasi
translated: The fourth, which is the sacrificial name, when thou hast made it, then we know it.

original: ād it patir na ohase //
analyzed: āt id patiḥ naḥ ohase
translated: Then the lord comes to thee as a guest.

original: avīvṛdhad vo amṛtā amandīd ekadyūr devā uta yāś ca devīḥ /
analyzed: avīvṛdhat vaḥ amṛtāḥ amandīt ekadyūḥ devāḥ uta yāḥ ca devīḥ
translated: The immortal ones have strengthened you, the one-day (sacrifice) has delighted the gods and the goddesses.

original: tasmā u rādhaḥ kṛṇuta praśastam prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jagamyāt //
analyzed: tasmai u rādhaḥ kṛṇuta praśastam prātar makṣū dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt
translated: To him make ye a praiseworthy gift, that he may come quickly in the morning with wealth in his thought.

original: ā tū na indra kṣumantaṃ citraṃ grābhaṃ saṃ gṛbhāya /
analyzed: ā tu naḥ indra kṣumantam citram grābham sam gṛbhāya
translated: O Indra, seize thou the strong, the wonderful grasp,

original: mahāhastī dakṣiṇena //
analyzed: mahā hastī dakṣiṇena
translated: The great elephant with his right (hand).

original: vidmā hi tvā tuvikūrmiṃ tuvideṣṇaṃ tuvīmagham /
analyzed: vidma hi tvā tuvikūrmim tuvi deṣṇam tuvīmagham
translated: We know thee as very mighty, very terrible, of very great wealth,

original: tuvimātram avobhiḥ //🔽nahi tvā śūra devā na martāso ditsantam /
analyzed: tuvimātram avobhiḥ  nahi tvā śūra devāḥ na martāsaḥ ditsantam
translated: Of very great power with thy aids.🔽Neither the gods, O hero, nor men, when thou art willing to give,

original: bhīmaṃ na gāṃ vārayante //
analyzed: bhīmam na gām vārayante
translated: Can keep thee back, like a terrible cow, from the fodder.

original: eto nv indraṃ stavāmeśānaṃ vasvaḥ svarājam /
analyzed: eta u nu indram stavāma īśānam vasvaḥ sva rājam
translated: Let us praise Indra, the lord of wealth, the self-ruling one.

original: na rādhasā mardhiṣan naḥ //
analyzed: na rādhasā mardhiṣat naḥ
translated: Do not deprive us of your bounty.

original: pra stoṣad upa gāsiṣac chravat sāma gīyamānam /
analyzed: pra stoṣat upa gāsiṣat śravat sāma gīyamānam
translated: Let him praise, let him invite, let him listen to the Saman being sung.

original: abhi rādhasā jugurat //🔽ā no bhara dakṣiṇenābhi savyena pra mṛśa /
analyzed: abhi rādhasā jugurat  ā naḥ bhara dakṣiṇena abhi savyena pra mṛśa
translated: Let him rejoice in the bounty.🔽Bring to us with the right, touch with the left.

analyzed: a dāśūṣṭarasya vedaḥ

analyzed: sadyas juvaḥ te vājāḥ asmabhyam viśva ścandrāḥ

analyzed: vaśaiḥ ca makṣū jarante

analyzed: madhvaḥ prati prabharmaṇi

analyzed: tīvrāḥ somāsaḥ ā gahi sutāsaḥ mādayiṣṇavaḥ

original: bhuvat ta indra śaṃ hṛde //
analyzed: bhuvat te indra śam hṛde

original: upame rocane divaḥ //
analyzed: upame rocane divaḥ

analyzed: tubhya ayam adribhiḥ sutaḥ gobhiḥ śrītaḥ madāya kam

analyzed: pra somaḥ indra hūyate

original: indra śrudhi su me havam asme sutasya gomataḥ /
analyzed: indra śrudhi su me havam asme sutasya gomataḥ
translated: O Indra, listen to my good invocation, to the juice of the one rich in cattle.

original: vi pītiṃ tṛptim aśnuhi //
analyzed: vi pītim tṛptim aśnuhi

analyzed: yaḥ indra camaseṣu ā somaḥ camūṣu te sutaḥ
translated: O Indra, the Soma which is in the goblets, which is pressed in the wooden tubs for thee,

original: pibed asya tvam īśiṣe //
analyzed: piba id asya tvam īśiṣe
translated: thou art the lord of this one to drink.

original: yo apsu candramā iva somaś camūṣu dadṛśe /
analyzed: yaḥ apsu candramāḥ iva somaḥ camūṣu dadṛśe
translated: The Soma which is seen in the wooden tubs, like the moon in the waters,

original: pibed asya tvam īśiṣe //
analyzed: piba id asya tvam īśiṣe
translated: thou art the lord of this one to drink.

original: yaṃ te śyenaḥ padābharat tiro rajāṃsy aspṛtam /
analyzed: yam te śyenaḥ padā abharat tiras rajāṃsi a spṛtam
translated: The (Soma) which the hawk has brought to thee, borne on his foot across the regions, uninjured,

original: pibed asya tvam īśiṣe //
analyzed: piba id asya tvam īśiṣe
translated: thou art the lord of this one to drink.

analyzed: devānām id avaḥ mahat tat ā vṛṇīmahe vayam  vṛṣṇām asmabhyam ūtaye

original: te naḥ santu yujaḥ sadā varuṇo mitro aryamā /
analyzed: te naḥ santu yujaḥ sadā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā

analyzed: vṛdhāsaḥ ca pracetasaḥ

original: ati no viṣpitā puru naubhir apo na parṣatha /
analyzed: ati naḥ viṣpitā puru naubhiḥ apaḥ na parṣatha

original: yūyam ṛtasya rathyaḥ //
analyzed: yūyam ṛtasya rathyaḥ

original: vāmaṃ no astv aryaman vāmaṃ varuṇa śaṃsyam /
analyzed: vāmam naḥ astu aryaman vāmam varuṇa śaṃsyam

original: vāmaṃ hy āvṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: vāmam hi āvṛṇīmahe

original: vāmasya hi pracetasa īśānāśo riśādasaḥ /
analyzed: vāmasya hi pracetasaḥ īśāna āśaḥ riśādasaḥ

analyzed: na īm ādityāḥ aghasya yat

original: vayam id vaḥ sudānavaḥ kṣiyanto yānto adhvann ā /
analyzed: vayam id vaḥ sudānavaḥ kṣiyantaḥ yāntaḥ adhvan ā

original: devā vṛdhāya hūmahe //
analyzed: devāḥ vṛdhāya hūmahe

original: adhi na indraiṣāṃ viṣṇo sajātyānām /
analyzed: adhi naḥ indra eṣām viṣṇo sajātyānām

original: mātur garbhe bharāmahe //
analyzed: mātuḥ garbhe bharāmahe

analyzed: adhā cit vaḥ uta bruve

analyzed: preṣṭham vaḥ atithim stuṣe mitram iva priyam

original: agniṃ rathaṃ na vedyam //
analyzed: agnim ratham na vedyam

analyzed: kavim iva pracetasam yam devāsaḥ adha dvitā

analyzed: kayā te agne aṅgiraḥ ūrjaḥ napāt upastutim

analyzed: varāya deva manyave

analyzed: vāja draviṇasaḥ giraḥ

analyzed: agne su vīraḥ edhate

analyzed: madhvaḥ somasya pītaye
translated: To drink the sweet Soma juice.

analyzed: nu me giraḥ nāsatyā aśvinā prāvatam yuvam

analyzed: madhvaḥ somasya pītaye

analyzed: tā vām viśvakaḥ havate tanū kṛthe mā naḥ vi yauṣṭam sakhyā mumocatam
translated: Viśvaka calls you to his body, do not forsake us, do not abandon us in our friendship.

original: yuvaṃ hi ṣmā purubhujemam edhatuṃ viṣṇāpve dadathur vasyaiṣṭaye /
analyzed: yuvam hi sma puru bhujā imam edhatum viṣṇāpve dadathuḥ vasyaiṣṭaye
translated: For you two, O you who have much to enjoy, have given this prosperity for the sake of prosperity.

original: tā vāṃ viśvako havate tanūkṛthe mā no vi yauṣṭaṃ sakhyā mumocatam //
analyzed: tā vām viśvakaḥ havate tanū kṛthe mā naḥ vi yauṣṭam sakhyā mumocatam
translated: Viśvaka calls you to his body, do not forsake us, do not abandon us in our friendship.

analyzed: uta tyam vīram dhana sām ṛjīṣiṇam dūre cit santam avase havāmahe

analyzed: yasya svādiṣṭhā sumatiḥ pituḥ yathā mā naḥ vi yauṣṭam sakhyā mumocatam

analyzed: ṛtena devaḥ savitā śamāyate ṛtasya śṛṅgam urviyā vi paprathe
translated: By truth the god Savitar hath been made to rest: the horn of truth hath spread itself abroad in width.

original: pibataṃ gharmam madhumantam aśvinā barhiḥ sīdataṃ narā /
analyzed: pibatam gharmam madhumantam aśvinā barhiḥ sīdatam narā

original: tā mandasānā manuṣo duroṇa ā ni pātaṃ vedasā vayaḥ //
analyzed: tā mandasānā manuṣaḥ duroṇe ā ni pātam vedasā vayaḥ
translated: So, rejoicing, come to the house of Manu, and drink the life-giving drink.

original: ā vāṃ viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ priyamedhā ahūṣata /
analyzed: ā vām viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ priyamedhāḥ ahūṣata
translated: With all your succours have the pious called you, O ye of sweet meath.

original: tā vartir yātam upa vṛktabarhiṣo juṣṭaṃ yajñaṃ diviṣṭiṣu //
analyzed: tā vartiḥ yātam upa vṛkta barhiṣaḥ juṣṭam yajñam diviṣṭiṣu
translated: Come to the house of him who strews the sacred grass, to the dear sacrifice at the feasts of Dyaus.

original: pibataṃ somam madhumantam aśvinā barhiḥ sīdataṃ sumat /
analyzed: pibatam somam madhumantam aśvinā barhiḥ sīdatam sumat
translated: Drink, O ye Aṣvins, the meath-rich Soma juice: sit on the sacred grass, O ye who love the song.

original: tā vāvṛdhānā upa suṣṭutiṃ divo gantaṃ gaurāv iveriṇam //
analyzed: tā vāvṛdhānau upa suṣṭutim divaḥ gantam gaurau iva iriṇam
translated: So, waxing great, come to the praise of heaven, as two bulls to the pen.

original: ā nūnaṃ yātam aśvināśvebhiḥ pruṣitapsubhiḥ /
analyzed: ā nūnam yātam aśvinā aśvebhiḥ pruṣitapsubhiḥ

analyzed: dasrā hiraṇya vartanī śubhaḥ patī pātam somam ṛtāvṛdhā
translated: Ye Wonder-Workers, whose path is golden, Lords of splendour: drink the Soma, ye who strengthen Law.

original: vayaṃ hi vāṃ havāmahe vipanyavo viprāso vājasātaye /
analyzed: vayam hi vām havāmahe vipanyavaḥ viprāsaḥ vājasātaye
translated: For we, O you two, are invoking you, the singers, to win strength, you who are far away.

original: tā valgū dasrā purudaṃsasā dhiyāśvinā śruṣṭy ā gatam //
analyzed: tā valgū dasrā puru daṃsasā dhiyā aśvinā śruṣṭī ā gatam
translated: Come, O you two beautiful and wondrous ones, rich in gifts, O Aśvins, to the hearing of our prayer.

original: taṃ vo dasmam ṛtīṣahaṃ vasor mandānam andhasaḥ /
analyzed: tam vaḥ dasmam ṛtīṣaham vasoḥ mandānam andhasaḥ
translated: We praise that wondrous Indra, the conqueror of foes, who rejoices in the juice of the Soma,

original: abhi vatsaṃ na svasareṣu dhenava indraṃ gīrbhir navāmahe //🔽dyukṣaṃ sudānuṃ taviṣībhir āvṛtaṃ giriṃ na purubhojasam /

translated: Like milch-cows their calf among their sisters, with songs we praise Indra.🔽The glorious one, the bountiful, surrounded by his powers, like a mountain, the supporter of many,

original: kṣumantaṃ vājaṃ śatinaṃ sahasriṇam makṣū gomantam īmahe //
analyzed: kṣumantam vājam śatinam sahasriṇam makṣū gomantam īmahe
translated: We quickly seek the strong food, a hundredfold, a thousandfold, with cattle, the bountiful one.

original: na tvā bṛhanto adrayo varanta indra vīḷavaḥ /
analyzed: na tvā bṛhantaḥ adrayaḥ varante indra vīḍavaḥ
translated: The great mountains do not hold thee back, O Indra, the wide ones,

original: yad ditsasi stuvate māvate vasu nakiṣ ṭad ā mināti te //
analyzed: yat ditsasi stuvate māvate vasu nakir tat ā mināti te
translated: When thou wishest to give wealth to the singer, none can hinder that of thine.

original: yoddhāsi kratvā śavasota daṃsanā viśvā jātābhi majmanā /
analyzed: yoddhā asi kratvā śavasā uta daṃsanā viśvā jātā abhi majmanā
translated: Thou who art to be praised with the hymn, with strength, and with the wondrous one, all beings with thy majesty,

original: ā tvāyam arka ūtaye vavartati yaṃ gotamā ajījanan //
analyzed: ā tvā ayam arkaḥ ūtaye vavartati yam gotamāḥ ajījanan
translated: This praise of thine turns hither for help, which the Gotamas have produced.

original: pra hi ririkṣa ojasā divo antebhyas pari /
analyzed: pra hi ririkṣe ojasā divaḥ antebhyaḥ pari
translated: For thou art about to spread abroad with might from the ends of the sky,

original: na tvā vivyāca raja indra pārthivam anu svadhāṃ vavakṣitha //
analyzed: na tvā vivyāca rajaḥ indra pārthivam anu svadhām vavakṣitha
translated: The region, O Indra, is not too wide for thee. Thou hast extended thy own power.

original: nakiḥ pariṣṭir maghavan maghasya te yad dāśuṣe daśasyasi /
analyzed: nakir pariṣṭiḥ maghavan maghasya te yat dāśuṣe daśasyasi
translated: No one can resist thy bounty, O bountiful one, when thou art gracious to the worshipper.

original: asmākam bodhy ucathasya coditā maṃhiṣṭho vājasātaye //
analyzed: asmākam bodhi ucathasya coditā maṃhiṣṭhaḥ vāja sātaye
translated: Be thou our nearest friend, O most liberal one, to urge us to strength.

original: bṛhad indrāya gāyata maruto vṛtrahantamam /
analyzed: bṛhat indrāya gāyata marutaḥ vṛtra hantamam
translated: Sing forth to Indra, O Maruts, the great hymn, the best of Vrtra-slayers,

original: yena jyotir ajanayann ṛtāvṛdho devaṃ devāya jāgṛvi //
analyzed: yena jyotiḥ ajanayan ṛtāvṛdhaḥ devam devāya jāgṛvi
translated: By whom they have produced the light, the holy ones, the watchful god for the god.

original: apādhamad abhiśastīr aśastihāthendro dyumny ābhavat /🔽devās ta indra sakhyāya yemire bṛhadbhāno marudgaṇa //
analyzed: apādhamat abhiśastīḥ aśasti hā atha indraḥ dyumnī ābhavat  devāḥ te indra sakhyāya yemire bṛhat bhāno marut gaṇa
translated: He has driven away the curses, the curse-averting Indra has become glorious.🔽The gods, O Indra, have sought thee for friendship, O thou of great splendour, O company of Maruts.

original: pra va indrāya bṛhate maruto brahmārcata /
analyzed: pra vaḥ indrāya bṛhate marutaḥ brahma arcata
translated: Sing forth to Indra the great hymn, O Maruts, sing forth the holy hymn.

original: vṛtraṃ hanati vṛtrahā śatakratur vajreṇa śataparvaṇā //
analyzed: vṛtram hanati vṛtrahā śatakratuḥ vajreṇa śata parvaṇā
translated: The Vrtra-slayer, of a hundred sacrifices, with his hundred-knotted thunderbolt, slays Vrtra.

original: abhi pra bhara dhṛṣatā dhṛṣanmanaḥ śravaś cit te asad bṛhat /🔽arṣantv āpo javasā vi mātaro hano vṛtraṃ jayā svaḥ //
analyzed: abhi pra bhara dhṛṣatā dhṛṣat manaḥ śravaḥ cit te asat bṛhat  arṣantu āpaḥ javasā vi mātaraḥ hanaḥ vṛtram jaya svar
translated: Bring forth, O bold one, with boldness, let thy fame be great.🔽Let the waters flow with speed, the mothers. Slay Vrtra, win the heaven.

original: yaj jāyathā apūrvya maghavan vṛtrahatyāya /
analyzed: yat jāyathāḥ apūrvya maghavan vṛtra hatyāya
translated: When thou wast born, O thou of incomparable might, O Maghavan, for the slaying of Vrtra,

original: tat pṛthivīm aprathayas tad astabhnā uta dyām //
analyzed: tat pṛthivīm aprathayaḥ tat astabhnāḥ uta dyām
translated: Then thou hast spread out the earth, then thou hast upheld the sky.

original: tat te yajño ajāyata tad arka uta haskṛtiḥ /
analyzed: tat te yajñaḥ ajāyata tat arkaḥ uta haskṛtiḥ
translated: From that was born thy sacrifice, that hymn, and that praise.

original: tad viśvam abhibhūr asi yaj jātaṃ yac ca jantvam //
analyzed: tat viśvam abhibhūḥ asi yat jātam yat ca jantvam
translated: Thou art the overlord of that universe, of what is born and what is to be born.

original: āmāsu pakvam airaya ā sūryaṃ rohayo divi /
analyzed: āmāsu pakvam airayaḥ ā sūryam rohayaḥ divi
translated: In the raw thou placest the cooked, thou raisest the sun to the sky.

original: gharmaṃ na sāman tapatā suvṛktibhir juṣṭaṃ girvaṇase bṛhat //
analyzed: gharmam na sāman tapata suvṛktibhiḥ juṣṭam girvaṇase bṛhat
translated: Like the hot draught, with fair hymns, thou heatest the much-praised one dear to the lover of song.

original: ā no viśvāsu havya indraḥ samatsu bhūṣatu /
analyzed: ā naḥ viśvāsu havyaḥ indraḥ samatsu bhūṣatu
translated: May Indra be with us in all battles, may he be present at the prayers and libations.

original: upa brahmāṇi savanāni vṛtrahā paramajyā ṛcīṣamaḥ //
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi savanāni vṛtrahā paramajyāḥ ṛcīṣamaḥ
translated: The Vr̥itra-slayer, most mighty, most swift to hear, is to be chosen.

original: tvaṃ dātā prathamo rādhasām asy asi satya īśānakṛt /
analyzed: tvam dātā prathamaḥ rādhasām asi asi satyaḥ īśāna kṛt
translated: Thou art the first giver of his gifts, thou art the true disposer of wealth.

original: tuvidyumnasya yujyā vṛṇīmahe putrasya śavaso mahaḥ //🔽brahmā ta indra girvaṇaḥ kriyante anatidbhutā /
analyzed: tuvi dyumnasya yujyā vṛṇīmahe putrasya śavasaḥ mahaḥ  brahmā te indra girvaṇaḥ kriyante anatidbhutā
translated: We choose the yoke-fellow of the mighty one, the son of strength, of greatness.🔽O Indra, lover of the song, the prayers are made to thee, O thou whom many invoke.

original: imā juṣasva haryaśva yojanendra yā te amanmahi //
analyzed: imā juṣasva haryaśva yojanā indra yā te amanmahi
translated: Accept these, O thou of the bay steeds, on the way, O Indra, which we have thought upon.

original: tvaṃ hi satyo maghavann anānato vṛtrā bhūri nyṛñjase /
analyzed: tvam hi satyaḥ maghavan an ānataḥ vṛtrā bhūri nyṛñjase
translated: For thou art true, O bountiful one, not to be overcome, thou strivest to overcome many foes.

original: sa tvaṃ śaviṣṭha vajrahasta dāśuṣe 'rvāñcaṃ rayim ā kṛdhi //
analyzed: sa tvam śaviṣṭha vajrahasta dāśuṣe rvāñcam rayim ā kṛdhi
translated: O thou of mighty power, O thou who hast the bolt in thy hand, bring thou to the worshipper wealth that comes to us.

original: tvam indra yaśā asy ṛjīṣī śavasas pate /
analyzed: tvam indra yaśāḥ asi ṛjīṣī śavasaḥ pate
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the glorious one, the impetuous, the lord of strength.

original: tvaṃ vṛtrāṇi haṃsy apratīny eka id anuttā carṣaṇīdhṛtā //
analyzed: tvam vṛtrāṇi haṃsi apratīni ekaḥ id anuttā carṣaṇī dhṛtā
translated: Thou alone, O thou who presidest over men, smitest down the unconquerable foes.

original: tam u tvā nūnam asura pracetasaṃ rādho bhāgam ivemahe /
analyzed: tam u tvā nūnam asura pracetasam rādhaḥ bhāgam iva īmahe
translated: We now, O Asura, to thee, the wise, for a share of the gift, as it were, come.

original: mahīva kṛttiḥ śaraṇā ta indra pra te sumnā no aśnavan //
analyzed: mahī iva kṛttiḥ śaraṇā te indra pra te sumnā naḥ aśnavan
translated: Like a great shield, O Indra, are thy protections. May thy favours reach us.

original: kanyā vār avāyatī somam api srutāvidat /
analyzed: kanyā vār avāyatī somam api srutā avidat
translated: The maiden, the water, flowing, has found the Soma, the flowing one.

original: astam bharanty abravīd indrāya sunavai tvā śakrāya sunavai tvā //
analyzed: astam bharantī abravīt indrāya sunavai tvā śakrāya sunavai tvā
translated: They carry it to the place of rest. She has said: I shall press thee for Indra, I shall press thee for Shakra.

original: asau ya eṣi vīrako gṛhaṃgṛhaṃ vicākaśad /
analyzed: asau yaḥ eṣi vīrakaḥ gṛhaṃgṛham vicākaśat
translated: He who goes about as a young man, looking into every house,

original: imaṃ jambhasutam piba dhānāvantaṃ karambhiṇam apūpavantam ukthinam //
analyzed: imam jambha sutam piba dhānāvantam karambhiṇam apūpavantam ukthinam
translated: Drink this son of Jambu, rich in milk, full of curds, with cakes, with praises.

original: ā cana tvā cikitsāmo 'dhi cana tvā nemasi /
analyzed: ā cana tvā cikitsāmaḥ dhi cana tvā na imasi
translated: We will think of thee, and we will strive for thee.

original: śanair iva śanakair ivendrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: śanais iva śanakais iva indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Slowly, as it were, slowly, O Indu, flow for Indra.

original: kuvic chakat kuvit karat kuvin no vasyasas karat /
analyzed: kuvid śakat kuvid karat kuvid naḥ vasyasaḥ karat
translated: What will he do? What will he make? What will he do for our welfare?

original: kuvit patidviṣo yatīr indreṇa saṃgamāmahai //🔽imāni trīṇi viṣṭapā tānīndra vi rohaya /
analyzed: kuvid pati dviṣaḥ yatīḥ indreṇa saṃgamāmahai  imāni trīṇi viṣṭapā tāni indra vi rohaya
translated: What will he do to the wives of our enemies? With Indra may we meet them.🔽These three layers, O Indra, do thou spread out.

original: śiras tatasyorvarām ād idam ma upodare //
analyzed: śiraḥ tatasya urvarām āt idam me upa udare
translated: The head of that one, and this my belly, and this my field.

original: asau ca yā na urvarād imāṃ tanvam mama /
analyzed: asau ca yā naḥ urvarā āt imām tanvam mama
translated: And that field of mine, and this my body,

original: atho tatasya yac chiraḥ sarvā tā romaśā kṛdhi //
analyzed: atha u tatasya yat śiraḥ sarvā tā romaśā kṛdhi
translated: And the head of that one, make all of them hairy.

original: khe rathasya khe 'nasaḥ khe yugasya śatakrato /
analyzed: khe rathasya khe nasaḥ khe yugasya śatakrato
translated: In the sky of the chariot, in the sky of the yoke, O Shatakratu,

original: apālām indra triṣ pūtvy akṛṇoḥ sūryatvacam //
analyzed: apālām indra tris pūtvī akṛṇoḥ sūrya tvacam
translated: You made the sun's skin, O Indra, to be guarded thrice.

original: pāntam ā vo andhasa indram abhi pra gāyata /🔽viśvāsāhaṃ śatakratum maṃhiṣṭhaṃ carṣaṇīnām //
analyzed: pāntam ā vaḥ andhasaḥ indram abhi pra gāyata  viśvāsāham śatakratum maṃhiṣṭham carṣaṇīnām
translated: Sing forth to Indra, the protector of your drink,🔽The all-conquering Shatakratu, the most bountiful among men.

original: puruhūtam puruṣṭutaṃ gāthānyaṃ sanaśrutam /
analyzed: puruhūtam puruṣṭutam gāthānyam sana śrutam
translated: The invoked, the praised, the sung, the renowned,

original: indra iti bravītana //
analyzed: indraḥ iti bravītana
translated: Call him by the name of Indra.

original: indra in no mahānāṃ dātā vājānāṃ nṛtuḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ id naḥ mahānām dātā vājānām nṛtuḥ
translated: Indra, the great one, the giver of strength, the dancer,

original: mahāṃ abhijñv ā yamat //🔽apād u śipry andhasaḥ sudakṣasya prahoṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: mahān abhijñu ā yamat  apāt u śiprī andhasaḥ su dakṣasya prahoṣiṇaḥ
translated: I will exalt the great one, the famous one.🔽The handsome one, the strong one, the impetuous one,

original: indor indro yavāśiraḥ //
analyzed: indoḥ indraḥ yava āśiraḥ
translated: The Indra of the Indra of the barley-sprout.

original: tam v abhi prārcatendraṃ somasya pītaye /
analyzed: tam u abhi prārcata indram somasya pītaye
translated: To him, to Indra, they sing forth for the drinking of the Soma,

original: tad id dhy asya vardhanam //
analyzed: tat id hi asya vardhanam
translated: For that is indeed his exaltation.

original: asya pītvā madānāṃ devo devasyaujasā /
analyzed: asya pītvā madānām devaḥ devasya ojasā
translated: Having drunk of his gladdening drinks, the god with the god's strength,

original: viśvābhi bhuvanā bhuvat //
analyzed: viśvā abhi bhuvanā bhuvat
translated: He became the lord of all beings.

original: tyam u vaḥ satrāsāhaṃ viśvāsu gīrṣv āyatam /
analyzed: tyam u vaḥ satrāsāham viśvāsu gīrṣu āyatam
translated: To him, the fearless one, I offer praise, the all-supporting one, in all the songs,

original: ā cyāvayasy ūtaye //
analyzed: ā cyāvayasi ūtaye
translated: To make him come for help.

original: yudhmaṃ santam anarvāṇaṃ somapām anapacyutam /
analyzed: yudhmam santam anarvāṇam soma pām an apacyutam
translated: The warrior who is unconquerable, the Soma-drinker who does not stumble,

original: naram avāryakratum //
analyzed: naram a vārya kratum
translated: The man whose resolve is irresistible.

original: śikṣā ṇa indra rāya ā puru vidvāṃ ṛcīṣama /
analyzed: śikṣa naḥ indra rāyaḥ ā puru vidvān ṛcīṣama
translated: O Indra, who knowest all, O thou who hast a thousand powers, teach us to gain

original: avā naḥ pārye dhane //
analyzed: avā naḥ pārye dhane
translated: To us in the battle that is to come.

original: ataś cid indra ṇa upā yāhi śatavājayā /
analyzed: atas cit indra naḥ upa ā yāhi śata vājayā
translated: From there, O Indra, come to us with a hundred powers,

original: iṣā sahasravājayā //
analyzed: iṣā sahasra vājayā
translated: With food of a thousand powers.

original: ayāma dhīvato dhiyo 'rvadbhiḥ śakra godare /
analyzed: ayāma dhīvataḥ dhiyaḥ rvadbhiḥ śakra godare
translated: We have brought our thoughts, O you who are rich in thoughts, O Shakra, with our horses, to the place where the cows are.

original: jayema pṛtsu vajrivaḥ //
analyzed: jayema pṛtsu vajrivas
translated: May we win in battles, O wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: vayam u tvā śatakrato gāvo na yavaseṣv ā /
analyzed: vayam u tvā śatakrato gāvaḥ na yavaseṣu ā
translated: We, O Shatakratu, like cows in the pastures,

original: uktheṣu raṇayāmasi //
analyzed: uktheṣu raṇayāmasi
translated: In the hymns, we delight you.

original: viśvā hi martyatvanānukāmā śatakrato /
analyzed: viśvā hi martyatvanā anukāmā śatakrato
translated: For all mortals, O Shatakratu, desire you.

original: aganma vajrinn āśasaḥ //
analyzed: aganma vajrin āśasaḥ
translated: We have come, O wielder of the thunderbolt, to your bounty.

original: tve su putra śavaso 'vṛtran kāmakātayaḥ /
analyzed: tve su putra śavasaḥ vṛtran kāma kātayaḥ
translated: In you, O good son, the desires that bring about what one desires have found a place.

original: na tvām indrāti ricyate //
analyzed: na tvām indra ati ricyate
translated: No one surpasses you, O Indra.

original: sa no vṛṣan saniṣṭhayā saṃ ghorayā dravitnvā /
analyzed: sa naḥ vṛṣan saniṣṭhayā sam ghorayā dravitnvā
translated: O bull, with your most bountiful, terrible, and swift

original: dhiyāviḍḍhi purandhyā //
analyzed: dhiyā aviḍḍhi purandhyā
translated: thought, favor us with your generosity.

original: yas te nūnaṃ śatakratav indra dyumnitamo madaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te nūnam śatakrato indra dyumnitamaḥ madaḥ
translated: That most glorious rapture of yours, O Indra, O you of a hundred powers,

original: tena nūnam made madeḥ //
analyzed: tena nūnam made madeḥ
translated: with that rapture you should be rapturous.

original: yas te citraśravastamo ya indra vṛtrahantamaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te citra śravastamaḥ yaḥ indra vṛtra hantamaḥ
translated: That most famous, O Indra, that which is best at slaying Vrtra,

original: ya ojodātamo madaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ ojaḥ dātamaḥ madaḥ
translated: that which is most powerful rapture

original: vidmā hi yas te adrivas tvādattaḥ satya somapāḥ /
analyzed: vidma hi yaḥ te adrivas tvādattaḥ satya soma pāḥ
translated: We know that one, O wielder of the thunderbolt, who has received your gift, O true one, who drinks Soma,

original: viśvāsu dasma kṛṣṭiṣu //
analyzed: viśvāsu dasma kṛṣṭiṣu
translated: in all the assemblies, O wondrous one.

original: indrāya madvane sutam pari ṣṭobhantu no giraḥ /
analyzed: indrāya madvane sutam pari stobhantu naḥ giraḥ
translated: Let our songs resound for Indra, the strong one, the pressed juice that delights him.

original: arkam arcantu kāravaḥ //
analyzed: arkam arcantu kāravaḥ
translated: Let the singers sing praises to the Arka.

original: yasmin viśvā adhi śriyo raṇanti sapta saṃsadaḥ /
analyzed: yasmin viśvāḥ adhi śriyaḥ raṇanti sapta saṃsadaḥ
translated: In whom all glories are united, the seven assemblies,

original: indraṃ sute havāmahe //
analyzed: indram sute havāmahe
translated: We invoke Indra at the pressing of the Soma.

original: trikadrukeṣu cetanaṃ devāso yajñam atnata /
analyzed: trikadrukeṣu cetanam devāsaḥ yajñam atnata
translated: The gods have set up the sacrifice, the watchful one, on the Trikadrukas.

original: tam id vardhantu no giraḥ //
analyzed: tam id vardhantu naḥ giraḥ
translated: May our songs of praise exalt him.

original: ā tvā viśantv indavaḥ samudram iva sindhavaḥ /
analyzed: ā tvā viśantu indavaḥ samudram iva sindhavaḥ
translated: Let the drops enter into thee, as the rivers into the ocean.

original: na tvām indrāti ricyate //
analyzed: na tvām indra ati ricyate
translated: No one surpasses thee, O Indra.

original: vivyaktha mahinā vṛṣan bhakṣaṃ somasya jāgṛve /
analyzed: vivyaktha mahinā vṛṣan bhakṣam somasya jāgṛve
translated: Thou hast opened, O mighty one, the oblation of the watchful Soma,

original: ya indra jaṭhareṣu te //
analyzed: yaḥ indra jaṭhareṣu te
translated: Which is in thy belly, O Indra.

original: araṃ ta indra kukṣaye somo bhavatu vṛtrahan /
analyzed: aram te indra kukṣaye somaḥ bhavatu vṛtrahan
translated: May Soma be easy for thy belly, O Indra, O Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: araṃ dhāmabhya indavaḥ //
analyzed: aram dhāmabhyaḥ indavaḥ
translated: May the drops be easy for thy forms.

original: aram aśvāya gāyati śrutakakṣo araṃ gave /🔽aram indrasya dhāmne //
analyzed: aram aśvāya gāyati śrutakakṣaḥ aram gave  aram indrasya dhāmne
translated: He sings easily for the horse, he of the heard-of abode sings easily for the cow,🔽He sings easily for Indra's abode.

original: araṃ hi ṣma suteṣu ṇaḥ someṣv indra bhūṣasi /
analyzed: aram hi sma suteṣu naḥ someṣu indra bhūṣasi
translated: For thou art easy for us in our pressed (Soma), O Indra, in our Soma-offerings.

original: araṃ te śakra dāvane //
analyzed: aram te śakra dāvane
translated: Thou art easy, O mighty one, to give.

original: parākāttāc cid adrivas tvāṃ nakṣanta no giraḥ /
analyzed: parākāttāt cit adrivas tvām nakṣanta naḥ giraḥ
translated: From afar, O wielder of the thunderbolt, our songs seek thee.

original: araṃ gamāma te vayam //
analyzed: aram gamāma te vayam
translated: We come easily to thee.

original: evā hy asi vīrayur evā śūra uta sthiraḥ /
analyzed: eva hi asi vīrayuḥ eva śūraḥ uta sthiraḥ
translated: For thou art the hero's friend, thou, O Indra, art the hero's friend.

original: evā te rādhyam manaḥ //
analyzed: eva te rādhyam manaḥ
translated: Easy to be entreated is thy mind.

original: evā rātis tuvīmagha viśvebhir dhāyi dhātṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: eva rātiḥ tuvīmagha viśvebhiḥ dhāyi dhātṛbhiḥ
translated: Easy is thy gift, O thou of great bounty, with all the supporters.

original: adhā cid indra me sacā //
analyzed: adha cit indra me sacā
translated: Now also, O Indra, be thou with me.

original: mo ṣu brahmeva tandrayur bhuvo vājānām pate /
analyzed: mā u su brahmā iva tandrayuḥ bhuvaḥ vājānām pate
translated: Be not like a sluggish priest, O lord of strength.

original: matsvā sutasya gomataḥ //
analyzed: matsva sutasya gomataḥ
translated: Rejoice in the juice of him who possesses cattle.

original: mā na indrābhy ādiśaḥ sūro aktuṣv ā yaman /
analyzed: mā naḥ indra abhi ādiśaḥ sūraḥ aktuṣu ā yaman
translated: Do not, O Indra, look away from us, as the sun moves away in the directions.

original: tvā yujā vanema tat //
analyzed: tvā yujā vanema tat
translated: We wish to win that through union with you.

original: tvayed indra yujā vayam prati bruvīmahi spṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: tvayā id indra yujā vayam prati bruvīmahi spṛdhaḥ
translated: Through union with you, O Indra, may we overcome our enemies.

original: tvam asmākaṃ tava smasi //
analyzed: tvam asmākam tava smasi
translated: We are yours, O Indra, you are ours.

original: tvām id dhi tvāyavo 'nunonuvataś carān /
analyzed: tvām id hi tvāyavaḥ nunonuvataḥ carān
translated: For you, indeed, the active ones, the singers, have followed you,

original: sakhāya indra kāravaḥ //
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ indra kāravaḥ
translated: O friend Indra, the artisans.

original: ud ghed abhi śrutāmaghaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ naryāpasam /
analyzed: ud gha id abhi śrutāmagham vṛṣabham narya apasam

original: astāram eṣi sūrya //
analyzed: astāram eṣi sūrya

original: nava yo navatim puro bibheda bāhvojasā /
analyzed: nava yaḥ navatim puraḥ bibheda bāhu ojasā

analyzed: ahim ca vṛtrahā avadhīt
translated: And slew Ahi, the Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: sa na indraḥ śivaḥ sakhāśvāvad gomad yavamat /
analyzed: sa naḥ indraḥ śivaḥ sakhā aśvāvat gomat yavamat
translated: He is Indra, the auspicious friend, rich in horses, cattle, and barley,

original: urudhāreva dohate //
analyzed: uru dhārā iva dohate
translated: Who milks out for us a full stream.

original: yad adya kac ca vṛtrahann udagā abhi sūrya /
analyzed: yat adya kad ca vṛtrahan udagāḥ abhi sūrya
translated: Whatever, O Vr̥itra-slayer, thou hast done today, O thou who shinest,

original: sarvaṃ tad indra te vaśe //
analyzed: sarvam tat indra te vaśe
translated: All that, O Indra, is in thy power.

original: yad vā pravṛddha satpate na marā iti manyase /
analyzed: yat vā pravṛddha satpate na marai iti manyase
translated: Or if, O lord of the brave, thou thinkest, 'I shall not die,'

original: uto tat satyam it tava //
analyzed: uta u tat satyam id tava
translated: Even that is true of thee.

original: ye somāsaḥ parāvati ye arvāvati sunvire /
analyzed: ye somāsaḥ parāvati ye arvāvati sunvire
translated: Those Soma-pressings that are far away, and those that are near at hand,

original: sarvāṃs tāṃ indra gacchasi //
analyzed: sarvān tām indra gacchasi
translated: To all of them, O Indra, thou goest.

original: tam indraṃ vājayāmasi mahe vṛtrāya hantave /
analyzed: tam indram vājayāmasi mahe vṛtrāya hantave
translated: We urge that Indra on to the great deed, to smite down Vr̥itra.

original: sa vṛṣā vṛṣabho bhuvat //
analyzed: sa vṛṣā vṛṣabhaḥ bhuvat
translated: He is a bull, a mighty bull.

original: indraḥ sa dāmane kṛta ojiṣṭhaḥ sa made hitaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ sa dāmane kṛtaḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ sa made hitaḥ
translated: Indra is he who should be served: in the wild joy he is set for strength.

original: dyumnī ślokī sa somyaḥ //
analyzed: dyumnī ślokī sa somyaḥ
translated: He is the glorious, the famed, the lover of the juice.

original: girā vajro na sambhṛtaḥ sabalo anapacyutaḥ /
analyzed: girā vajraḥ na sambhṛtaḥ sa balaḥ an apacyutaḥ
translated: The bolt is gathered with a song, strong, never failing,

original: vavakṣa ṛṣvo astṛtaḥ //
analyzed: vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ astṛtaḥ
translated: the lofty, irresistible one hath waxed in might.

original: durge cin naḥ sugaṃ kṛdhi gṛṇāna indra girvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: durge cit naḥ sugam kṛdhi gṛṇāna indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: Even in the difficult make thou easy for us, O thou who lovest song, O Indra, when we praise thee.

original: tvaṃ ca maghavan vaśaḥ //
analyzed: tvam ca maghavan vaśaḥ
translated: Thou, O Maghavan, art the Lord.

original: yasya te nū cid ādiśaṃ na minanti svarājyam /
analyzed: yasya te nu cit ādiśam na minanti sva rājyam
translated: Whose sway, O God, no man may interrupt, whose sway as Sovran Lord,

original: na devo nādhrigur janaḥ //
analyzed: na devaḥ na adhriguḥ janaḥ
translated: No man, no people may interrupt.

original: adhā te apratiṣkutaṃ devī śuṣmaṃ saparyataḥ /
analyzed: adhā te apratiṣkutam devī śuṣmam saparyataḥ
translated: Now they who worship thee, O God, attend on thee, O thou Unresisting One,

original: ubhe suśipra rodasī //
analyzed: ubhe su śipra rodasī
translated: On thee, O thou of beauteous brows, on both the worlds.

original: tvam etad adhārayaḥ kṛṣṇāsu rohiṇīṣu ca /
analyzed: tvam etat adhārayaḥ kṛṣṇāsu rohiṇīṣu ca
translated: Thou hast established this, the dark and ruddy cows,

original: paruṣṇīṣu ruśat payaḥ //
analyzed: paruṣṇīṣu ruśat payaḥ
translated: and the white milk in the Parushṇis.

original: vi yad aher adha tviṣo viśve devāso akramuḥ /
analyzed: vi yat aheḥ adha tviṣaḥ viśve devāsaḥ akramuḥ
translated: When all the Gods have fled away from the snake's flashing splendour,

original: vidan mṛgasya tāṃ amaḥ //
analyzed: vidat mṛgasya tām amaḥ
translated: They have discovered the deer's lair.

original: ād u me nivaro bhuvad vṛtrahādiṣṭa pauṃsyam /
analyzed: āt u me nivaraḥ bhuvat vṛtrahā adiṣṭa pauṃsyam
translated: Now hath my help been near to me: the Vr̥itra-slayer hath declared

original: ajātaśatrur astṛtaḥ //🔽śrutaṃ vo vṛtrahantamam pra śardhaṃ carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: a jāta śatruḥ a stṛtaḥ  śrutam vaḥ vṛtra hantamam pra śardham carṣaṇīnām
translated: His manhood, invincible, with foes unborn.🔽Ye have heard him, best Vritra-slayer, the boldest of men,

original: ā śuṣe rādhase mahe //
analyzed: ā śuṣe rādhase mahe
translated: To win great bounty have I sought him.

original: ayā dhiyā ca gavyayā puruṇāman puruṣṭuta /
analyzed: ayā dhiyā ca gavyayā puruṇāman puruṣṭuta
translated: With this thought, O you of many names, O much-praised one, with the thought of cattle,

original: yat somesoma ābhavaḥ //
analyzed: yat somesome ābhavaḥ
translated: When you are present at the Soma sacrifice, O Soma.

original: bodhinmanā id astu no vṛtrahā bhūryāsutiḥ /
analyzed: bodhinmanāḥ id astu naḥ vṛtrahā bhūri āsutiḥ
translated: May he, the wise one, be our protector, the slayer of Vrtra, of abundant praise.

original: śṛṇotu śakra āśiṣam //🔽kayā tvaṃ na ūtyābhi pra mandase vṛṣan /🔽kayā stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: śṛṇotu śakraḥ āśiṣam  kayā tvam naḥ ūtyā abhi pra mandase vṛṣan  kayā stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: May Shakra listen to our prayer.🔽By what favour, O powerful one, do you delight us?🔽By what (favour) do you bring to the praisers?

original: kasya vṛṣā sute sacā niyutvān vṛṣabho raṇat /
analyzed: kasya vṛṣā sute sacā niyutvān vṛṣabhaḥ raṇat
translated: With whose aid, O powerful one, in the juice, accompanied by his team, the bull roars,

original: vṛtrahā somapītaye //
analyzed: vṛtrahā soma pītaye
translated: The Vrtra-killer, to drink the Soma?

original: abhī ṣu ṇas tvaṃ rayim mandasānaḥ sahasriṇam /
analyzed: abhi su naḥ tvam rayim mandasānaḥ sahasriṇam
translated: Do you, being delighted, grant us wealth consisting of a thousand (cows).

original: prayantā bodhi dāśuṣe //
analyzed: prayantā bodhi dāśuṣe
translated: Be ready to give to the worshipper.

original: patnīvantaḥ sutā ima uśanto yanti vītaye /
analyzed: patnīvantaḥ sutāḥ ime uśantaḥ yanti vītaye
translated: These pressed (juices) with their wives, longing, go to the feast,

original: apāṃ jagmir nicumpuṇaḥ //
analyzed: apām jagmiḥ nicumpuṇaḥ
translated: The wanderer to the waters.

original: iṣṭā hotrā asṛkṣatendraṃ vṛdhāso adhvare /
analyzed: iṣṭāḥ hotrāḥ asṛkṣata indram vṛdhāsaḥ adhvare
translated: The priests, having offered the oblations, have started to Indra at the sacrifice,

original: acchāvabhṛtham ojasā //
analyzed: acchā avabhṛtham ojasā
translated: To the purifying bath with might.

original: iha tyā sadhamādyā harī hiraṇyakeśyā /
analyzed: iha tyā sadhamādyā harī hiraṇya keśyā
translated: Here, O you whose hair is golden, are your two most delightful bay horses,

original: voḷhām abhi prayo hitam //
analyzed: voḍhām abhi prayaḥ hitam
translated: To the yoke, to the place prepared.

original: tubhyaṃ somāḥ sutā ime stīrṇam barhir vibhāvaso /
analyzed: tubhyam somāḥ sutāḥ ime stīrṇam barhiḥ vibhāvaso
translated: These pressed Somas are for you, O you of bright radiance, the sacrificial grass is strewn.

original: stotṛbhya indram ā vaha //
analyzed: stotṛbhyaḥ indram ā vaha
translated: Bring Indra to the praisers.

original: ā te dakṣaṃ vi rocanā dadhad ratnā vi dāśuṣe /
analyzed: ā te dakṣam vi rocanā dadhat ratnā vi dāśuṣe
translated: May he bestow on you power, the lights, treasures on the worshipper.

original: stotṛbhya indram arcata //
analyzed: stotṛbhyaḥ indram arcata
translated: Praise Indra for the praisers.

original: ā te dadhāmīndriyam ukthā viśvā śatakrato /
analyzed: ā te dadhāmi indriyam ukthā viśvā śatakrato
translated: I place in you, O Indra, the power of hymns, all, O Shatakratu,

original: stotṛbhya indra mṛḷaya //
analyzed: stotṛbhyaḥ indra mṛḍaya
translated: Be gracious, O Indra, to the praisers.

original: bhadrambhadraṃ na ā bhareṣam ūrjaṃ śatakrato /
analyzed: bhadram bhadram naḥ ā bhara iṣam ūrjam śatakrato
translated: I bring you, O Shatakratu, good after good, strength,

original: yad indra mṛḷayāsi naḥ //
analyzed: yat indra mṛḍayāsi naḥ

original: sa no viśvāny ā bhara suvitāni śatakrato /
analyzed: sa naḥ viśvāni ā bhara suvitāni śatakrato
translated: Bring to us all good things, O Shatakratu,

original: yad indra mṛḷayāsi naḥ //
analyzed: yat indra mṛḍayāsi naḥ
translated: If, O Indra, you are gracious to us.

original: tvām id vṛtrahantama sutāvanto havāmahe /
analyzed: tvām id vṛtra hantama sutāvantaḥ havāmahe
translated: We invoke you, O best slayer of Vrtra, O you who are served with the Soma,
