analyzed: yat indra mṛḍayāsi naḥ  upa naḥ haribhiḥ sutam yāhi madānām pate
translated: If, O Indra, you are gracious to us.🔽Come to us with your bay steeds to the juice, O lord of the gladdening drinks,

original: upa no haribhiḥ sutam //
analyzed: upa naḥ haribhiḥ sutam
translated: Come to us with your bay steeds to the juice.

original: dvitā yo vṛtrahantamo vida indraḥ śatakratuḥ /
analyzed: dvitā yaḥ vṛtra hantamaḥ vide indraḥ śatakratuḥ
translated: He who is most often invoked, the slayer of Vrtra, Indra, Shatakratu,

original: upa no haribhiḥ sutam //
analyzed: upa naḥ haribhiḥ sutam
translated: Come to us with your bay steeds to the juice.

original: tvaṃ hi vṛtrahann eṣām pātā somānām asi /
analyzed: tvam hi vṛtrahan eṣām pātā somānām asi
translated: For you are the guardian of these Soma juices, O slayer of Vrtra,

original: upa no haribhiḥ sutam //
analyzed: upa naḥ haribhiḥ sutam
translated: Come to us with your bay steeds to the juice.

original: indra iṣe dadātu na ṛbhukṣaṇam ṛbhuṃ rayim /
analyzed: indraḥ iṣe dadātu naḥ ṛbhukṣaṇam ṛbhum rayim

analyzed: vājī dadātu vājinam
translated: May the strong one give us the strong one.

analyzed: gauḥ dhayati marutām śravasyuḥ mātā maghonām

analyzed: yuktā vahniḥ rathānām

original: yasyā devā upasthe vratā viśve dhārayante /
analyzed: yasyāḥ devāḥ upasthe vratā viśve dhārayante
translated: In whose lap, O goddess, all the gods uphold the vows,

original: sūryāmāsā dṛśe kam //
analyzed: sūryāmāsā dṛśe kam
translated: The sun and moon for all to see.

original: tat su no viśve arya ā sadā gṛṇanti kāravaḥ /
analyzed: tat su naḥ viśve aryaḥ ā sadā gṛṇanti kāravaḥ
translated: May that be well for us, which the noble ones always sing,

original: marutaḥ somapītaye //
analyzed: marutaḥ soma pītaye
translated: O Maruts, for the drinking of Soma.

original: asti somo ayaṃ sutaḥ pibanty asya marutaḥ /
analyzed: asti somaḥ ayam sutaḥ pibanti asya marutaḥ
translated: Here is this Soma pressed; the Maruts drink of it,

analyzed: uta svarājaḥ aśvinā

original: pibanti mitro aryamā tanā pūtasya varuṇaḥ /
analyzed: pibanti mitraḥ aryamā tanā pūtasya varuṇaḥ
translated: Mitra, Aryaman, Varuna drink of the purified Soma,

analyzed: triṣadhasthasya jāvataḥ
translated: Of him who dwells in the threefold abode, who is to be invoked.

original: uto nv asya joṣam āṃ indraḥ sutasya gomataḥ /
analyzed: uta u nu asya joṣam ām indraḥ sutasya gomataḥ
translated: And Indra delights in the acceptance of this Soma, O you who possess cattle,

original: prātar hoteva matsati //
analyzed: prātar hotā iva matsati
translated: As if he were the Hotri priest in the morning.

original: kad atviṣanta sūrayas tira āpa iva sridhaḥ /
analyzed: kad atviṣanta sūrayaḥ tiras āpaḥ iva sridhaḥ
translated: How do the radiant princes shine, like the waters against the foe?

analyzed: arṣanti pūta dakṣasaḥ  kad vaḥ adya mahānām devānām avaḥ vṛṇe
translated: They flow, having pure strength.🔽How do I today choose the favor of you great gods,

original: tmanā ca dasmavarcasām //
analyzed: tmanā ca dasma varcasām
translated: By myself and by those whose splendor is wondrous?

original: ā ye viśvā pārthivāni paprathan rocanā divaḥ /
analyzed: ā ye viśvā pārthivāni paprathan rocanā divaḥ
translated: Those who have extended all the earthly lights and the radiance of heaven,

original: marutaḥ somapītaye //
analyzed: marutaḥ soma pītaye
translated: The Maruts, for the drinking of Soma.

original: tyān nu pūtadakṣaso divo vo maruto huve /
analyzed: tyān nu pūta dakṣasaḥ divaḥ vaḥ marutaḥ huve
translated: I invoke those of you, O you of pure strength, O Maruts, from heaven,

original: asya somasya pītaye //
analyzed: asya somasya pītaye
translated: For the drinking of this Soma.

original: tyān nu ye vi rodasī tastabhur maruto huve /
analyzed: tyān nu ye vi rodasī tastabhuḥ marutaḥ huve
translated: I invoke those Maruts who have extended the two worlds,

original: asya somasya pītaye //
analyzed: asya somasya pītaye
translated: For the drinking of this Soma.

original: tyaṃ nu mārutaṃ gaṇaṃ giriṣṭhāṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ huve /
analyzed: tyam nu mārutam gaṇam giriṣṭhām vṛṣaṇam huve
translated: I invoke that powerful troop of Maruts who dwell in the mountains,

original: asya somasya pītaye //
analyzed: asya somasya pītaye
translated: For the drinking of this Soma.

original: ā tvā giro rathīr ivāsthuḥ suteṣu girvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: ā tvā giraḥ rathīḥ iva asthuḥ suteṣu girvaṇaḥ

original: abhi tvā sam anūṣatendra vatsaṃ na mātaraḥ //
analyzed: abhi tvā sam anūṣata indra vatsam na mātaraḥ
translated: They have extolled thee, Indra, as a mother her calf.

original: ā tvā śukrā acucyavuḥ sutāsa indra girvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: ā tvā śukrāḥ acucyavuḥ sutāsaḥ indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: The bright libations have impelled thee, Indra, Lord of songs.

original: pibā tv asyāndhasa indra viśvāsu te hitam //
analyzed: pibā tu asya andhasaḥ indra viśvāsu te hitam
translated: Drink of this juice, O Indra: all is ready for thee.

original: pibā somam madāya kam indra śyenābhṛtaṃ sutam /
analyzed: pibā somam madāya kam indra śyena ābhṛtam sutam
translated: Drink Soma for the sake of joy, O Indra, pressed by the falcon.

original: tvaṃ hi śaśvatīnām patī rājā viśām asi //
analyzed: tvam hi śaśvatīnām patiḥ rājā viśām asi
translated: For thou art ever Lord and King of all the people.

original: śrudhī havaṃ tiraścyā indra yas tvā saparyati /
analyzed: śrudhi havam tiraścyāḥ indra yaḥ tvā saparyati
translated: Hear the call of him who lies extended, O Indra, who serves thee well.

original: suvīryasya gomato rāyas pūrdhi mahāṃ asi //
analyzed: su vīryasya gomataḥ rāyaḥ pūrdhi mahān asi
translated: Grant him great wealth in cattle and heroic might.

original: indra yas te navīyasīṃ giram mandrām ajījanat /
analyzed: indra yaḥ te navīyasīm giram mandrām ajījanat
translated: O Indra, he who hath produced for thee the newest song, the gladdening,

original: cikitvinmanasaṃ dhiyam pratnām ṛtasya pipyuṣīm //
analyzed: cikitvit manasam dhiyam pratnām ṛtasya pipyuṣīm
translated: The thought-filled hymn, the ancient hymn that swells with sap of sacrifice.

original: tam u ṣṭavāma yaṃ gira indram ukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ /
analyzed: tam u stavāma yam giraḥ indram ukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ
translated: Let us laud him whom the songs and hymns have strengthened, Indra.

original: purūṇy asya pauṃsyā siṣāsanto vanāmahe //🔽eto nv indraṃ stavāma śuddhaṃ śuddhena sāmnā /🔽śuddhair ukthair vāvṛdhvāṃsaṃ śuddha āśīrvān mamattu //
analyzed: purūṇi asya pauṃsyā siṣāsantaḥ vanāmahe  eta u nu indram stavāma śuddham śuddhena sāmnā  śuddhaiḥ ukthaiḥ vāvṛdhvāṃsam śuddhaḥ āśīrvān mamattu
translated: We, longing for his many manly deeds, have sought to win his favour.🔽Now let us laud Indra, the pure, with a pure hymn.🔽With pure lauds let us make him wax strong, and let the pure one rejoice in my pure gifts.

original: indra śuddho na ā gahi śuddhaḥ śuddhābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: indra śuddhaḥ naḥ ā gahi śuddhaḥ śuddhābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: O Indra, come thou pure to us, pure with thy pure protections.

original: śuddho rayiṃ ni dhāraya śuddho mamaddhi somyaḥ //
analyzed: śuddhaḥ rayim ni dhāraya śuddhaḥ mamaddhi somyaḥ
translated: Purified, bestow wealth upon us; purified, rejoice in the Soma-juice.

original: indra śuddho hi no rayiṃ śuddho ratnāni dāśuṣe /
analyzed: indra śuddhaḥ hi naḥ rayim śuddhaḥ ratnāni dāśuṣe
translated: Purified, O Indra, bestow wealth upon us; purified, give treasures to the worshipper.

original: śuddho vṛtrāṇi jighnase śuddho vājaṃ siṣāsasi //
analyzed: śuddhaḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnase śuddhaḥ vājam siṣāsasi
translated: Purified, thou smitest down the Vr̥itras; purified, thou fain wouldst win the booty.

original: asmā uṣāsa ātiranta yāmam indrāya naktam ūrmyāḥ suvācaḥ /
analyzed: asmai uṣāsaḥ ātiranta yāmam indrāya naktam ūrmyāḥ su vācaḥ
translated: To him the Dawns have brought their course, to Indra, the Night with her fair voice her wave.

original: asmā āpo mātaraḥ sapta tasthur nṛbhyas tarāya sindhavaḥ supārāḥ //
analyzed: asmai āpaḥ mātaraḥ sapta tasthuḥ nṛbhyaḥ tarāya sindhavaḥ su pārāḥ
translated: To him have the seven Rivers, the Mothers, the Waters, stood for the sake of men, easy to cross.

original: atividdhā vithureṇā cid astrā triḥ sapta sānu saṃhitā girīṇām /
analyzed: atividdhā vithureṇa cit astrā tris sapta sānu saṃhitā girīṇām
translated: Even by the feeble is the bolt of Indra, the son of strength, thrice seven times, hurled against the ridges of the mountains.

original: na tad devo na martyas tuturyād yāni pravṛddho vṛṣabhaś cakāra //
analyzed: na tat devaḥ na martyaḥ tuturyāt yāni pravṛddhaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ cakāra
translated: Neither a God nor mortal can extol those deeds which the mighty Bull hath done.

original: indrasya vajra āyaso nimiśla indrasya bāhvor bhūyiṣṭham ojaḥ /
analyzed: indrasya vajraḥ āyasaḥ nimiślaḥ indrasya bāhvoḥ bhūyiṣṭham ojaḥ
translated: The bolt of Indra is of iron, in Indra's arms is most abundant strength.

original: śīrṣann indrasya kratavo nireka āsann eṣanta śrutyā upāke //
analyzed: śīrṣan indrasya kratavaḥ nireke āsan śrutyai upāke
translated: In Indra's head are all his thoughts, his counsels, which have come to pass. They have attained to hearing, to the end.

original: manye tvā yajñiyaṃ yajñiyānām manye tvā cyavanam acyutānām /
analyzed: manye tvā yajñiyam yajñiyānām manye tvā cyavanam a cyutānām
translated: I deem thee meet for worship of all meet for worship; I deem thee the deceiver of deceivers.

original: manye tvā satvanām indra ketum manye tvā vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnām //
analyzed: manye tvā satvanām indra ketum manye tvā vṛṣabham carṣaṇīnām
translated: I deem thee the ensign of the strong, O Indra; I deem thee the Bull of men.

original: ā yad vajram bāhvor indra dhatse madacyutam ahaye hantavā u /
analyzed: ā yat vajram bāhvoḥ indra dhatse mada cyutam ahaye hantavai u
translated: When thou placest in thy arms, O Indra, the thunderbolt that drops with joy, to slay the dragon,

original: pra parvatā anavanta pra gāvaḥ pra brahmāṇo abhinakṣanta indram //
analyzed: pra parvatāḥ anavanta pra gāvaḥ pra brahmāṇaḥ abhinakṣantaḥ indram
translated: The mountains have flowed forth, the cows have flowed forth, the Brahmans have flowed forth to Indra.

original: tam u ṣṭavāma ya imā jajāna viśvā jātāny avarāṇy asmāt /
analyzed: tam u stavāma yaḥ imā jajāna viśvā jātāni avarāṇi asmāt
translated: Praise him who has produced these, who is greater than all these created things.

original: indreṇa mitraṃ didhiṣema gīrbhir upo namobhir vṛṣabhaṃ viśema //
analyzed: indreṇa mitram didhiṣema gīrbhiḥ upa u namobhiḥ vṛṣabham viśema
translated: With hymns let us seek favour with Indra, with homage let us approach the mighty one.

original: vṛtrasya tvā śvasathād īṣamāṇā viśve devā ajahur ye sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: vṛtrasya tvā śvasathāt īṣamāṇāḥ viśve devāḥ ajahuḥ ye sakhāyaḥ
translated: The All-gods, your friends, have left you, seeking to escape from Vritra's breath.

original: marudbhir indra sakhyaṃ te astv athemā viśvāḥ pṛtanā jayāsi //
analyzed: marudbhiḥ indra sakhyam te astu atha imāḥ viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ jayāsi
translated: Let your friendship with the Maruts be, O Indra, then you shall conquer all these hosts.

original: triḥ ṣaṣṭis tvā maruto vāvṛdhānā usrā iva rāśayo yajñiyāsaḥ /
analyzed: tris ṣaṣṭiḥ tvā marutaḥ vāvṛdhānāḥ usrāḥ iva rāśayaḥ yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: The sixty-three Maruts, waxing great, like the rays of the sun, worthy of sacrifice,

original: upa tvemaḥ kṛdhi no bhāgadheyaṃ śuṣmaṃ ta enā haviṣā vidhema //
analyzed: upa tvā imaḥ kṛdhi naḥ bhāgadheyam śuṣmam te enā haviṣā vidhema
translated: Have come to you. Make our portion. We will serve you with this oblation.

original: tigmam āyudham marutām anīkaṃ kas ta indra prati vajraṃ dadharṣa /
analyzed: tigmam āyudham marutām anīkam kaḥ te indra prati vajram dadharṣa
translated: The sharp weapon, the host of the Maruts, who dares to resist your thunderbolt, O Indra?

original: anāyudhāso asurā adevāś cakreṇa tāṃ apa vapa ṛjīṣin //
analyzed: an āyudhāsaḥ asurāḥ a devāḥ cakreṇa tām apa vapa ṛjīṣin
translated: The Asuras, weaponless, godless, O you who have the wheel, have you cut them off, O you who have the wheel.

original: maha ugrāya tavase suvṛktim preraya śivatamāya paśvaḥ /
analyzed: mahe ugrāya tavase suvṛktim preraya śivatamāya paśvaḥ
translated: To the great, strong, very mighty one send forth the hymn.

original: girvāhase gira indrāya pūrvīr dhehi tanve kuvid aṅga vedat //
analyzed: gir vāhase giraḥ indrāya pūrvīḥ dhehi tanve kuvid aṅga vedat
translated: To the bearer of songs, to Indra, give many songs: will he know how to accept them?

original: ukthavāhase vibhve manīṣāṃ druṇā na pāram īrayā nadīnām /
analyzed: uktha vāhase vibhve manīṣām druṇā na pāram īraya nadīnām
translated: To the bearer of praise, to the mighty one, offer thought, as with a boat the other shore of the rivers.

original: ni spṛśa dhiyā tanvi śrutasya juṣṭatarasya kuvid aṅga vedat //
analyzed: ni spṛśa dhiyā tanvi śrutasya juṣṭatarasya kuvid aṅga vedat
translated: Touch with the thought the body of the famous one: will he know how to accept what is more pleasing?

original: tad viviḍḍhi yat ta indro jujoṣat stuhi suṣṭutiṃ namasā vivāsa /
analyzed: tat viviḍḍhi yat te indraḥ jujoṣat stuhi suṣṭutim namasā vivāsa
translated: Do that which Indra delights in: praise with good praise, seek with reverence.

original: upa bhūṣa jaritar mā ruvaṇyaḥ śrāvayā vācaṃ kuvid aṅga vedat //
analyzed: upa bhūṣa jaritar mā ruvaṇyaḥ śrāvaya vācam kuvid aṅga vedat
translated: Do not be silent, O worshipper: will he know how to accept the voice?

original: ava drapso aṃśumatīm atiṣṭhad iyānaḥ kṛṣṇo daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ /
analyzed: ava drapsaḥ aṃśumatīm atiṣṭhat iyānaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ
translated: The drop has stood in the plant, the dark one, growing, with ten thousand.

original: āvat tam indraḥ śacyā dhamantam apa snehitīr nṛmaṇā adhatta //
analyzed: āvat tam indraḥ śacyā dhamantam apa snehitīḥ nṛmaṇāḥ adhatta
translated: Indra with Śacī has placed him, the man-conquering one, in the moist places, who was blowing.

original: drapsam apaśyaṃ viṣuṇe carantam upahvare nadyo aṃśumatyāḥ /
analyzed: drapsam apaśyam viṣuṇe carantam upahvare nadyaḥ aṃśumatyāḥ
translated: I saw the drop moving in the hollow, on the bank of the river Aṃśumatī.

original: nabho na kṛṣṇam avatasthivāṃsam iṣyāmi vo vṛṣaṇo yudhyatājau //
analyzed: nabhaḥ na kṛṣṇam avatasthivāṃsam iṣyāmi vaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ yudhyata ājau
translated: Like a dark cloud that has settled down, I will send you, O heroes, to fight in the battle.

original: adha drapso aṃśumatyā upasthe 'dhārayat tanvaṃ titviṣāṇaḥ /
analyzed: adha drapsaḥ aṃśumatyāḥ upasthe dhārayat tanvam titviṣāṇaḥ
translated: Then the drop, shining, placed his body in the lap of Aṃśumatī.

original: viśo adevīr abhy ācarantīr bṛhaspatinā yujendraḥ sasāhe //
analyzed: viśaḥ adevīḥ abhī ācarantīḥ bṛhaspatinā yujā indraḥ sasāhe
translated: Indra, yoked with Bṛhaspati, conquered the godless people who were attacking the clans.

original: tvaṃ ha tyat saptabhyo jāyamāno 'śatrubhyo abhavaḥ śatrur indra /
analyzed: tvam ha tyad saptabhyaḥ jāyamānaḥ śatrubhyaḥ abhavaḥ śatruḥ indra
translated: Thou, when born from the seven, wast made a foe to the foes, O Indra.

original: gūḷhe dyāvāpṛthivī anv avindo vibhumadbhyo bhuvanebhyo raṇaṃ dhāḥ //🔽tvaṃ ha tyad apratimānam ojo vajreṇa vajrin dhṛṣito jaghantha /🔽tvaṃ śuṣṇasyāvātiro vadhatrais tvaṃ gā indra śacyed avindaḥ //
analyzed: gūḷhe dyāvāpṛthivī anu avindaḥ vibhumadbhyaḥ bhuvanebhyaḥ raṇam dhāḥ  tvam ha tyad a pratimānam ojaḥ vajreṇa vajrin dhṛṣitaḥ jaghantha  tvam śuṣṇasya avātiraḥ vadhatraiḥ tvam gāḥ indra śacyā id avindaḥ
translated: Thou foundest the hidden heaven and earth: give room to the wide-spreading worlds.🔽Thou, verily, O wielder of the thunderbolt, with the thunderbolt didst smite down the matchless strength of the foe.🔽Thou, O Indra, with the blows of thy thunderbolt didst slay the wicked, and didst find the kine, O mighty one.

original: tvaṃ ha tyad vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnāṃ ghano vṛtrāṇāṃ taviṣo babhūtha /
analyzed: tvam ha tyad vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām ghanaḥ vṛtrāṇām taviṣaḥ babhūtha
translated: Thou, verily, O bull, of the men, hast become the mighty one of mighty power, the slayer of the foes.

original: tvaṃ sindhūṃr asṛjas tastabhānān tvam apo ajayo dāsapatnīḥ //
analyzed: tvam sindhūṃr asṛjaḥ tastabhānān tvam apaḥ ajayaḥ dāsa patnīḥ
translated: Thou hast loosed the rivers that were held fast: thou hast won the waters, the wives of the Dâsa.

original: sa sukratū raṇitā yaḥ suteṣv anuttamanyur yo aheva revān /
analyzed: sa su kratuḥ raṇitā yaḥ suteṣu anutta manyuḥ yaḥ ahā iva revān
translated: He is the two good friends, the two who rejoice in the libations, he who is of unvanquished wrath, he who is rich and liberal.

original: ya eka in nary apāṃsi kartā sa vṛtrahā pratīd anyam āhuḥ //🔽sa vṛtrahendraś carṣaṇīdhṛt taṃ suṣṭutyā havyaṃ huvema /🔽sa prāvitā maghavā no 'dhivaktā sa vājasya śravasyasya dātā //
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id nari apāṃsi kartā sa vṛtrahā prati id anyam āhuḥ  sa vṛtrahā indraḥ carṣaṇī dhṛt tam suṣṭutyā havyam huvema  sa prāvitā maghavā naḥ dhivaktā sa vājasya śravasyasya dātā
translated: He who alone is the doer of manly deeds, him, the Vr̥itra-slayer, they call another.🔽That Indra, the Vr̥itra-slayer, the supporter of men, let us call to the feast with fair praise.🔽He is the leader, the bountiful one, the overlord to us: he is the giver of strength and of glory.

original: sa vṛtrahendra ṛbhukṣāḥ sadyo jajñāno havyo babhūva /
analyzed: sa vṛtrahā indraḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ sadyas jajñānaḥ havyaḥ babhūva
translated: That Indra, the Vr̥itra-slayer, the eater of the strong, as soon as he was born became worthy of the oblation.

original: kṛṇvann apāṃsi naryā purūṇi somo na pīto havyaḥ sakhibhyaḥ //
analyzed: kṛṇvan apāṃsi naryā purūṇi somaḥ na pītaḥ havyaḥ sakhibhyaḥ
translated: Performing many manly deeds, Soma, when drunk, is to be offered to friends.

original: yā indra bhuja ābharaḥ svarvāṃ asurebhyaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ indra bhujaḥ ābharaḥ svarvān asurebhyaḥ
translated: O Indra, the wealth that you brought from the Asuras, consisting of the heavenly world,

original: stotāram in maghavann asya vardhaya ye ca tve vṛktabarhiṣaḥ //
analyzed: stotāram id maghavan asya vardhaya ye ca tve vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: O Maghavan, increase the worshipper of this (sacrifice) and those who spread out the sacrificial grass for you.

original: yam indra dadhiṣe tvam aśvaṃ gām bhāgam avyayam /
analyzed: yam indra dadhiṣe tvam aśvam gām bhāgam avyayam
translated: O Indra, the horse, the cow, the unfailing portion which you enjoy,

original: yajamāne sunvati dakṣiṇāvati tasmin taṃ dhehi mā paṇau //
analyzed: yajamāne sunvati dakṣiṇāvati tasmin tam dhehi mā paṇau
translated: Place it in the sacrificer who presses (Soma) and gives gifts, not in the niggard.

original: ya indra sasty avrato 'nuṣvāpam adevayuḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ indra sasti avrataḥ nuṣvāpam adevayuḥ
translated: O Indra, he who is unrighteous, who sleeps on, who is godless,

original: svaiḥ ṣa evair mumurat poṣyaṃ rayiṃ sanutar dhehi taṃ tataḥ //
analyzed: svaiḥ saḥ evaiḥ mumurat poṣyam rayim sanutar dhehi tam tatas
translated: With your own, O bountiful one, let him enjoy the wealth which supports (him). Place it in him from whom it comes.

original: yac chakrāsi parāvati yad arvāvati vṛtrahan /
analyzed: yat śakra asi parāvati yat arvāvati vṛtrahan
translated: If, O Shakra, you are far away, or if, O Vrtra-killer, you are near,

original: atas tvā gīrbhir dyugad indra keśibhiḥ sutāvāṃ ā vivāsati //
analyzed: atas tvā gīrbhiḥ dyugad indra keśibhiḥ sutāvān ā vivāsati
translated: From there, O Indra, the charioteer, I invite you with these songs, you who are to be invoked with Soma.

original: yad vāsi rocane divaḥ samudrasyādhi viṣṭapi /
analyzed: yat vā asi rocane divaḥ samudrasya adhi viṣṭapi
translated: If you are in the light of heaven, on the ridge of the ocean,

original: yat pārthive sadane vṛtrahantama yad antarikṣa ā gahi //
analyzed: yat pārthive sadane vṛtra hantama yat antarikṣe ā gahi
translated: If in the earthly abode, O best slayer of Vrtra, if in the atmosphere, come hither.

original: sa naḥ someṣu somapāḥ suteṣu śavasas pate /
analyzed: sa naḥ someṣu soma pāḥ suteṣu śavasaḥ pate
translated: You who drink Soma among the Somas, O lord of strength, in the pressed (Soma),

original: mādayasva rādhasā sūnṛtāvatendra rāyā parīṇasā //
analyzed: mādayasva rādhasā sūnṛtāvatā indra rāyā parīṇasā
translated: Rejoice, O Indra, with bounty for him who is full of truth, with wealth and with full store.

original: mā na indra parā vṛṇag bhavā naḥ sadhamādyaḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ indra parā vṛṇak bhava naḥ sadhamādyaḥ
translated: Do not forsake us, O Indra, be our best protector.

original: tvaṃ na ūtī tvam in na āpyam mā na indra parā vṛṇak //
analyzed: tvam naḥ ūtī tvam id naḥ āpyam mā naḥ indra parā vṛṇak
translated: You are our helper, you are our protector. Do not forsake us, O Indra.

original: asme indra sacā sute ni ṣadā pītaye madhu /
analyzed: asme indra sacā sute ni sada pītaye madhu
translated: O Indra, sit with us by the pressed (Soma) to drink the sweet (juice).

original: kṛdhī jaritre maghavann avo mahad asme indra sacā sute //
analyzed: kṛdhi jaritre maghavan avaḥ mahat asme indra sacā sute
translated: Make great glory for the singer, O bountiful one. O Indra, sit with us by the pressed (Soma).

original: na tvā devāsa āśata na martyāso adrivaḥ /
analyzed: na tvā devāsaḥ āśata na martyāsaḥ adrivas
translated: Neither the gods nor mortal men have attained to thee, O Indra.

original: viśvā jātāni śavasābhibhūr asi na tvā devāsa āśata //
analyzed: viśvā jātāni śavasā abhibhūḥ asi na tvā devāsaḥ āśata
translated: By thy power thou art the overlord of all created things. Neither the gods nor mortal men have attained to thee.

original: viśvāḥ pṛtanā abhibhūtaraṃ naraṃ sajūs tatakṣur indraṃ jajanuś ca rājase /
analyzed: viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ abhibhūtaram naram sajūs tatakṣuḥ indram jajanuḥ ca rājase
translated: The All-conquering, the hero, Indra, they have fashioned together, and generated for the royal (order).

original: kratvā variṣṭhaṃ vara āmurim utogram ojiṣṭhaṃ tavasaṃ tarasvinam //
analyzed: kratvā variṣṭham vare āmurim uta ugram ojiṣṭham tavasam tarasvinam
translated: The wisest, the most powerful, the most impetuous, the strongest, the most daring.

original: sam īṃ rebhāso asvarann indraṃ somasya pītaye /
analyzed: sam īm rebhāsaḥ asvaran indram somasya pītaye
translated: The singers have sung to Indra to drink the Soma.

original: svarpatiṃ yad īṃ vṛdhe dhṛtavrato hy ojasā sam ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: svarpatim yat īm vṛdhe dhṛtavrataḥ hi ojasā sam ūtibhiḥ
translated: To the lord of heaven, whom the one of firm vow supports for increase, with his powers and his aids.

original: nemiṃ namanti cakṣasā meṣaṃ viprā abhisvarā /
analyzed: nemim namanti cakṣasā meṣam viprāḥ abhisvarā
translated: The sages with their eye worship him, the ram, with their voices.

original: sudītayo vo adruho 'pi karṇe tarasvinaḥ sam ṛkvabhiḥ //
analyzed: su dītayaḥ vaḥ adruhaḥ pi karṇe tarasvinaḥ sam ṛkvabhiḥ
translated: Your very wise, guileless, impetuous (priests) have come to the ear with the Rik verses.

original: tam indraṃ johavīmi maghavānam ugraṃ satrā dadhānam apratiṣkutaṃ śavāṃsi /
analyzed: tam indram johavīmi maghavānam ugram satrā dadhānam apratiṣkutam śavāṃsi
translated: I invoke that Indra, the wealthy, the mighty, who always possesses unequalled powers.

original: maṃhiṣṭho gīrbhir ā ca yajñiyo vavartad rāye no viśvā supathā kṛṇotu vajrī //
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭhaḥ gīrbhiḥ ā ca yajñiyaḥ vavartat rāye naḥ viśvā su pathā kṛṇotu vajrī
translated: May he, the most bountiful, be made worthy of worship through our songs. May the wielder of the thunderbolt make all paths easy for us to attain prosperity.

original: tvam pura indra cikid enā vy ojasā śaviṣṭha śakra nāśayadhyai /
analyzed: tvam puras indra cikit enā vi ojasā śaviṣṭha śakra nāśayadhyai
translated: O Indra, O Shakra, most powerful one, you have already shattered these forts with your strength, so that they may be destroyed.

original: tvad viśvāni bhuvanāni vajrin dyāvā rejete pṛthivī ca bhīṣā //
analyzed: tvat viśvāni bhuvanāni vajrin dyāvā rejete pṛthivī ca bhīṣā
translated: O wielder of the thunderbolt, all the worlds, through your fear, the heaven and the earth, shine forth.

original: tan ma ṛtam indra śūra citra pātv apo na vajrin duritāti parṣi bhūri /
analyzed: tat me ṛtam indra śūra citra pātu apaḥ na vajrin duritā ati parṣi bhūri
translated: O Indra, O hero, O wondrous one, protect me from that sin, O wielder of the thunderbolt, lead me across many dangers.

original: kadā na indra rāya ā daśasyer viśvapsnyasya spṛhayāyyasya rājan //
analyzed: kadā naḥ indra rāyaḥ ā daśasyeḥ viśvapsnyasya spṛhayāyyasya rājan
translated: O Indra, when will you bestow wealth on us, O king, to be desired by all, to be longed for?

original: indrāya sāma gāyata viprāya bṛhate bṛhat /
analyzed: indrāya sāma gāyata viprāya bṛhate bṛhat
translated: Sing a Sāman to Indra, to the great, to the inspired one.

original: dharmakṛte vipaścite panasyave //
analyzed: dharma kṛte vipaścite panasyave
translated: To the creator of order, to the wise one, to the one who deserves praise.

original: tvam indrābhibhūr asi tvaṃ sūryam arocayaḥ /
analyzed: tvam indra abhibhūḥ asi tvam sūryam arocayaḥ
translated: O Indra, you are the overlord. You have made the sun shine.

original: viśvakarmā viśvadevo mahāṃ asi //🔽vibhrājañ jyotiṣā svar agaccho rocanaṃ divaḥ /🔽devās ta indra sakhyāya yemire //
analyzed: viśvakarmā viśva devaḥ mahān asi  vibhrājam jyotiṣā svar agacchaḥ rocanam divaḥ  devāḥ te indra sakhyāya yemire
translated: You are the creator of all, the great one of all gods.🔽Shining with light, you have gone to heaven, to the shining realm of the sky.🔽The gods, O Indra, have turned to you for friendship.

original: endra no gadhi priyaḥ satrājid agohyaḥ /
analyzed: ā indra naḥ gadhi priyaḥ satrājit agohyaḥ
translated: O Indra, be our dear guest, ever-victorious, not to be disregarded,

original: girir na viśvatas pṛthuḥ patir divaḥ //
analyzed: giriḥ na viśvatas pṛthuḥ patiḥ divaḥ
translated: The mountain is all-around vast, the lord of heaven.

original: abhi hi satya somapā ubhe babhūtha rodasī /
analyzed: abhi hi satya soma pāḥ ubhe babhūtha rodasī
translated: For you have become, O truthful one, the drinker of Soma, the lord of both worlds.

original: indrāsi sunvato vṛdhaḥ patir divaḥ //
analyzed: indra asi sunvataḥ vṛdhaḥ patiḥ divaḥ
translated: You are the increaser of the presser, O Indra, the lord of heaven.

original: tvaṃ hi śaśvatīnām indra dartā purām asi /
analyzed: tvam hi śaśvatīnām indra dartā purām asi
translated: For you, O Indra, are the breaker of the ancient forts of all.

original: hantā dasyor manor vṛdhaḥ patir divaḥ //
analyzed: hantā dasyoḥ manoḥ vṛdhaḥ patiḥ divaḥ
translated: You are the slayer of the Dasyu, the increaser of Manu, the lord of heaven.

original: adhā hīndra girvaṇa upa tvā kāmān mahaḥ sasṛjmahe /
analyzed: adhā hi indra girvaṇaḥ upa tvā kāmān mahaḥ sasṛjmahe
translated: Now then, O Indra, lover of song, we have created for you great desires.

original: udeva yanta udabhiḥ //
analyzed: udā iva yantaḥ udabhiḥ
translated: Like waters flowing from a spring.

original: vār ṇa tvā yavyābhir vardhanti śūra brahmāṇi /
analyzed: vār na tvā yavyābhiḥ vardhanti śūra brahmāṇi
translated: O hero, they strengthen you with the waters and the young plants, O Indra, with the prayers.

original: vāvṛdhvāṃsaṃ cid adrivo divedive //
analyzed: vāvṛdhvāṃsam cit adrivas dive dive
translated: Even the invincible one day by day.

original: yuñjanti harī iṣirasya gāthayorau ratha uruyuge /
analyzed: yuñjanti harī iṣirasya gāthayā urau rathe uru yuge
translated: They yoke the two bays of the swift one with a song, the chariot with the wide yoke.

original: indravāhā vacoyujā //
analyzed: indra vāhā vacaḥ yujā
translated: Drawn by speech, O Indra, as the bearer.

original: tvaṃ na indrā bharaṃ ojo nṛmṇaṃ śatakrato vicarṣaṇe /
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra ā bhara ojaḥ nṛmṇam śatakrato vicarṣaṇe
translated: You, O Indra, O Shatakratu, the very active one, bestow strength and heroism upon us.

original: ā vīram pṛtanāṣaham //
analyzed: ā vīram pṛtanāṣaham
translated: Bring us a hero who conquers in battles.

original: tvaṃ hi naḥ pitā vaso tvam mātā śatakrato babhūvitha /
analyzed: tvam hi naḥ pitā vaso tvam mātā śatakrato babhūvitha
translated: For you, O good one, are our father, you, O Shatakratu, have become our mother.

original: adhā te sumnam īmahe //
analyzed: adhā te sumnam īmahe
translated: Now we seek your favor.

original: tvāṃ śuṣmin puruhūta vājayantam upa bruve śatakrato /
analyzed: tvām śuṣmin puruhūta vājayantam upa bruve śatakrato
translated: To you, O mighty one, O much-invoked one, who delights in strength, I speak, O Shatakratu.

original: sa no rāsva suvīryam //
analyzed: sa naḥ rāsva su vīryam
translated: Grant us good heroism.

original: tvām idā hyo naro 'pīpyan vajrin bhūrṇayaḥ /
analyzed: tvām idā hyas naraḥ pīpyan vajrin bhūrṇayaḥ
translated: You, O wielder of the thunderbolt, the impetuous men have pressed forward today.

original: sa indra stomavāhasām iha śrudhy upa svasaram ā gahi //🔽matsvā suśipra harivas tad īmahe tve ā bhūṣanti vedhasaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ indra stoma vāhasām iha śrudhi upa svasaram ā gahi  matsva su śipra harivas tat īmahe tve ā bhūṣanti vedhasaḥ
translated: O Indra, be thou here the hearer of those who bring the praise-song. Come to thy native place.🔽Rejoice, O thou of beautiful brows, O thou who hast bay steeds. We seek that grace of thine. The priests adorn themselves for thee.

original: tava śravāṃsy upamāny ukthyā suteṣv indra girvaṇaḥ //
analyzed: tava śravāṃsi upamāni ukthyā suteṣu indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: Thy glories, worthy of lauds, are to be compared with the hymns at the Soma-pressings, O Indra, lover of the song.

original: śrāyanta iva sūryaṃ viśved indrasya bhakṣata /🔽vasūni jāte janamāna ojasā prati bhāgaṃ na dīdhima //
analyzed: śrāyantaḥ iva sūryam viśvā id indrasya bhakṣata  vasūni jāte janamāne ojasā prati bhāgam na dīdhima
translated: All men enjoy the treasures of Indra, as if they were inclined towards the sun.

original: anarśarātiṃ vasudām upa stuhi bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ /
analyzed: anarśarātim vasu dām upa stuhi bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: The bountiful, the giver of wealth, is to be praised. The good gifts of Indra are to be desired.

original: so asya kāmaṃ vidhato na roṣati mano dānāya codayan //🔽tvam indra pratūrtiṣv abhi viśvā asi spṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ asya kāmam vidhataḥ na roṣati manaḥ dānāya codayan  tvam indra pratūrtiṣu abhi viśvāḥ asi spṛdhaḥ
translated: He does not delay the wish of him who offers, urging his mind to give.🔽Thou, O Indra, in the battles, art over all the enemies.

original: aśastihā janitā viśvatūr asi tvaṃ tūrya taruṣyataḥ //
analyzed: aśasti hā janitā viśvatūr asi tvam tūrya taruṣyataḥ
translated: Thou art the begetter of all, the destroyer of curses. Thou art the conqueror, the conqueror of the conqueror.

original: anu te śuṣmaṃ turayantam īyatuḥ kṣoṇī śiśuṃ na mātarā /
analyzed: anu te śuṣmam turayantam īyatuḥ kṣoṇī śiśum na mātarā
translated: The two worlds follow thy rushing strength, as two mothers their child.

original: viśvās te spṛdhaḥ śnathayanta manyave vṛtraṃ yad indra tūrvasi //
analyzed: viśvāḥ te spṛdhaḥ śnathayanta manyave vṛtram yat indra tūrvasi
translated: All thy enemies thou breakest for thy wrath, when thou, O Indra, goest to slay Vritra.

original: ita ūtī vo ajaram prahetāram aprahitam /
analyzed: itas ūtī vaḥ ajaram prahetāram a prahitam
translated: From this place have I sent forth your undecaying leader, the unled,

original: āśuṃ jetāraṃ hetāraṃ rathītamam atūrtaṃ tugryāvṛdham //
analyzed: āśum jetāram hetāram rathītamam a tūrtam tugryāvṛdham
translated: The swift conqueror, the leader, the best charioteer, the unvanquished, the strengthener of Tugra.

original: iṣkartāram aniṣkṛtaṃ sahaskṛtaṃ śatamūtiṃ śatakratum /
analyzed: iṣkartāram a niṣkṛtam sahaskṛtam śatamūtim śatakratum
translated: The performer, the unperformed, the well-performed, the hundred-powered, the hundred-sacrificer,

original: samānam indram avase havāmahe vasavānaṃ vasūjuvam //
analyzed: samānam indram avase havāmahe vasavānam vasūjuvam
translated: We call upon Indra, the same, for help, the most wealthy, the best of the wealthy.

original: ayaṃ ta emi tanvā purastād viśve devā abhi mā yanti paścāt /
analyzed: ayam te emi tanvā purastāt viśve devāḥ abhi mā yanti paścāt
translated: This one goes forth in front with his body; the All-gods come to me from behind.

original: yadā mahyaṃ dīdharo bhāgam indrād in mayā kṛṇavo vīryāṇi //
analyzed: yadā mahyam dīdharaḥ bhāgam indra āt id mayā kṛṇavaḥ vīryāṇi
translated: When you have given me a share, O Indra, then you will perform heroic deeds with me.

original: dadhāmi te madhuno bhakṣam agre hitas te bhāgaḥ suto astu somaḥ /
analyzed: dadhāmi te madhunaḥ bhakṣam agre hitaḥ te bhāgaḥ sutaḥ astu somaḥ
translated: I place the honey-mixture before you; may the pressed Soma be your allotted share.

original: asaś ca tvaṃ dakṣiṇataḥ sakhā me 'dhā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāva bhūri //
analyzed: asaḥ ca tvam dakṣiṇatas sakhā me dhāḥ vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāva bhūri
translated: And you be my friend on the right side; grant me abundant strength to overcome the foes.

original: pra su stomam bharata vājayanta indrāya satyaṃ yadi satyam asti /
analyzed: pra su stomam bharata vājayantaḥ indrāya satyam yadi satyam asti
translated: Bring forth the praise, O people, which brings strength, if truth be in Indra, the true one.

original: nendro astīti nema u tva āha ka īṃ dadarśa kam abhi ṣṭavāma //
analyzed: na indraḥ asti iti nemaḥ u tve āha kaḥ īm dadarśa kam abhi stavāma
translated: No one says to you, Indra does not exist; who has seen him? Whom shall we praise?

original: ayam asmi jaritaḥ paśya meha viśvā jātāny abhy asmi mahnā /
analyzed: ayam asmi jaritar paśya mā iha viśvā jātāni abhī asmi mahnā
translated: Here I am, O singer, behold me; in greatness I am above all beings.

original: ṛtasya mā pradiśo vardhayanty ādardiro bhuvanā dardarīmi //
analyzed: ṛtasya mā pradiśaḥ vardhayanti ādardiraḥ bhuvanā dardarīmi
translated: The quarters of heaven increase my truth; I crush the worlds, I crush the one who crushes.

original: ā yan mā venā aruhann ṛtasyaṃ ekam āsīnaṃ haryatasya pṛṣṭhe /
analyzed: ā yat mā venāḥ ṛtasya ekam āsīnam haryatasya pṛṣṭhe
translated: When the veins of truth have mounted upon me, sitting alone on the back of the brown one,

original: manaś cin me hṛda ā praty avocad acikradañ chiśumantaḥ sakhāyaḥ //
analyzed: manaḥ cit me hṛde ā prati avocat acikradam śiśumantaḥ sakhāyaḥ
translated: My mind has spoken to me from my heart, the friends with children have bellowed.

original: viśvet tā te savaneṣu pravācyā yā cakartha maghavann indra sunvate /
analyzed: viśvā id tā te savaneṣu pravācyā yā cakartha maghavan indra sunvate
translated: All that you have done at the libations, O bountiful Indra, for the presser,

original: pārāvataṃ yat purusambhṛtaṃ vasv apāvṛṇoḥ śarabhāya ṛṣibandhave //
analyzed: pārāvatam yat puru sambhṛtam vasu apāvṛṇoḥ śarabhāya ṛṣi bandhave
translated: The Paravata, the much-treasured wealth, you have opened for Sharabha, the friend of the Rishis.

original: pra nūnaṃ dhāvatā pṛthaṅ neha yo vo avāvarīt /
analyzed: pra nūnam dhāvata pṛthak na iha yaḥ vaḥ avāvarīt
translated: Now run forth separately, O ye two, he who has turned away from you here.

original: ni ṣīṃ vṛtrasya marmaṇi vajram indro apīpatat //
analyzed: ni sīm vṛtrasya marmaṇi vajram indraḥ apīpatat
translated: Indra has hurled his thunderbolt into the vital parts of Vritra.

original: manojavā ayamāna āyasīm atarat puram /
analyzed: manaḥ javāḥ ayamānaḥ āyasīm atarat puram
translated: Swift as thought, he has come, he has crossed the iron fortress.

original: divaṃ suparṇo gatvāya somaṃ vajriṇa ābharat //
analyzed: divam suparṇaḥ gatvāya somam vajriṇe ābharat
translated: The eagle, having gone to heaven, has brought the Soma to the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: samudre antaḥ śayata udnā vajro abhīvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: samudre antar śayate udnā vajraḥ abhīvṛtaḥ
translated: He lies within the ocean, the thunderbolt is covered by the waters.

original: bharanty asmai saṃyataḥ puraḥprasravaṇā balim //
analyzed: bharanti asmai saṃyataḥ puras prasravaṇāḥ balim
translated: They bring him the oblation, the forts with the outpourings in front, are bound to him.

original: yad vāg vadanty avicetanāni rāṣṭrī devānāṃ niṣasāda mandrā /
analyzed: yat vāc vadantī a vicetanāni rāṣṭrī devānām niṣasāda mandrā
translated: What the insentient things say, the queen of the gods has sat down, the delightful one.

original: catasra ūrjaṃ duduhe payāṃsi kva svid asyāḥ paramaṃ jagāma //
analyzed: catasraḥ ūrjam duduhe payāṃsi kva svid asyāḥ paramam jagāma
translated: She has milked out four kinds of strength and milk, where has her highest place gone?

original: devīṃ vācam ajanayanta devās tāṃ viśvarūpāḥ paśavo vadanti /
analyzed: devīm vācam ajanayanta devāḥ tām viśva rūpāḥ paśavaḥ vadanti
translated: The gods have generated the divine speech, the animals of all forms speak it.

original: sā no mandreṣam ūrjaṃ duhānā dhenur vāg asmān upa suṣṭutaitu //
analyzed: sā naḥ mandrā iṣam ūrjam duhānā dhenuḥ vāc asmān upa suṣṭutā etu
translated: May that speech, the milch-cow, yielding us strength and food, come to us with good praise.

original: sakhe viṣṇo vitaraṃ vi kramasva dyaur dehi lokaṃ vajrāya viṣkabhe /
analyzed: sakhe viṣṇo vitaram vi kramasva dyauḥ dehi lokam vajrāya viṣkabhe
translated: O friend Vishnu, spread out your stride, O heaven, give room for the thunderbolt to strike.

original: hanāva vṛtraṃ riṇacāva sindhūn indrasya yantu prasave visṛṣṭāḥ //
analyzed: hanāva vṛtram riṇacāva sindhūn indrasya yantu prasave visṛṣṭāḥ
translated: Let it be sent forth in the impulse of Indra to slay Vrtra and to bind the rivers.

original: ṛdhag itthā sa martyaḥ śaśame devatātaye /
analyzed: ṛdhak itthā sa martyaḥ śaśame devatātaye
translated: This mortal man has indeed prospered in serving the gods,

original: yo nūnam mitrāvaruṇāv abhiṣṭaya ācakre havyadātaye //
analyzed: yaḥ nūnam mitrāvaruṇau abhiṣṭaye ācakre havya dātaye
translated: Who now has made you, O Mitra-Varuna, to be invoked for the offering of oblations.

original: varṣiṣṭhakṣatrā urucakṣasā narā rājānā dīrghaśruttamā /
analyzed: varṣiṣṭha kṣatrau uru cakṣasā narā rājānā dīrgha śruttamā
translated: O kings with the highest rule and far-seeing, most renowned,

original: tā bāhutā na daṃsanā ratharyataḥ sākaṃ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ //
analyzed: tā bāhutā na daṃsanā ratharyataḥ sākam sūryasya raśmibhiḥ
translated: You two, O mighty ones, with the rays of the sun, go together.

original: pra yo vām mitrāvaruṇājiro dūto adravat /
analyzed: pra yaḥ vām mitrāvaruṇā ajiraḥ dūtaḥ adravat
translated: He who has run as your messenger, O Mitra-Varuna,

original: ayaḥśīrṣā maderaghuḥ //
analyzed: ayaḥ śīrṣā maderaghuḥ
translated: The one with an iron head, has become weary.

original: na yaḥ sampṛcche na punar havītave na saṃvādāya ramate /
analyzed: na yaḥ sampṛcche na punar havītave na saṃvādāya ramate
translated: He who does not ask for a return favor, nor for a reward, nor for a response,

original: tasmān no adya samṛter uruṣyatam bāhubhyāṃ na uruṣyatam //
analyzed: tasmāt naḥ adya samṛteḥ uruṣyatam bāhubhyām naḥ uruṣyatam
translated: From him, O Mitra-Varuna, protect us today with your wide protection, with your arms.

original: pra mitrāya prāryamṇe sacathyam ṛtāvaso /
analyzed: pra mitrāya pra aryamṇe sacathyam ṛtāvaso
translated: To Mitra, to Aryaman, to the truthful one, the worthy one,

original: varūthyaṃ varuṇe chandyaṃ vaca stotraṃ rājasu gāyata //
analyzed: varūthyam varuṇe chandyam vacaḥ stotram rājasu gāyata
translated: To Varuna, the protector, the one to be praised, sing the praise to the kings together.

original: te hinvire aruṇaṃ jenyaṃ vasv ekam putraṃ tisṝṇām /
analyzed: te hinvire aruṇam jenyam vasu ekam putram tisṝṇām
translated: They urge on the ruddy one, the worthy, the single wealth of the three,

original: te dhāmāny amṛtā martyānām adabdhā abhi cakṣate //
analyzed: te dhāmāni amṛtā martyānām adabdhā abhi cakṣate
translated: The immortal ones, the undeceiving ones, look down upon the abodes of mortals.

original: ā me vacāṃsy udyatā dyumattamāni kartvā /
analyzed: ā me vacāṃsi udyatā dyumattamāni kartvā
translated: My uplifted words, most splendid, are ready to do their work.

original: ubhā yātaṃ nāsatyā sajoṣasā prati havyāni vītaye //
analyzed: ubhā yātam nāsatyā sajoṣasā prati havyāni vītaye
translated: Come, O Nāsatyas, in unison, to the offerings to be enjoyed.

original: rātiṃ yad vām arakṣasaṃ havāmahe yuvābhyāṃ vājinīvasū /
analyzed: rātim yat vām arakṣasam havāmahe yuvābhyām vājinīvasū
translated: When we invoke your favour, O you two who are not to be deceived, O you two rich in wealth,

original: prācīṃ hotrām pratirantāv itaṃ narā gṛṇānā jamadagninā //
analyzed: prācīm hotrām pratirantau itam narā gṛṇānā jamadagninā
translated: Come hither, O heroes, to the eastern invocation, to be praised by Jamadagni.

original: ā no yajñaṃ divispṛśaṃ vāyo yāhi sumanmabhiḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ yajñam divispṛśam vāyo yāhi su manmabhiḥ
translated: Come to our sacrifice, O Vāyu, which touches the sky, with your well-disposed thoughts,

original: antaḥ pavitra upari śrīṇāno 'yaṃ śukro ayāmi te //
analyzed: antar pavitre upari śrīṇānaḥ yam śukraḥ ayāmi te
translated: Pouring above in the pure place, this bright one is going to you.

original: vety adhvaryuḥ pathibhī rajiṣṭhaiḥ prati havyāni vītaye /
analyzed: veti adhvaryuḥ pathibhiḥ rajiṣṭhaiḥ prati havyāni vītaye
translated: The Adhvaryu comes by the most direct paths to the offerings to be enjoyed.

original: adhā niyutva ubhayasya naḥ piba śuciṃ somaṃ gavāśiram //🔽baṇ mahāṃ asi sūrya baḷ āditya mahāṃ asi /🔽mahas te sato mahimā panasyate 'ddhā deva mahāṃ asi //
analyzed: adha niyutvas ubhayasya naḥ piba śucim somam gavāśiram  baṭ mahān asi sūrya baṭ āditya mahān asi  mahaḥ te sataḥ mahimā panasyate ddhā deva mahān asi
translated: Now, O charioteer, drink of both for us, the pure Soma, the one with the head of a cow.🔽O Sūrya, you are great. O Āditya, you are great.🔽Your greatness, O existent one, is praised. Truly, O god, you are great.

original: baṭ sūrya śravasā mahāṃ asi satrā deva mahāṃ asi /
analyzed: baṭ sūrya śravasā mahān asi satrā deva mahān asi
translated: O Sūrya, you are great by fame. You are always great, O god.

original: mahnā devānām asuryaḥ purohito vibhu jyotir adābhyam //
analyzed: mahnā devānām asuryaḥ purohitaḥ vibhu jyotiḥ adābhyam
translated: The priest of the gods, the Asura, with his greatness, the all-pervading light, the unerring one.

original: iyaṃ yā nīcy arkiṇī rūpā rohiṇyā kṛtā /
analyzed: iyam yā nīcī arkiṇī rūpā rohiṇyā kṛtā
translated: This low-lying, shining form, made by Rohini,

original: citreva praty adarśy āyaty antar daśasu bāhuṣu //
analyzed: citrā iva prati adarśi āyatī antar daśasu bāhuṣu
translated: Like a picture, it appears, coming from within the ten fingers.

original: prajā ha tisro atyāyam īyur ny anyā arkam abhito viviśre /
analyzed: prajāḥ ha tisraḥ atyāyam īyuḥ ni anyāḥ arkam abhitas viviśre
translated: Three kinds of offspring have gone beyond, others have entered around the sun.

original: bṛhad dha tasthau bhuvaneṣv antaḥ pavamāno harita ā viveśa //
analyzed: bṛhat ha tasthau bhuvaneṣu antar pavamānaḥ haritaḥ ā viveśa
translated: The great one has stood in the worlds, Pavamana has entered the green ones.

original: mātā rudrāṇāṃ duhitā vasūnāṃ svasādityānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ /
analyzed: mātā rudrāṇām duhitā vasūnām svasā ādityānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ
translated: Mother of the Rudras, daughter of the Vasus, sister of the Adityas, navel of immortality.

original: pra nu vocaṃ cikituṣe janāya mā gām anāgām aditiṃ vadhiṣṭa //
analyzed: pra nu vocam cikituṣe janāya mā gām anāgām aditim vadhiṣṭa
translated: I will tell this to the discerning people: do not kill the innocent cow, Aditi.

original: vacovidaṃ vācam udīrayantīṃ viśvābhir dhībhir upatiṣṭhamānām /
analyzed: vacaḥ vidam vācam udīrayantīm viśvābhiḥ dhībhiḥ upatiṣṭhamānām
translated: The one who knows speech, uttering speech, being attended by all thoughts,

original: devīṃ devebhyaḥ pary eyuṣīṃ gām ā māvṛkta martyo dabhracetāḥ //
analyzed: devīm devebhyaḥ pari eyuṣīm gām ā mā avṛkta martyaḥ dabhra cetāḥ
translated: The divine cow, going around to the gods, may no mortal of foolish mind harm me.

original: tvam agne bṛhad vayo dadhāsi deva dāśuṣe /
analyzed: tvam agne bṛhat vayaḥ dadhāsi deva dāśuṣe
translated: You, O Agni, O god, bestow great life upon the worshipper,

original: kavir gṛhapatir yuvā //
analyzed: kaviḥ gṛhapatiḥ yuvā
translated: The wise one, the lord of the house, the young one.

original: sa na īḷānayā saha devāṃ agne duvasyuvā /🔽cikid vibhānav ā vaha //
analyzed: sa naḥ īḍānayā saha devān agne duvasyuvā  cikit vibhāno ā vaha
translated: With that, O Agni, together with the one who serves the gods,🔽Do you bring the shining one, O bringer of good things.

original: tvayā ha svid yujā vayaṃ codiṣṭhena yaviṣṭhya /
analyzed: tvayā ha svid yujā vayam codiṣṭhena yaviṣṭhya
translated: By you, O most youthful one, we are indeed urged on by the most powerful one,

original: abhi ṣmo vājasātaye //
analyzed: abhi smaḥ vājasātaye
translated: For the winning of strength.

original: aurvabhṛguvac chucim apnavānavad ā huve /
analyzed: aurva bhṛgu vat śucim apnavāna vat ā huve
translated: I invoke Agni, pure as Aurva and Bhrigu, like Apnavana,

original: agniṃ samudravāsasam //
analyzed: agnim samudra vāsasam
translated: Agni who dwells in the ocean.

original: huve vātasvanaṃ kavim parjanyakrandyaṃ sahaḥ /
analyzed: huve vāta svanam kavim parjanya krandyam sahaḥ
translated: I invoke the sage who roars like the wind, the strength that thunders like Parjanya,

original: agniṃ samudravāsasam //
analyzed: agnim samudra vāsasam
translated: Agni who dwells in the ocean.

original: ā savaṃ savitur yathā bhagasyeva bhujiṃ huve /
analyzed: ā savam savituḥ yathā bhagasya iva bhujim huve
translated: I invoke the impulse of Savitar, the enjoyment like that of Bhaga,

original: agniṃ samudravāsasam //
analyzed: agnim samudra vāsasam
translated: Agni who dwells in the ocean.

original: agniṃ vo vṛdhantam adhvarāṇām purūtamam /
analyzed: agnim vaḥ vṛdhantam adhvarāṇām purūtamam
translated: I invoke Agni, your growing one, most frequent at sacrifices,

original: acchā naptre sahasvate //🔽ayaṃ yathā na ābhuvat tvaṣṭā rūpeva takṣyā /
analyzed: acchā naptre sahasvate  ayam yathā naḥ ābhuvat tvaṣṭā rūpā iva takṣyā
translated: To the powerful grandson.🔽May he be like Tvastr to the craftsman in his form,

original: asya kratvā yaśasvataḥ //
analyzed: asya kratvā yaśasvataḥ
translated: Of this one who is glorious through his power.

original: ayaṃ viśvā abhi śriyo 'gnir deveṣu patyate /
analyzed: ayam viśvāḥ abhi śriyaḥ gniḥ deveṣu patyate
translated: This Agni rules over all glories among the gods.

original: ā vājair upa no gamat //
analyzed: ā vājaiḥ upa naḥ gamat
translated: May he come to us with his treasures.

original: viśveṣām iha stuhi hotṝṇāṃ yaśastamam /
analyzed: viśveṣām iha stuhi hotṝṇām yaśastamam
translated: Here praise him, the most glorious of all the priests,

original: agniṃ yajñeṣu pūrvyam //
analyzed: agnim yajñeṣu pūrvyam
translated: Agni, the first at sacrifices.

original: śīram pāvakaśociṣaṃ jyeṣṭho yo dameṣv ā /
analyzed: śīram pāvaka śociṣam jyeṣṭhaḥ yaḥ dameṣu ā
translated: The bright one with the purifying flame, the eldest in the houses,

original: dīdāya dīrghaśruttamaḥ //
analyzed: dīdāya dīrghaśruttamaḥ
translated: Shines, most famous in the distance.

original: tam arvantaṃ na sānasiṃ gṛṇīhi vipra śuṣmiṇam /
analyzed: tam arvantam na sānasim gṛṇīhi vipra śuṣmiṇam
translated: Praise him, O sage, like a swift horse that brings booty, the mighty one,

original: mitraṃ na yātayajjanam //
analyzed: mitram na yātayat janam
translated: Like a friend who delights in sacrifice.

original: upa tvā jāmayo giro dediśatīr haviṣkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: upa tvā jāmayaḥ giraḥ dediśatīḥ haviṣkṛtaḥ
translated: The sisters, the hymns, have turned to you, the ones who prepare the oblation,

original: vāyor anīke asthiran //
analyzed: vāyoḥ anīke asthiran
translated: They have settled in the front of Vayu.

original: yasya tridhātv avṛtam barhis tasthāv asaṃdinam /
analyzed: yasya tri dhātu a vṛtam barhiḥ tasthau a saṃdinam
translated: Whose grass in the three worlds stood unshorn,

original: āpaś cin ni dadhā padam //
analyzed: āpaḥ cit ni dadha padam
translated: The waters even set his foot.

original: padaṃ devasya mīḷhuṣo 'nādhṛṣṭābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: padam devasya mīḍhuṣaḥ na adhṛṣṭābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: The foot of the god who rains, with his irresistible aids,

original: bhadrā sūrya ivopadṛk //
analyzed: bhadrā sūryaḥ iva upadṛś
translated: Is auspicious, like the sun to look on.

original: agne ghṛtasya dhītibhis tepāno deva śociṣā /
analyzed: agne ghṛtasya dhītibhiḥ tepānaḥ deva śociṣā
translated: O Agni, with the thoughts of ghee, being purified, O god, with thy radiance,

original: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca //
analyzed: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca
translated: Do thou bring the gods and worship them.

original: taṃ tvājananta mātaraḥ kaviṃ devāso aṅgiraḥ /
analyzed: tam tvā ajananta mātaraḥ kavim devāsaḥ aṅgiraḥ
translated: Thee, the wise one, the mothers, the gods, O Angiras, have generated,

original: havyavāham amartyam //
analyzed: havya vāham amartyam
translated: The immortal bearer of oblations.

original: pracetasaṃ tvā kave 'gne dūtaṃ vareṇyam /
analyzed: pracetasam tvā kave gne dūtam vareṇyam
translated: Thee, O wise Agni, the discerning, the messenger, the excellent,

original: havyavāhaṃ ni ṣedire //
analyzed: havyavāham ni sedire
translated: They have seated as the bearer of oblations.

original: nahi me asty aghnyā na svadhitir vananvati /
analyzed: nahi me asti aghnyā na svadhitiḥ vananvati
translated: For I have no cow to slay, no axe to cut with,

original: athaitādṛg bharāmi te //
analyzed: atha etādṛś bharāmi te
translated: Yet I bring thee this kind of offering.

original: yad agne kāni kāni cid ā te dārūṇi dadhmasi /
analyzed: yat agne kāni kāni cit ā te dārūṇi dadhmasi
translated: Whatever pieces of wood, O Agni, we put on thee,

original: tā juṣasva yaviṣṭhya //
analyzed: tā juṣasva yaviṣṭhya
translated: Accept them, O youngest one.

original: yad atty upajihvikā yad vamro atisarpati /
analyzed: yat atti upajihvikā yat vamraḥ atisarpati
translated: What the tongue licks up, what the worm creeps over,

original: sarvaṃ tad astu te ghṛtam //
analyzed: sarvam tat astu te ghṛtam
translated: Let all that be ghee for thee.

original: agnim indhāno manasā dhiyaṃ saceta martyaḥ /
analyzed: agnim indhānaḥ manasā dhiyam saceta martyaḥ
translated: Kindling Agni in his mind, the mortal man should think of the thought,

original: agnim īdhe vivasvabhiḥ //
analyzed: agnim īdhe vivasvabhiḥ
translated: He should kindle Agni with the rays.

original: adarśi gātuvittamo yasmin vratāny ādadhuḥ /
analyzed: adarśi gātu vittamaḥ yasmin vratāni ādadhuḥ
translated: He who has appeared, the best finder of room, in whom they have established the observances,

original: upo ṣu jātam āryasya vardhanam agniṃ nakṣanta no giraḥ //
analyzed: upa u su jātam āryasya vardhanam agnim nakṣanta naḥ giraḥ
translated: To Agni, the noble one's growth, born for help, our songs of praise go forth.

original: pra daivodāso agnir devāṃ acchā na majmanā /
analyzed: pra daivodāsaḥ agniḥ devān acchā na majmanā
translated: Agni, the servant of the gods, goes to the gods by his might.

original: anu mātaram pṛthivīṃ vi vāvṛte tasthau nākasya sānavi //
analyzed: anu mātaram pṛthivīm vi vāvṛte tasthau nākasya sānavi
translated: He spreads out along his mother earth, he stands on the ridge of the vault.

original: yasmād rejanta kṛṣṭayaś carkṛtyāni kṛṇvataḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt rejanta kṛṣṭayaḥ carkṛtyāni kṛṇvataḥ
translated: From whom the people tremble, who performs the rites,

original: sahasrasām medhasātāv iva tmanāgniṃ dhībhiḥ saparyata //
analyzed: sahasra sām medha sātau iva tmanā agnim dhībhiḥ saparyata
translated: with a thousand rewards, as it were, in the contest of the wise, worship Agni with your thoughts.

original: pra yaṃ rāye ninīṣasi marto yas te vaso dāśat /🔽sa vīraṃ dhatte agna ukthaśaṃsinaṃ tmanā sahasrapoṣiṇam //
analyzed: pra yam rāye ninīṣasi martaḥ yaḥ te vaso dāśat  sa vīram dhatte agne uktha śaṃsinam tmanā sahasra poṣiṇam
translated: The man who wishes to lead you to wealth, O Vasu, who would give to you,🔽he begets a hero, O Agni, who praises with hymns, by himself, with a thousandfold increase.

original: sa dṛḷhe cid abhi tṛṇatti vājam arvatā sa dhatte akṣiti śravaḥ /
analyzed: sa dṛḷhe cit abhi tṛṇatti vājam arvatā sa dhatte akṣiti śravaḥ
translated: He hurls the prize even against the strong one with the horse, he bestows imperishable fame.

original: tve devatrā sadā purūvaso viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi //
analyzed: tve devatrā sadā purūvaso viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi
translated: In you, O god, always, O you of much wealth, we must think of all good things.

original: yo viśvā dayate vasu hotā mandro janānām /
analyzed: yaḥ viśvā dayate vasu hotā mandraḥ janānām
translated: He who bestows all wealth, the priest, the delightful one of the people,

original: madhor na pātrā prathamāny asmai pra stomā yanty agnaye //
analyzed: madhoḥ na pātrā prathamāni asmai pra stomāḥ yanti agnaye
translated: for him the first vessels of honey are prepared, the praises go forth to Agni.

original: aśvaṃ na gīrbhī rathyaṃ sudānavo marmṛjyante devayavaḥ /
analyzed: aśvam na gīrbhiḥ rathyam sudānavaḥ marmṛjyante devayavaḥ
translated: The bountiful ones, the lovers of the gods, anoint the horse suitable for the chariot with songs,

original: ubhe toke tanaye dasma viśpate parṣi rādho maghonām //
analyzed: ubhe toke tanaye dasma viśpate parṣi rādhaḥ maghonām
translated: O wondrous lord of the people, you support the wealth of the generous ones in both offspring and progeny.

original: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya gāyata ṛtāvne bṛhate śukraśociṣe /
analyzed: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya gāyata ṛtāvne bṛhate śukra śociṣe
translated: Sing to the most bountiful one, to the lord of truth, to the great one with pure and shining flames,

original: upastutāso agnaye //🔽ā vaṃsate maghavā vīravad yaśaḥ samiddho dyumny āhutaḥ /
analyzed: upastutāsaḥ agnaye  ā vaṃsate maghavā vīravat yaśaḥ samiddhaḥ dyumnī āhutaḥ
translated: To Agni, who is praised with offerings.🔽May the wealthy one, with heroic fame, prosper, enkindled, glorious, offered to,

original: kuvin no asya sumatir navīyasy acchā vājebhir āgamat //
analyzed: kuvid naḥ asya sumatiḥ navīyasī acchā vājebhiḥ āgamat
translated: May his new and most gracious favor come to us with strength.

original: preṣṭham u priyāṇāṃ stuhy āsāvātithim /
analyzed: preṣṭham u priyāṇām stuhi āsāva atithim
translated: Praise him, the dearest of the dear, that guest of yours,

original: agniṃ rathānāṃ yamam //
analyzed: agnim rathānām yamam
translated: Agni, the charioteer of the people.

original: uditā yo niditā veditā vasv ā yajñiyo vavartati /
analyzed: uditā yaḥ niditā veditā vasū ā yajñiyaḥ vavartati
translated: He who is risen, set, and known, the knower of wealth, who turns to the worshipper,

original: duṣṭarā yasya pravaṇe normayo dhiyā vājaṃ siṣāsataḥ //
analyzed: duṣṭarāḥ yasya pravaṇe na ūrmayaḥ dhiyā vājam siṣāsataḥ
translated: Whose currents in the sloping (channels) are hard to cross, striving with thought for strength.

original: mā no hṛṇītām atithir vasur agniḥ purupraśasta eṣaḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ hṛṇītām atithiḥ vasuḥ agniḥ puru praśastaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: Let not the guest, the good Agni, the wealthy one, much praised by the people, be angry with us,

original: yaḥ suhotā svadhvaraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ su hotā su adhvaraḥ
translated: He who is a good priest, well-worshipping.

original: mo te riṣan ye acchoktibhir vaso 'gne kebhiś cid evaiḥ /
analyzed: mā u te riṣan ye acchoktibhiḥ vaso gne kebhiḥ cit evaiḥ
translated: Let not thy anger, O good Agni, come upon us in any way, O thou who art to be invoked with speech,

original: kīriś cid dhi tvām īṭṭe dūtyāya rātahavyaḥ svadhvaraḥ //🔽āgne yāhi marutsakhā rudrebhiḥ somapītaye /
analyzed: kīriḥ cit hi tvām īṭṭe dūtyāya rāta havyaḥ su adhvaraḥ  ā agne yāhi marut sakhā rudrebhiḥ soma pītaye
translated: For even the poor, O thou who art to be invoked with speech, Rātahavya, well-worshipping, chooses thee as a messenger.🔽Come, O Agni, with the Maruts as friends, with the Rudras to the drinking of Soma,

original: sobharyā upa suṣṭutim mādayasva svarṇare //
analyzed: sobharyāḥ upa suṣṭutim mādayasva svarṇare
translated: To the praise of Sobhari, rejoice in the gold-streaming (Soma).
